VOQwgU4iCDKSE2VCeBGLwQ.text: This place is adorable, the staff give great service and the food is delicious. What's not to love!?

srbgO7xDNGcuZ9K_wRw_dg.text: Set in a historic home with what can only be described as an enchanted patio, Cibo is a romantic and rustic departure from the ordinary. It is the perfect place for a dinner date with that special someone or to reunite with friends to share an amazing meal. My favorite pizza is the Tartufata - prosciutto, mushrooms, truffle oil, simply wonderful. Stop by for a unique and exquisite dining experience.

VhCVsyYgHR6fVLOqf2dDFQ.text: I have been here a few times now and it is was one of the better places to go when you are in downtown phx.   Cibo is house that has been turned into a pizza restaurant, but they also serve other food. They are known for their pizza though. I didn't think their pizza was to die for, but it was quite good and a bit unique.  I actually asked for ranch (because ranch and pizza = awesome), and the server looked at me like I was stupid, so, keep that in mind. lol  The prices are fair, the atmosphere is awesome, and the live music was well done.   This is a good place to take your signification other on a date!

E7RD1U4NKkboOQRbZaJWWw.text: Well, I have been to Cibo several times and I don't think a month goes by that I don't get the craving and desire to drive 40 miles just to taste the food and enjoy the awesome atmosphere at this restaurant!  Truly deserving of the 5 stars!  Very reasonable prices, excellent food and just the best way to experience what a great restaurant should be.

mQVtcOIDV-rlrAvCUcZxTg.text: Let me start by saying the atmosphere up in here is great!  The front dining yard is lit up at night by peaceful white lights strewn in organized chaos from the trees that grace the grounds.  This is the perfect patio for a relaxing meal spent  enjoying the company of good friends or for a casual date.  As far as food goes....YUM, delicious, please sir...may I have some more?  I can't say enough about the pizza...the crust is perfect in texture and taste and the ingredients that top the pizza (including the ooey gooey cheese) are of the highest quality.  I highly recommend this traint (trendy AND quaint) Phoenix eatery.  You won't be disappointed!

g3nMU1ASfi0DASf_z8D8Aw.text: Okay so Cibo's is really good, let's get that out of the way right up front.  Their salads with pine nut goodness, their sandwiches with the bread that holds up no matter the insides, the iced tea.  Oh good lord almighty that tea is great.  So yeah, after two lunches at Cibo with Jesse, I am definitely sold on the joint.  BUT that is not to say that Cibo is flawless.  Let us proceed...  Jesse was having a crazy busy day, and I was bored.  We decided to lunch early and headed over to Cibo, since Jesse had been craving it.  We arrive in the neighborhood north of Van Buren where the quaint little sandwich/pizza house is located, and immediately I note the line of cars up and down one street, along with the line of tractors ripping up the intersecting one.  There at the corner lies her beloved eatery, with many chin-up suits and aging re-debutantes making their way towards it from all directions.  Jesse, sensing the parking challenge that was soon to present itself, slammed the brakes.  "Go get us a table."  I'm out of the car like a greased-up salamander out of a Mexican Coke bottle.   Scuttling across the street to get ahead of all the winners, I'm considering my seating preference.  It's a little warm out, but all the shade trees in Cibo's courtyard would fix that right up.  Then I remembered the close quarters the last time we sat outside, not to mention Jesse's disgust at being seated next to a table with *GASP* a child.  I didn't know what things were like inside, but it hardly mattered.  My mind was made up, and when the hostess showed me to our window table in the small dining room near the bar, I realized it didn't matter at all.  The whole place was close quarters, except now we were gonna be inside, which meant way better acoustics!  Full tables all around.  This place is way above the radar and has been for some time, so this was to be expected.  What I didn't expect was the high-haired doughy woman in the electric lime muumuu sitting directly in my line of vision.  She ultimately heightened my experience a great deal just by showing up, although I couldn't help wondering which tribal casino was calling all the hospitals, looking for their most loyal customer.  Jesse ended up ordering the caprese sandwich with added prosciutto (server was happy to oblige), and I had the BBQ pulled pork.  Jesse's sandwich was pretty good.  My sandwich was MAGNIFICENT.  The spice was a pleasant surprise, and also gave me a bit of good old-fashioned sweat-face.  I wasn't really feeling the couple of flies buzzing around us during our chewing time, but to be fair I didn't know who they belonged to, so I can't in good faith pin it completely on the establishment.  Also, the server seemed to forget we were there a couple of times, which is always fun.  But hey, I'm sure the Carries outside needed their lemon water refills real bad, having just played their freckle-tanned backs off in the breast cancer tennis match they just came from.  It may seem from my review that I didn't have the best time.  This absolutely IS NOT the case.  I don't think lunch at Cibo could have gone any better.  The cramped eating space, outspoken clientele, somewhat negligent wait staff, all these should be, well, kind of expected when partaking of a place like Cibo.  It's almost like dinner theater - get in, get settled and get ready for the show.  And whenever possible, watch for muumuus.

iIXSuNTcLcXtTevGc9sYxA.text: This restaurant is super cute! I loved the big outside patio and all of the tree lights. We ordered a pizza, a salad, and a sandwich. The pizza was ok, it was a little burnt in spots. The salad had a fresh taste but not a lot of flavor. The truffle fries that came with the sandwich were probably the best part of the meal. I would probably give this place one more shot.

l7-elPtJ9nvI_06BEFSAMQ.text: Food, service and atmosphere are all beyond compare at this wonderful neighborhood eatery.   In my few dozen visits to Cibo I have always had a wonderful experience. The staff are very friendly and attentive. The food is always amazing - appetizer to dessert.   Customer for life.

J2BcGhe2_nf1HXvX3pSUSA.text: Love coming here for lunch and dinner! Perfect for a lunch hour and good options to choose from and now offer pizza during lunch time. Absolutely love going here for dinner and the ambiance is so cozy and relaxing. Also love the fact that they have live music playing in the evenings

sFBS-lMbHX_qHEbCxY4lag.text: My daughter, grandson and I visited this quaint little restaurant last evening and were very impressed with the pizza and salad.  I would highly recommend trying Cibo.

WudQuiNPtOGBPHjbTyiR8A.text: The lunch menu is good and the fruit salad with the sandwich makes an awesome duo. It's a little pricy, but well worth it.

Q1a2bh8FfvurbiToFgMLTQ.text: I love the building and the ambience of the restaurant.  A great place for a business lunch.  We did arrive early to get a table for six.  The staff was friendly and helpful when looking at the menu.  Some coworkers ordered the couscous salad, I had the pastrami and onions hot sandwich. Really good.  Lots of meat, cheese and onions.  I will need to come back and try the pizzas and salads.  Price is decent and our glasses were always full.

53E8LZa2nZDNU3VcOC95mQ.text: Really tasty pizza, I've been here twice and it is really good stuff, the Nutella crepes for desert are so good. If you like a good drink I'd recommend the limoncello, it's like a lemon drop in liquid form, the lemon concentrate is strong though hardly sour. The prices are a tad high but it's still worth it, the quality of ingredients are definitely superb and the serving sizes are generous. Definitely would be a nice place to bring a date. I would recommend this place for sure.

CXRVvFqGK74ENfB7yuIo-A.text: Wahoo Cibo!  I am an absolute pizza lover and this place made me very happy.  I read up on Cibo in a recent Phoenix Magazine article and felt it was time to check it out and expand my pizza-horizons. My man and I drove down and were in love at first sight.  The atmosphere of this place is perfection. Right up my alley. The twinkly lights and warm patio was almost as cozy looking as the inside of the old home. A delicious pizza place in a quaint bungalow in downtown Phoenix? Yes please!   I love my wine almost as much as I love my pizza. So when I asked my server for a recommendation, she provided a sweet, flavorful glass of an Italian white wine. The wine combined with the Caprese Salad and a fresh Margherita pizza...I was in heaven. This will be a favorite of ours for quite some time to come. Thank you, Cibo!

cY4WnLj_0AHBbslNgssHPg.text: Very quaint restaurant in historic Phoenix. Pizza are excellent, however could use more toppings. Great atmosphere

0kD9m6maZPddNDFs4MPnqw.text: This place can do no wrong. Everything I've ever eaten here has been amazing! Not only that they have great servers and carry Lemoncello!

CGcvD-F_uPZH2CSxSYLQ5Q.text: Best pizza place I've been to outside of Italy. The best part, they actually have LEGIT and delicious gluten free pizza!!! First time I've eaten gluten free pizza and not gagged! AMAZING! I highly recommend the burrata as well! Great start to the meal. Our server was fantastic and suggested the perfect wine and craft beers. Charming, historic restaurant. My husband will be making this part of our regular date night scene!!

FZwc4Ygd7UmBVUT9kaq-Pw.text: This is hands down the best pizza in the valley. I lived in Rome for a month and the pizza at Cibo was better than most I had there. The wine selection here is also amazing- you can tell they really care about their selections. I just love how authentic this place is. Tutto bene!   Seriously, I'd get married here if I could.

omoLgpulErm5bsbmrWkIbw.text: It is axiomatic in Phoenix that the better the restaurant is, the worse the parking. The parking at Cibo is atrocious. Aside from the cutthroat street-side parking, there are something like six parking places in the back.   That being said, the food here is amazing. Cibo has two distinct menus: a lunchtime and dinnertime selection. Sandwiches are during lunch and Pizzas are dinner. Pizzas are not served here during lunchtime since the wood oven requires different temperatures for sandwiches. If you NEED a pizza, arrive in the evening.   This is not to say that the sandwiches are worth skipping. They are delicious. The bread is a perfect blend of crisp and soft. A lunchtime visit is definitely recommended.   However, the star of the show here is the pizza; their pizzas are amazing. There is JUST enough char from the wood ovens to give the dough that brittle crispness that is a sign of a great thin-crust pizza. Their ingredients are fresh and each bite gives a discernible taste for each ingredient in the pizza. It is not a mish-mash of grease and spice like so many other pizzas are.   For dessert, you must get their crepes. Their crepes make a perfect end to a wonderful meal.  The service here is extremely friendly and accommodating.   To give an idea of how good this place is, here is an anecdote. We went to Cibo in the middle of summer late in the afternoon. It was about 113 degrees Fahrenheit outside. When we arrived we found out that their air-conditioning was out.   We stayed anyway.

3ZpmsTv4CQn7z5aYlvqgqw.text: Yummy. Good for lunch for the downtown crowd. It's nice to have something that's not in the business district.

h05pY7-IBQGI49KJgBKpVw.text: LOVE everything about Cibo! Food, Atmosphere and Waiters. Highly recommend!

nmP09pf5oP6FXzg_b6SgdQ.text: Great for ambience, honesty you can get the same pizza for way less at many of the new fast pizza joints for way less. Seating and service were prompt drinks were good, bruschetta appetizer was great. Menu mostly pizza, some pasta and other dishes. Restored house with multiple dining rooms, like I said, great ambience. Nice place for pre-show dinner. Parking not a problem. 15 minute walk to Comerica.

J2ykeyBC27yADA3P1VybKQ.text: Food is fantastic. Very good wood fired pizza here. Also some nice pasta selections.  Amazing place overall. It's small and accessible to everyone. I loved the atmosphere the most.

vELl6jjR2Sq583Pcx_E3XA.text: Pizza was GREAT! Thin and crispy just like I like it! Dough is soft, toppings fresh. Cool place to eat in. Nice garden type setting outside. Service was good.  I will be back!

RweFrFuy6iOLLMHBCjThtw.text: Cibo restaurant has absolutely fantastic dessert ( Nutella  banana creeps )and wine selection. Their pizza on the other hand is a bit overpriced for what it is. If you are picky with your pizza be aware this might not be the place for you but the salads are a great dinner selection .

qGq71VtA-4IpX_pP4Kakyg.text: I'd like to give this place more stars, but can't because the staff and ownership are often so off-putting if not rude.   On a positive note, the ambiance is excellent. It's an old house with dining on the patio. It's a good place to go on a date, especially in the Fall or Spring. The pizza is spot on Neapolitan style pizza.  The Marinara is vegan if you hold the anchovies. Ask to replace them with olives.   There were a few friendly cats that live in the area when I visited and they would hang out with you while you ate on the patio.

oFNEXvHAuvPBHSdMR21KnA.text: I had bookmarked Cibo as a restaurant I definitely wanted to check out since I first moved to Phoenix almost a year ago. Finally, I went to celebrate my bday weekend! It was a somewhat chilly night and we sat outside but I love the heaters nearby which is awesome because outside is the place where you should sit. It's romantic, pretty, cozy, just perfect whether you are on a date or out with friends. We started with the Arancini appetizer which is arborio rice with creamy mozzarella lightly fried & served with marinara. It was absolutely perfect! It was hard to decide between a pizza or a pasta since everything sounded so amazing but I was definitely in a Pizza mood and opted for the Genova which is pesto, mozzarella, potatoes, white onions and parmesan. It was really good but for me it got a little too greasy after the 3rd slice. This is just my personal opinion as I don't do well with foods that are greasy, however it's a really great pizza. I absolutely love their crust, that is definitely something I will be thinking about for some time. There are alot of pizza's I'd love to try in the future for sure. My friends had a pizza as well but I don't recall what they ordered because frankly, I was just having too good a time focused on conversation and possibly dessert. The service was good. They were pretty busy when we got there being a Saturday night and all, but when our server came over she was lovely. A mistake was made with our order but she took ownership and made it right. I love when someone does that! No one is perfect, but when you own up to something and make it seamlessly easy for the customer to be happy it means a lot! For dessert we had a Nutella crepe w/icecream & an order of Palline (small donut balls) NICE!!! We shared all of it, and the crepe was way better than I even expected. Definitely will visit Cibo again in the future.

9p3qzFf18HSunCqAecx3gg.text: Good eats, pleasant staff.  Would recommend this quaint little eatery in Central Phoenix for sure.  Eating outside in the covered patio is quite the pleasant experience and the prices are very reasonable. Pizza and salads are their specialty so if this is what you crave in Central Phoenix you hit the spot!

_EArN8xXNsxKYZN_C-VyvQ.text: Finally made it back to one of my favorite patios in Phoenix for a delicious lunch!   We enjoyed the Sardegna (baby spinach salad) with grilled shrimp and a Vegetariano  Saltinocca (sandwich) hot.   The salad was absolutely perfect. Wouldn't change a thing. The shrimp was perfectly grilled. Plenty of candied walnuts and goat cheese with fresh strawberries and spinach.   The Vegetariano was very good as well. Could have used a punch of flavor with a pesto or some kind of sauce.   Great service and perfect seating on the patio engulfed by the big tree.  Thanks Cibo!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Baby Spinach Salad w/ grilled shrimp and Vegetariano

2EZHjWwLMk2Yw24ojrZ7kg.text: This was my first visit to Cuba before and not it was worth the money ($$$ - $$$$) range.  Mmmm sip sip sip at the healthy wine portion I've been served.  Hmm is this my first or second glass?  I don't typically eat ham but the prosciutto pizza had me stuffing my face and disappointed when it was gone.  Now what's really to die for at this restaurant is the fruit crepes.  They're HUGE and they don't skimp on the fruit or toppings. Nom Nom Nom Nom... polite burp.  Kiss kiss smotch from the girlfriend for taking her to a romantic spot for dinner.  Oh if the temperature is right sit outside, it's dimly lite with vegetation and hanging lights.  Not for the faint of heart in terms of $ but worth every penny you spend.

LyZmcrvwfOy51XAG1Pl88g.text: My husband believes he is a pizza connoisseur and could eat for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. So for his birthday I decided we try out Cibo. It didn't disappoint. We happened to go during happy hour which was a plus so filled up on apps, entrees, and our twin daughters indulged in the Nutella and donuts. Definitely will be back!   Small space inside though but still a good atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy mixed fruit for the kids
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Loving her donuts and nutella
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Calamari for an app

UyK5zo1f3cJ6ZRPFE7H1bw.text: We ordered fresh pasta and a margarita pizza. The pasta was very fresh and cooked very well. The pizza was an excellent thin crust wood fired type of pizza. Pizza sauce was full of flavor and mozzarella was very delicious. Very pleasant at night, has both inside and outside seating.

iRciW3FCiu2_n85MkjoqXw.text: The food here is some of the best I've had in ages. Service can be hit or miss, but over all it's a nice place.

1mxIlrA7n4X3yInHXJVvLw.text: Delicious with amazing service! The atmosphere is beautiful and romantic! Lights strung everywhere through the trees! The waiter was knowledgeable about wines and the whole menu

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gBXf8MLdZszs892IBrSOkg.text: Fantastic Patio Fantastic Pizza Fantastic Wine Fantastic Vibe  What more could you ask for. Need I say too much more? If you answered no....too bad. I am going to say at least a little more.  This patio with live guitar is absolutely phenomenal. Make sure to go at the right time of year for it to be a very pleasant evening. Don't skip the bruschetta and go with a group. Why you ask, so you can order quite a few pizzas and get to taste a slice of each.  Besides, pizza and wine with a good group of friends on a beautiful night on the patio...that sounds awesome.  Oh there you go, that's what more your could want, Fantastic Friends.  Well, that's on you. Cibo will provide the rest.

MiJFh4ER5NmeGIa8xTFAqA.text: Awesome place to enjoy the PHX weather outside on the patio. Come for happy hour where they have great food and drink deals (ends at 6pm) $2.50 peroni's and $4 wine.

j2TcMr4ODVEY0Co1HvFjTg.text: My daughter brought me to this little gem for the first time last night.  Let me just say, it will not be the last!!  Everything was beyond amazing!!  The ambiance was charming and quaint.  The service was excellent!!  We started with a house salad and the meatball appetizer, so good!!!  We had your basic margarita pizza which was wood fired.  The crust was amazing!!  We ended with a strawberry, banana crepe, yum!!   So excited to find this place and can't wait to return to Phoenix so that I can come back.  Check it out and bon appetit!!!

LmF9AG40oZ_rWj4djigpnw.text: Sadly, I'm not impressed with Cibo other than the very pleasant, kid-friendly outdoor patio. It's been over six or seven years since I last dined here, and back then, I was never really impressed by the food, but, after like 100 people telling me over the years how awesome the pizza was, my family and decided to give it another try because I must be crazy if I'm the only one I know who did not love Cibo, right??   My opinion has not changed. The food was edible, some fresh-ish such as the mozzarella on the margarita pizza but it was not explosively so and frankly lacked any flavor at all (as compared to other fresh mozzarellas which can be incredibly delicious despite lacking much "flavor".... ) The prosciutto my four year old ordered as a side to his kids' pizza (hey, he's a foodie!) was sub par quality but he gobbled it! The sauces on the pizza and pasta were "spaghetti'o" tasting per my husband and I kind of agree. No fresh Parmesan... disappointing.   And overall, while it's a kid friendly setting, my husband an I both felt like our server was merely tolerating the existence of our two kids who were at her table. She was pleasant enough and was in no way rude or sub-par as far as her duties, but really didn't seem to be into having kids in her section. I get it, we're a pain, we're messy, we know it ... but we tip well and would prefer to feel like we didn't have to leave asap. The busser at the end of the meal was super cool with our kids, engaging, friendly and happy, so sad I didn't get his name to thank him.

VjRL3yJapazLwY9lZKUU5w.text: Cibo is my favorite place on the planet. I've tried almost everything on the menu, and it's all been fantastic! Start with Il Tagliere, and it's not debatable. Diavola with ricotta (or the the calzone) are the stars on the menu, as are the Nutella crepes and homemade limoncello. If you can't find something on this menu to your liking, then there's something seriously wrong with you. Even cat people will find an orange tabby to their liking (not on the menu).

TNXDXRREH6cNWulg7gtiiQ.text: Amazing! Food was great! The staff was amazing! I proposed here and the staff made sure it was a perfect night! Thanks again!!

TAPRgDaLFoJdulq05bFLww.text: The best gluten free pizza crust I have ever had - made from rice and potato (not just rice flour, like the usual GF fare).  Solid wine list.  Great Caprese Salad.  Quaint setting - reminds me of House of Tricks in Tempe.  Decent wine list - although our server didn't know anything about the wines.  We asked her to ask the bartender to help.  He also knew very little.  In an effort to provide good service, they told us that if we didn't like our bottle, the staff would drink it at the end of the night and we could order another.

xn3XAHxe33LQ-soWfQxVNw.text: Perfect crust, delicious sauce and super fresh ingredients. Delectable crepes for dessert--you have to save room!! The atmosphere is difficult to beat; it's essentially a little old house with a huge front patio, complete with several outdoor tables, strings of those medium sized "yellowish" lights. Inside is so adorable, with a few different rooms with tables in each one. It is always clean and can be a great place for a date or get together with family or friends. So worth it. I've never bothered to wait to eat at Pizzeria Bianco, so I can't say from personal experience but I suspect they wouldn't be any better than this little gem, CIBO. From friends who've been to both, I'd say they'd agree!

yYoqG8wj2bwcWqaQV1H-zg.text: Cibo's Great reputation is well deserved!  Picked a gluten free friend at the airport and headed to Cibo based on the reviews and the availability of gluten free crusts. Got there and were struck by the gorgeous patio and cute interior. Had two salads (huge and and delicious) and 3 pizzas (2 gluten free and one regular).  Our friend ranked it as one of the best gluten free she ever had, and my wife said she couldn't decide which crust she preferred.  Can highly recommend the Salsiccia, capricciosa, and the tartufo. Truffle smell was to die for. Also an excellent choice of very good quality wines at reasonable prices. The Scarpetta Barbera was great.  It was chilly when we went but the beautiful patio was crowded with people and heaters. We will be back for the patio as soon as the weather warms up!  Our server was perfect - knowledgeable, efficient and really fun to banter with. She's been there 6 years and perfect for the job. Couldn't have been a better night!

RKeKHmA1ZfSbADIsdcVw8w.text: I dream about their Diavola Pizza every time I'm in the neighborhood. A very romantic setting, with a huge outdoor seating area and small, but cozy interior. I have only ever had a few of their different pizzas, but have never been disappointed.

En4-jKGuJTdlfvfGLhorhA.text: Best desert I have had in a long time.  Nutella crapes with marscapone.  Great place for pizza. Would love to see one or two more pasta dishes on their menu.

tytE26mm4smxy3L_TRM9vA.text: My girlfriend took me here for a night out as a thank you for her photo shoot. It was absolutely delicious and gorgeous. It was only a few months after I came back from Italy and the food and ambience was perfect. I can't wait for my husband to take me here.

BReCfdY2wNFfLOWjqVwztA.text: I really wanted to like Cibo as soon as we walked up to it. The outdoor patios are lovely and such a nice setting. We went Sunday during brunch time and I was a little worried that they wouldn't have their pizza as I read a few reviews (old ones) that said that they didn't serve PIzza. For the record, they do.  We ordered their margherita pizza and M&M. The margherita pizza was OK, nothing too special. It was also a little salty in my opinion. I was kind of hoping for some freshly grated parmesan too instead of the powdered kind. The M&M was good though, but not something I would go out of my way to get.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cute outdoor patio
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. M&amp;M with strawberry jam
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margharita pizza

JErsc7-Rwr3MnUDJ6r-oLw.text: Although I came with a girlfriend of mine, I would say this is the perfect place for a first date. The staff is friendly and the ambience is warm and inviting- not too fancy. On top of that, the food is absolutely amazing. The pizzas are supposed to be personal, but they are huge!!! They have a nice wine list as well. I also had a salad to start out with which they give you bread and oil and vinegar to go with it. I tried the spiced oil and vinegar and it was delicious. Definitely took my pizza home and had it for breakfast the next day. Will be coming back here when I'm in the area.

0TC-qmZfs5nt-sFQHToIgg.text: Anybody who doesn't love their pizza is a fool. This has to be the best pizza in all of Arizona. The crust is cooked to perfection. The sauce is seasoned just right. The cheese is just enough. They have nailed what pizza should be. Even their gluten-free pizza is amazing. I could eat their pizza everyday. The hot olive oil is definitely a wonderful add to the pizza, just ask for it.  The atmosphere is quite refreshing. I very much prefer to sit outside, weather permitting. Especially having little children they can get a little rowdy inside and they echo. I also think the seating inside is a little tight. Especially with a larger group more than five. Which is why we really like the outside seating. Sometimes still a little close depending on where you are seated but less likely to notice the noise level on the group we always have.  The prices are very reasonable for the quality and size of the food. Two thumbs up.

f1HVOQKSvSjMC7bofclTcA.text: Cibo really is a great spot for date night or a romantic dinner.  We got seated inside and they really set the mood... the lights were so dim I almost whipped out my phone's flashlight app to look at the menu.  We started with the pesto salad (mixed greens, pine nuts, tomatoes, roasted potatoes and parmesan cheese). I thought the salad was excellent. The potatoes were warm and paired with the cooler ingredients was really interesting (in a good way). The server brought out bread and our choice of olive oil. We chose a red chili flakes infused olive oil. This was nice and spicy had a good kick to it.  For our entree we shared the margherita pizza. Really good thin, slightly charred crust. Good classic pizza.   For dessert we split a nutella crepe with strawberries and bananas. I was in chocolate heaven!   Overall a great place for dinner... and they have complimentary valet parking!

t9vkgstw5EpYynCVILt5nQ.text: Fun place!  Great food, vibe, etc...Staff is super friendly and attentive to your needs.  Will be back for sure!!

d4BVchQXaS_VbxKii7FBfg.text: Excellent wood fired pizza and the bartender was very attentive and helpful. Great place.

-e1qh77vcZ4FdNEev6jtyQ.text: Beautiful place for a romantic dinner. The staff was really friendly. Options were great. Only "not so great" thing: asked the bartender for opinion between peach Bellini, limoncello or sambuca. I stated I wanted something fresh and light. He recommended the sambuca. I ordered it only to find it is like VERY strong liquid licorice. Not fresh at all. So spicy I got heartburn. Other than this, I loved the place! Wil be back!

a1N5IRoxoKpQqAQQqz8y1A.text: One of my favorite places to eat in downtown phoenix. Their patio is very cute - I would definitely recommended sitting outside when the weather is nice.  Everything we ordered was very good - there were 4 of us and we ordered a few things to share:   Pear salad - an arugula salad with balsamic, pears, honey, cheese, and toasted almonds - Very good, would definitely recommend!   Burrata - creamy mozzarella with a balsamic glaze served with prosciutto and toast  - so good but not enough toast in the cheese-to-bread ratio!   Vegetariana pizza - a pizza with mozzarella, artichokes, zucchini, roasted red peppers - comes with mushrooms but we asked for it without. This was good but the veggies are separated by section - so you only get one type of veggie on a slice of pizza, rather than having it mixed.   Prosciutto Crudo pizza - sauce, mozzarella, topped with prosciutto. Very tasty but the pizza is cut before the prosciutto is added to the pizza, so you have to recut it to avoid ending up with all the prosciutto on one piece.   Pizza is good - very thin crust and all the ingredients seem very fresh.   Service was pretty good - although they must have been training when we were there, they seemed to get the tables confused and kept attempting to drop off items we hadn't ordered. But normally the service is great. I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burrata Antipasti at Cibo
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pear Salad at Cibo

Y0Uz-h6IpBamGrllaNM_Sg.text: AMAZING food, I used to work within walking distance. The eggplant parmigiana sandwich was my favorite, and the pizza was always great too. On cool days the patio is perfect. Food has always come quickly, and the servers are always attentive. I now work way in the East Valley, and I must say this is one thing I miss having.

ZDbcb2qGkWM7AvfJY64qEA.text: Yep--this is my first and my last stop in Phoenix EVERY SINGLE TIME!  And I always order 2 salads--the Ostia and the Pesto--with extra potatoes and parsnips.  So good!!!

cZhjJIED9yTTwF5EuaVkGQ.text: Always a great place to eat! Love the acoustic music outside! Awesome place for lunch or dinner and the desserts are always amazing!

RpX7xDo50h3XGwLMJfOi5w.text: Great Pizza and the best cappuccino I have had in a long time. This is an all time favorite in Downtown PHX.

3maef99O-B_gAZAdCv-xNQ.text: (Pronounced chee-boh) - Unique pizzas, calzones and salads...and a dessert menu that is 95% Nutella...Yummo!  A beautifully lit patio for dining, which we very much enjoyed this time of year!  I had the Procida pizze bianche...Mozzarella, prosciutto, Asian pears, arugula, and goat cheese.  Paired with a Pecorino white wine, it was a melody of flavors in my mouth!  I wish I could've eaten the whole thing in one sitting, but you get a lot for the money and I had to take half to go.  Why four stars and not five?  Service was not bad, but not impeccable either.  Parking isn't that great and it's a small place.  However, I don't know about you, but I go to a place for food and service...not available parking.  ;-)  I will definitely go back...especially because I didn't have room for dessert!  Maybe I'll start with that next time...

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tartufata and my Mom&#39;s hand...haha!

wA63kD6QvKU2nqBJv_vEOw.text: The burrata is out of this world! The ingredients are so fresh and flavorful! The margherita pizza is my personal favorite! You can go wrong with a classic like that. Cibo's is legit!!

xuJ6UZykmKGIOKd01Td8FA.text: Best pizza in Phoenix! Everyone says pizzeria bianco is the best but it's nothing compared to cibo! I love the setting and the pizza is phenomenal! The menu is unique and I have never been disappointed!

jvZqIz15nrWVrwnxK-5HxQ.text: For an artisan pizzeria, it's pretty good.   Not so spectacular that I will insist that all my friends go there, but if someone suggests it, I certainly won't argue against their decision to take me there.  Also, their crepes. Delicious.

q6tICVAXjsSW5Fv2_6UdkQ.text: One of the cutest date spots in downtown. I always get good service and their patio is adorable. I like to come and share a salad, pizza and bottle of red wine. I really can't recommend more than that since that's all I have gotten in the years I've been coming!

lUQv89dwRZI-1tjhei7gBg.text: Authentic Italian cuisine that never fails to deliver. The pasta specials are the closest to True Italian flavors I've found in the valley. The prices are incredibly reasonable and the ambiance is lovely.

lFQnDLEPLexfDj7h7VOshg.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix! The ambience is lovely and magical. Indoor seating is nice if you want that homey downtown vibe, as it is located in an old house with fun creaky floors and warm mood lighting.   Outdoor seating is my personal favorite. I have always gone on weekend nights so there is sometimes live (but not overwhelming) music and quaint lights wrapped around the trees surrounding the tables.   And as though the ambience wasn't enough, oh my god the food! My favorite pizza the is the diavla (spell?) which is a spicy salami pizza, and it tastes like what dreams are made of... The crust is crispy and the ingredients taste fresh! And the dessert! I HIGHLY recommend ANY crepes. They don't mess around. Fluffly and not to sweet, and always a perfect compliment to the nutella or fruit or vanilla ice cream. Honestly, they could probably put a pork chop in one of their crepes, and it would still be fantastic. Hahaha.  Perfect date night or girls night out or a good "show your parents from out of town an awesome place" restaurant.   Only downside? The wait... But I can't say I don't understand why there is one, and believe me... It is WORTH the wait :)  UPDATE: We have since moved from Phoenix, but whenever I have friends that are visiting, Cibo is first on my list of recommendations. Also, whenever we are in town, we always try to hit it up. Also, I'm gluten free now, since this original review, and Cibo has GF pizza nowwww!! YES!!! And it's good! So, I STILL highly recommend (It's worth the wait).

jr_NF2mPvjsJDAVUKBmnvA.text: Good service and satisfactory pizza. It's not my favorite in the area, that would be pizzeria bianco! The loose leaf tea was quite yummy though. Meatballs were tasty with scrumptious sauce. I'd have to try other dishes before I could give it 5 stars. Still a wonderful and inviting place to eat. Would be romantic for couples and inviting for the family as well! Nice outdoor seating with live music.

TKqwGn9jzbtauHXgDEoz_g.text: So delicious!! Best Pizza I've had in Arizona. And the Burrata was amazing. I'll definitely be coming back here when I'm in the mood for authentic wood fired pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing Burrata

CTJlDpzRFUx2V41iA7medw.text: Last night, I took my mother to Cibo for her first time. It was my third time. First of all, there is complimentary valet (which we did not use), but the parking lot is TINY. We ended up parking a bit away at the Salvation Army establishment. Once we walked to the entrance, we signed in (they send you a text message once your table is ready), and we were lucky enough to sit at the two chairs outside the front door. But please be aware; the waitresses carelessly kick the door open as they walk outside, and after we watched this happen over and over again, we decided it to be a danger. So if you have little ones, DO NOT let them wander by the front door. Her initial reaction to the loudness inside the restaurant was shock. Beware; the sound levels on a busy night are near-deafening. Also, the tables are situated very, very close to each other, so this is definitely not a good idea for a romantic dinner. We both ordered the pulled-pork sandwich made with fresh charbroiled buns. The pulled-pork was delicious and the buns were tough, but was okay, because we ate our sandwiches with a fork and knife. After dessert, we ordered crepes! I had the Nutella and Banana, and she had the Nutella and Mascarpone (fancy cheese). My crepe was excellent, and cost $7.50, which is worth it in my opinion. Her's cost $8.00 and was great, but she complained of not being able to taste the cheese. All in all, we enjoyed our food and dessert, and ultimately, recommend you try Cibo, and if at all costs possible, during a non-busy time of the day.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The lit candle on our table provided a nice, warm touch to our dining experience.
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious Nutella and Banana crépe for $7.50.

YAULDU94rLITAHGu3e3S6A.text: When the moon hitsa your eye lika big pizza pia, that's a cibo" dont' doubt my sangin skills. Finally got a chance to check out Cibo tonight and man am I happy as a...well you get the rest.  Took wife and kids out for dinner before first friday.  I got this great glass or red called Valpolicello, which was AWESOME!  Wifey had a glass of Rose' that was legit.  We decided to have the pesto salad, Di Notte Pizza and Prosciutto Crudo. The salad was pretty good. I didn't taste much pesto, but it was still good. The crust on the pizza was something magic, seriously dope. The Prosciuto crudo was just like when I lived in Italy. Simple, straight forward and dope. Di Notte on the other hand literally tasted like buttered popcorn. No seriously, if you try it watch and see..not my fave. Overall the pizza was awesome, I'm stoked to try some of the other pies. They were busy but we managed to get an inside table right away, score!  If your looking for a legitamus prime pizza spot in cen-pho, you've found it.

VtgBc15hNoi8HNZV_pCuYA.text: Some of the last negative reviews are just plain whining.   I've been eating here for years and the food has NEVER disappointed. The service is always consistent and friendly. The owners Tony and his wife, along with their son - treat you like family. Many of the servers here have been here for years.  The restaurant is located in an old vintage house - so those complaining about the atmosphere or grounds are way off the mark as the antique and rustic feeling is part of the vibe.  Is the Pizza as good as Bianco? No.  Is the pizza outstanding? Yes - no question.  Those comparing this to Bianco again again ad nauseum are missing the point. The pizza here has an extremely flavorful thin crust, and the pies are made by a real pizzailo chef straight from Italy. The pizza is generally perfectly charred, with a nice depth of flavors. This pizza is very similar to the pizza you might get in any good restaurant in Italy.   So stop the whining and comparison to Bianco... sheesh! These are yummy pies any way you slice them, with some interesting twists like sweet aged Balsamic onions that my kids especially love.   The salads here also rock - especially the Pesto salad with small crispy potato bits. Yum!  When you come to Cibo you will be treated like family. Sitting outside among the beautiful mature trees and the cool lights at night makes for a wonderful evening out, and few restaurants in Phoenix can match the consistently great food and ambiance.   Desserts are outstanding, and the Nutella Crepe with vanilla ice cream is simply delicate and melts in your mouth - I like this one better than the Fresca (fresh fruit) crepe as it has a direct route to my sweet tooth.  So for the last few whiner Yelp reviwers...  I say go get yourself a pizza "to go" at Panne Bianco and pick up a Red Box movie... and just stay home!  They do not put Arugula on everything btw - goofy comments, what can you do lol.

NoIs-LOq_dCPi1jNFV_58g.text: First visit and I have to say, the food was outstanding and the ambiance was perfect.  I had heard good things about Cibo in the past so I was a bit confused by the less-than-stellar reviews showing up lately but decided to give it a chance anyway and I couldn't be happier I did. The evening's weather was beautiful so my date and I sat out on the patio. Twinkling string lights and lush plant life complimented by the trickling of a few water features really helped set the mood. Giving the patio almost a Naples feel to it.   We decided to order the caprese salad to split and a couple pizzas (one veggie, one mushroom) to share. First out came the salad and I was already impressed after the first bite. The tomatoes were sweet and juicy and the mozzarella tasted so fresh I swear I heard it moo. Next came the pizza. Now, understand, I consider myself a bit of a pizza snob so It takes a pretty good pie to impress me. That being said, Cibo impressed the hell out of me! The crust was airy and elastic with that perfect rustic baking taste. Again, the fresh mozzarella and ripe tomatoes made an appearance and with the addition of our toppings I was a happy man. I only wish I wasn't such a hog so I could have saved some for lunch the next day.   The only reason I couldn't give Cibo a five star rating was the service. Although our server was as nice and the food came out timely, there was a definite lack of attention. We were in a bit of A time crunch and I had to end up tracking her down to ask for the tab, then again to actually pay it. That being said, everyone has their off nights and the food was so delicious that I well be back many times.

AAdPUflFki9nDFIeKD_ulw.text: Let me say right off the bat, the food here is phenomenal. The reasons I'm giving it such a poor review is everything I experienced this evening - outside of the food - was awful. They don't accept reservations which I think is a quack. Usually when a restaurant doesn't accept reservations, they have a bar area or a patio where you can sit, relax, and wait to be seated. Cibo has a bar - a tiny one - inside the home. There is almost no place to sit and wait to be seated for dinner. We arrived at about 7:30 and were told there would be an hour wait...I think it was closer to 75-80 minutes. As I was the oldest in my group with some health issues, I was the one chosen to get to sit in the one and only (metal) chair by the front entrance. I was thankful for that.  There was no wait staff who came by to see if we wanted anything to drink, so my friends and I waited the entire time, badly in need of refreshment.  We finally were seated on the patio about ten feet from a fellow with an electric keyboard. Call me old and cranky, but when I come to dine in a restaurant, I want to be able to talk in a low voice with my dining companions. Granted, we didn't have to yell to be heard with the music right next to us, but it was definitely hard to hear each other.   We did receive our menus after about five minutes, but I think it was another 30 minutes before we got our meals. The waitresses did keep our water glasses filled which was nice.  Our table was metal, sitting on a paver-type floor, and was uneven. My friend had to keep her foot on the bar of the table to keep it from wobbling. The table had cross bars on either side so you couldn't even sit dead-on to the table. I had to sit sideways and was very uncomfortable. The chairs were horrendous...plastic, skinny, and barely enough room to seat your behind. I think those chairs are there to encourage you to eat and run.  I loved our food...we had the Burrata, the Tricolore and the Tartufta (sp?) pizze which was extraordinary. We didn't get dessert as we were stuffed.  I would return to Cibo but only when they first open. I don't appreciate restaurants that don't take reservations and then expect you to stand the entire time until you can be seated.

mJpHoVv4scmMxjxK9bTlGw.text: Ordered takeout. The pizza was soggy. They seem very pretentious.

VtYZDXCiXeS9elOeny_YIw.text: Wow where do I begin.  I guess this is top dog for Phoenix but in the realm of pizza in general it rates up there with a strip mall no name pizza joint.  I am going to start with the dessert menu.  Really - every dessert is served with Nutella?  There wasn't one faux authentic Italian dessert on the menu.  Coffee - regular coffee that was exactly like the coffee I had in a hospital cafeteria.  I asked if they had cream for the coffee and I was told "Yes, we have half/half."  It was liquid Coffee Mate? Uh, that is not half/half.  While I wait let me give you "our cold stale bread" served without anything not even butter.  We had the Latina pizza and the tomato on the pizza was not even ripe nor near the color red and it was cold dropped on the pizza like a wet noodle.  I bit into a piece of rosemary and felt like I was immersed in a Vicks Vaporub mozzarella pizza.  If this place is owned by a native Italian he/she would be the laughing stock of his former Italian neighborhood.    Hang on... I didn't taste any of the wine.  You might be redeemed with a decent selection of Chianti but I can't imagine this is possible.    Wait wait wait.... the actual restaurant is very quaint in appearance.

tC2KDYCYd3eQJ3g3rCqASg.text: Cibo has a really Great patio. I've been here numerous times. Their prosciutto and arugula pizza is delicious - the Nutella crepe for dessert is absolutely delicious! I do recommend this place all the way.  A lot of people will say this place rivals Pizzeria Bianco - I suppose that it True.  Different flavor than what Chris Bianco is turning out. And Cibo has a much larger pizza selection- which doesn't make that necessarily better or worse. They just do.   The one and only thing that I don't love about this place- their beer selection is lacking. I would love to see them Offer more beers. As a local restaurant, Why not offer some Local brewery stuff - 4 peaks, SanTan?  if you're into wine- their wine selection is extensive!  I'm just not a big wine drinker when I go out to eat.

DzetqXP2uXcHrEde3L6Jbg.text: Tony and wife provide a fabulous experience. On top of great pastas, pizzas and wine list, the service is fun and attentive on a relaxing outdoor lawn. And live tunes to boot. I can't wait to go back!

7qFiYh2C28510mkApsAFjA.text: This is currently our favorite place for date night.  I live in the north valley and don't get to downtown very often but if we have an occasion we definately go to Cibo.  My husband and I are trying to experience all the Best of Phoenix restaurants and so far this is our favorite.    The pizza is amazing.  My husband especially enjoys the pasta specials.   They seat us promptly and the service is top notch.  The fresh mozzarella app is amazing.    If only we lived closer we would go be there much more frequently.

ZGLXuKEtfdt9IVKoQbM0WQ.text: we are repeat Cibo goers especially on Tuesdays when they have pasta specials.  Everything this place does is the bomb.   The cheese plate they did last time we were there was amazing.  This is a cool Romantic setting type of place, but last time we brought out 1 year old and it is family friendly too.  We just wish it was closer!  We live in Gilbert so it is a bit of a drive, but WELL worth it.  The crepe Suzette is amazing if you like marmalade.

v-Ol2eOmss6xxcQHPVH42w.text: Cibo is another of those hidden gems that you would probably never notice if you were just passing through or don't make it to downtown Phoenix. Since this is an old bungalow that has been made into an eatery, this place is smack dab if the middle of a residential neighborhood. Their menu consists of pizza, salads and sandwiches made on fine Italian bread with some awesome Italian meats and cheeses and fresh local ingredients. I love the meatball sandwich so much that I can't bring myself to order anything else. I don't think you could go wrong with anything on the menu. The service is friendly and the atmosphere homey. Their outdoor patio is really a pleasant place to enjoy lunch. I really need to come here for dinner or their new breakfast. Cibo is truly among the best that Phoenix has to offer.

dQWPhbeKxe8-lZjSEoOXpQ.text: I have eaten here several times, its a bit hard to find if you don't know your way around Phoenix. The 1900's Bungalow is amazing, I like to sit outside on the Patio in the fall and listen to the Music. The service is outstanding. Lunch time is for Sandwiches- order the fruit salad with it.... dinner is for amazing Pizza, Biancos is great, expensive and too damn long a wait, Al Fornos in Glendale is great but too noisy, Cibo is right in the middle, great food served in a unique setting

XP6vULRL1OhN4EOvyAtALQ.text: The food here is absolutely AMAZING!!! The only reason they don't get all five stars is because almost every time I'm there, a piece of silverware or dish is not completely clean.

Nq3YSkckZMv58mCUK6RpHw.text: Great atmosphere. Great happy hour. Great food and service. The meatballs and mushroom pizza are my go to dishes. Finish dinner or happy hour with a delicious crepe and cappuccino.

iuoyGJMMzV8BnjEO6tsx5g.text: We love Cibo! Delicious food and great service every single time! Save room for the crepes... so worth it!

9zgreGDF3Dcn-5enIY-czg.text: I love Cibo! Always is consistently good. Such a good place to sit on the patio, and it's even better when they have live music

1Ca50S6MYVRRuJg-qn9kBw.text: The cutest date night location especially if you love dinning outdoors, and the best Italian food with ingredients so fresh it tastes super authentic!

c0UHlzINJpzpO3aZ_RNxvw.text: Whether it's date night or girls dinner night I find myself wanting to go to Cibo.  The ambiance, the food, the pleasant staff, and the happy hour is what keeps me coming back.  The selection of decadent crepes is the cherry on top.

j2d_me0oBdjGOOg2UQjISQ.text: Ok, I must admit, this place had one of the most DELICIOUS pizzas I have ever tried! And that's coming from a genuine, authentic pizza lover.  They give you the option of splitting the pizza into two halves, so you're able to try out 2 different pizzas on one dish! I was able to try 4 different pizzas and they were all delicious!  Also, their service was excellent! Shoutout to the waiter for accommodating my needs and making me feel welcomed!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

WhkXdD9O1Lnxctomd-lxYg.text: I am so surprised I have never reviewed Cibo! This is our absolute favorite date spot. We have been coming in for as long as I can remember... at least 6 years. Absolutely love the romantic but laid back atmosphere. We have so many beautiful memories of dates, birthdays, anniversaries, and holidays. Also, their pizza is my favorite in all of AZ not to mention their crepes for dessert... amazing!

f0IusDLe2cfzO_03RMUW7g.text: The salsiccia sandwich was amazing! Tasty Italian sausage, roasted bell peppers and sauteed onions on wood fires bread with a side house salad. My taste buds were dancing

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

DNnFNKZTKrlk-WqkXj3zPw.text: All the rage and a focused location for all my pizza cravings.   Staff is super kind food is delicious and consistent.    Meatballs are some of the best in the country.   My top pizza destination in the valley.

BlCi8RGGQVZbklJ7i9NSgw.text: This is our favorite pizza joint in Phoenix. It is our daughter's favorite restaurant too! The Antipasto is always fresh and amazing. Pizza is perfect every time. Best happy hour downtown with $2.50 Peroni which tastes great on a hot Phoenix night. Sit outside if the temps are right as they have a wonderful garden area.

evU6PmNURFv8yEwWJOLYIQ.text: Great pizza, wine and burrata! Also must try the patio. Really pretty and last time I went there was live music on a Sunday night.

brTZJ4O8ixGKVsE5i-6Y2A.text: Came here for dinner on a Sunday night with my bff. Cibo definitely did not disappoint. I did make reservations due to its popularity, but Sunday night at 7p wasn't busy for a table for 2 on the patio. When we arrived we were asked if we wanted indoor or patio seating. Definitely sit outside, esp if it's nice out. Enjoy the fresh air and the beautiful ambiance.   We decided to order the Sunday dinner special - lasagna, and the Diavola pizza - red sauce, mozz, spicy salami and definitely add the ricotta cheese for an extra $2.   I didn't care for the lasagna much since the insides had a lot of veggies (carrots and celery). Yes it is different but I live my meats!   I did enjoy the pizza very much. I added more chili flakes for an added spice. The spicy salami had a good kick and the added cheese made the pizza really creamy. Delicious. Unfortunately, the crust was soggy with all our toppings. I would have preferred a crunchier crust.  Our service was great and we got good recommendations from our server. Cute "house"/restaurant with lots of charm and character. Busy on Sunday night and good home cooked food.  Street parking, but be mindful of the meters and red fire lanes!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cibo
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lasagna

Bb-sxCALT15fdUv-_H71dg.text: I came with a big group, and we were seated outside. The weather was nice, which was awesome. There were a lot of leaves being blown onto the table, but it's a worthy tradeoff for getting some shade.  The service was great; they were generally unintrusive, but were available to bring new water jugs and clear plates in a timely fashion. I also really loved the fact that our waitress announced loudly when she passed out the checks that the gratuity was already included. I would've expected that with a group as big as ours (14 people), but it was nice to have it be declared and not assumed.  I ordered the contadino with a side house salad. The cheese on the salad was 10/10, and it was light on the dressing, which I appreciated. The sandwich had amaaaaaazing flavors (man, do I love egg), but it was a bit heavier than I had expected, which made it impossible to finish.

CVXUuh7lfzHGZhyn6lZTKg.text: The food was GREAT! The pizza and pasta were fresh and authentic. The only reason for the low stars was because of our server Amanda. There are other mentions of her on the reviews, please listen and stay clear of her. She made us feel very unwelcome and uncomfortable at a place which should've been a fun time. As long as your serve isn't Amanda, the experience will be great!

xfBHIYVo1CBedDWv5bC7Bg.text: yummy pizza and amazing desserts! Beautiful outdoor seating area.

P6UemGF9-k_-18xCG7MEiQ.text: Cibo is HANDS DOWN one of my favorite restaurants and always a top recommendation for any friends, family, or visitors coming to Arizona for the perfect night out.   I was VERY disappointed on Saturday night when we brought our out of town friends to Cibo. It was around 8pm and we had a party of 6, totally understand a wait with a larger party- they quoted us 45 minutes. I was a little thrown off because the night was settling down and there were multiple open tables. I have worked in the restaurant industry, so I know how it goes. When I asked if they were under staffed, the hostess snapped with some major attitude- totally uncalled for. When I asked to speak with a manager, her response was "he's over there, you can go talk to him" instead of having him coming to us. I am not sure if she was having an off night or what the situation was, but I did not appreciate the bad attitude. It was embarrassing since we had talked Cibo up ALL day to our visitors and we were looking forward to the always amazing meal.   We ended up going to another pizza restaurant in Phoenix because the hostess made us feel very uncomfortable and unwelcome.   I will definitely give Cibo another try and not let this hostess ruin my view on this restaurant.

yqGOiz6RoKRPMYGiudXnsw.text: Excellent pies, good wine, and the crepes... I've had the vegetarian with prosciutto and the Da Vinci pizzas, the Mara wine, and the Nutella and banana crepes. Yummy

X-FZRgQbxo6pZkDXNgf17A.text: Very cozy place, its almost a hole in the wall. We started with the meatball appetizer and OMG, it was just a perfect blend of meat and suace.  Staff were super friendly, we had their Tuesday special and I do no remember the name, but it was great. Well not as good as the meatballs but still good.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RAhSiIi7t9WvS6WRjEAJNA.text: This place is perfect.. the food, the ambiance. My boyfriend loves the lasagna which they only make on occasion. I had sent a message via Facebook asking if they could make it again for an upcoming date night as a surprise. They accommodated! Not many places will do something like that. We are regulars and I suggest this place to anyone! I don't eat meat and I recommend the Geneva Pizza it's amazing. And my boyfriend would definitely recommend the lasagna. Best place in Phoenix. I've been coming here for years and will continue for years to come.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KyQsYdMQpOgu4596oUihTA.text: My favorite Italian restaurant.  The staff are very friendly and the food is delicious!  The owner can be seen there from time to time and though he speaks mostly Italian, he is still funny and a pleasure to talk to.  His paintings are the ones on the inside walls of the restaurant so it gives the place a cozy vibe.  Prices are reasonable too!

a0FDaWxPRX60ZVJZLk51Hw.text: Cibo, Cibo, Cibo! I'm here every few months. I love and appreciate all the gluten free efforts and options. I can't say that enough! The salads are so fresh and light, very delicious! The wine selection is nice as well as the option of champagne at a decent price.   On this particular visit I was disappointed by the GF pizza for the first time ever! However, having had it so many times before, this was a fluke.  The Rustica is phenomenal as well as the Salsiccia, Diavola, and my favorite... the prosciutto crudo.   The best part of the meal on any given night is, of course, the Nutella and strawberry filled crepes. I always have the gluten free crepes and nobody has ever been able to tell the different. The crepes are warm, soft, fluffy, and somehow hold up again getting soggy for longer than expected!!   The restaurant is a converted house which is adorable and cute. However, this makes for a LOUD experience.  Everything is wood and the acoustics around bad. It's loud and hard to hear across the table.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gluten free crepe with strawberries, Nutella, ice cream and whip

ae6H0JL3teQXce7V5R4irA.text: We were brought to Cibo by some Phoenix locals who claimed this was some of the best pizza in the area. They did not lie. My partner and I shared an Ostia salad and a half marinera, half tartufata pizza. The pizza was so good and the salad went well with it. The dough is just so good here - it was crisp and chewy at the same time. We were in pizza heaven!  I would be here every week if I stayed closer.

kzYz6S7jDb8lU7tlufdepg.text: We ate dinner here and loved this place! We had planned on just getting dessert and eating dinner in, but we couldn't resist the unique and reasonably priced pizza options! You can get any of the pizza combinations half and half to make a full pizza, even red and white sauce combos. That's what we did and both halves were excellent! We ended with our dessert, which was a crepe with mascarpone cream and berries and the best dessert we've had in a long time. Highly recommend!

Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Yr3BsGH-RcwVl-fbNkJN0w.text: This week the Jolly Diners went to Cibo. Started with an antipasto roasted / grilled vegetable platter which was delightful. The entrees were meatballs and crusty bread, sausage sandwich with truffle fries, and a fungi vegan pizza with marinara sauce. Everything was delicious, the atmosphere good, the service was good. The Jolly Diners rated Cibo at a 4 out of 5. For couples, Cibo had a great outdoor dining area with live music.

MCqA1o91p7rkWUMz2qLMpQ.text: A few friends from the Owatonna, MN Class of 1963,  got together recently at Cibo for a mini reunion. We shared wine, pasta, LAUGHS and good memories under the twinkling lights of their outdoor patio.   Cibo can accommodate groups from two to thirty-two with ease. Their talented one man band provides just the right ambiance.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED !!

9w9PmXbBiiP2yeKgsNeLBw.text: First time here was last Friday! We had a group of 10 friends and were sat quickly. Our server neglected us, and focused on the party of 14+ sitting next to us. Over 40 minutes to put our order in.   But the food was delicious! Unique pizza combinations, I got the sienna. A white pizza with zucchini and prosciutto. Flavors were perfectly combined and the crust was thin but not floppy. Took another 20 minutes to close out the check...  Patio was beautiful though!

1vFwoZyqxereUJduQAWjoQ.text: Came here for double date night as my friend is gluten free. We waited at the bar for our table & I had their Bellini which was awesome, I loved the inside, it felt like we were in someones home. We started with arancini which was amazing then came our pizza, we split the Margherita & was not disappointed. The real show stopper was the linguine cacao e pepe, oh my goodness this was absolute perfection! So creamy and cheesy! I would definitely come back for that pasta alone!

_eQwB_LG3iOM4SBkirtiqw.text: A long time favorite - I absolutely love the patio when the temperature is right. And the food is always fantastic.

fBW1q98eHe_WCw4M22ieXw.text: Nice outdoor seating and a quieter dining experience. Very noisy inside but cooler in the summer. The food was good but you cannot have a conversation with anyone. Service is a bit slow.

qUlo8quz3-YznoibQVQInQ.text: We love it here, we keep coming back. Patio is charming and casual, the pear salad is my favorite

ZbCxaJIj0-w5AmDFOq7hUw.text: My favorite place for pizza in Phoenix!     I absolutely love going to Cibo for many reasons.  What is there not to love about this place.  Cibo is a restaurant set inside of an early 20th century bungalow with beautiful hardwood floors and exposed brick. When you walk through the main doors, you are greeted by the hostess stand and a small quaint bar... there are several dining "areas" throughout the restaurant, as this was a "house" that has been renovated in the historic Filmore area just off the main downtown area of Phoenix.    The pizza here is fantastic.  People often compare this pizza to another popular pizza restaurant in Phoenix.  I don't think that there is a comparison.  Cibo is so much better.  I have tried several pizzas here, but my favorite, surprisingly, is the Genova.  I always order the pizza well done and the crust comes out nice and crisp.  I love the Pear Salad as well.  The salad is huge and can be share between 2 friends.  You must also try the lemoncello.  It is divine and the best in Phoenix that I've tried other than homemade.    Bon Appetite!

2CVZC8u8_XfoHjXwG-SulA.text: Great pizza, reasonable prices and very authentic compare to our resend trip to Rome.

EFaSfwDPOY3MBotLy1crUg.text: Love this place!!! They have great pizza. Their pizza is thin crust and always cooked to perfection! We actually ordered the pasta & meatballs the last time we were there and both was delicious.  Must get - their dessert. The strawberry & Nutella crepe. I had to fight my hubby off the damn thing. Pricing is also very reasonable. You won't be disappointed.

2oYwIZoOs_LxxBzpaqFwDw.text: Wow. One hour and I still do not have a simple pasta dish. Staff has told me twice I'm next in line but I don't believe it. Used to live this place but an hour for a simple pasta dish-- which I must take to go so I can make it to the theater -- is not acceptable.

y8L9OZhGQ821hlLt8jGYeg.text: One of my favorite pies in town.  I love the tartufata and the salami calzone is AMAZING. I never want to share my calzone.  Delicious and fresh!  it's been here awhile, if you haven't checked it out , you are missing out!!!

fs3O9labkBdMhWHKcK8qtQ.text: 1st time here for dinner! Definitely will be back ! We had a couple of appetizers,pizza wine a desert ! Everything was on point along with the customer service! The music  in the evening was wonderful! Loved the ambiance and feel  of this restaurant!  The perfect Gem tucked away !

Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LpY_V91-Oc-Gz-s2amqoug.text: Ohhhh Cibo  The atmosphere of this restaurant is definitely 5 stars. The patio is gorgeous. The inside of the restaurant is a house. Being from New York originally, Cibo gives me that historic vibe that I might get in an old little Italian restaurant in NY.   I guess I should comment on the food as well... DELICIOUS! I have only gotten pizza here and that is because I can't justify getting something else because the pizza is so good. One pizza is large enough to split between two people with an appetizer or some bread.   Highly recommended.

VeBUJa7VtMxB1zCalzedOA.text: Great wine list and really like the Pizza Di Norte. Try the T&K salad with oranges and gorgonzola.

D5cRQnGxav2NNCX5PtbpQA.text: I love Cibo. I'm not fond of pizza and I don't like long Yelp reviews, but I've got to preface this with a ten-second backstory so you'll understand why I was there in the first place. I'll make it fast:   Amanda M is one of my favorite Austin Yelpers, who has since transplanted to London. A couple of weeks ago she sent me a totally random text: "I accidentally deleted all my pictures of a wonderful restaurant Andi & I went to in Phoenix, and I just want you to sympathize with me." Well okay then, I can do that. I feel your loss, been there, done that. Incidentally, Andi is Amanda's fiance and a cool guy.   So here's how Karma works: Two weeks later I find myself in Phoenix, I have to eat somewhere, and I start thinking just because I'm a cool & sensitive guy, wouldn't it be fitting if I went to that restaurant and made a surprise photo montage for Amanda? Of course it would. That's what makes me a cool & sensitive guy.   But what caught me by surprise is Cibo really is a remarkable place. It appears to be a converted house, and the outside patio/garden/dining area strewn with tiny lights is truly a wonderful place to be. On any given evening, it's easy to see why Cibo is a popular Phoenix destination.   And it's also the best pizza I've ever had in a restaurant. I got a half Vegetariana and half Diavola, because Amanda said their spicy salami was really, really good. And she's correct. Perfect crust, perfect toppings. I'm pretty sure their cheese isn't coming from a can. The house salad and Nutella & strawberry crepe were just bonuses, and superb ones at that.  I wish I could be a little more specific on what made Cibo - and everything about the place - a wonderful and memorable experience for me. The quality of ingredients? The magical ambiance? The precise yet transparent service? Maybe it's as simple as completing my mission - I knew what Amanda's montage would look like before I even pieced the pictures together. And I posted it for you here.   You know that classic storybook rhetoric about the planets lining up correctly, and then everything falls into place in perfect harmony? Well, that's pretty much how I felt walking into Cibo, and that's exactly how I felt walking out. I'm not sure it gets much better than that. In proper Yelpspeak, that makes Cibo as good as it gets.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Preliminary test shot of Cibo. Oh, that crepe with Nutella &amp; strawberries? Um, yes please...

4VBkNIv83bhrjEY6Xj0NiA.text: A colleague took me here on a recent business trip, and on my next trip I will definitely be back. The thing that impressed me about  Cibo's is the food is all very fresh and very high quality. I don't know if they cure their own olives, but it wouldn't surprise me - it's that kind of place. You just can't go wrong on that menu. Portions are generous but not absurd and service was great; friendly, thoughtful - eager, even. The staff seemed proud of the place.The surroundings were very nice, too.  I may share the secret of Cibo's with my other colleagues when we visit Phoenix next month...if they're extra nice to me.

cI1J-gEiJhvxL-JsEWs32w.text: Great place to buy a pistol..knowledgeable staff and friendly ...have done business before and will do again..the new location looks great

1nIrMXZ63lQkMtAesuNyMQ.text: Amazing wine list, fantastic pizzas with unusual toppings, and gnutella crepes for dessert.  It doesn't get any better.  Not to mention that the service is excellent and friendly, and the atmosphere is comfortable and welcoming, something that you don't usually experience in a place as hip as Cibo.  I get nervous going out to trendy places because I'm scared of getting dirty looks from rich people, but this was not my experience at Cibo.  Just sitting on their patio is a relaxing experience, what with the lovely foliage, glass of wine, and beardy waiter.  I always want to go back when I've got the cash.  Great for a date or special event.

sZEHl0t9cFYFzAtVY_LtNA.text: I think their pizza is overrated and it always has burned crust.  Supposedly, that comes with wood fired pizza. I'd rather have not-wood-fired pizza then.  Thanks.

IiHOCy5TY70BUFOVtri_Lg.text: Better than Pizzeria Bianco...NUF SAID!!!   Seriously, this is one of my favorite places to dine in the valley, phoenix, arizona, um...anywhere for that matter. I've had some of the best pizza there is, from new york to chicago, italy and back. Cibo is my favorite. The service is always spot-on. The wine list smart, the appetizers tasty, salads luscious, deserts to die for, the location is adorable and of course the pizza is perfect! This place has palpable charm and the ambiance whether its quiet or busy is somehow always what you hoped for. Just writing this is making me change my plans for dinner tonight!

2ThKcMLHlakBUktHS05oNg.text: Always enjoy eating here.  The Chef makes a good pizza.  If you like the pizza in southern Italy, you will love the pizza here.

tq-sSWtsLRpzhFWjv91Uuw.text: Been to Cibo many times! Beautiful historic house, consistently great service, best pizza in the Valley. We have long-debated whether Cibo surpassed Bianco, but I no longer question that it does. Cibo is best, and reasonably priced and delicious. The burrata is also the best I have ever had, and I highly recommend it. It is extremely creamy, but holds together very well, and the balsamic drizzled across the top is phenomenal.

GcYY8Y5UBBTFGPe6Ob1rNA.text: I had been here before and the food was pretty good, patio is amazing and they have gluten free pizza (someone in my party has an intolerance), so I decided to take my family here for dinner. There were six of us and when the first two arrived, they were told they would not be seated until our entire party arrived. This seemed a bit strange, and I felt bad, as I had told them to order drinks and an appetizer while they waited for us. Not the end of the world, though. When the rest of us arrived and went to the host, I asked if we could please be seated on the patio, he looked at me as though I insulted his mother, and in a curt, very rude tone (with a facial expression to match) said "No, you can't". Then he said that they were booked due to a concert (there were several empty tables on the patio) that he was sure I was going to. When I said I wasn't going to any concert he just rolled his eyes and turned away, handed some menus to an embarrassed looking waitress and we followed her to our table. We were all in shock at how rude this guy was. I can't stress the shock. I have never, ever, ever had any employee at any restaurant I have ever been to be this rude. I was not upset about the patio (maybe a little disappointed, because it is very nice), I was just blown away that this guy had been this rude with absolutely no provocation. We only took a few minutes to talk it over and everyone agreed to leave, and everyone was in as much disbelief as I was. Before leaving I asked the waitress who the rude man was and she responded "Michael, the manager." What!!!! The manager?!! When I asked how that guy ended up in a managerial position there, she explained that it's a "family business". Wow. My advice to that family is to hire somebody who actually deserves and wants a job to run your restaurant. We ended up going to Bianco (about 2 miles away) and received amazing service and amazing food (I mean, AMAZING food). No gluten free pizza, but a delicious antipasto that met our gluten free needs quite nicely. I will NEVER go to Cibo again and I promise, I will tell everyone I know to avoid that place like the plague.

-t4m_kLhZf35omHkjHlRAg.text: Best pizza in phoenix (Sorry Chef Bianco). Really affordable meal and wine! My new favorite place in phoenix.

qEuEROZbyBQ7k18vLECsPA.text: The atmosphere was very laid back and friendly. The food was very good. They used very fresh ingredients which gets a gold star in my book.

TIV6VbCe_3LYrTvnPJHySA.text: Cibo is actually a house that's been converted to a restaurant. There is seating and a small bar area inside, as well as outside patio seating in the front yard. The outdoor area has white lights strung up among the trees, very cute. This all makes for a wonderful atmosphere: charming during the day and romantic at night!   The service is also great. Our waiter was friendly, knowledgable about the menu and made some solid recommendations for us.  On to the food: The pizza is AMAZING! I think Cibo is way better than Pizzeria Bianco. The crust is thin, but it's still doughy and a little chewy. We ordered the Salciccia (tomato sauce, sausage and cheese) and the De Notte (4 cheeses, spicy salame, no sauce). The sausage tastes like it has rosemary in it and the salame is indeed quite spicy.   Delicious!

E8yegFYrKt4c8blututkWQ.text: Everything I've had here is great.  Excellent pizza, excellent antipasti, excellent salads, excellent desserts.

30WhpI4G0_Efy25H7TC6ng.text: Great lunch spot away from Downtown Phoenix.  I love their salads!

AK62JQoXTzsg3wFvSUPN6A.text: Best authentic Italian style pizza in town! Absolutley love the food. Long wait, but well worth it. Go knowing you are going to spend some time waiting and grab a drink. You wont regret it!

st_3bpOmbdsBjdUsD8bZKw.text: very good pizza, great crepes. We had the large sampler appetizer plate, and it was really good too.

KLPo0kBPUJT8Tj9p5NBmTQ.text: This is one of my new favorite restaurants. I have been twice now and I can't wait for my next visit! Both times I went with a group of friends and everything we ordered was excellent. The pizza was amazing! Dessert was devoured in a frenzy. The ambiance was perfect. This is a great place for a date or a night out with the girls. Also, a wonderful place to take visitors. If I lived closer I would be there every week.

MBoDovF3otg2HiT_HlOUng.text: Saturday night was our second time at Cibo and we were NOT disappointed.  We started at Bianco and were disappointed when they told our party of 6 that it would be a 4 hour wait.  So we decided to give Cibo a shot.  Great choice.  They sat us on their beautiful patio immediately and they had live music.  James was our server and he was wonderful.  We started with the Il Tagliere and the 3 pairs of Bruschetta, amazing.  Then I think for our party of 6, we got 7 pizza's, they were all delicisous. I think everyone's favorite was the Procida, it was light and fresh and simply amazing.  I would come back here again anytime.

5IFXvpU1rZJBiP30hFnVjA.text: Love this place! It gives you a relax and warming atmosphere, where you can either enjoy with your significant other or with a group of friends. Every time I been here, makes me want to jump into airplane and fly to Venice, Italy.

9iUluLEVSSYnzpLb9qP1lQ.text: I absolutely love this place! I have lived here four years and I can not believe that I just found out about it this year. I have been there several times and the service is impeccable, the food is mouth watering and the ambiance is great. The owners are such nice, friendly people and I have to give a shout out to TOM. Who made my night with amazing recommendations and genuine service. :)

9ewWDQ4fumNrwRx7QMDlGQ.text: Today was my first time at Cibo for lunch after several years of heading there for dinner.  I prefer the lunch menu.  The hot lunch sandwiches are amazing, we had the pulled pork and fried eggplant.  I very small salad comes on the side (it could use more dressing and less large onions.)  All the tables have umbrellas or are in the shade so it is a great spot to enjoy the beautiful March weather.

8JVsHg0QrKthCF0FscudWQ.text: I met a friend for lunch. We sat on the patio since it's somewhat nice weather for Phoenix. It's sprinkling!! The waiter was a bit abrupt (unexpected) but polite. He seemed in a hurry, but it was empty. Who knows! We ordered sandwiches and were tasty. The house salad was very good.  Will be back in the evening sometime.

2WPpHlvBDzrBHtE3cb6Tug.text: Cibo! Cibo! Cibo!  I love you and your cute old farm house, your amazing pizza, affordable wine, awesome crepe desserts, and fabulous staff!  I want to live in the apartment above the restaurant!!   Go to Cibo for awesome food, charming atmosphere, and a great time for a girls night or on a date.  Cibo has quickly become my favorite place in Phoenix!   *They're closed on Sundays...found this out the hard way.

QvR-vsVEGAmvpAnpRpF5WQ.text: Good looking food and a cute little place, but the last few times I've gone the service has been SO slow. Kind of wish there were more options that didn't involve cheese. Go on your birthday because you get the delicious crepe for free. Yum!

_yx25_DMPOJqywzcj6G0rg.text: Top notch pizza with plenty of red or white options. Nice, charming patio seating area. Looks like it was converted from a house. Just came back from italy and this place is just as good or better than pizza places there.

etYbUs8aIuGWAOhYPi9Puw.text: My boyfriend and I have been to Cibo 3 times and have not been disappointed yet! The atmosphere is charming - it's basically a house that was turned into a restaurant. The interior can get a bit cramped, but the outdoor seating is lovely with a gardeny-feeling and twinkle lights.  Each time we've gone, we've gotten the burrata and it's FANTASTIC.
