I highly recommend it to all the cheese lovers out there! We've also gotten several different pizzas (all of which are excellent) and the Tartugata and the Genova are particular favorites for us. The pizzas are a bit small, so we usually get a few appetizers or a pasta to go with our pizza. The price for the quality of food that you get is well worth it. Also, Happy Hour is a great value - I got a (generous) glass of the house red wine for $4 and it was quite good.

DKkmqMThjqfkmK4BQREaUw.text: Really good. Cute place, nice ambiance. I had their very thin crust pizza which was lovely and my friend had a sandwich that she enjoys regularly - this was my first visit. Everything appears clean, service was prompt and friendly and not overly hovering.   Will definitely return. Nice lunch place!

nu3P1jFSoGVI9DH6nupyjQ.text: Love this place. Met up with a good friend for Happy Hour here. I actually enjoy coming here by myself from time to time and people watch from the bar. There's always somethin' on their wine list to accommodate Love their pizzas and salads. A restaurant that knows how to tease me properly with Nutella as an ingredient will always receive high praise from me! Decor and setting is perfect for friends and family -- If wear permits and is ideal, I highly recommend dining out on their patio. Can't say anything negative about this place.

5OV8PO6baWvrkiooMY1_gg.text: New happy hour menu was terrific. Had the meatballs and Gnocchi. The Margarita pizza was very good. Overall, as good as Pizzeria Bianco, and there's no crazy wait.

02uIWc7WKIljFAiurZY6Pg.text: My favorite gluten free pizza ever! They have a spicy sausage that's fantastic. Service has always been great. Be sure to sit outside and get their iced tea...so yum! They have a live jazz band that does radiohead covers, which is the perfect cherry on top!

s-a5GscOQbbVbh7X5pCU5A.text: Came here on Sat evening. Has a little cute patio with really really nice jazz band. Wait was only 20 minutes to sit outdoor. Easy nice selection of food. I think this will be a nice place to come out on the date. The bar only offer beer and wine. Also we got eaten by mosquitos for sitting out! Other than that, a great little place to stop by for any occasion!

PbRcugXa1J-HtDJAe1a4Gw.text: Not bad.  The atmosphere is really the best part about this place.  Cute outdoor dining area that is draped in lights.   Sometimes they have live music.  Food misses the mark in comparison to the million other pizza restaurants in Central Phoenix.  I feel like they would do better if they featured more pasta options.

b5VTig7i8zq2Lzr9Qm6i3g.text: This place is, as the five stars suggests, as good as it gets.  If you are looking for a nice romantic dinner, Cibo offers it all.   Great food and drinks, great location, and great atmosphere.

Cz73RUSL2OWfuvot4HwCLg.text: Might have found my fave resto in Phx. Cibo hearkens to the good life, often attempted but rarely found.  With its exceptional ambiance, Cibo belongs more in Sonoma than Phx... rustic charm w/an incredible eye for detail - menu, staff, and venue all with great character. The entire restaurant has an intimate, homey feel - from its candle-lit outdoor garden seating, to its wooden porch entrance, cozy seating inside.  Visited to sample their handmade pastas (Tuesdays), gnocchi caprese-style with cherry tomatoes, fresh mozarella. Was impressed by their extensive, reasonable wine list with unexpected finds.  Would return for their foodie pizzas, enjoy a glass of vino alfresco, and savor Cibo.

zURFIjgmVuVGu19yicIAOg.text: Creamy hearted burrata just as everyone says: delicious. Quality balsamic and prosciutto crudo. Tomatoes are firm but marinated nicely. Found a Siciliano wine the people of Sicily actually drink: bonus points. Order a half/half pizza if you can't decide. Di Notte is indeed spicy and balanced by the Gorgonzola while the sausage on the Salsiccia is springy in texture and the crust beneath a bit limp (if you like crispy, this isn't for you---it's up to personal preference). Enjoyed the ambiance of the house and outdoor garden. And the stiff froth on my cappuccino convinced me the barista knows his/her stuff. Great service, too! I'll be back.

pfpIzr6ND6xDgI6LdiBULw.text: In town on business.  Great food, great service, great crapes, good selection of local beer and the price was right.

uEgPdEpTvl7HlKL3Paygxg.text: I had heard and read about this place for over a year but I lived too far to ever go here, plus I am lazy when it comes to driving too. Well good news and bad news. The good news is I had a class near this place so I went there for lunch finally. The bad news? It was just okay, talk about a big let down.   First, the good is the excellent atmosphere. The place is just beautiful and the setting is in a nice and quiet neighborhood that you never thought is Phoenix. Luckily the weather is gorgeous at this time of year and the servers were very nice. You just can't beat the atmosphere, it is a great place to take out of town guest to impress just make sure they don't expect the same from the food.   The food, Now to be fair, I do not know where all these wood buring or what I call rustic pizza craze is coming from. From grimaldis to lagrande orange to other places like these, their crust are just awful from my point of view. I use to live in Chicago and those were real crust that you can actually see and taste and feel the textures in your mouth from the buttery thick crust to the crispy and light thin crust. All I can ever feel are just the toppings, the crust is paper thin with no texture or taste. Please the outside crust don't count, who eats that with the ingredients huh? Well all I can say is that if it is thin crust, it should be nice and crispy, not barely able to hold up the pizza that you have to eat it with a fork.   I have to say their ingredients is top notch and the salami was excellent on the Davoda pizza. Else everything was alright, the sauce was good, but not the best I have had by far. Beside that there is nothing to judge off really in a pizza, crust, toppings and sauce really is all. It was average, but again, next time that  I have outside visitors from out of state, definitely taking them here to enjoy the atmosphere.

U4aV4zHW0CcmlFaJdSvxyQ.text: 5 stars for atmosphere, food, and the Nutella and strawberry crepe. Spent Friday the 13th here for V-day and it was great. The patio ambiance and the guitarist were spectacular. I LOVE me some Cibo!

jXTcADSfROwBOvyXNV4ltg.text: Some nights.... I.... sitting here.... day dream about your truffle pizza.... I want .... I want it .... IN MY BELLY!!!!!!!!!!

oJa6D-rCrxM3wMNwHXLNnA.text: Very pleasant experience. I enjoyed dinning outside on a beautiful evening. Romantic atmosphere.

-A29i-tP5T6M82bO5IJmTA.text: Went with a group of 4 people and we all agreed it was the best pizza in PHX/Scottsdale.  Diavola, Tartufata and Quattro Formaggi were flat out unreal.

vzo39W5tT8xKjrXcFsOqXg.text: Had a nice dinner here with my Girlfriend in our one month anniversary... I really liked the experience... Great food and great Service. Parking was a bit of a hassle but it was fine. Definitely recommend this place :)

UGOOluuUphUQ735HbMDyQw.text: Went in 2012 loved it havnt been since but When I drive by its always busy. Food was pretty amazing.

kH77iIxDCjDKWbjZgCpLAQ.text: It's been a while since I've been back here and this time it was the Cibi we all know and love.   The server was excellent.  Very cheerful and engaging.   The food was the usual perfection.   And of course the crepes were the perfect dessert.   This place will always be on my A list.

BPUjmZPR5GyNf4N6irD-WQ.text: Absolute best pizza in AZ. No competition.  Cannot say enough about this establishment, from the staff on, it is fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

eG2FBoMj7GXv1qA02ytzeA.text: Cibo is a cute restaurant in a historic house in downtown Phoenix. Parking  can be limited to parallel street parking but it's worth it. The house salad that comes as a side to sandwiches is delicious. I love the cheese in it. I usually get the grilled cheese and it is soooo rich and delicious. The hint of mint makes it very unique. The iced tea is delicious. The only drawback is the service - it seems to be either hit or miss here. I've had more misses than hits unfortunately!

6hsmgVcq0RLTm7YgOM-NXA.text: This is a quaint spot, which undoubtedly was once someone's residence. You try to figure out which room is which as you walk in, picturing a TV or a sofa in the corner. You feel like you are having dinner and your buddy's house with his folks preparing a meal. We showed up for a late lunch, no wait or crowd. Pizza was fabulous. Nice texture to the crust, a little floppy so using a fork isn't out of the question. My son had the crepe, which looked amazing and tasted just as good. I would imagine parking could be beastly during a rush, since you are in a neighborhood, so plan accordingly.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Creeps and sausage pizza! Does it get any better than that?

frDPkvjG-Co0hPLyyzBYYA.text: Great food.   Service wasn't very attentive the day I went.  Needed to get up and go ask for 4 out of 5 plates to eat since we only had one after clearing our salads.  However, I would definitely recommend Cibo given how good the food is (spicy salami pizza was awesome) and give them a one time pass on the service that day.

gDK5hJNekSwfaZAFFQFSfw.text: 3.5 stars Nice place to have dinner outside. Excellent service. The highlight of the food for me was the Diavole pizza. Pizza overall is good. Our group didn't like the wine as much. In my opinion the dessert crepe with nutella and strawberries had too much nutella.

lcDPKV8DTkEnxKJ2OJLixQ.text: I am a fan, period. I wish someone would take me here, but I might just go alone or with my mom... Hah.

ReKJLbN6f6cSly_FdkOs4w.text: Cibo hits all the right spots! Their pizza is some of the best I've had in the Valley- chewy, tender crust with that wood-fired taste and it's obvious that all of the toppings are high quality.   Luckily I came here on a night when they were serving up handmade pasta and got to try the Orecchiette Bolognese which was delicious all around, perfectly sauced, and came with a small side salad. The portion was a bit small which was a tad disappointing for the $14ish price.  We rounded up the meal with the Banana Nutella Crepe with Ice Cream...the perfectly sweet way to end the meal! Cibo has a gorgeous patio space and live music on some nights. It was a bit chilly but there were ample heaters to keep us comfortable during our meal.  The service was a bit spotty and our waitress wasn't very sincere and seemed rushed, which was a bit irritating, but the food made up for that and that's why Cibo gets 4 stars in my book.  Will definitely be returning!

vXr7wwwEf0ZoGn0GUHJw7w.text: Great location and very good food. If you're looking for a patio restaurant in central phoenix, I'd highly recommend it - perfect for a date or a group of ~10-15 people (though if you're going at prime time, you'll probably want to call ahead).

fRqpeJxT1I8lYUOXG2HYkw.text: I thought the food was super good! It was reasonably priced for a higher quality pizza! Cozy environment, nice location.

vTQP6TDn_o4tfgwZSGPVbQ.text: This is the best pizza place I have tried thus far in Phoenix. I love that it is located in a house. I couldn't decide between two of the pizzas and they let you do half and half! That really got me excited. I had the truffle pizza and another white one with spicy sausage. They both were amazing! I will be back shortly. Great place to take out of town guests.

cBKPVxWPcouLg0Lh7p3QbA.text: Love the ambiance . Quaint Urban setting in an old downtown home. Live music, patio dining as well as indoors.   Beer and Wine bar.

ct5NNe-fVysA8EX9y0woXg.text: Hands down, best gluten-free pizza in my 6 years of gluten free.

ZkMMIUJsQNXi6KysQTyUIQ.text: After eating about the city for about a year and a half, I can't find a restaurant more divine than Cibo.  The setting is key.  Carved into an old house, Cibo offers a stellar patio from October to March where giant trees studded with lights and providing a seductive canopy create a romantic or intimate setting (depending on who you are dining with).  Inside small two or four seat tables nestled into every nook and cranny of the adorable former house provide the same feeling as the outside but with a few dashes of warmth and cozy.  Now comes the food.  I feel in love with prosciutto at Cibo.  I rediscovered why I loved pepperoni here.  I remember each time I come just how perfect pizza can be.  I have had about 7 different pizzas here.  The one with arugula on top is delicious.  The one with just cheese (4 delectable kinds) and spicy salami is delicious.  The one with walnuts is delicious.  I could go on and on.  Perfect for a date. Perfect for an out of towner.  Perfect for a birthday.  Perfect for any occasion.

ipNSl-xRGePjQHGHMIOKWQ.text: Excellent wood-fired pizza in a cozy (crowded) setting that used to be a house. Have some time to spend, but worthwhile if you do.

cxOzTTZDM5VOOQuS-xbUpA.text: Always a great spot to meet friends and know you're getting good food and good service. Awesome outdoor patio

mDQgL1_cQ8EeR1GlHy7uIg.text: Great patio and nice beer selection. The pizzas are small but delicious. I could probably eat 2 by myself if I was really hungry.

ekIpdQobLu_3sK-US0LzDw.text: The pizza was delicious. Really, really good. The restaurant itself is a cool little place also. Awesome patio. My wife and I each got our own pizza, shared some, and had a little bit left over. Highly recommended.

WSlEiKTmVDbcxaHkLl07Wg.text: Charming restaurant that delivered with excellent pizza and prompt, friendly service.  It is located in a neighborhood and is very unassuming.  However, the food and service made this a can't miss spot!

cmwN2aYQ95LhSChORYA2Mg.text: Slow service and this place charges for soda refills!!!  Pizza is ok, but NO FREE DRINK REFILLS!!!!  There's better.

j7dJqtUeAmNQDaWPPv7RRA.text: Friends of mine and I used to jokingly say that Cibo was where people went when they couldn't get into Pizzeria Bianco. However, as good as Cibo is, it isn't even in the same league as Bianco. With that said, Cibo still gets 4 stars from me because of the adorable converted house it occupies, the decent service, and pretty good pizzas. Not my favorite pizzas in the world, but they're not too pricey and they get the job done. I also enjoy their crepes for dessert and appetizers. Their beer and wine could use a little upgrading, and I stay far away from their limoncello (which is just too harsh when it should be velvety and smooth). I like to sit outside on beautiful Phoenix nights and soak in the smell of the desert, but only nights when there isn't any live music. And by live music, I mean the nights when second or third-rate Phoenix bands play half-assed cover songs in exchange for drinks from the bar...no thanks.  Good for special occasions, large groups, and for trying to impress your parents when they come to visit.

N0-rTqsnmrKNM-0s_PZ_Dg.text: One of the best places in Phoenix, situated in the old historic district.  Cibo has great wines, great appetizer's too.  I recommend one of my favorite pizza's that is prepared just like you would have in Italy, the pizza con proscuitto crudo.

eL3YVsGaPH0SYN73KVu9dA.text: Great pizza and I love the beer selection. It's a super cute place that is perfect for a first date. The pizza sizes are generous as I could have easily shared mine with a friend. Parking can be difficult during peak dining times, but as long as you are willing to drive around a bit, it shouldn't be too hard.

jM9j1Zac7yyu6xstk_b8AQ.text: Wonderful outdoor patio atmosphere. Good appetizers and wine selection. Nice, quiet, romantic evening dinner location.

Mci3AYLt2sCsHD1vpYiUgg.text: Cibo has been one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix for quite some time.  It love the space, particulalry when I can eat outside.  The pizza is always good.  I'm a big fan of the Rustica.  There is a good wine list, and overall it is a place that I like to sit with friends and hang out.  Unfortunately, I can't give Cibo four or five stars becuase the service continues to be awful.  I was in the restaurant last Saturday night, it was busy and there seemed to be a complete melt down with the bar staff and the wait staff.  The Bar tender refused to serve us.  She sent us to a drab coach house in the back of the restaurant.  The Coach House did not have the full wine list available.  Really, there was not much available.  The bar tender kept dissapearing, he ran out of glasses, it was too crowded, noisy...I expect much more from a restaurant.  After we were finally seated, things improved.    I think I'll avoid Cibo on the weekends until it can work out its service issues.

DTeSsVM3Orm_lS2qNrH56g.text: Had lunch at CIBO today.  They only serve sandwiches at lunch.  I had the eggplant sandwich.  It was delish.  Served with a side salad.  Salad was just OK.  Ice tea very tasty.  Great urban feeling.  I want to go back in the fall and sit outside at night under the little white lights with a glass of wine and enjoy Phoenix.  And of course try one of their pizzas.

e_ROKRzcviDlr5fp4uMEJQ.text: Spicy pep pep pizza, nutella crepe with ice cream and banana or strawberry, glass of wine, get you right in the head in the '97 sucker. Cannot vouch for anything else on their menu.

dVFnZkhq-dNShJolmRExBA.text: LOVE it.  Pizza is terrific... people are nice.  Love the patio (unless it's summer).  We go often!

Cy2pMg7vqseJ5HWyDAF-8A.text: I was not impressed. The pizza crust on the Margherita I ordered was soggy. I have had better at Pizzeria Bianco or Humble Pie.

qf3PPs7_FB1L3nsaMQB5aQ.text: I've had 2 great experiences with CIBO, and 2 that left me cold.   Pros: Great pizza, delectable crust, ambiance, cordial service, great wine, bustlingly quaint & neighborhood-y.  Cons: When CIBO gets overwhelmed, which is often, the service and product diminish steadily and predictably. Last visit, my order came out within 5 minutes of placing it and I got low-pitched food illness thereafter.   I want to love you, CIBO, because when you are good, you are oh so good.

wWmQAdFNK1tgICaSonOa6Q.text: I believe that everyone who loves pizza should visit this place. Cibo is famous for their Italian foods but their pizza is the best in town. I've been here a lot of times and they never failed to satisfy me. I love pizza. Want pizza? Go to Cibo now!

dIhogru5fCaZXPJIUpZfmw.text: NEVER a complaint about the food or ambiance.  As far as a great meal and great atmosphere are concerned, this is the best place in Phoenix.  The only reason for the 3 stars is the hit-or-miss service.  Sometimes you get the best service you've ever had and sometimes you think your waiter forgot you sat down 30 minutes ago.  I want to give 5 stars, but I just can't.

cobpl2-5AP7xEv2KNfeIPg.text: Delicious pizza! Definitely a wait at dinner time, even on weekdays though. Waited about half hour after arriving at 7 on a Thursday. But 100% worth the wait.

U0kmgKBH1z29vgo5y-TbWA.text: Not really necessary to add to the compliments but why not if they deserve it. Food was phenomenal. Really. It was. Best pizza I had in a long time (ever?), and my husband shared that sentiment. Grilled veggie appetizer was very good too. Next day we went back (not our M.O. in a city where we only have 2 days) and got pizza and desert, crepes. Hmmm. Only complaint we had is the first day, the service was really rushed. Girl wanted to take our plate while there was still some olives on it, and when she brought us the check, while she was thanking us she was already turned away to the next table. A few extra seconds go a long way here, I'd say. Also, they "switched out"  some beers without telling us when we ordered, which I didn't like. Service next day was better and all in all, I'd very much recommend the place!

Qr716H1AxNl35ujNdzuNHA.text: Love this place.  Atmosphere, service, food great!  If you ever have a bad experience here, stuff happens as they do with most places.  Don't judge, just give them another chance or just come back when you're having a better day.  Signed: A former restaurant owner.

nVnhwx3eis3bA2LIb0Vy0g.text: SoOoO AMAZING!!! Great Bruschetta pizza, also tried some of the Arizona Hefewizen really good beer! The waiter we had also made it very welcoming super nice guy!

f7-z7M1z4fNdPU_oRaF0Ng.text: Very very good lunch spot!  Was a little disappointed when I found out they didn't have pizza on their lunch menu. But when I tasted the prosciutto "sandwich", I didn't mind anymore. It was a great meal with a relaxing & great ambiance!

6rBp7gh_kgi7yQjvaGbxrA.text: it was rainy. it was crowded. it was good pizza.  i really wanted the burrata, but i was vetoed. bah.  we had the tartufata, genova and something with sausage on it - maybe the salsiccia? the sausage one was ok - we got it to satisfy the little cousin who was with us.  the tartufata was incredible - i mean, what thing with truffle oil isn't? the genova, also delightful.   and like most others, we came here because we couldn't stand a 3+ hour wait at PB. sigh. but all in all, a good alternative.

9myZGkAET9TCHUX6FoaXTQ.text: Romantic,  warm, great staff our waitress was perfect,  she knew her wines, fantastic food, the pizza was perfect matched wirh a perfectly matched bottle of wine, yea,  live music, awesome ambience . Perfect place for a warm romantic date, candles on the table,  lights to add to the ambience outside. Had a remarkable evening.

NhRALlzHmY_dUNvr8GAnNg.text: Wow! Best all around for food and a great environment. The specials are worth trying for something unique. You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is the Fiocchi alle Pere. AMAZING!!!

E-MWjbQF28mnNzEkwsKSrw.text: Great experience! Drove up with worries about where to park but luckily they had complementary parking! Saved my husband and I the parallel park argument! Was then greeted by the owners and sat in the front room. Our waitress was adorable and super friendly offering suggestions but not being pushy. The food came fast. Large portions and delicious! I would love to return when the weather gets cooler so we can sit outside!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9NhqLpp3Dt53BaiJ2nObxQ.text: This place was alright. I took my bf here for a surprise dinner for his birthday. When I called I asked if they do anything special for birthdays and they said they could bring out a dessert for him. I also asked if we could reserve a table outside, and they said no problem.   I called an hour before our reservation and was told everything was good to go. When we arrived, the waiter almost said "everyone is seated back here" and I kind of had to shush him, being that it was a big surprise for my bf... So he walked us to our table, which was inside even though we reserved an outside table.   Everything went well, the food was okay but no dessert was ever brought out. I wasn't too impressed with my first visit but I think I'd return for a casual dinner date or something.

PY_2wofGXGreTmPc7Mpy1A.text: Awesome music , out or inside atmosphere the food and dessert are fabulous ! Yummie  Waiter give excelent service !

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresca delicious with fruit and ice cream must try ! Along with a sip of fine wine ! ;P
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nutella and strawberry
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mascarpone !!!!

B9FCe5u9VARhwex5SbrDFA.text: Awesome lil pizza spot. Casual & romantic. Pizza is great! Outdoor patio is quaint and relaxing with the musicians that play.

iTGjWa6z7nGeTPmZiz0oKQ.text: Its a perfect place for dinner. There is live music n we choose outdoor seating. We ordered half n half pizza both were vegetarian they have gluten free pizza extra 3$. I and my husband loved gluten free pizza. Specially for vegetarians its wonderful place u have lot of options.service is good and fast.

2QhaSc60ITj4XVG6ezWfyw.text: The patio is amazing! And the live music was great. But the food is sub-par. The reviews of the food made me really excited to try this place but honestly it was meh at best. And the service could definitely improve. But hey I get it, when the place is good and already has a good reputation the restaurant owners and staff feel that they don't have to put in as much effort.

iJtGHc5zwgsYVYT-9Zf2Pw.text: I'd been to CIbo a couple times and had good impressions. Yeah, it's on the pricier side but I wouldn't argue if you said the pizza challenged for the best in the valley. Service had always been pretty much par and the whole experience just kind of enjoyable. Then I saw the reviews on here (1200+ -- so why am I even bothering with mine?) and was really glad I hadn't Yelped Cibo first.  Look, the food is good and the atmosphere is inviting. Really, it's good. But it's a restaurant. It's got a small space and you are going to get the fallbacks that come with a popular and small place. Now, I know some people feel like they aren't going to a worthwhile establishment if they aren't waiting -- I disagree. But I will say this is -- if you are looking for a good dining experience, Cibo is there. If you're looking for the out of this world experience that some Yelpers have had, I can't provide a roadmap for that.

CVjEHhsv2crGVk0oXBbkNw.text: What a great spot! Awesome fresh made Italian food from their freshly picked salads to their delicious maple/ Neapolitan food fired pizzas yummmm!! Thus downtown spot is well worth the drive for us, I love their patio, lush with green plants and dim string lights just makes your dining experience even more romantic.

KPKNJeIbyFQiKmS6hSPe7A.text: Cibo, by far, has been a long time favorite for me and most of my friends. The atmosphere, service, and food never disappoint.

nmsg_xWe-lFkYoglKBGqbg.text: BEST GLUTEN FREE PIZZA EVER! I've been GF for a long time. This one is worth the travel. We went to wildlife zoo and headed home to the east side and hit traffic. We decided to find a place in the middle to eat. We have eaten here before but not for years. We all LOOKED like we went to the zoo. Family of five wearing flannels and baseball hats. Our server was sweet, knowledgeable, efficient and was patient with the three kids. We never felt like we were treated like we looked (happens often) - a hot mess express. We did get there by 5:30. By the time we left the place was starting to fill up. We left happy, bellies full and talking about the when we would come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best gluten free pizza I&#39;ve ever had
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KPi69R8FZjR8lCMFz-3AuQ.text: eat anything and everything here. Best Pizza in the Valley, hands down.  Wonderful wine selection, great happy hour.

_pPU2_pCSzn76gzzDqTOjw.text: We stopped in on our last night before our flight back home from The Grand Canyon. Cute place in the center of a residential area. Very nice outside patio/garden area but we opted to eat inside as they allowed smoking right outside the perimeter of the patio area. We had 3 out of our party of 6 who are gf by choice to myself, being very gluten sensitive & extremely sick when ingesting even small amounts of gluten. Most of us had pizza & were very satisfied. I had a gf Basil pesto pizza that had roasted potatoes on it. I wasn't a huge fan of the potatoes but they did not allow substitutions & did not have build your own option. It would have been amazing with some org. chicken breast on it & I did tell our waiter that.  The crust was amazing for a gf pizza crust, you would never have known it was gf if it didn't come out with a gf flag on each gf pizza. 5+ stars on the crust. One in our party had a calzone with sausage & the sausage was very spicy hot. She had to pick most of it out just too hot for her. Would have been good to warn those ordering sausage about that. One in our party had calamari as his entree & it was just okay, not great. Looked like french fries, different than any I have ever seen. Most of us got crepes for desert. They had a buckwheat gf version, which I got. They were all amazing! All in all a good meal with great service. We will def go back if ever in the phoenix area again.

cThDsmHHmH_-uHFNnDHZMg.text: This place is the cutest date place. The patio is fun and romantic with cute lights and grape leaves growing around. The burrata salad is a must have. We ordered 2 pizzas- one margharita and one white pizza. Both were so tasty but we leaned towards the margharita as the winner. The italian wine we ordered was a hit and tasty as well. Our waitress recommended it and I wish I had remembered what kind it was. Seems that the staff sure know their stuff!   Beware of mosquitos on the patio though!

VnF_lc7jNrw0DpdvP1bibQ.text: Probably not a lot new I can say about cibo except they're awesome.  Most recently wife and I went with our 13 month old son after work on Friday.  Not only are they a nice date place to go before a night out, but they also can accommodate our toddler with finger foods and friendly service.    Baby B loved his meatballs and chewy pizza crust, while momma had the Di Notti, and I had the Rustica because it has arugula on top which makes me feel I'm eating healthy.  The sparrows got a healthy dose of pizza crust too because B is a bit of a messy eater.   We always do the patio, and love sitting outside in this nice old Phoenix neighborhood.  Let the tourists go to Bianco; locals know Cibo is better, and you don't have to wait four hours for a table.

6J7x6PE4UHHIwGwHY5dDzQ.text: Wow! I have been waiting so long to give a five star review. I had a Margherita pizza with prosciutto and it was amazing. The service was great! My only regret is that I didn't have more time to explore the menu. I will be back!

cw4NeHA6yXOliBDvYWr3Ww.text: I think all that can be said has been said about this awesome place! I can't wait to go back! Funghi pizza (Tomato sauce, mushrooms, and mozzarella) we added sausage, and arugula! It was so perfect! The wood fired gluten free crust was devine. Everything you want in a wood fired pizza. Our friends let us try some of their house salad. That was also perfection. With its grape tomatoes, pin nuts, red, peppers, onions and more with balsamic and mixed greens. For dessert we had the Crepes filled with marsclpon, blueberries, raspberries, and strawberries, sprinkled with powdered sugar! So yummy. To top it all off we had a nice Cappuccino, so foamy and warm! I think I had already fallen in love the second we turned the corner and all you could see was this beautiful place draped with lights and vines. As you walk up through the beautiful patio setting there were misters and a live band playing. Then the waitress took us through the little maze of what use to be a house to our cozy little table. I don't have one bad thing to say! I will be back very soon to try some pasta and wine! I can't wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Couldn&#39;t wait to dig in!Funghi pizza (Tomato sauce, mushrooms, and mozzarella) we added sausage, and arugula!

5LPs7MPmYeic2gcNt0248Q.text: The white pizza was outstanding.  The crust was perfect.  We also had the pulled pork sandwich which was great as well.  We actually went for the pasta but found out it is not served until after 5pm.  Great outdoor and indoor seating.  The weather was perfect as well as the service.

FC2tGjA87ih6HJZu97yp3g.text: Some of the best GF pizza I've had in PHX! Would definitely recommend this place. Cannot wait to come back to sit on the patio once it cools down  *misting system is on point*. Upon entering, we were immediately greeted and sat at a table, service was prompt, and friendly. Unfortunately,  our waitress seemed to not be in a great mood, she was short in response,  and maybe seemed to be in a bad mood or having a bad day. Either way,  this will only encourage me more to come back, try more food, enjoy the patio. I give the food 5 stars, but the service could have been a little more friendlier.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

kscY2L00sN8BKJlD9l4YPg.text: I've never had a bad experience at this place.  And it is so quaint and wonderful.  I go probably for the atmosphere more than for the food (although the food is wonderful as well).  My one thing would be that because I try to steer clear of pork, maybe more chicken or fish plate options might be nice?

8sgtHPFsi2FB7hKL8utjiA.text: In my mind, there is NO better pizza place in the Valley. From the unique atmosphere, to the awesome servers, to the food that makes you moan in a "sweet-mother-of-pearl-this-is-insane" way, Cibo's is a MUST. And this rarely happens to me, but I CRAVE Cibo's on a weekly basis. The pizza was to DIE for, but the prosciutto-mozzarella sandwich was by far the BEST thing I've eaten in years.   I love you, Cibo!

aOFF_On5KtuSCINtYz4GPQ.text: Being the pizza connoisseurs that we are, we decided to try Cibo a few weeks ago after reading some pretty stellar reviews on Yelp. As you can tell by now from the sheer amount of 4 and 5 star reviews, this place has got it going on like Donkey Kong (sorry).   In no particular order, here are some of my favorite things about Cibo:   1. It's right next door to Tammie Coe! We love us some red velvet cupcakes that Ms. Coe bakes up, so it's almost a little too perfect that two of our most favorite things in Phoenix are right across the street from each other!!   2. The pizza of course silly! Last time we tried three of their pizza's and they were all phenomenal. You could order cow dung and bird feathers on pizza and they would make it taste moist and delicious, that's how good they are! This pizza reminds me a lot of the pizza they serve at the almighty Pizzeria Bianco....and that's saying something.   3. Simon Crown! Who is Simon Crown you ask? Why, he's only the greatest keyboard player west of the Mississippi! Well, that might be a slight stretch, but he is a really cool black dude who plays catchy and happy melodies on weekends while you eat in the outdoor patio and wait to be seated. He even sells his CD there for $15, but he only accepts cash so make sure to bring some extra spending money next time you go to Cibo so you can support a unique local artist!   4. Great for people watching. Cibo was voted one of the best places to go on a first date in Phoenix, so you'll be sure to see lot's of awkwardness between couples of all ages. It could even turn into a fun game while you wait to be seated....like, who can be the first person to spot the couple on their first date?   Well, even if none of the aforementioned reasons for visiting Cibo strikes your fancy, you've just got to bite the bullet and try this place already! I promise you won't go home disappointed (unless you're a real jerk).

2ZNtQiZZrm0h1Ly61VB_RA.text: Cool place.  It's in this old house and the environment is nice for a casual date.  Pizza and salad were really good.

5JIzSC0jBimffd_hknnZ-g.text: I love the ambiance and the food! Last night was my second time to Cibo and they have yet to disappoint. I've enjoyed dinner on both the patio and inside, and both are equally charming. Great place for a date night if that's what you're looking for. The only reason I rated this experience a 4 out of 5 is because of the time it took for the server to take our orders and bring our check. (We were headed to an event downtown after dinner and were limited on time)

hZ_i12U-_BJK51KyhFZp-A.text: This is one of the best pizza joints out there!!  They have wonderful pizza dough.  The sauce is amazing! The sandwiches (i've heard) are very good.  Still need to try those!

ZHioyqEnnjEWYQkrsQqhyg.text: Great date night spot.  Casual and warm.  Pizza is solid.

4cNZAefeL9XNW7xPsi4PNw.text: Let me add to the chorus of awesome.  This place sets the Neapolitan pizza standard in Phoenix (amidst quite a bit of competition).  Bianco, yeah yeah, it's good, if you've got the patience to wait and know well in advance that all the hype is more than just a wee overstated.  I've eaten at Cibo probably 50 times in the last 5 years and, without question, it is safe to say that it's better than Bianco.  Guido has established a standard of excellence and consistency with the pizzas that is beyond compare, really at any restaurant I've ever frequented.  And then you have ever-changing pastas and (in the winter) soups Tuesdays and Wednesdays?  Out of this world sandwiches, served only at lunch?  And have you HAD their breakfast?  It's all ridiculously excellent.  And stupid reasonably priced.    If you're in any way freaked out by the neighborhood, it says a lot more about you than it does about the 'hood.  Stay in Chandler, there's a Chili's there waiting for you, with lots of ranch dressing.  Enjoy!

GT0ERkGpRIHgZjItFB040Q.text: Tucked away in downtown Phoenix, this local restaurant has character and amazing food! In my first, and definitely not last trip, enjoyed the Ai Spinaci. Which is truly a treat for your taste buds!  Perfectly sauteed spinach, savory prosciutto cotto and fontina cheese, yum!

oxY_Qg_BtdRZVRyMqG3QGQ.text: Lunch at Cibo today. I was looking for a good pizza and Cibo came up under the top pizzas in Phx. It's been a few years since I was there and that was only to stop by for a drink. Wow, they seem to have expanded. Very nice atmosphere. Nice place to eat outside. It really wasn't pizza... More like a pocket pizza or almost a calzone. Regardless, they have a nice menu variety, reasonable wines, and the desserts look terrific (did not try). This place may move up to 5 stars after my next visit. The fact that I say "next visit" should tell you something. We really liked this place. Parking is in the street with high curbs. Watch for door scrapes unless you are driving a truck or an SUV.

50V9IoNcmiZdjVlsXUph9A.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE the ambience outside! Love the fact the restaurant is in a old style bungalow and the patio is lit with string lights.  I went there for the first time last night 15min before close and I dont know if they usually have music or not..but if they don't, they need it.   Food was great but nothing to die for.

QW55EuptoE0gUN0T6BAv7g.text: Yelp has been on a roll lately, with all the best foods I've been eating, I've become a food snob. This place is nothing short of spectacular. Great outdoor seating, sitting outside right when the sun is going down in the warm breeze and eating great food. Appetizer of bread, meat and cheese, delicious and light pizza, a glass of wine and top it off with strawberry-nutella crepe = perfect meal.

Wg-NKDH8P07ICofDU_cEBQ.text: Came in for dinner last night, since we are from Scottsdale you have to really want to eat here to put up with the traffic/drive but the desserts alone are worth it, nothing says happy like the nutella and strawberry crepe. We had the rustica pizza , very nice, good crust but the crepe for dessert was the best part.

_XsFDuKIGR-ilpBZQdEnag.text: I finally made it down here with the family and was pleasantly surprised at how quickly we were seated on a Friday night. Between four of us (2 adults and 2 children), we split a salad and two pizzas. The salad was the pesto dressing house salad which had mixed greens, shaved parmesan cheese, nuts, and lord if I can't remember the rest. It was very good though. It was too bland for my husband but I thoroughly enjoyed it. The pizza was Di Napoli and the Crudo. The white pizza was super greasy and too heavy for me. The crudo was good but be warned that the salami was very spicy. I had a glass of rose which was okay. I tried to get the Cioccolotini but they were out so we split a Limoncello instead. I loved the location and that it was a historic home. That adds such character.

6sTP1ivBSWZhzDH6oTehUw.text: Big fan! I was in Phoenix for work and yelped out best pizza in Phoenix and this place came up. I ordered a Margherita pizza with cherry tomatoes on top and it was fantastic.  The Nutella was awesome too!

6m88EnPo_OSIWP4V1ZH9lQ.text: This is one of our favorite places to go. In fact my fiance and I are actually going to get married there this year!  The service is great. People are nice / pleasant people. The ambiance of both inside and outside is excellent & so is the food. At night Cibo serves pizza (and gnocchi pasta on most Tuesday nights, call first though to ask).  On weekdays they are open for lunch and serve amazing sandwiches, the bread is based off the pizza dough. But no pizza during the day.  We love the pizza! Our favorite is the sausage / "Salsiccia". The sausage itself is exceptional. It's a thinner pizza, but not a hard crispy bottom. The sauce is not one of those over-spiced sauces, it is mellow and very fresh. They have an excellent wine selection. My favorite right now is the Barbera (spelling?) that they carry.  Just like most places, if you are there with a few people, it's a better deal to just get a bottle.  Favorite salad, the Pear Salad.  Spinach leaves, light balsamic dressing, pears and pecorino cheese (kind of like a hard parmesan cheese). It's so good!  Also anitpasto plate is also great, but getting two appetizers might be much here.  They serve crepes for desert. If you have room, go for it. If you like desert crepes, and who doesn't, you won't be disappointed. The nutella / banana is our fav.  Excellent place to bring  a date.

7UqGpWWDXBBrgMNEv8ydsA.text: I've been to Cibo before and the pizza is pretty good (4 stars) but last night I was exposed to quite possibly the rudest waiter I have experienced during the short time I have spent on this planet. I'm not sure if James was just having a bad night, but he seemed incredibly rushed and annoyed to have to be helping us out by taking our order and getting us some food and drink. It was bad enough for me to leave before ordering. (My friends that stayed behind informed me that it never got any better.) I get that Cibo is a busy place, James, but never be rude to people who have no control over those circumstances. Not if you want a reasonable tip.

hQjMpNk71fm4UmmLcdZalQ.text: This is the BEST food I have had in Phoenix! Their margherita pizza is so delicious with big fresh basil and they use good moz and great crust. Very fluffy and soft! I also tried their strawberries and goat cheese salad, very fresh and refreshing!! Their nutella and marscopone crepe was AMAZING!!! I wanna come back here every other day! Will be back!

y5R0mlzz-qf7sDfEnue-CA.text: In the heart of downtown lies a quaint little place called Cibo. I visited this place on a Friday during lunchtime and sat outside because the weather was beautiful. Nestled in an old house off of 5th ave, this place has a lot of character. Wrought iron tables and chairs on a brick patio surrounded by green shrubs and birds a chirpin, it's got a relaxed type of vibe. Our server was cool, and did a good job of being attentive and getting out food out to us. We ordered the PLT and Salsiccia both with side house salads. The food came out a little under 10 min after we ordered! We were very impressed by that. The portion sizes were great, and I almost couldn't finish all of mine. I had always heard good things about this place and was not disappointed. Will def be back to try the pizza and wine.

v523on67rY6rmGIvzsZxVA.text: LOVE Cibo!! Go there every chance I get..HIGHLY recommend!

gaKgPQUsQ1KrD_fE8HNg3A.text: I'm impressed! We went around 11pm at night and the atmosphere was great. There was a live band playing! And our waiter was super nice. We ordered a few pizzas but the best one is... one that I cannot pronounce. lol. I just know it has prosciutto in it and other meats. I also added anchovies in there as well. Delicious!  The board we ordered was nice too. Got to stir up our appetite with the wine. Overall, the outdoor patio experience was pretty. It was chill and relaxed. I want to come back and try the other food as well. Or stick to the ones we had because our pizzas and appetizers were really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cappricosa with anchovies
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Da Vinci
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Baratta

hzm16dZhZoHkM0HIgzjSSg.text: Came here to celebrate a 30 year anniversary dinner with family and it was mediocre to say the least. The service was awful and the waitress Amanda was not friendly at all. Mind you there were 12 of us but it wasn't busy at all. There were several empty tables. We asked for split checks and with an attitude she said she would split them. We all ordered pizza at the same time.   We ordered the margherita pizza and it was okay. I mean they really put a whole basil leaf on the pizza instead of shredding it or making it into smaller pieces on other slices. The crust is really thin and the cheese kept sliding off. They also don't have pepperoni which is odd for a pizza place.  Two people in our group still didn't receive their pizza as the majority of us were already done eating. They also got the same pizza and it came out 15 min later! The waitress never came out to check on us during our meal and took foreverrrr to bring our checks and bring our cards back after we paid. Also, our waters were empty during our meal and the lady who brought the last pizza out filled it since our server was no where to be found. Needless to say with the poor service and just okay pizza we will not be returning. I'd rather go to Fired Pie for the same type of pizza for cheaper.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nAVMC_e9OTME8BlHElf__Q.text: This place is great! The food is awesome and the outdoor patio is huge and great for hanging out. They have live music on certain evenings but it's pretty low key and not obnoxious.   You won't get a deep dish or greasy pizza here. What you will get is a fresh ingredients, hand tossed wood fired pizza. I've also had a few of the appetizers and sandwiches here and they have all been great.   I really like the bar, but it doesn't have a lot of seats and fills up fast. The service has always been attentive and friendly.   If your looking for a place to have pizza that won't make you feel terrible about yourself after scarfing it down, then give this place a try!

KoiAszW2F4sX5hpylrHYGw.text: A couple months ago, I flew down from Georgia to visit family that I have down in Phoenix. I came to eat here because I was told the food was great!  I was not disappointed.. The food was so good, I sat outside. Where there was live music, that I enjoyed! The atmosphere was so relaxing and also romantic. When I'm back in town, I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

FxBP2g49OdLJE3qCHVtsAw.text: Great place! Great area! and Delicious food!  They had live music when I went, on a Thursday, which was the best part! My biggest issue was it took 15 minutes before someone asked if we wanted something to drink.. The staff definitely need an attitude adjustment but the cooks make up for the lack of service.   Overall, I'll deal with the 2 star service for the 5 star food and atmosphere!

KR3lWPPRiY0loWjToVqxaA.text: What a wonderful place to experience great Italian food! From the caesar salad to the pizza to the gnocchi or the charcuterie board or... pulled pork sandwich or sausage sandwich or even the oil truffle fries, it all deserved a five star in execution!  Most of the staff was outstanding! Unfortunately our waitress Amanda was mediocre, made us feel unwelcome and made us wait for everything we ordered.   Never mind her, we loved experiencing Cibo especially on our daughter's graduation, she earned her Master's degree in Literacy from ASU today , woot woot!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Such a nice setting!
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1rNGgPFf31oKugCM7TTJGQ.text: Food was ok, disappointed as it did not reach the expectations set by other reviews. The price was reasonable, staff were courteous and the ambiance (outside) was good. Would recommend to a friend but there are much better pizza places in Phoenix

XUJ_XN7vinQrcH2jbbWgwA.text: Best atmosphere in downtown Phoenix. It is like stepping into a different world. Often has a long wait. But worth it! Great place for a date or special occasion.  Everything I have had here is great. Pizza is of the thin variety and the dough has a crispness but a nice chewy bite as well. Don't miss out on the dessert crepes! They are amazing!

aBKwD5c1Uk_g7h6jIodaiQ.text: Really delicious food and amazing service. Prices are extremely reasonable. Highly recommend this place to everyone

Y4FDmCcPckkgBbh6yhiOcA.text: What can I say, Cibo is my favorite pizzeria in Phoenix. The pizza is fantastic & the restaurant decor makes me feel right at home. I ordered the Salsiccia Con Patate and was pleasantly surprised! I've never had potatoes on my pizza but now I wouldn't have it any other way.   They have a cute little barn looking section that is separate from the restaurant for private parties at a very reasonable rate! We almost had our wedding dinner party here as I was looking for the rustic look, but we decided to have a destination wedding instead. The private section has its own mini bar area, lots of seating, a bathroom and it's own backyard section which was my favorite! Cute string lights and a perfect ambience for live soft music.   Side note: service is always outstanding!  I will definitely be taking my hubby here soon and will find an excuse to throw a party here :)

VHs3kRx36wPq8bKugK6dDg.text: Today is 1/2/2018 I am on the lovely intimate patio visiting with friends.  The service by Tommy (not to be confused with the amazing musician Tommy Connell) the server at Cibo is lacking table service. Has been asked several times for beverages.  Also disappears before we can order.  I had to have another server come take our order. Very sad that each time I come the service has been underwhelming.   Previous review below.    I went  to see a local musician named Tommy Connell last Sunday. The patio was lovely. Dimly lit with white lights and large trees. Thankfully we could still use the heaters as it was also cold out from the rain earlier that day. Tommy played a variety of classics and some originals on his Gretsch guitar. What an incredible sound and way to wind down after an intense weekend. He is a musical wizard as his fingers make their way across the strings. During his break he came over and chatted with my group. What a class act, a very humble man. A friend of mine mentioned later that he also won best jazz guitar for the Phoenix New Times. That is a award he certainly deserves.   As per the restaurant itself. The food was delicious with large portions. The service started out very disorganised and quite unprofessional until about an hour in another girl took over and things ran smoothly.  I will be back though to see Tommy play again and will being a new group of friends each time. He is worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tommy Connell - Cibo, Sunday nights.  Phoenix New Times - best jazz guitar

wbe0s-u1z-QXr-tPPnK6DA.text: The food at Cibo is amazing. The artisanal pizza is made to order and very fresh. It tastes great. When you think of Phoenix, pizza isn't really what you think of, but Cibo really puts it's stamp on our valley.  The food and plates are very picturesque and when using an iPhone in Portrait mode, it really makes the picture pop! The pizza reminds me of a little pizzeria in Rome, Italy.   The atmosphere and space hinders on this restaurant getting a perfect 5  review in my book. It is not a great place to go for a quiet date night especially if you like eating inside with A/C. The tables and space is very tight and cramped. You're so close to other parties that you can hear and be apart of their entire conversation. When other diners are so loud it puts a damper on your date and meal, that it leaves a bad taste in your mouth and ringing in your ears.   I would definitely recommend eating outside if you want to enjoy a date night.   Overall I would give Cibo a 3 and revisit when it's cooler outside so we can enjoy our meal outside on the patio area.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita and Italian Sausage Pizza
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita Pizza with fresh Mozzarella and Basil.

9e9ymoKn0CYfFG52j2DhhQ.text: The restaurant itself is a 4 star adorable charming place in downtown Phoenix.   The margarita pizza 5 star..crust was perfection!   The LIMITED LUNCH menu 2 star  :/ It's very  disappointing to see all the great food pics on Yelp,  then be limited on choices.  The blah pesto salad ..2 star. no flavor at all the greens were very fresh tho.   The nice staff 4  star

yjud3M97OsPGVpxa7M01DA.text: Best pizza and pasta in the valley!  Bold statement perhaps, but still True!   Salads are fantastic too.  Very nice, romantic atmosphere.  We always bring our out of town guests here to eat outside on the expansive patio.  When they come back to visit, they always want to go back!  Also, if you or someone in your party has gluten sensitivities, their gluten free crust is unbelievable and about as good as it gets.  In this house, it is the now the standard by which all others are judged.

hYGr2E7kkNz19I0MOgfWkg.text: This quaint restaurant is resemblant of a little house turned into a little Italy cafe. What failed for me was the cleanliness. All our dishes were dirty, when we asked for new, we continued to get dirty dishes, glasses, and silverware. Frustrating, because you automatically put off, before your food even arrives. (Hopefully this was an off day, and the dishwasher was broken?) giving them the  benefit of doubt here. Next was a trip to the bathroom to wash up, didn't help that it too was dirty and smelly. Hint, light a candle, put an air freshener, or plug in, it will go a long way! The waiter seemed like he just rose from bed, messy hair, and wearing old blue jeans and wrinkled shirt.  I'm giving them a three star, because the food really is great! I think you eat first with your eyes, so had this been a neat and tidy restaurant, starting off with clean dishes, and a more professionally dressed waiter, it definitely would of improved the rating.  We started with the bruschetta appetizer, really good! Grape tomatoes marinated in garlic, olive oil, and fresh basil, drizzled with balsamic, accompanied by grilled Baguette slices, and freshly made mozzarella. The pizza is wood fired, and simply Italian dressed with quality ingredients. The margherita was delicious, nice chew and char on the crust, and fresh cheese and basil! The Pasta Bolognese was great as well, homemade pasta, which is a must, makes all the difference and really sets this dish apart from others in the valley.   Conclusion; Cibo has so much going for it, in my opinion, it just needs to be executed better. The kitchen seems to know what their doing, everything else is failing. We go out for the full experience, to sit and enjoy our company, food and atmosphere. We don't want to worry about clean dishes, and dirty employees, that's your job! Get it right, because your food is really delicious, especially when served on clean dishes:)

gNeSibIKVxyPNBR2u9y1UA.text: Guys, this place was so good! Came here with a few friends ordered 2 pizzas, 2 apps, dessert, and a drink and the bill came to about $54! Not only is the price for the food reasonable, but everything was so DELICIOUS! If you sit on the patio you get to enjoy the beautiful scenery and nature, also you might be greeted by a cute yellow cat! The hostesses and servers were fantastic and made it a more enjoyable experience. Definitely will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

iM8MhxXofrlaQysTKyGpKQ.text: Looks can be deceiving...  Came here today with my folks and wife for my 31st birthday. Having been to Cibo a number of times I recommend the spot, unfortunately. We met my parents and our seating was outside. The server (Katie) had a noticeable snarky attitude from the onset of our parties interactions. Katie was sparse with a touch of cavalier with her attitude and interactions (what more would you expect from a freaking server at Cibo) She did not bring us bread for the table originally. When compounding  the  waiting for our request for bread, the attitude, and my stupid expectations... I finally asked for the manager and no longer wanted to eat their. Katie did me one better and got the owner of Cibo himself (Michael K.) came to finally provide the service I was expecting. NOPE. Michael was obviously dismissive in tone and nature. He ignored the fact that his employee had sub-par service and leaned on the fact that he believed we got our bread in the ample amount of time. Extremely unprofessional behavior that cemented my decision to never come here again. Will not recommend.   Birthday wasn't ruined at all despite 'condescending Katie' and 'smug Michaels' efforts! My family walked 50 feet to The Vig and had a great meal with great service (check the Vig for my review on that experience)   DO NOT waste your time or money at Cibo. It 100% comes from the top down. So no fix in sight folks. Michael was in a powerful position as the owner to fix a situation and he made it clear he could care less about getting resolved.

iw4CBWHfCPAkhCrD5qraiw.text: I'm sad to say that I was not impressed by Cibo. I'm really disappointed after reading all of the amazing reviews of this place. I will say that the atmosphere was great. The patio seating was really charming and the twinkle lights were pretty. I went for dinner with friends but it would have been a nice place for a date as well.   But our service was less than stellar. Once we got our food, we had to flag people down to get any more attention. Someone took our empty water carafe and never brought more water. One of my friends got the margherita pizza which she described as "ok". My second friend got the  rustica pizza. She said that she wished she could taste something. I got the tartufata pizza. I liked all the toppings but it just didn't have much flavor. The pizza was also soggy in the middle. The slice just kind of flopped down as I picked it up and all the toppings fell off.   Worst of all, there were two stray cats wandering around the patio as we ate. It was so disgusting to feel them brush against my leg passing under my chair and under our table as we tried to enjoy our dinner. The staff didn't seem to care or attempt to keep them away from people; everyone simply walked past them. It just felt very unsanitary.  Maybe I came on an off night, but Cibo definitely did not live up to the hype.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tartufata pizza. Better in theory than execution.

mIjYyPV9EZCUr9SDMs4fDQ.text: Adorable, cozy atmosphere and amazing food. HOWEVER, we had a pretty poor experience with waitstaff. Everyone there last night was completely apathetic and seemingly unwelcoming. In situations like this, I try to give the benefit of the doubt that perhaps the place was busy and the people working are a little stressed out and worn thin. But that didn't seem to be the case at all. It was barely 5pm and there were virtually only a handful of patrons. We walked in without a hello or directions on how to be seated. Just a gentleman standing there waiting for us to finally ask where to go. Our waitress seemed to be overly involved and enthusiastic with a table that had a family, and yet my boyfriend and I sat there with barely any acknowledgement and sparse check in. When we spoke to her to order, she didn't really acknowledge anything we said she just kind of wrote it down and turned around and walked away when she was done. At the conclusion or our evening when the bill was paid, a stone faced young man came to our table to collect my boyfriend's plate, and though I was still eating, stayed standing there waiting until I was done and as he picked up my plate the second I finished, hastily let the fork drop down on the table in front of my face.... as we left a young woman who seemed to be the appointed hostess (was absent when we first came in) was now sitting there scrolling on her phone as we walked out, not lifting her head to even say goodbye or show acknowledgment of any kind. I feel like we were pleasant customers and truly loved the food, but unfortunately the general feeling when I left the restaurant was unsettling and an overall feeling of apathy by the people who worked there. Either the waitstaff didn't want to be there, they were young seasonal summer staff who couldn't care less, they were overly tired, or they didn't want to invest too much effort in a table that only seated 2. I'll give it some time before I ever return again if I actually do because the food was fantastic and the place was adorable; hopefully we might catch them on a better night.

FXVJbYWz_3pQUG-qDrRW6g.text: Cibo is a definite find.  The salad and pizza was a solid 10/10.   Our waiter Tom made excellent suggestions and the service was spot on.  Even the wine was a perfect match.   It took about 30 minutes for a table but well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yum Yum
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yum II
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yum

PyUGgtGCujpraREYs6pnjw.text: Slightly expensive but worth every dime, especially when the weather is right and you sit on their beautiful patio, lit by string lights and filled with the sounds of their beautiful fountains. Perfect place to take a date or have a special and unforgettable evening.   Their wood fired pizzas are small but their ingredients are fresh and pair deliciously with a bottle of wine or a Peroni. This place fills up fast though so definitely make reservations if you're hoping to get a table at night.

kuLfD7NpKYpd5M2TXDuVYg.text: I went for a date night this past weekend and I am sad to say I was not impressed! The atmosphere is a perfect date night spot, and the music was a perfect addition! Unfortunately the pizza I ordered was greasy, and the salad was extremely bland. Maybe I went on an "off" night but it was 3 star food quality for sure.

MpqXge8acpFsPPuttwfJiQ.text: Compliments to the chef bc the food was excellent! My salad was very fresh, grilled pesto shrimp to top was perfection, pizza was authentic, fresh & hand made and dessert (Nutella & strawberries crepe) was great! Our service was prompt, polite and courteous (kudos!). Loved the atmosphere, it was cozy, romantic & the live musician made the night perfect. I give this place 4 stars bc of valet. The young man was rude to my mother when asking a simple question about parking. He was the first person we encountered so that wasn't a good start but it only turned into a better night bc of his coworkers. It definitely would have been a 5 star experience otherwise.

_VDdP17lVTfSr5J6tuUWjw.text: Love Cibo!!!! Always a great experience! I love the burrata appetizer, tartufata pizza, and Fresca crepe. You really can't go wrong though.

o6T6oPGel05MFaXx1fzdiQ.text: I have dined here a few times and every time the food and service has been great.  What is distinctive about Cibo is its ambiance - the lovely patio with old trees providing the shade.  It is so pleasant.  For evening happy hour, I have twice shared the platter with meat, cheese, etc. and it is quite good with a glass of wine.  The thin crust pizza is excellent, too.  I hope to try more things.  The servers are friendly and in my experience, fast.  And unlike many downtown Phoenix restaurants, parking is pretty easy.  That does make a difference.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outdoor dining

w6Uk3NBVjgP1B2dpHSxpTw.text: Get the burrata!!  Amazing!! We went here, hoping to be impressed and we were! The outside was so romantic and precious with lights hanging from the trees.  Complimentary valet!  I didn't care too much for our pizza, but i think of we had ordered a different kind,  I would say otherwise.  Lovely place.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

W72nQ5gsE8pl5qXxEa5PDw.text: Cute place for a date night! There's a bit of a wait even at 9PM on a Friday night. There's live music outside, and there is seating outside and inside for whichever you prefer. There's also a couch for you to sit while waiting! :)   At first I was slightly skeptical of ordering a pizza with no sauce, but I am so glad I tried it!! They have a wide variety of pizza to choose from and I wish I can try them all. Although, I wish there were more options for pasta...  Overall great experience, very good food, romantic and cute ambiance -- Would definitely come back again!

63Lq8YAekbYuZ3EcS08iNQ.text: I am not sure why but some of the best pizza I've had comes from the Arizona desert.  The outside seating looked pleasant surrounded by nice trees.  However, it was 110 degrees in Phoenix but the inside is nice and cool.  The bar is cozy and it was refreshing to get a local brew from Oak Creek Sedona.  I think there was only 4 choices of pizzas on the menu, I chose the one with sausage and it was delicious.  The parking lot can fill up but there is lots of parking on the adjacent streets.  It was a relaxing stop with nice service from everyone there.

5sl7i-AYDKK_KQ_JXOTZpw.text: We had an amazing dinner at Cibo tonight.  It's truly a beautiful restaurant with a welcoming atmosphere.  The patio has beautiful glowing lights and is perfect for a romantic dinner.  My mom and I didn't need it to be romantic -- but it was still lovely.  We split the Linguine Cacio e Pepe.  The pasta was clearly VERY fresh, and each of the cheeses expressed themselves with distinct yet subtle flavors.  We also split a crepe with nutella and added bananas and whipped cream.  It was heaven in your mouth -- and they did not skimp on any ingredient.  Abundant banana slices, whipped cream (also fresh), and absolutely slathered with Nutella.  We loved Cibo!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nutella crepe with bananas and whipped cream added.  Sublime!

YaoJSaXgGp3eiQjoAm6JHw.text: My daughter took me here for the second time and we got the red pizza vegetariana with potatoes substitute mozzarella as well as the Ostia salad with the chickpea dressing.  That chickpea salad is really delicious! We left stuffed.

senNvQpnj3ngNSPQ4X0NlQ.text: What a great night! Excellent table outside, solid service, good pasta & incredible pizza. One slight issue: fried calamari starter - nicely breaded & fried however the calamari was cut into thick strips (not a fan), needed salt & thought the red pepper aioli didn't match. Drinks very nice. Sausage pizza was one of the best we've had...crust was delicious & only slightly charred, good mozzarella, simple tomato sauce & house made fennel sausage. Server gave us a leisurely pace which we love. We will be returning. Good, casual place to bring friends.

KeaFArfrUo-139wbQqGSlQ.text: My wife and I made our first visit ever on Wednesday, February 13th (2019). I am big on finding good service and restaurants with "Yelp" based on the star rating and the number of raters. Cibo looked outstanding with 4 1/2 stars and over 2000 raters. It doesn't get any better than that. I was so excited to take my wife there. We went for lunch at about 1pm. Our first shock was the neighborhood, it was a bit scary. Next was the parking ( why the city even issued a permit for this restaurant without sufficient parking, I don't know). I was told that on Friday/Saturday nights they had additional parking a block away. Parking is by valet however, I would not want my car parked a block away in this neighborhood, and the wait to get your car? My car was parked so close to the car next to it that I could not get in to get it our and had to have the valet get in and pull it forward.  We entered the restaurant and it was basically an old house that had been converted to a restaurant. Maybe it is the part where they sat us, but it was not romantic as advertised. It was very noisy and cramped, and there weren't even that many people in there.  Now, our waitress and the service or lack of.....It seemed like all the help was young kids wearing old levis jeans. The waitress came to take our order and wammo.....they were out of the wine that we ordered. We went through the wine list, both red and white and were told that they had NO sweet wines. (???? the names were odd and we couldn't tell). We finally ordered a wine that was a little sweet. We ordered a pizza and a salad as they advertised, gluten free, and every body raved about it on the Yelp site. WE FORGOT TO ORDER GLUTEN FREE WHEN WE ORDERED, and that was our fault. I have to say that the pizza was excellent and the bathroom I used was clean. Our salad and bread came, then the pizza. We were not given a separate plate so that we didn't have to put the pizza on the oily salad dish. We were give no serving spoon for the salad and when we asked for a serving spoon we were told that they had none, "would two forks be ok"? No butter was given with the bread, we had to ask. I am not done yet.....she forgot to bring our wine and 3/4 of the way through our meal we had to ask her if it was coming. She brought our wine a short time later with nothing even resembling an apology. Throughout our entire meal the waitress never returned to see if all was good or if we needed anything.  I must tell all who read this, that the menu does state that there is no pasta until after 5 pm. You also can't order a large regular pizza until after 5 pm. Be warned!!!! You will have to order from a "LUNCH" menu only.   I am going to have to trust that over 2000 people who rated this restaurant at 4 1/2 stars can't all be wrong, maybe we just hit them, and their "B" team of waiters on a bad day, My wife and I will not return and can hardly recommend this restaurant to anybody.  WE WERE VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!!!!!!

ScjiXe8ZKhdOC4rJLAo9Aw.text: Story time: called early on the morning of Dec 22nd to make reservations for 12. They were full for evening reservations but were totally pro about guiding me to the "No Wait" app. That sounded like a plan.  On the way down there we launched the app and attempted to put in our group, but the app maxes out at 6 for this particular establishment, we put 6 and added a note.   When we arrived they were a bit shocked at our group size, but they took care of it. We waiting no more than 15 minutes and we're seated in a sort of guest house out back with 2 other large groups. It was great!   Now to the food. Sweet mother of all that is holy, the Diavola pizza was AMMMAAAZZZZINNNG!!!!!  We opted for Gluten Free crust and it was out of this world. One of the best pies I've ever had. Then we got crepes and they made he pizza look more humble...which I wouldn't have bet was possible.    This place is stellar! Staff is world class, food is other worldly and it's super cute and charming.  Stop reading, go eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresca crepe....can&#39;t describe...busy eating!!
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Half and half pizza on Gluten Free. I want to eat my phone just looking at it.

naOay2rlhFdYFBFIw1GFfQ.text: Went to Cibo on a cold arizona December night. The outdoor heaters were clutch because the weather was below freezing. Ordered a pizza and the ravioli special. Tiny raviolis but hit the spot. The outdoor patio setting was lit beautifully. The pizza was decent. It's the perfect spot for a date. Hopefully I'll ditch my dad next time and bring one.

EqWTsyBBnh8KYUT6SMV36A.text: This is a perfect romantic date/ first date/family event spot.  The restaurant is adorable, the food is delicious, and the service is great.  If you order the pizza, if if you just love gluten for days, make sure to order the gluten free crust.  They make it in-house, and it is even more delicious than the traditional crust. The food is phenomenal.  The service is pretty good.  The location is convenient, and it is easy to find parking.  I just love this place.

XMFJmbcSoIRYfyJq26W-MQ.text: Best authentic Italian in Phoenix! Read my lips! BEST ITALIAN in Phoenix... you will fall in love or I will buy you dinner. Haha

UU_jVijLdclKDuKdC7MUvQ.text: What We Ordered: Tartufata pizza (mushroom, prosciutto, truffle oil), Gnocchi (with cream sauce), Pinot Grigio (Scarpetta)  Service: Our waitress was nice. However, she didn't give us much in the way of promoting the food or guiding our decision. She didn't go over the specials or any of the dishes.  What We Liked: -Atmosphere: elegant without being pretentious, nice outdoor and indoor, simple decor, charming home converted to restaurant -Pizza: we enjoyed the pizza, thin crust with a nice wood-fire char.   What We Disliked: -The Gnocchi: although the texture was perfect to me (pillowy, soft, handmade), the flavor fell flat. I didn't feel it was special the way a good gnocchi dish is. It is also very small in portion. And although I do agree with the waitress that it was filling, part of enjoying a dish is the initial appearance, and the initial appearance was sad, served in a small cast iron skillet, and looked a bit "cheap" with a bread crumb crust. We confirmed it was actually the entree because first glance we thought it was an appetizer.  -Opted out of desert because we were underwhelmed by the food.  Overall, the service and food fell flat. Which I think is challenging to do with a cream gnocchi dish. I appreciate simple flavor and although  it was certainly rich, the dish just lacked too much in flavor.The pizza was good, however it is comparable to many other pizzerias in the Valley. I want to like this charming place, and I would come back and give it another try if someone else suggested it and wanted to check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

jCVlw6TB0k0Hbje7-M6eJw.text: We had a 15-20 min wait on Friday night,so it wasn't too shabby,we started of with a delicious salad,then we ordered a spaghetti and pizza which was pretty good,pasta was alright,and pizza was For desert we ordered the crepe and that was REALLY good.i recommend this place!

ClYC3PGEPbeKyIXdTr9Omg.text: Can't believe I've waited so long to check this place out.  Very friendly staff and wonderful food.  Had the calzone and dessert crepe.  Both were amazing and I would certainly order again!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EyEV2769rP8O6gmAq1vXcQ.text: You can literally never go wrong with cibo. Everything is delicious! The white pizzas are our favorites. And don't miss out on getting a crepe. They are the best in town!

N1WYxSFgp3eBTLpLH-8BgA.text: Great sandwich, delicious fries and pizza made the right way - meaning thin crisp crust (now there is a tongue twister for you), tasteful and not too greasy. I stopped by a few times during a business trip where I stayed at a nearby hotel.   The outside area is great for gatherings, with live music and plentiful shade under the trees.   For you loners out there, I can recommend sitting at the bar. Lively atmosphere, great service.

sOBP40zmvokgPiX1794zBA.text: Great dinner choice while in Phoenix. Their pizza was pretty good, kind of soggy in the middle, i prefer it to be a little more crispy but overall pretty good pie. Their burrata app with fresh mozzarella was awesome and their crepe filled with nutella and chocolate sauce was great too. Would definitely visit this place again if I was in the area.

8Osn0w0UV8CDMdIpi6gCFg.text: After receiving recommendations from locals and looking this place up online, I was super excited to check this place out.  Dined here on a Tuesday evening, it was rather busy and we were in a larger group of 7. We ended up dining outside on the patio, which I loved!

zOogEhDLrDxclRdmzDA9Mw.text: I was so hyped up about this place, but the experience didn't live up to it. We came here at night which seems like the best time to come. The ambiance and decor was very romantic when we sat on their outside patio. However, the food was mediocre. The pizza we ordered was far from amazing...prosciutto crudo. The base of the pizza tasted plain with prosciutto just thrown on top. Our salad was good. And it also felt like we were forgotten for a while since they sat us outside. We hardly saw our server, but when we did, she was very kind and accomodating. I would recommend this place if I was going on a first date and food didn't matter to me.

1MaTiEh0dIAQDujgtn2QCQ.text: I love this place! Been dining here for years and never disappointed. Consistent good food and wine. Great service. The patio is spectacular! A great place for a date or a night out with a group! Don't forget to get a crepe for desert, so yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dSWedUmGqSMc-ojxpY-4Gw.text: Holy mother of pizza. When I travelled to Phoenix on business and asked the Phoenix yelpers where to go, I was a little surprised so many people said Cibo. I was even more surprised when I saw how many reviews it had. Well, Phoenix, I understand now. I have seen the light. You have converted me to Ciboism.  It's. Phenomenal.  The location is in a neighborhood and it's obviously a converted house where the outdoor seating is actually on the front lawn with some nice lights in the trees. Very cool to sit outside on a cool night in Phoenix and enjoy great company and delicious food!  When I was looking at the menu I was so excited to see so many options for Pizza Biancha (white pizza!). I can't eat tomatoes so it was like a kid in a candy store for me. Once I saw the Di Notte I knew it had to be mine. A huge portion, wood fired pizza with fontina, pecorino, gorgonzola and mozzarella cheeses along with spicy salami. It was to die for. I enjoyed it at the table AND I enjoyed the leftovers. My co-workers even stole a slice each and couldn't stop ooo'ing and aah'ing over it.  One of my co-workers got a meatball sub which he swore up and down was as good as his authentic-from-Italy grandmother's. He said it might be sacriledge to say it, but it was True. My other co-worker had a half vegetarian and half ham and she said the whole thing was delicious.  For dessert, even though we were full, we couldn't pass up the opportunity to try the Nutella & Marscapone crepe. It was a warm crepe filled with nutella and marscapone cheese, covered in powdered sugar and drizzled with chocolate sauce, with a dollop of ice cream. It was sinfully delicious.  I completely agree that this might be the best pizza I've ever had!! Thank you Phoenix, and thank you Cibo!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegetarian / ham with kalomota olives!
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Di Notte pizza!!! Yum!!!
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Meatball Sandwich

CcE9YPsKhp35yDlE_UA8eA.text: Oh my lord. This is it. The end all be all of Phoenix pizza. I loved everything we ordered and had no problems devouring it.
