We started with the calamari which was perfectly cripy and had the perfect amount of salt and bright lemon.   The funghi pizza with red sauce was to die for. The ultra thing crust is dangerously easy to chow down on. The white pizza with truffle oil was great too, but I'm personally not into truffle anything.   The ambiance is adorable and unique - a converted house to give a very homey and warm feeling. This is definitely on the short list of perfect date spots.

gHYdnPVKZuptCac6xcUyRg.text: Outdoor patio - gorgeous. Food - excellent and fresh. Wine selection - also excellent. Service - a little disjointed. It's never bad, but definitely don't come here if you're in a hurry. Plan to settle in, relax, and enjoy a great meal.

CT7dxSCdPJhZiO7km0-uEQ.text: Ate here last night while visiting Phoenix..   I would highly recommend this restaurant.   Gourmet Pizza's, unique appetizers, full bar...  Great outdoor seating area...  Cibo makes one of the best crusts I've had...  Go here if you're in town...

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

eXBk0E3DSWdT0zWKXlmUdA.text: I adore Cibo! Their pizzas, pastas, salads, and crepes are truly to die for. Fresh and handmade each night, authentic unique and perfectly balanced flavors. I've tried every pizza on the menu and it never gets old. And I love the Ostia salad, I try to recreate it at home, but it never beats Cibo. I've celebrated many special occasions end life events here, as well going for a regular day lunch or dinner when I'm wanting the most delicious Italian option that downtown Phoenix has to offer. If you've never been to this local jewel, you need to. Tonight.

Yfw0iRJxwCIHrTIbKMXN3A.text: I've never been disappointed by any of my experiences here. The food is amazing and the owners are so nice! If this spot was closer to home I would be there all the time.

mi8DcCcnicp_V8eYOmi3dA.text: They say Chris Bianco has the best Pizza in town. This place is better, but without the wait and cheaper bottles of wine.   I finally became tired of waiting in the line at Bianco's Pizza for hours on end, and wound up at this amazing pizza joint. It's a restored 1913 bungalow on the corner of 5th Avenue and Fillmore with outdoor seating in the cozy front yard; it even has a fireplace to relax if there happens to be a short dinner rush.   I have been coming here with friends for a few years now; it is consistently delectable artesian pizza. I believe the chef is from Naples. It is very close to most pizza joints in that region of Italy. Some of my favorites, in this order, are: the Rustica, Tricolore, and Capricciosa pizzas. The balsamic onions are great on some pizzas too for an additional charge.   Hands down, the best thing and reason for coming here, is the Burrata appetizer. Average meal is around $17-25, add a $30 bottle of wine and split costs with friends.  Mon : 11am - 2pm / 5pm - 9pm Tue - Thurs : 11am - 2pm / 5pm - 10pm Fri : 11am - 2pm / 5pm - 11pm Sat :11am - 11pm - pizzas all day  (brunch from 11am-2pm) Sun : 9am - 2pm

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Buy 2, share flavors with a friend!
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burrata

HFdWSVIXByBVSh4TA_xJcw.text: The best thing about Cibo is that you can eat outside. The food is not that great. Phoenicians just don't know about good quality Italian food ... too bad.

Y2gNB0tyBvcqXDnNfKUaUg.text: The service was excellent and so was the food for the most part. Did lack some flavor and they did not have a lot of the drinks they claimed to have in the menu.

T8HYMUrKte2DB4mztPaEzg.text: I was very excited to try Cibo after reading many great reviews. However, after visiting...I have come to the conclusion that when you have Pizzeria Bianco/Pane Bianco in town, there is no reason to break from perfection.  The Pizza: WAY TOO MUCH CHEESE. Dough: WAY TOO DOUGHY.   I was pulling the cheese off into huge glops with my fork. We didn't finish our pizza, nor did we want to take it home.   Hopefully, they were having an 'off' night.

yl7k4APzrb9gNMMjundi6w.text: I agree with the other Yelpers...skip the insane 2 hour wait at Pizzaria Bianco. The pie here is equally delicious (if not better)!   Cibo offers the perfect crispy/chewy crust with simple, fresh toppings.   Fantastico!

8z_qhjOFD0aEnFEYk1yPRg.text: I've eaten at Cibo about a dozen times over the past 8 years. It's a beautiful restaurant, just tucked away from the Downtown/Roosevelt hustle & bustle - and the food is fantastic! The pizza here is crisp and delicious, and I really enjoy their sandwich creations! They use very high quality meat (and yes, I'm a mostly vegetarian!), and the ciabatta bread is to die for!   This place is great if you are looking to spend all night drinking wine and eating great food with friends, if you are celebrating something special, or if you just want a tasty lunch! Parking is fairly straightforward here. And also, big kudos to the staff who have always been very friendly and attentive!

52jpgoLW4c1rVtyKkmjnvg.text: Parking is a nightmare but supposedly they have valet so if there's a next time, we will try that.   Phoenix weather is starting to get manageable so it's very nice to eat outside. We came after dusk so the lights were very pretty. We were seated in the more exposed outside area... There's another side right nearby that's more enclosed and looks much cozier.   We had a 1/2 Tartufata and Capricciosa. I wanted something familiar and tasty and that was hard to find. I chose tartufata because I like mushrooms and the prosciutto.   Um, the pizzas were barely ok. They weren't terrible, but nothing like the reviews suggested. It's thin crust, but was floppy. The only thing telling me the two diff pizzas apart was that one had olives. I THINK there was mushrooms but I didn't taste it. The pizzas, sauce and toppings, were one homogenous thing. I HATE that when it comes to pizza. It didn't come out cheese-bubbly and charred.   It's an expensive small pizza. It should taste better than Dominoes. I'm hoping it's a bad day because it tastes like soggy leftover pizza. No cheese stringing away after you bite it or anything. It was an even layer of firm sauce  and toppings.   The dessert was good. We had the fresca. The sliced peaches tasted it came from a can but the rest of the fruit was fresh and the ice cream and whipped cream was good.   One last note. It seems the server dresses in whatever they want and there are a lot of them so it's just a flurry of people walking around, all wearing regular clothing. Sometimes we didn't know if they worked there to flag them down. I went to Clever Koi recently and the staff there was so friendly and really knew their menu. The servers here were curt and disinterested. However the people cleaning up our plates after each course were prompt.   Pros: Ambience (though we were on the "less nice" side Dessert  Cons: Pizza  Service

thR1uZ88ywKfUuOWo7rEvQ.text: Appalled at the service and staff. Uninspiring food did little to make up for it. Too many things with the service were off which leads me to believe there is a serious issue with management.  Every member of staff was dressed in raggedy clothes and they didn't look very happy at all either. The majority of them were frowning... our waitress was nice and smiled a lot but looked stoned and reeked of bad b.o. (yes it's hot in AZ but try to prudently refresh yourself every hour or so if you know you're getting sweaty). We waited 10+ minutes to be greeted by her despite her coming to check on the tables right next to us. Her service through the night was very erratic and left a lot to be desired.  We ordered the lasagna as an appetizer and a Salsiccia pizza for dinner but the pizza came out first! Needless to say I was very irritated that a pre-made lasagna failed to make its way out of the kitchen before a pizza.  The pizza was barely above average. The fennel sausage and the mozzarella were good but the crust and sauce didn't prove to be anything memorable. There are far superior places in the valley including one just blocks away and even a nationwide brand of pizzerias so to not even beat out a large chain was very disappointing.  The lasagna offered nothing special and was quite worthless being ordered as an appetizer but arriving after the entree.  Bland food, low staff morale, and terrible service just made for a bad experience and with these many problems in one night I didn't even want to waste my time giving a manager feedback. I just wanted to run out as fast as possible.

lUeSbwK6uczSfXyHbS2Yew.text: My friend and I decided to check this place out, because from four squares rating, it was very good. The home made pasta isn't served until 5pm. We got there about 4:20pm, so we decided to drink and wait until 5pm. Once 5pm hit we ordered the special for Saturday, and it was fantastic. It's a dryer pasta, but it was delicious!!! I had my moscato that was very tasty also. The ambience is relaxing and almost vintage. Will be back!

DSD6eYLbv6RhLq2SLMObYw.text: This place is overrated, sad to say. We have tried to get reservations here several times and each time is always a hassle and over the phone the staff always says the wait is at least an hour. We happened to get in for a party of 5 right away when we were in the area and were looking forward to finally trying the famous Cibo. The place is beautiful no doubt, atmosphere is 4 star but as far as the pizza goes you can get higher quality and price at The Parlor. We also had the calamari which was too tough and over cooked. The Parlors calamari was perfect and juicy. Our servers were also not friendly despite us only saying thank you whenever they stopped by our table. Of course, this was all just our one time experience but it did not leave a good impression.

CwhWMNHBPIaWsyg4dl1f_w.text: This is -hands down- the best pizza place in town. We take people here, every time we want to empress them with a  mind blowing pizza. I have no other pizza joint that I like in town, but Cibo's.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oh yeah...

DNqwZdOK-iamk4KVd25d4Q.text: I'm not understanding the recent rash of lackluster reviews. CiBo is consistently awesome, tasty and efficient. Better than  Bianco without the three hour wait. Adorable setting, great staff and beautifully community minded, holding yearly fundraising events for local charities. CiBo is the real deal, and if you folks who left bad reviews don't come back? More pizza for me!  Ps- zeppoli? Heck yes.

ISPIt3eOwvQF0_YEzpl8cw.text: This place is excellent. We went late after a show downtown and even near closing the food and staff was just excellent. I love the outdoor seating and the atmosphere. It's a must go if your downtown looking for pizza.

LMo_8oR4uzofi_RNedH-QA.text: Their pizza is to die for! I cannot keep myself away from ordering the same thing every single time because it's basically everything I've ever wanted in a pizza. Their crust is on the thin side, which is just my style, and has a ton of flavor. Their white procida (sp?) pizza is absolutely amazing: goat cheese, prosciutto and pear deliciousness!   The ambiance is great also. I would definitely suggest sitting on the patio (if it's not sweltering hot outside) and enjoying some live music and cocktails. This is definitely a happy place for me:)

nb66npDCukttF8HhVJYaIw.text: Awesome Happy hour -- got the Polpette (meatballs) & they were AMAZING.. came with 3 large meatballs with some bread and lots of sauce for $6. Also, we got the gnocchi (Also $6), which I don't love gnocchi, & it was delicious.. the sauce on the two were different which made them even better in my opinion. The HH wine was only $4 and OK -- for that price, I'll drink whatever but wouldn't be too pleased if I paid full price for it.. but I'm sure its the house wine/chianti of some kind. My boyfriend and I then split the Capricciosa pizza, perfect size for us both (plus the 2 apps we shared). The pizza reminded me of something you would get in Italy & we both enjoyed it a lot. I would highly recommend it here, food is good, service is great, ambience is nice.

YZVfwlVkvqmNuKO9_9-WQQ.text: Wow! My friends had been raving about this place for over a year so had to check it out on my recent visit. The pizzas are super thin crust which is just how I like it. I definitely recommend the spicy pepperoni pie, but they had so many options to choose from that you really can't go wrong. Cibo is an old house right in the heart of Phoenix, so the place has tons of charm if you are looking for a great date spot. I thought the service was excellent as well.

kqCDPX1-v08_7FLmCJeScw.text: I've been trying to perfect the neapolitan pizza on my own time, so when I first went here, I of course went for the Margherita... Of course I have since tried many of their pies, but I want to focus on the most pristine of their pies, as if you don't have that nailed, you have nothing.  Component wise this pizza was top notch.  The crust was leopard spotted, perfect hydration for their oven, salted cornichone... Just perfect.  The sauce was excellent.  Not sweet, fresh, tangy, bomb.  Their mozzarella is milky goodness, and they throw the fresh bail on last after it's cooked. Magnifico!  People go around talking about their favorite pizza spots and it always boils down to some certain pizza configuration; however, a True pizza person must see through this fluff in order to see the True greatness.  Cibo has the right oven, the right temperature, the right wood, the right bakers ratios in use on their dough, fresh ingredients, and elegant flavors.  Don't get fooled into this pie or that.  Get into perfection.  Get into Cibo.

Xox4qabPiWibju6eZzdGuQ.text: Oh Diavola, how you delight me so!  Incredible!!  The pizza was one of the better that I have ever had. Although I was stuffed, we decided to split a Fresca for dessert and it was so good!  Amazing lunch spot. It was very easy to get in and out and the service was fast and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresca. Awesome.

yMYRsMD_GuUYYiZtv2dXjA.text: This place is really great!  Such a nice atmosphere to sit outside around the trees and sparkling lights.  Wonderful pizza and fresh made pasta specials.  Happy hour is a great time to go get inexpensive but delicious wine and appetizer options.  I recommend the antipasta speciale, burrata, polpette, and arancini for appetizers, la noce, di notte, and tartufata for pizza.  They may not have pasta every night, but I had the BEST pasta with shrimp.  Can't wait to go back!

3r3IMuUyjp4cg7oM5WJIrw.text: Cibo needs no review, it's just that amazing! Service and ambiance are always spot on. It's definitely a place we frequent as a family, with friends, and any time we have guests in town.

drvpE8uz-Y39EqK4igsOng.text: Love their wine selection!!! Outstanding prices. It is a small place but their flavors are phenomenal. Definitely recommend this place.

cjhrhncB_N32VWG0MHL_sA.text: Cibo is my favorite restaurant in town. I have never had a bad experience here. You may need to wait to get a table if you go during peak hours, but it is always worth it. The restaurant itself is extremely unique and the food is the best!

Xg3Ith76WKCoZQFOR66EZA.text: We came down 5th and didn't know where to park - no valet was immediately visable and the streets were packed. We eventually found the valet behind the building but found a spot on the street at the same time so went with that.  The give you bread to share which was just ok. The pizzas were all overdone (the crust was burnt) otherwise it seemed like the crust would have been good. Also, some of the pizza toppings were poorly distributed. One had 2 slices with huge chunks of prosciutto but none on any of the other slices. Kind of annoying when you're splitting. The pizzas were all mediocre. I also found it irritating that they don't use those little elevated pizza holders. Our table was PACKED. It was hard to eat.  We split a bunch of desserts. I thought the tiramisu was ok but a little dense. If you hate Nutella you're pretty screwed on dessert because 80% of the dessert was heavily Nutella based. The strawberry and Nutella crepe was good, but the banana and Nutella not so much. It had way too much Nutella (which is saying a lot because I can eat Nutella by the spoonful). We also had the doughnut spheres (which were actually more like triangles... who cares but I thought it was weird that they called them spheres). They were not the best doughnut holes + dip that I've had.  The atmosphere was the high point - nice patio if a bit crowded and there was live music. I thought our service was not spectacular but sufficient.

yHV-VU7MAXqp6rnjRehxlA.text: Sigh. This place just isn't as good as I remember it from a couple years ago. I don't know if the quality has gone downhill or my tastes have changed, but it just wasn't the experience I was hoping for.   During my recent visit, I split the pesto salad and funghi pizza with my cousin. The bread brought out was ok, crusty but a little too chewy and cold. I appreciate having oil on the table to dip. The salad was good. I absolutely loved the roasted potatoes on top. Way better than traditional croutons. The dressing was ok; I thought it could use more of a garlic kick.  Overall, the pizza was just good. I remember it being excellent. The sauce was bad. Bland and a bit too bitter. Good quality cheese. Again, I needed more of a "kick" from the toppings. No strong earthy flavors from the mushrooms. Crust was by far the best part.  Service was slow and inattentive but friendly. Value was good since we only spent $22 for our items. I was very full the rest of the night and even had leftover pizza for my husband to sample.  If anyone wanted to go to Cibo before an event downtown, I wouldn't argue, but I certainly wouldn't drive into Phoenix just for the food.

KYEdWXK1eqhnAx4LcyFA4A.text: Cute venue and service was okay, not stellar but not the worst.  Started off with Antipasta plate: too much shallots, not enough cheese & olives, which is the whole point of antipastas, right?? Capriossa pizza: ok, but the crust was soggy and the ingredients weren't carefully placed so some slices had nothing but red sauce.  Crepe: The ONLY reason this was a 3 and not 2 star review was the crepe. It was delicious. We had strawberries & nutella with a side of ice cream.

7aehyyyqk6krdPDu8vx1WA.text: The best word to describe Cibo would be "pleasant." From the staff and the environment to the wine, pizza, & crepes- it was sweet and warm. Also, it was reasonably priced for such a classy setting. Love love love!

_QJEGp21bah5bPd_HRijLQ.text: I'll try anything twice, that's always been my motto.  While the staff is very kind there is a hint of disdain.  Perhaps it was my "Bearded for her pleasure" shirt.  I actually enjoyed everything about this restaurant, except for the food, atmosphere and service.

rEyj9X6JBXCm6kVvZdLFIA.text: Pizza was very good service was terrible. Waitress was rude and for that reason I probably won't return. That's a shame that the employees reflect so badly on this business. If you are not a people person than being a server is probably not a great career choice.

Q6uNx4EOHL4Uktaz287eYg.text: I've had the opportunity to come once again, to Cibo. Upon first glance, it's small, intimate with the essence of a True Italian pizzeria. We were first greeted by the hostess, then shown to our table. Once we sat down, we waited for our server, who's first question was if we were ready to order. Not hello, not even his name. We place the order for a Margeritta pizza and the salsiccia. The Magueritta was oily, with few basil on top. The sauce tasted as if it were from a can. The Salsiccia was a different story, it was saucy, tangy from the tomatoes and a bit of smokiness from the sausage and the crust. Overall our favorite. What brought this to a 3 star would have to be the 5 flies hovering our table, the greasy table top and dirty wine list. Overall an average experience. Not worth the 20 minute drive.

jLNBAC79gUVXv5Pz83bN7g.text: If you are looking for the urban feel and wonderfull pizza look no further! Cibos setting couldnt be any better, in a vintage house on an historical street and touches of detail everywhere it instantly puts you in a great mood. And the FOOD!   Try anything and you will not be dissappointed but if you want to be pushed over your culinary edge......desert crepe's!

A7FyYuZqFTOZZzzLC8uH_g.text: loved the food, location, and look of the place...they have the same style of pizza that the pizzeria in Heritage Square does...only your not sitting on top of strangers. Wait staff runs Hot and Cold...some nights we had a waitress/waiter that seemed to be having a wonderful time with their guests...other nights the waiter/waitress and the "water re-filler" seem to be very unhappy we were there. Food makes up for it in my book and you just "rasberry" them off until you get your pizza. thats what Tipping is for

BBZ3bhSZWS2O3GeAX6SQWQ.text: Stopped in for a late night bite on a Friday, and loved every minute of it. The ambiance is amazing, the staff was so helpful and the food was delish!!   Mom isn't a big fan of pizza, but ask her now and she'll just rave about Cibo's pizza. That alone says a lot!

yJYCGdWDHmzsAkkND70T2Q.text: Ok, went back last night, felt terrible because we were the late nighters, and everything was perfect. The pizza, the salads and the wine were all so nicely done. And what finally brought me to five stars was the crepe with Nuteila and Mascarpone. OMG awesome. I am now craving it the day after. Fully beats out the crepe with nutella and banana that I also adore...

8ldu1t66iVHQfEa_njNJFA.text: Lovely atmosphere, hospitable service. We were a party of 3 for lunch and had the chicken salad, the caprese salad and charcuterie platter. With a very nice bottle of wine. All very satisfying.

L6mEJFYT52vBLAoBZPmiCg.text: If you're in downtown Phoenix and you want some Neapolitan style pizza, this is the place to go. The Diavola pizza is very tasty with a beer. Although their beer selection is sub par compared to places like Mellow Mushroom.

YajMPM2Z4M8Ti3qZ7oJWAw.text: Love, Love this place!! We have been coming here for years and have watched the place grow based on the wonderful food, great service and lovely atmosphere.

iJn9QXrC_LOjh1bubyk06Q.text: This rating is based on an average from two different visits. During one visit, I went for dinner and had the most delicious pizza! The charm of this place makes you feel like you are distant from reality. The dessert wine I ordered at the end was the icing on the cake!   However, on my next visit, I sat outside on the patio for brunch and it was not quite as great of an experience. The weather was great, but the sun was shining pretty bright so I am guessing that is why our server only came by to get our order, drop it off, and bring our tab. No refills, no feedback requested on the meal, nothing. She was a very sweet lady, she just didn't seem to want to serve our table. The food was just ok. Nothing exciting. And probably more disappointing since I had already been there once and had such an awesome experience.   Overall, I'm not sure if I would recommend it. I recommend the pizza, but I guess it is kind of hit or miss.

cDwqZgCA8hcdBpi8sM1YgA.text: Not sure what all the fuss is about this place. I have eaten real pizza in Napoli. My husband lived in Italy for a while and I'm from Brazil. We like fresh authentic food. This place is cute, nice atmosphere. Service was ok, we waited a while to be seated even though they were not busy. Took several minutes to get us menus. We ordered a white pizza and a margherita pizza. Both were OK only. I found the crust hard and dry. The desert menu had only nutella products...   The taste was blend for the most part. You could not taste quality or freshness out of the pizzas and appetizers we had. The taste was Americanized for sure.   The menu had a huge selection, kind of overwhelming. Nothing special about the food or the place, over priced actually. The pizza sauce tasted like a can product. We will not be coming back. We will keep POMO Pizzeria as our place for good pizza. To add, the place is a bit too dark. The live music outside was nice but we wish the guy had a better sound/voice so we could try to enjoy being there. The kids liked though. Other reviews that say this is a good place they never tried Pomo yet. Side note, this is NOTHING compared to Pizzaria Bianco or Pomo. You can compare Pomo and Pizzaria Bianco, not this place! This place was all looks and show, nothing else.

DmAwvNWyUTmQDZtcPF-BLQ.text: Best of 2009: Best Place to Take a First Date  Best of 2008: Best Place to Make Yourself at Home  Best of 2007: Best Downtown Lunch  Best of 2006: Best Gourmet Pizza  Best of 2005: Best Gourmet Pizza   These are just some of the awards that Cibo has won. Well, this year, Cibo is being awarded its most prestigious award to date.  And that is the Craig R's Favorite Dinner While Visiting Arizona Award   Cibo, which is located in a residential neighborhood in Phoenix, is actually an old restored 1913 bungalow. The inside of Cibo has hardwood floors, beautiful stained glass paneling, an all wood bar and a fireplace. Since it was such a warm, beautiful Phoenix evening, my fiance and I decided to dine in the front yard of Cibo, which is covered with tables, Christmas lights and a fire pit. Cibo also has local Jazz bands come in and play live music in the front yard, which gives Cibo a super relaxing and romantic vibe. In fact, this was one of the most romantic evenings my fiance and I have shared in a long time.   To start out the night we shared their famous Burrata appetizer, which tends to sell out every night. The Burrata consisted of fresh mozzarella topped with a balsamic glaze, black label prosciutto crudo and toasted bread. This app was extremely flavorful and fun to eat. I can see why it sells out almost every night. The mozzarella was really creamy and had an awesome sweet and tangy flavor because of the balsamic glaze. When you combine all the elements of this dish together you get this awesome little sandwich that is sweet, tangy and salty all at the same time.    Cibo is known for their homemade wood fire pizza's that they prepare with only locally grown organic produce and imported Italian products. Every pizza on their menu sounded amazing so my fiance and I each ordered a different one so we could share them. These are the pizza's we got:   Diavola- Tomato sauce, mozzarella, spicy salami, and Italian sausage  Tartufata- Mozzarella, prosciutto crudo, white mushrooms and truffle oil. I also added Italian sausage and ricotta cheese.    Both of these pizzas were phenomenal. They were both huge and cooked perfectly so the crust was thin and crispy, with slightly burnt edges. The spicy salami on the Diavola was actually really, really spicy. The tomato sauce on this pie was extremely flavorful too. The Tartufata  was really cheesy since it contained both mozzarella and ricotta cheese. The truffle oil and the white mushrooms that were on this pizza gave it such an amazing taste.   The service at Cibo was top notch. Our waitress was really friendly and attentive. Since we had never been there before she was very helpful in explaining their menu and giving us suggestions on what we should try and what some of their most popular dishes are. She also always made sure our drinks were always full and that we had everything we needed.  The prices at Cibo were good too. Their pizzas range anywhere from $12 to $15 dollars a piece, which is great considering how big and delicious they were.   Whether you live in Phoenix or just visiting like I was, if you're looking for a romantic place to take you significant other then look no further than Cibo.

Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tartufata
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burrata

onAoUzbe6d3KFHMEZM3Qkw.text: This is a really nice little place located in downtown Phoenix. Parking is quite good in their private lot,but if it is full you can always park on the street around the neighborhood. It is a house that has been changed to a lovely little eatery. They have designed it very nicely, so it flows but, it is also private. We have been here for Brunch only.  But, the food was very good and the coffee nice and smooth. They even have raw sugar(my favourte.)    This place is for sure worth your time. I would come back any time.    Prices are a little high, But that is the way it goes.

YM_AH2_vLtQxXuGfHNxJHQ.text: Cibo is a go to for delicious sandwiches and pizza! The saltimbocca bread is perfectly baked and so fresh. It is a cute little restaurant in an old Phoenix house with a great patio to enjoy your meal on if it is a nice day/evening.   Personal favorites: Alla Parmigana, Caprese & Tonno Sandwiches  Only minor thing I would have to say is on a busy day sometimes service feels understaffed. It may take a little bit to get drink refills etc. But that was only if I was being super critical, usually it is great!

aBuApLu-C9jF6ASgKrLRzw.text: Easily one of the best places to eat in all of PHX.   The food is excellent.  The crepe desserts are fantastic.   The wait staff are as professional as anywhere else in the City.  Patio seating has music and a great atmosphere.  And I got to sit at the table next to TV10's Kari Lake.....practically needed a pitcher of ice water to unwedge myself out from under my table.

Im2Tl5VC-sqDuT3RCF-00g.text: Was at Cibo a couple years ago- I had read about the place online and decided to check it out while on vacation in Phoenix. Easy to find with the GPS in tow.  The tables are terribly close together- but cozy. We had brought two kids with us- not really kid menu friendly. No highchairs, boosters or anything of that nature. I wished I had known that prior to going- perhaps a note on the website regarding their inability to accommodate small children.  The waitress was not friendly at all- she seemed annoyed that there were kids with us and rolled her eyes at us a few times.  The pizza was good- but enjoyed the antipasto plate more than the pizza. The patio was nice, but it was closed because it was "only 64 degrees"-- shorts weather for us.  They seemed like they were trying to rush us out of there to turn the tables quickly-- or to get rid of the kids, I am not sure.   I would not go out of my way to visit again.

FSTVamK3T7VfZ_XSHd_-Ag.text: Oh the pizza and calzones gods live here.  My 2nd most favorite pizza in Phoenix.  Now the calzones - the bread is the light as a cloud bread that isn't soggy or heavy.  It must be godly magic but after eating a filled with meats and cheeses calzone from Cibo - you don't feel like you ate a loaf of bread.  Love the ambiance of this little place and we have also ordered take out from here as well. Hubby and I will visit soon and be blessed by the pizza and calzone gods once again.  Thank you Cibo.

meQS19ael2ok9AS4UTo63Q.text: Cibo is a very nice place to chill and have a few drinks after work. The prices are affordable and the stuff is very friendly. No complaint at all! I will recommend this place to every one of you!

ugPrYCPnJHGKMtEO4MhXrQ.text: Came with a large group of friends, so we ordered a few pizzas, and I had a chance to try multiple items from their menu. Not at all appetizing. Crust was dry and flavorless and the topping choices were very limited, with no good sauces to pick from. I felt I was eating a week-old bread with leaves on top. Seriously the WORST pizza I ever had (and I tried many in Mass, RI, NYC, CA, and AZ).   I thought, well maybe at least I can enjoy some drinks and have a nice time hanging out with my friends... WRONG!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Terrible waitress service - guess she didn't have to try hard, since the tip was added to the bill due to our large group size, but still she was on the margin of being MEAN to the point I felt awkward to ask her to take our picture :/   This place ruined my evening out!! Usually I give restaurants another chance if something went wrong the first time, but I am never, ever coming back here - that's how bad it was.

XC0zqIRUfcQ9bUysf8LXJg.text: My favorite pizza spot in the entire state. I typically order the diablo and the small amount of kick it has is perfect. Very small but place I've never had to wait long. Atmosphere is laid back and friendly. Pizza is light and airy with the perfect amount of seasonings. Dessert menu is very limited as they only serve crepes but they are delicious. I always get the banana, strawberry, and Nutella crepe.

G9H6KOfDAa67zNwfRViUCQ.text: Not all its cracked up to be. The pizza was mediocre at best (we had three pizzas and tried 6 different styles). To be fair to the restaurant, the appetizers (especially the burrata) was fresh and of quality. Additionally, the dessert special (tiramisu) was above average - though a bit cream heavy. Atmosphere was probably the highlight, being tucked away in a cozy home with outdoor seating that would serve as a good date spot.

4vCd6PAMy0Dv5itUzD16RA.text: It's pizza.  Yes, it is fired in a brick oven and yes, it blows Littles Ceasars or Dominoes out of the water...but it is still pizza.  I go here occasionally because the food really is tasty.  And the ambiance is cool-- being in an old historic home in downtown Phx.  But the service, while prompt, is never very warm or friendly. (for lack of a better word)  Every single time I go here to eat, I leave in disbelief that I dropped a $100 dollar bill practically on a two topping pizza and a glass of wine.  I give it 3 stars simply because I feel it is over-priced.

zjTP_tlj9LHjxt0MwdsKdQ.text: Awesome place. Tooo romantic. Must sit out. Great pizza. Crepes can be better. But they come gluten free which is rare and good for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Just loved it! Will come anytime need a romantic escape in an Italian backyard filled with lights and home made awesome pizza

mEjxn0bKAeq-m7wW7uDDeg.text: Amazing pizza, crepes and choclichello...  (chocolate version of limoncello).  Yum.  Go early to avoid waiting.

bCv1d4arATtYov3wUYew5A.text: I read Cibo opened in 2009 so they must have been a little ahead of their time when they opened this quaint little italian pizza and sandwich restaurant in downtown Phoenix area.  This seems to be the trend in 2010+, find an old house or business and convert into a comfortable, home-style, eating experience.  The house concept was relaxing, in a old neighborhood of brick homes and full-grown shade trees and at the same time, seeing the downtown Phoenix landscape on the near horizon.  The Drinks: n/a Didn't feel like any drinks on this visit although the menu selection looked decent.  The Food: **** We started with the Pear Salad, organic spinach, pear, pecorino cheese, honey and toasted almonds.  Very refreshing, and probably could have stopped here.  The bread basket was a little weak.  Didn't feel bad not getting seconds,   where normally I would.  I had the Calzone.  Much bigger than I expected.  Good pizza dough/crust, smooth and not too spicy sauce, mozzarella, ricotta, prosciutto and salami.  I don't recall any other ingredients in the calzone like onions, bell peppers or mushrooms.  More of a creamy texture like folding up a slice of pizza and eating it.  Very good.  Kat had the bolognaise.  Again, good flavor in the meat sauce, homemade noodles and healthy portion.  The Dessert: ***** Mostly crepe menu items like Nutella and berries or moscapone and lemon zest with powered sugar.  Nice end to a good meal.  The Service: ** Our waitress was nice but the rest of the staff seemed a little "tired" and unexcited.  We intentionally left our water bottle on the edge of the table to see if they would offer to refill.  No such luck.  Super bowl week is just starting so they better step up their game.

0vZj7gCqZSUdO71wiDboUQ.text: My girlfriend and I decided to try this place out on the advice of a friend. What started off as a 40-minute wait actually ended up being only a 10-min wait. We started with a meat and cheese board, then a house salad and finished it off with a sausage and prosciutto pizza. Everything was delicious and satisfying. We will definitely be coming back very soon.

25IsDEmGC5z3IuQF3b3efw.text: The porcellono sandwich was great. Everyone loved their food. Indoor and outdoor areas. Highly recommend for lunch.

xIza657vC3h8thhqBZxUZQ.text: Wow! We had the best experience here this afternoon! The food was fantastic and the service was phenomenal. My husband and I sat at the bar and Angie was our server. She offered suggestions and was wonderful to have conversation with. If you're looking for incredible food, great atmosphere and dynamic service, you must try Cibo and ask for Angie!

Q0b_E2V03JFlurxckA6xvw.text: Yay Cibo! 1. We dream of their handmade pasta/bolognese; 2. We're not vegetarian, but veggie panini rocketh; 3. BEST fries ever, until you try the 4. *Truffle fries* (you can swoon me later;) 5. Of course, the pizza is wonderful  Thank you for getting rid of the rudest valets in the valley, continually parking cash tippers in the few handicapped spots available, making needy elderly/disabled/vets etc scramble due to lack of spaces. Boss man called the picks out on it: BAD ASS!

uAOtjwQKIM3_4XMDY3AK-g.text: Love my pizza and am a fan of this place.  Great outdoor seating if the weather is right.  We always share a couple appetizers and a couple pies.  Cant really go wrong with anything that you choose.

F6LlanDyooHPiQnEgyg1CQ.text: The best part of Cibo's by far is the warm, inviting ambiance. A great place for a romantic evening to begin. Also, the service is very friendly. The food is excellent. It is a quaint, romantic setting for two (as I shared on my visit) or a relaxing place to visit with friends after a long work week. Without a doubt, we'll be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best part of Cibo&#39;s? The ambiance is warm &amp; inviting. Great place for a quiet romantic evening to start!

KsgMU5Z8hyCYMkWhuvy_0Q.text: Cibo - what a beautiful setting. I love the patio, and love that it's in an awesome historic house in downtown Phoenix.  The pizza is very good and the spicy salami is the icing on the pie! Good crust, good cheese, good sauce. And I've never had bad service.  My one complaint is that the salads aren't all that - they're passable, but the salads at Forno 301 and even Grazie in Scottsdale are much better. If you improve on these, you'll have a really good thing going.  I always try to pass it up, but never can - the nutella and mascarpone crepe. DELICIOUS!  It's a great overall experience for date night, family meal, afternoon snack and wine on a beautiful patio - keep it up Cibo!

ZckkhMvSPR9dtJCSdJolhw.text: Great bread! I've pretty much tried it all and I love it! Its so cute at night when they turn their lights on! Its like a little picnic under the stars!

Ji1D0B1eYn0RrS0dq1-U9w.text: The best pizza place in Phoenix! Great food and very reasonable prices. Nowhere else compares

GNJSiKP1Sx8lpIsxBHj4nA.text: The best pizza I have tried ever! I have been to over 15 different countries, nothing like it. The tartufata is a must if you like truffles. The service was good and attentive. The outdoors was beautiful and relaxing. For dessert check out the Nutella crepe. Definitely coming back on my next trip to Phoenix.

3HgiY1F5BjZHRY6kG8u3Eg.text: Fun, quirky yet sophisticated, place. Their urban pizzas make up the majority of the menu and are always delicious. With every glass of wine I try here I think I fall a tad in love. Patio and ambience are great. Live musician playing low-key ambient music many nights.   Can easily be a "casual dress" place but it's got a romantic aspect to it and many people dress up, too.  Really a neighborhood gem!

Jc7L0M61Sos3pT1gMZIOtQ.text: It's taken me way too long to write about one of my all-time favorite restaurants in the Valley, Cibo. I love everything about it: the phenomenal pizza, the beautiful decor, the on-top-of-things servers and the charming neighborhood location -- it's a must-try, for sure!  Cibo is in a historic home-turned-restaurant, with the most gorgeous twinkly light-lit patio (there are misters, so you can even sit here during the summer.) The interior is just as cute, with a small bar overlooking the open kitchen churning out perfect wood-fired pizzas. There's also an area that overlooks the backyard garden, and the rest of the inside seating is quaint and cozy -- you'll most likely be sat close to another table, so prepare to get intimate.  The obvious menu draw here is the pizza, and they're pretty close to perfect. You can get pizzas for dinner (their lunch menu consists mostly of sandwiches and salads.)   A single pizza alone is a huge meal for one (though I can happily finish one myself and still manage to gobble up some dessert), so consider splitting an appetizer and sharing a pie. My favorite kind to get is a simple Margherita pizza with olives added ($12.50). The dough is always my favorite consistency -- thin and soft and with crispy edges. The fresh basil is amazing -- I love it!  Plan on having a crepe -- they're definitely a must-have if you go to Cibo. I love getting the Nutella and banana one and adding mascarpone and whipped cream to it, too ($10.50). Every bite is incredible, and it will have you coming back for more.  The atmosphere combined with the mouthwatering food solidifies Cibo as one of my go-to restaurants. It's truly a Valley gem, and I hope it stays open forever!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nutella, banana and mascarpone crepe with whipped cream.
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita pizza with olives

lHONuBN6-qTKjPfRhnAM-w.text: I loved this place! Came for a little romantic dinner with my love right before enjoying the Suns basketball game. We had a wonderful walk to this place. It was a very romantic scenery. The view was lovely, the food was delicious. New great memories for him and I.  The pizza was jus wonderful very filling for the both of us. First thing I thought of was artichoke on pizza? Eh idk. But that was my fav! Definitely coming back for more. Thank you for the lovely staff and for the musician playing romantic songs during our dinner it was just lovely all the way around.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Even the water was amazing
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My veggie pizza! Super uber delicious! Specially after an amazing house salad. artichokes, squash, and tomatoes
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love the little set up

ZbNf2ac6LpKxLyhPPUHAkA.text: This is definitely our favorite Pizza place in town! Absolutely AMAZING! This is my wife's go to spot for our once a month "cheat" day and let me tell you we totally take advantage. The Margarita pizza with added ground sausage is simply ogasmic. My only complaint would be their restrooms, however, if they were to paint their filthy doors and put a little bit more TLC in them I would give it an A+. My father and I own three successful businesses in the valley and he won't go back there because of the restrooms. What a shame cause that pizza is "BOMB"!!

FjvKdL49cwGBruiBRbbFkA.text: I've heard so many great things about this place; so glad I finally got to try it myself! We were looking for Italian food in downtown Phoenix last night and this place popped into my mind almost instantly. We went around 5:30 and only waited a couple of minutes for a table. My boyfriend had the Oak Creek Hefeweizen (one of our favorites) and I had a Pinot Grigio, which was the perfect choice for the warm summer night. I started with the house salad, which was delicious and fresh. Then, we got a pizza and a pasta to split. I had the pasta del giorno (whichever the pasta of the day was for Saturday) and we also got the La Noce pizza, which my boyfriend raved about (and wouldn't let me try because he enjoyed it himself so much!). Overall, it was a very enjoyable dining experience. The food was delicious and the servers were very friendly and helpful! We'll definitely be returning and I'll be joining my friends in recommending it.

miDFiIg0hhVjA2MC_7_ejA.text: The place is always packed.  The ambiance is perfect.  We do take out a lot from there, but it's really hard to get in and out of because they are SO busy!  Our favorite pizza is the Capricciosa.  We've had their Calzone but it's not as good.  Maybe someday, we'll try some other items, but for now, we know and love their pizza!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Capricciosa pizza. Our favorite!

spT0ellfRahd2VVtTAfTnw.text: Amazing food!!!! Will definitely go back. Huge portions. I'm Italian- so I can vouch for sure. I ate too fast so I wasn't able to take pics ha ha

GvPaKKEr69bJXvM9oOqZgg.text: I just feel like the quality doesn't justify the price. I've gone on multiple occasions and though I enjoy bread and salad, the pizza is always a bit soggy and disappointing.

gJfJdTInep_L9CRmd3rGrA.text: Took my mom here for Mother's Day.  Absolutely lovely experience. The night time patio ambiance with greenery in a home setting with candle like light.  Pizza was a creative mix of artistic design and flavor.  My personal favorite was the dessert though.  Crepes with Nutella and chocolate or berries will end the night on a perfect note.

6oVofB7FXwJznKkjtcrJYA.text: Cibo never disappoints. Best patio in Phoenix and the menu and service to match. The patio manages to transport you to some kind of Pizza Paradise. Choices are unique and the menu has something to offer everyone. The Mixed Vegetables are grilled to perfection and my personal fave. Go for the patio, stay for the culinary party in your mouth. PS if the patio is full, enjoy the comfy house and bar area anyway, they will not disappoint.

kzkhOGoDj6ah_MMU8Pc0nA.text: Loved, loved, loved this place. There's something so rustic and romantic about it, with it's quaint cottage look and glowing string lights above their outside seating. I was visiting my old roommate in Arizona and she took me to this place for some authentic Italian eats, the usual catch up wine and dine.  It's a little nondescript as the street holds no other restaurants, but it adds to the homey vibe. We went for simple and grabbed the cacio e pepe (a dish of noodles with pepper and parmesan that allows the homemade pasta to shine) and the Tartufata pizza. The pizza was amazing with a woodfired crust, crispy prosciutto, and the light taste of truffle oil. Definitely get it if you're a fan of white pizzas. Altogether, I loved how classic the dishes were.  As for service, it was solid. Our water was always kept filled and they were really patient when we were struggling over what to order.  This is definitely a place with a really intimate feel and is a popular date spot, as we were surrounded by parties of two. However, don't let that deter you from grabbing a bite with old friends.  And finally, if you had any doubts like I did, it's pronounced CHEE-boh. You're welcome.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tartufata pizza

abCQFcL7KQ6irDrt-RVHxA.text: Fresh food, good wine, and a beautiful outdoor setting - what more can a girl ask for? We came here for lunch and got the meatballs, margherita pizza, and eggplant parm sandwich. Everything was delicious and the outdoor seating was adorable. Would definitely come back, time and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita pizza, meatballs, eggplant parm sandwich, delish!

LydHu2B8HNwtKTdYF4_LWw.text: I love this restaurant. It's atmosphere is as good as the menu. The menu isn't overwhelming and it has great entrees. Good service, excellent food. I have never been disappointed in a meal at Cibo. The owners are there to greet their customers coming and going, meeting new people in the community, making sure their meal was satisfactory and their experience was good.

iH9VqfXkqfAOh0fosN6YaA.text: This former residential dwelling is nestled in downtown and surrounded with trees. When weather permits you should definitely dine outside. The service was great. The arugula pear salad is the business, light, crisp and delicious. I got a regular cheese pizza nothing fancy. Love the thin crust! Leave room for dessert, I'm glad I did. I love Cibo and will be back soon.

cpkjbudcrI5CKjl17AVeCA.text: Came here for the first time with my bf. I have to say this place can be pretty romantic if you sit outside when the lights turn on. In the daytime it's like relaxing at a friends house having a meal but come night fall it's beautiful.  There's also soft music playing in the background. On the night we went they had low jazz playing and then a live guitarist playing along with it and it make the song and entire mood so much better.  I also love that yelp allows you to join the wait list as you're on your way to go there. Perfect if you're busy and needing a table somewhere quick. I highly recommend it.

aHkZhmUJrGIT6EnelbHWKg.text: Very good spot near downtown. We got two pizzas (margherita and diavola), plus their meatballs, and the burrata with prosciutto and tomatoes. I thought everything was really good -- the pizza was floppier than I'd typically want, but still very good. The meatballs were probably the standout, although the burrata/prosciutto/tomatoes were excellent as well.

uu7h06ZJVTA2GHKWpoCKgA.text: The best gluten free pizza I've had! I think the difference is they make their crust in house. I've tried a lot of gluten free pizza in the LA area but I guess the place to go to get my gf pizza fix is in Phoenix, AZ now.   We went on a Friday evening and it was pretty quick to get seated inside for a party of 4. They estimated it would take 30 minutes to get seated but it was much sooner than that.

TdaNlpY_YTdICVDlTJ4R8A.text: The service was decent! But if you sit outside expect to be attacked by bees and birds... I got a margheritta pizza. kiup00DZoc_xyWGxGRflfg.text: What's not to love about Cibo?  Delectable, authentic wood-fired pizza, adorable 1920s renovated farmhouse, live music on the large patio when weather permits, locally-owned... a definitive five stars.

eCYWVbUajCOlo4aGE5vbnA.text: One of my favorite Italian restaurants in Phoenix. It has an old-school vibe with Italian classics. The Bolognese is my go-to every time. Try to sit outside if you can, the courtyard is pretty nice if the weather is manageable.

-gfrjCapIGeh4jmDhOUvjg.text: Would eat here every day if my girlfriend would let me.  Best Calamari I have ever had!!

rEDry2ydrNc-IcvW065S3w.text: One of my favorite Napoli pizza places in Phoenix. Their margherita pizza is amazing and caprese salad comes not only with big mozzarella and tomatoes but also cherry tomatoes and mozzarella balls, adding to the variety. It's enough to be shared by four people in addition to a meal.

3Qj_lbpFkX5yszoylljmGQ.text: Ross at Cibo is wonderful. The pizza was so authentically Italian but service is everything! After visiting Italy om our honeymoon, I never thought I would have that taste and atmosphere again. This is as close as I've ever come. I will definitely be back. I hope the managers at Cibo know what a gem they have in hiring this gentleman. Thank you Ross!

GwaHZpcoN2g_GhKxLx68Ww.text: A proper Italian wine and dine dinner. Food is excellent and I would recommend the dolce pizza. Very amazing and well worth it. Definitely one of my favorites!

1KrChCtzZ16xC0KCx-RATQ.text: Very nice servers and hostess - made us feel really welcomed. Love the Italian feel of the interior. Clean bathroom and an excellent wood fired pizza! Salad special was also delicious. Beer prices were very reasonable as well.

DdagwSdO-ofsm5XYJLFwOA.text: Amazing service and food. Quaint little European style place. Caprese salad following by white pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TTvU4Ft6V_2jyOsB2d6Rog.text: Foods pretty good, service was not good. Prices are too high (( However, the place is convenient for food. In general, the place is average.

oJNpNHiMqsXL0o4SpjfoSw.text: My husband had been bugging me to check out Cibo for a while and strangely, I haven't been in much of a pizza or pasta mood of late so I had dismissed it every time he brought it up. His persistence eventually paid off clearly, cause we wound up at Cibo last weekend and I've been kicking myself since for not checking them out sooner. I usually have a list of go-to restaurants that I take any guests I have from out-of-town, and Cibo definitely made it on the list.  Getting to the restaurant at a little before prime dinner time, we were seated almost immediately. The patio was gorgeous but since we're still at the tail end of summer (yeah, I know, it's Arizona, when does summer really end), we opted to sit indoors. When it came to placing our orders, we consulted our waiter for his recommendations. I love that he legitimately had an opinion on the dishes, on top of telling us what the popular dishes were, and was able to give us a very layman's description of each dish, leaving me salivating just listening to it (internally, thankfully. I hope).  To get the best of both worlds, my husband and I ordered a pizza and pasta to share. Specifically, the Tartufata, which is one of their white sauce pizzas topped with mushrooms, prosciutto, and truffle oil - you really can't go wrong with that. As for the pasta, we had the Saturday pasta special (the name escapes me right now) but was our waiter's absolute favorite - that's when you know you have to try it. It was phenomenal. When my husband asked me to pick which I liked better, the pasta or pizza, I was at a loss. They were both amazing in their own right and in my mind, they were tied for first.  Will I be back, if it wasn't clear, hell yes. And as I mentioned before, with any out-of-town guests I may have in tow.

G3vNZa8P9duB9fNqa2-Nuw.text: Delicious pizza!!! I'm a huge fan of the truffle oil one! I wish we had ordered two of these instead of the margherita. Service was super fast and efficient for a busy Friday evening - I was impressed. I also loved the ambiance of the restaurant. We were seated outdoors by the entrance and it was surrounded by trees but it didn't feel too woodsy.  Always save room for dessert too. The banana nutella crepe was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crepe with Nutella And Banana
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cacio e pepe
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita and truffle oil pizza

OaARVw3YezKQCFtZHwlwOA.text: My favorite upper scale pizza spot in Phoenix, I go every year for my birthday! An adorable patio with lights strung from the trees, it's the cutest atmosphere. There are a shocking amount of tables they managed to fit outside without it seeming too crowded, though the inside seating does get a tiny bit tight.  They've got a pretty hefty wine list, and I've never been disappointed by any that I've tried. I typically lean into the Italian red blends to go with my meal.   The boothang is gluten intolerant, and Cibo has the best gf crust we've ever found. I straight up love gluten, and even I'll admit that it's good. That being said, their normal pizza crust is damn near perfection. Fluffy and doughy, it's perfectly proportioned to the sauce and cheese and toppings. My personal favorite is the salsiccia, with mushrooms added. The tartufata is an excellent white pie, but I usually lean red sauce. The salsiccia sandwich during lunch is also amazing. I've never had their pasta, but it's definitely on my to-try list. Their salads are good but not necessary -- my advice is to forgo and just double down on your entree.   They also do a free Nutella crepe for your birthday! And I don't think they mention on the menu, but you can also get this gluten free. It's amazingly every bit as tasty as a normal crepe.   The perfect date night spot, I highly recommend everyone come check Cibo out.

Wo6eGrXK1MP40Lucbo39PQ.text: Heellllloooooooo fellow Italian food lovers. This place is an experience. From the atmosphere to the food, they really pull together the rustic Italian experience. Make sure to start your meal with a shot of limoncello, and then move on to any of their fabulous starters. I'm a huge fan of the calamari if it's within your diet! The pizza is dope and pretty customizable. My partner is gluten free (which they have as an option) so it's so nice having some place to go where we can both indulge. Don't make the mistake of not getting desert. You can't go wrong with the affogato

t9YW8sVsGzkqs8SSL7bnPw.text: A converted heritage house just blocks from downtown, near the hipsterville area of Phoenix. You could be looking out the window up at the skyline but instead you're outside on the patio. Out there is live acoustic music and great service. It's really quite awesome. We ordered a salad and pizza to share and two local beers from a good selection. All were as advertised or better. We were full. La quenta arrives and I'm astounded how not expensive it was. This place is huge value (and it's also very very good) so I give it five stars because I would be holding out for a unicorn otherwise

PavnNsbpKfL0aTw5cdLa3w.text: Okay. I'm sure in 2005, Cibo was probably a ground-breaking culinary concept for Downtown Phoenix. But in 2018? Eh. Okay, I guess it still has its charms to a certain degree, especially if you're new to the area.  Although the ultra-trendy bungalow setup has now become somewhat of a hipster cliche in Central Phoenix, Cibo was there long before the downtown scene started picking up. Locals seem to flock here for their pizza and wine fixes. Based on the conversations I've overheard while eating, it's clear that Cibo not only serves as an ideal first-date place, but a somewhat secretive hideaway for middle-aged couples having mid-life marital affairs (I've witnessed both first-hand at nearby tables).  Unfortunately, if you strip the ambiance out of Cibo and just look at their food for what it is, I've found it to just be only slightly above average. Their pizza is your standard-fare wood-fired style that can range from "good" to "just okay" depending on the day. On the positive, I do like that Cibo has no problem with letting you order half-half pies. Most places will arrogantly scoff at the mere mention of the idea. In fact, they even let you combine a white pizza with a red one, which is very rare, but incredibly convenient given all of their different choices.  While I give Cibo credit for offering some interesting creations, is it really necessary to have 22 different pizzas (sans the calzones) on the menu? Oddly enough, despite all of these ridiculous options that give me anxiety at first glance, their best pizza is a traditional margherita. Their calzone, which is rather alarming at first due to its massive size, is also fine, but nothing that can't easily be obtained elsewhere.  I've found a lot of inconsistencies with Cibo's pasta to the point where I'll only order it if I'm up for taking a risk. After my girlfriend and I recently ordered a taglietelle that ended up being undercooked, I was reminded of why I can't bring myself to give Cibo anymore than three stars.  For desserts, their crepes are one of the few things that I feel they've got down to a science. You really can't go wrong with a Nutella-banana crepe with a scoop of ice cream thrown in.  Their canned sodas seem like kind of an odd choice, especially considering most pizzerias opt for the glass bottle selection. It seems rather ghetto in comparison to everything else on the menu. Not everyone drinks wine, you know?   I feel that Cibo is worth an occasional visit, especially if you're new to the city and not really familiar with the Phoenix restaurant scene. But in present-day, us dining veterans have become so spoiled with quality pizzerias and pasta joints that I feel Cibo is just kind of running on auto-pilot.

qL6MKndO-qOgvlXr86UfVg.text: Cibo is my favorite restaurant in the valley for wonderful pizza and a relaxing night.   I definitely recommend coming here for dinner over brunch/lunch because they have a very limited menu for brunch/lunch(I'm talking only 2 or 3 pizza options as opposed to their 20 for dinner).  Inside seating is very cute and romantic but noisy. Outside seating is amazing at night and the live music on weekends makes it the perfect date night spot.     Tonight, we ordered the Tartufata and Linguine Cacio e Pepe. My fiance and I always order the tartufata because we love mushroom, anything truffle, and prosciutto. The pizza here is just amazing and even though the white pizza doesn't have sauce (we didn't know this even though we've eaten here like 5 times) it's still the most tasty pizza out there.  Maybe one day we will branch out to other pizzas but the tartufata is our guilty addiction and I don't think I'll ever be able to give it up.  Tonight was also our first time trying the pasta. The linguini cacio e pepe was a very mild but pleasant dish. It's mixed with butter, cheese, and pepper and while the flavor doesn't knock you out, it's still very good. Next time we'll try the bolognese.  Cibo is the perfect date night spot. The outside view is amazing with all of the twinkling lights and the live music makes everything more romantic.

kRucM_jZsV50ox3VrBhWZA.text: Cibo is just amazing as always! This time we wanted to celebrate a very special day with friends! Therefore, I got a reservation for 6 in their yard. We didn't have to wait at all for our table and the table was ready for us! Love their set up at nights and the music band on weekends! The lighting make the yard so pretty! The restaurant was super busy that night and kitchen was backed up! We had to wait for our food for a while but with their great customer service and hospitality they offered 2 of our dishes to be on the house and our waiter apologized for the serving our dish later than expected so many times! I felt so bad because I could see how busy they were! It seemed like they have few big parties going on that night. But we enjoyed our food and the bottle of wine suggested from our waiter. And we will definitely go back aga

a-e4CFTf6-B3TrWeQY6LpA.text: First time here, first time trying a Margarita Pizza, figured first time should be at a real legit pizza. I was there on a Sat night and they had live music outside. Pizza was good, and so was service.

wm37Y8kAhGvGwAEVhPISKQ.text: Finally I get a chance to wrote this review. And it really is with a heavy heart that I have to present Cibo with three stars. But in my opinion completely justified.   My girlfriend and I decided to go there this weekend and revisit our first date spot. We live in Gilbert and this is a bit out of the way but we decided why not. This is one of her favorite spots so we made the trek.   First and foremost I really don't understand why they would not take reservations unless it's a party of 6. We waited 45 mins to be seated.   Once inside we were seated at a tiny table that is within body odor smells of the person next to you. In other words you are very close to other tables.  We also had the unfortunate pleasure of being seated between a drunken whiny birthday celebration in front of ya and a cackling hyena behind us. If you can mentally visualize this you will realize that it creates a very loud atmosphere. I literally had to shout a few times across the table.   Now onto the pizza, what everyone comes here for. First I want to say that the Caprese salad is one of the best I have ever had. Anyways, we ordered the Tartuffata and Procida. The tartuffata came out with the crust and the bottom being burned. The Procida had some asian pear slices on it which were very tasteless. Furthermore when I grabbed the slice it seems soggy and wet the toppings all fell off. I was left with a soggy pizza slice.   Needless to say we left a little disappointed.

QX5-IVag19p3sPOQKeENrw.text: Great place if you are craving Italian food. The ambiance is really good as well - very perfect for a date spot. Their pizza is amazing, and the nutella and banana dessert is 100/100.

_3xtPkQFr1roqJytQe86tw.text: We LOVE this place! It was our first visit and they treated us to a dessert.   The wine prices were very reasonable, although I wish they had more choices by the glass. The food prices were also great. The pizza we had (the white sauce, cheese and truffle oil) was amazing!! And the nutella & strawberry crepe for dessert was the perfect way to end the meal.   I read a few reviews that they were slow, but we were greeted, served, and brought our check in the perfect sequence. Not rushed and not waiting around, so I'm not sure what happened to those reviewers.  I can't wait to go back to this place in the fall and sit on the patio!

cuAtdzp7Y9MxY62ziRNh8Q.text: My favorite wood fire pizza in Phoenix (and Arizona). The atmosphere is perfect here and the food is excellent. I love the simplicity of the menu with white and red pies, and the salads are excellent. You can catch live jazz music here too, which adds to the lovely ambience. Not only is this my favorite pizza place but it might be my favorite restaurant in Phoenix. So much better than, you know who on 7th St. :)

xe1DW00Sd4aZbJYny8FEpg.text: Such a cute little artsy dinner. Nice and mellow ambience is romantic. Service is quick and friendly

soynpiJr_TECzNxo1Zk7AQ.text: A great pizza spot in the downtown area, and not too unfairly priced. Found a little wormie in our crepe for desert but I guess that just means the fruit is extra fresh! Or unwashed, but who cares ya know? Maybe you'll find one too! Larvae buddies!

X57tzhQtBES2E2naJ4-o_w.text: We came to Cibo last evening, before heading over to the Herberger to see "Man of La Mancha", aka a takeoff of Cervantes' Don Quixote.   Cabo is located in a former dutch colonial residence on W Fillmore near The Vig.  It's a fun and inviting setup that can be both romantic and classy in a bohemian sort of way.  Got it?  We arrived around five-thirty and Cibo was busy, but not crowded. I would certainly recommend the Yelp App to determine what the wait time is if you arrive after seven. When we left two hours later, there was a dozen waiting to be seated.   We started off with some Italian Red wine, Rosso Poggione ($13) and a House Salad ($5). Both were tasty and complemented each other. For our Entrees, we chose the Fra Diablo pizza ($14), with a few dollops of ricotta (for two extra dollars) and the Pappardelle ($15) pasta with a Bolognese sauce.   Both were clearly different, but outstanding.  The pizza had a nice kick, but wasn't a fire breather and didn't overwhelm your taste buds. My favorite was the pasta. The Bolognese was meaty and had nice layer of flavor. See photos.   Our tab, ran us a reasonable $61 before gratuities and taxes. Our server Cubana was friendly and on top of things, even though she was simultaneously handling a table of sixteen. Nice.   After seventeen hundred Yelp Reviews, you can see and read why everyone loves Cibo. We do, too.   Enjoy!

ULgKFqI9yDRzrrUXKSwiVw.text: My wife and I had a great date night here before we went to see Brad Paisley. We had a paste with white sauce, zucchini, and gorgonzola. Sorry we forgot the name but it was amazing. Our server Brittany was super friendly and knew we were in a rush so got us in and out of there.

nxzjdu3GEt5TbpkRP4JFXQ.text: Yummy. On way home. Just landed and wanted dinner. So good. Not too much food. We shared a salad and pizza. Very authentic. Great service. Highly recommend.

U14N52ie4jgw0OQoUt6BlQ.text: While a little difficult to find and park, this place is great.  I love the atmosphere and the pizza is good and has unique topping combinations.  The deep-fried cheese balls are a great appetizer as well.

4VgxGXSlJB_xRWNKGMNHUw.text: The patio at Cibo is so perfect that I haven't wanted to try eating inside.  I thought the interior couldn't possibly measure up to the allure of the patio.  Well, I was wrong.  The inside may be a little noisier, but it's still charming and a great place to grab a bite.     Cibo is a one-stop restaurant that not only has great pizza, but also fantastic salads and desserts.   And cheap wine.  I'm partial to the margherita pizza with the fresh basil followed by a nutella and strawberry crepe.  That way, I can say I've had at least one serving of fruits and vegetables for the day.   Add a glass of wine for heart health and it's a healthy and delicious meal!

FjFoj7Q1ylk6LHJUqMVYAQ.text: I am quite disappointed after reading all my friends brag about this place. I brought my now wife last Valentine's Day here and we showed up a little early before they opened and bottles and glasses that were left out from the night before. So we came back and there was a line, which isn't bad but we got sat right under the tree. We ordered a  salad that was had pear's as the main ingredient and there weren't many pears and dabs of honey. Just thought it was a little cheap.  Then the pizza, there wasn't much cheese on there and the ingredients seem to be again cheap. The dessert seemed to be the same way. Finally when the waitress brought our check and came back with the change she said she didn't have time to get us the change so we could add that into the tip. So she shorted us .40 some cents. I will try this place again given the reviews and telling my friends about my experience, will probably sit inside.

IWdghdcHj_h91CzHXZ6J7w.text: Had high hopes for this place but was very disappointed.  Went with a friend and sat at the bar (my preferred location in most restaurants).  Did get good wine bottle recommendation.  Bartender recommended we each get a pizza as one was too small.  My friend is a social butterfly and makes friends with everyone else at the bar (fortunately) and we kinda decide we'll share each other's pizzas.  We each order a pizza.  Here's where things start going badly. 1. The pizzas are large enough to share between 2. 2. My friend's pizza (white pizza with some stuff and truffle oil).  WAY too much truffle oil as we can't taste anything else. 3. My pizza doesn't arrive.  A few minutes later I ask the bartender where my pizza is.  "Should be out any minute" 4. 10 minutes later - "Should be out any minute" 5. 15 minutes later - "Uh, we are making it now" - Note that all of these were at my request for an update, not proactive by the bartender.  Since we shared pizza amongst the bar, I don't want it anymore.  I tell the bartender to stop the order.  "uh, ok, we won't charge you for it".  No kidding!!  The other pizza's were good but not great.  I did have some spaghetti from one of the other bar mates and that was better than the pizza.  Maybe sitting at the bar was a mistake.  I wouldn't go back anyway.

qyWEc9CTaaeFjrldda9ReQ.text: Absolutely fantastic pizza. One of the best in the area. Far better than Postinos. I can't wait to go back

e4KIOV59c_b4o4N5oorIxw.text: I've eaten here a few times and I can't get what all the hype is about.   I reaaaally want to be on board this band wagon but I just can't find the flavor in the pizza.    I do like the location though and the servers are always awesome.    Great atmosphere, cool vibe, good people...not my favorite pizza.   I'll chance the 50/50 of Grazie's in Old Town in getting my order right every other time if I want the perfect pizza, but I'll still keep trying Cibo.

n87H0OcJ2eYj5_j2wRbazA.text: So good!!! This joint and Harley's Bistro in midtown have the best pizza in the city!!

W_sCBPYCfxm_4W_QDYQM4A.text: Really, really nice... The patio is pretty with multiples lights, perfect for springs nights.  Service is GREAT, food IS delicious...

YqTZios2kxhd7s7VmSOO-g.text: Oh god, the crepes!! And everything else is wonderful, too! The patio is fantastic this time of year and they are very dog friendly :)

tng0Y2acOx5WmwGvhos14g.text: Great date spot!  The patio is so cute.  The pizzas we had were fantastic and the Nutella Mascarpone crepe was to die for!  Can't wait to go back!

GbAMC8SYW3lUh5PB7jurOg.text: Food is great..their burrata could be the best I have had in the state of Arizona. Great ambiance especially on the patio for this time of year, ride the bike up, chill on the patio with a glass of vino, and presto you are relaxed. I dropped 2 stars because honestly the last two times I have been there the service was downright slllllloooooooowwwwwwww....I don't like putting minutes on the time that I was waiting because honestly (and let's be honest) you can pretty much bet that if you are thinking "I was waiting 20 minutes for a glass of wine" it was probably about 7 if that, however it felt like 45 minutes and that is considering that the ambiance was amazing and I had great company. Love the food, love the outdoor patio, but I probably could have made wine at my table faster.

3mGPB8l4jMMck25RXJdgAA.text: Cibo is a great place to go when you are in the mood for pizza with a bit of a gourmet twist.  I have yet to try one that I did not like.  Their salads are really good as well.  And, I enjoy the quaint atmosphere.

pHe-W0md7cgqAYP_UkFe5w.text: Lovely restaurant with great outdoor seating. I am addicted to the meatball sandwich!

WoReTX7aug7ptzDPQb9CYw.text: Very relaxing atmosphere. We sat outside and there was live music as well as lots of greenery to keep the sun off. Food came in a reasonable time and very good, but I thought it was a little overpriced. Still, it's a good place for Sunday brunch.

fJceZ6WwwEzjsCS4g3iIXg.text: Let me just say that I love the atmosphere here, the outside tables, the twinkle-lights, the guy playing requests on keyboard. I spent a good long night here a couple weeks ago and had a great time. I enjoyed the pizza and the beer. There were a couple problems though. Never got offered a glass for my beer, service was slow like Monday mornings...  But I do love the neighborhood...so much so I decided to move down there :)

-YkIE_3mUMRXh1ipHnAdZA.text: This was our first time at Cibo. The restaurant is rather large but well spaced to provide comfortable casual seating. There is a lot of outside seating. The antipasto shared plate was quite good. The arancini was really good. The pizzas are decent with good quality ingredients and pleasant flavors. Our pizzas had a bit of a battle in the oven though. The desserts were also decent. Overall it is worth a return visit and makes for another dining option in Phoenix.

9gfsgmT3XGpvFLzXUn0-xg.text: Absolutely Love the cute place.  We tried salad, a couple appetizers, pizza, daily special and dessert.  Very tasty, a full of flavor...simply Delicious!   Cibo became one of my top "must-go once a while" places! My kids also enjoyed their food  and live music.  Outside seating will be very cozy in a couple months! Enjoy!

eSO-jTdbllTRL7aF3VVI6Q.text: When I choose a restaurant, essentially I am asking for good service as well as a great meal. At Cibo, it was a terrific experience from the moment we entired the old Craftsmen home that served us great Napoli Italian food!   Our server, Matt appeared immediately gleaming in his RUN-DMC t-shirt and I was ready to rap myself in great food from the beginning. The mozarella appetizer was delightful as was the antipasto. My mushroom pizza was thin crusted and delicious, and our guests from North Carolina were impressed.   Thanks for a great experience.

BtVodBbhFsMXr3RSp0llGw.text: I've always been one to say, "Pass!" to pizza. But since it was my birthday, my friend took me here for dinner...and when someone offers to take you out for your birthday, who says, "hell no, I'm not eating that!"  So I went.  Let me start with the ambiance of the place. The restaurant is actually a house, it looked very homey. We opted to sit outside in front because it was late evening and we saw they had misters...plus, the decorations outside looked so romantic and sweet. Definitely a good choice for a first date! Or ...the 100th date.   Now on to the food.  He ordered for us but I got to choose the dessert, and yes, I asked for it to come out FIRST.  It was a crepe filled with vanilla ice cream and topped with whipped cream and fresh fruit.  At first I said, "damn, $12 for a crepe?" Man, that was amazing.  And well worth more than $12.  We got two pizzas, they were about 8 inches around and it can probably feed a party of 2 (but since we had a huge crepe before, we had to take some pizza togo). My pizza had prosciutto topped with fresh, organic arugula. The crust was thin and very tasteful. I couldn't get enough of it. His pizza had salami, mushrooms, and mozzarella cheese. Also quite delectable.  Our waiter was very nice, he knew we were talkers so he left us alone to do so. After we were done eating, we wanted to get some coffee but it was 10:30pm on a Sunday night and no one was opened.  Again, our waiter came to the rescue and told us about a local coffee house down the street, about 5 minutes away.  We went there and it was amazing too!....but that's a different review.  :)  To say that I recommend Cibo would not express how I really feel about my experience there.  Let's just say, since that day, I've had dreams about my prosciutto topped with arugula pizza EVERY NIGHT!

03AovRI7PY8JKkRC_rbhOA.text: Love the food and the ambiance here. I think it's truly a super cool neighborhood place to hang out and eat good food and just have fun

0GnQmA08dAdXM3iCvM8_wQ.text: YUM! Best pizza. I order the truffle pizza and die each time I eat there. Heaven!!!!!

qqelzMDzFnTrvERaG6hC9w.text: We were in Phoenix for a few conferences and stopped in here for lunch. We started off with an order of arancini. We loved the arancini--straight up cheese and rice. It's the best we've tried so far. We order the margherita, salsiccia, and diavola pizzas to share. Each of us liked a different pizza the best.   I wish we had had time to go for dinner instead. The dinner menu is more extensive and along the lines of what Italian food I like. They also serve cacio e pepe, which I've had difficulty finding outside of Rome. Overall, however, we enjoyed our meal and would consider going again if in the area again.

IMhZwCrzdgO5tugZDFIcCg.text: Incredible pizza, awesome service, great atmosphere. Had the Di Notte, and it was the best pizza I've ever had. Four cheeses, spicy salami, balsamic onions, and the char flavor in the crust made for one hell of a meal. One that I wish I could eat every day.

mCk7D92bE0gXX6FUfTNqWg.text: Gluten free fruit crape with ice cream and chocolate - Pick and Holler Old Time Appalachian Music facebook.com/pickandholl...; it doesn't get much better at Cibo's. I love them both (great restaurant and great band). HB

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EF5HhJEy9y6EGA0DDMJB7Q.text: Great meal! Burratta was outstanding. I had a half and half pizza and my girl had a calazone that was so on point. We look forward until we return again.

B8_k6_yLKsBs42K0Tbw-sw.text: Quick and friendly service. I had a salad that was fantastic. My husband had the hot veggie sandwich. It was average at best. It tasted like it was reheated and the bread was slightly burned in places on the outside. The truffle fries were amazing and crispy.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yum!

VznUPDPWLxOq-ZOS-9N7fQ.text: This is the best pizza I have had in Arizona hands down - it is even better than NYC pizza, in my opinion.
