The atmosphere is very cozy and quaint. The calzones are HUGE. I ordered one for myself, and it could easily feed two people. The pizza and cappuccino are also delicious. My friend is full-blooded second generation Italian, and she said this was as close to authentic as it gets!  Overall, it was a wonderful experience!

RmfIkgXS8wwCHCUK0oG_sA.text: I really liked this salad when I had it sometime ago let's hope it's as good as I remember it!!

EK5j7eA1fUlKv805yCyaqg.text: I'm a big fan of the wood-fired pizza, and when I saw they had a vegetarian pizza I ordered that in a heartbeat. The pizza came with zucchini, mushroom, roasted red pepper, and artichoke. When the pizza came, it was strange because each slice only consisted of the one topping, it was not distributed throughout the full pizza. Having a slice of pizza with one thin slice of zucchini on it was not what I expected. As we were down to the last coupe of slices, we also noticed there was a long black hair on it - really gross. This place has a cute and cozy atmosphere, but I probably would not go back. Maybe if I ordered something else it would have been better, but overall I was very disappointed with my meal.

ZO0B7lDBMWQZ3zr7YurwqQ.text: This is a very nice place to bring a love one for a date night :)  Located in downtown Phoenix, Cibo has great customer service and their pizza is DELICIOUS!!! The only reason I gave them 4 out of 5 stars is that the price was a little high. The customer service was great and they made us feel right at home. My little sister-in-law even commented how the venue was so cute because the restaurant was inside a house.  Great place, would recommend out-of-towners to visit this lovely place.

ycN3IEQ9STAA6zlCfzbxsw.text: For the love of Jesus! I went here with miss Dottsy Z for our girls date night and omg this place is fantastic! I have been here one other time 6 years ago on a blind date and had forgotten just how good the food was.   We started off with the ever popular Burrata, which is- fresh mozzarella with a creamy heart topped with a balsamic glaze served with black label prosciutto crudo and toasted bread. From what I understand it is goats milk cheese that is flown in fresh daily and they have limited quantities. To say this is like butter is an understatement. It was delicious!!!!! Next I ordered the Rustica which is mozzarella, topped with prosciutto crudo and arugula after pizza is cooked. It took everything in me not to eat the entire damn pizza. Dottsy ordered the Prosciutto Crudo which is similar except hers has red sauce and no arugula. My goodness. I am still shaking my head and kicking myself for giving Dottsy all the leftovers. What in the world was I thinking? I will be back again very soon and not wait 6 years for another visit.

32TNgugIf1DPBTT5W-PJ0Q.text: I have always thought of Cibo as a perfectly fine establishment - but it is the bunch they serve on weekends that really won me over!    Their brunch menu conists of many egg (frittata) dishes, some crepes, and a few breakfast-style sandwiches.  Every item seemed to come with several side dishes and Nutella is always an option for your toast!! They don't have many vegetarian dishes, but what they do have they cook to perfection.    The thing that really gets my panties in a knot is that they charge $6.50 for a mimosa!  How is a girl supposed to nicely toasty before noon at that price?! Take note that you can order an entire glass of wine for a mere $6.

57rt4--8wg1lsFEXlhx4AA.text: What a wasted opportunity. Great location, one of the best patios in Phoenix and the opportunity for an authentic hand tossed French/Italian pizza ... The location and ambiance deliver, Unfortunately the food just doesn't. I had a great time. The service was good but the food was below average. I sampled three pizzas - all were bland - not bad - but not up to any reasonable expectation for a $16 personal pizza. The pesto salad was short on pesto and there are no draft beers available. The best part of the meal was the Lemoncello at the end   We deserve better Phoenix

hfh_mg7192aRtMFKOZIr6A.text: RIDICULOUSLY GOOD!!!  This is the best pizza I have ever had... In fact, it's so other-worldly good that I almost hesitate to call it pizza!  More like slices of heaven... Especially the Tartufata pizza!  Omg... Salivating thinking about it...

P89dC9Vz-j__U7E88FUGwQ.text: Food was good but not 4 & 1/2 star worthy.  9 of us dined on Aug 5, Friday.  Considering the difficulty in finding parking spot, tight dinning areas and borderline uncomfortable temperature inside, it was not worth the visit.  For anyone considering Cibo, I would recommend POMO, downtown Phoenix, for pizza and EVO in Scottsdale for pasta.

9ipE0hkRk4YvtLBb0B4HkA.text: Cibo's is easily the best pizza place in the city of Phoenix and probably in my top two overall for the valley of the sun (the other is in downtown glendale.) Great food, great wine and an amazing atmosphere, what else could you ask for? Come at the right time of the evening when the white patio x-mas lights are on and you'll swear your an extra in some cheesy romance movie and you just can't see the cameras. Winters are even better when the fire pit is roaring.   See the other reviews for how amazing the pizza is, i can't say anything more then what's been already said. Haven't tried Cibo's yet? what are you waiting for, get down there. You won't regret it

tnhrrO_0H_MbaRCsamCxFQ.text: Cibo is my go-to restaurant in the area. I cannot recommend their calzone enough. Like really, please try their calzone. Their pizza is good but their calzone is better. Not sure what makes it so great, but it's huge and flavorful and perfect. I especially love their marinara sauce... it's tangy and wonderful.  When it's not summer and hellish outside, there's nothing better than eating on their beautiful outdoor patio. The live music is great, and the trees wrapped in lights are so beautiful. Perfect for a date or a night out with friends.  I love Cibo. Try their calzone sometime.

SosTP1ZQI3lVcPeEzBsvFA.text: Kinda pricey; but so so worth it! Delicious food. Nice vibes for a date night. Really romantic restaurant to take a significant other.

bndyaCyT6cTud82j2RtFdg.text: Pizza Diavolo  Pizza was very sloppily made....Toppings were good but the overall experience was not good at all. Will not revisit.

uZbez54dr7np4fgkvZu-2Q.text: My family and I stopped by for an early dinner to congratulate our daughter for getting her masters degree. There was 6 adults and 2 small children in our group. We dined outside in a lush setting which also allowed our grand children the room to be out and about. We ordered multiple items from the menu some of which was the pulled pork sandwich on focaccia bread, a sausage sandwich also on focaccia,  an antipasto salad, a caesar salad and a pizza with prosciutto. I can't say enough words to describe how great everything tasted. The salad ingredients were fresh and the breads and pizza was over the top. Im so glad we chose this place to celebrate our daughters huge achievement. We'll definitely be back. If there was anything negative I'd have to say it was our server Amanda. She never had a smile on her face and we felt like our group size was too much of an inconvenience for her. Maybe we got her on a bad day....it happens. It didn't take anything away from a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rlhVtC1r46XpX4QepVH9jg.text: Best authentic Italian pizza I have been able to find in Arizona! Make sure to ask for their spicy olive oil to dip your pizza in! It is sooo good!

RqQHDHJG9fyc3WrcjzUfxw.text: Seriously, WOW AND YUM. I am one of those "Poor unfortunate fools" that has to follow one of those very strict diets to prevent inflammation. It was an Italian place so I was worried that meant pizza and spaghetti. THANK GOODNESS I was wrong! I had the most beautiful antipasto board (See picture). I couldn't eat the tomatoes or zucchini, but the rest was all wonderful.  For the first time in a long time, I'm FULL! Plus, my tastebuds are sooooooooo happy. The meats, cheeses, veggies, nuts, fruits all made for a fantastic meal. Now let's talk service, VERY attentive without being annoying, no pressure to get me out while I sip wine and write this review. It's November and the patio is cool and charming. I would return here often if it wasn't in another state. Thank you Cibo for making my week brighter! I'll be back next time I'm in Phoenix.

NxCP8MhuSYjGQQUXfIOwkg.text: Cibo is a very hipster, new-age pizzeria in downtown Phoenix. They have complimentary valet and indoor/outdoor seating.  We sat outside, which was decorated for Halloween. It was REALLY HOT and there are no misters. The live music was a nice touch, but it was WAY too loud. The tables are arranged oddly and you're often side-stepping to get around people.   The pizza was okay, but nothing over-the-top. The "Il Tagliere" was a good mix of an appetizer. Lots of different cheeses and meats to share for the table.   Overall a 3 out of 5 stars. I won't be back.

x-PMXOlMYW787xU96EoXOw.text: I'm not certain how many times I've reviewed Cibo, but every time we go there, I feel like the experience is 5-Star review worthy for a different reason.  Tonight: The Saffron Scallop Papadelle. Is it possible to concoct a more deliciously simple yet exquisite dish? This dish was off the hook amazing. I would eat it every day.  Never had it?  Get your ass down here and get it before Chef moves on.  Second great thing about tonight: The live music. Two dudes playing some extra entertaining interpretive classics. A keyboard & guitar is all. Brick House & Use Me, both classics and skillfully adapted by these guys. Anyone know who they are or where else they play? I mean these guys were Rhythm Room worthy.

x7DCmItKmESrOj8_05IYAQ.text: We had a great time at Cibo! My husband got their pasta of the day and he said it was some of the best pasta he has had. I got their pizza and it was delicious wood fired pizza. Also their Nutella crepe is a must have when going to Cibo!

VeKTgj0c-3dFyY9ySrCy9w.text: Food: 3.0 Atmosphere: 5.0  I dropped by Cibo on a Friday afternoon to grab pizza with a friend. Having never been there, I didn't know what to expect, but was pleasantly surprised by the gorgeous outside patio! My friend and I were seated under a charming little tree all done up with lights and were really taken with how pretty everything looked. It was a slightly chilly night, but the outside heaters were more than adequate to help keep us warm throughout dinner. We're both cat lovers so we loved the roaming cats that were walking around the patio as well!   Now, for the food. Let me start off by saying that I am a giant pizza FIEND. Pizza is what I crave almost all day, every day so I'm always looking for new, great places where I can get some delicious pizza! I also love arancini balls to death and basically jump up and down if I see them on a menu. When it came down to ordering, we grabbed the arancini, the margherita pizza, and the genova pizza. The arancini balls were good, but lacked a bit of inherent flavor and the margherita pizza was similar in the sense that it was good, but definitely on the blander side. The genova pizza, to me, was honestly a bad idea. The potato on the pizza was rather chunky and not sliced thin as I'd expected. Furthermore, the starchy texture of the potato mixed with the grainy texture of the pesto made it a really strange mouthful to swallow. Also be warned that the onions on this pizza are basically raw. I love onions, but there are only so many bites of raw onion that I can tolerate per meal.   Service was good overall and we were definitely attended to quite well throughout the night. I loved this place for the patio, but not so sure about the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

mMqD1kQurEWHnOqwACT-nA.text: Cibo is great place to get together with family and friends. The atmosphere is excellent with outside dining and the perfect ambiance set with strings of lights. The food was great although my rigatoni, which was a featured dish could have been a bit sweeter for my taste. The bread is the kind of crusty bread you find in authentic italian resturants. The house wine very good and crepes for dessert were wonderful. The coffee "Americana" is expresso and quite tasty. Prices were not bad however, finding parking is a bit difficult.

R0KKjJdoTQCTBM41eAV8SQ.text: Definitely one of the BEST pizza places in the valley!  I grew up in Naples Italy so I am always on the hunt for good pizza as it isn't as easy to find as I would like.  Cibo has great pizza (as authentic as you get in the US) and the atmosphere is cute and quaint, great for date night or anytime you want a stellar experience.

n9wl7gh4d88YJMz3tz3BPw.text: They know how to serve and they know how to make delicious food.  This is not your ordinary Italian restaurant. Check them out.

jE4-ZI8UW9q-itEicrtt6A.text: Came here to have an early valentines celebration on Monday night and it did not disappoint! The patio was romantic and even though it was a little chilly out they had plenty of heaters around. We started with a nice bottle of Chianti which was delicious. And then had the burrata which was the perfect amount for two people to share to start. Then we had the salsiccia and the diavola which were both amazing! After having an appetizer two pizzas were a little too much food but still tasty and nice to try a couple things. Service was quick and very friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gG9LvE34eQFrLP01dH4pcA.text: Great service is not always expected at upscale places like this but the staff here was awesome.  One of my kids was sleeping and they sat us right away. The waiter came often aswell as other staff members. I ordered beer and my wife had a bellini. Both my beers that i had were great a local hefeweizen from Tempe. We started off with Burrata and calimiri. The Burrata was the best appetizer i have had during my trip to Arizona. We ordered 2 half and half pizzas i think our favorite was the salcicca one then diavola.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Whats left of the Burrata

ulmtTNO2EuN-uZV5w_QD3Q.text: Never disappointing! This old house has been converted into a charming pizza parlor and it is delicious! It is the PERFECT place for a date night- the string lights outside give you the perfect vibe. Highly recommended.

Kqe0S3lsG9gCndUiZWRYbA.text: Let me start off by saying I love the food here and I go very often! I have been going here for years and always recommend it to friends and family. I also Order through post mates when I don't feel like going out.   The reason I am updating my review is because of my recent visit here over the weekend. My husband and I decided to go here for dinner this last Friday night to have a relaxing evening and to enjoy some great food. We wanted to sit out side because the weather was amazing and they have a great ambiance outside. When we got there we asked the hostess to be sat outside and I pointed to a table that I wanted to sit at because it was close to a heater and in the corner. I'm all about ambiance and felt this was an ideal table to sit at. I understand that sometimes hostesses cannot put people in certain sections because they don't want to give some waitresses more people over others etc. when I pointed out the table, the blonde hostess was extremely rude and said "no, actually, you're going to sit over here, we already double sat over there". I would have waited until a spot opened in that area, but she didn't give any options. We were shocked she was so rude and went to Pomo instead, which was a good choice, because we always neglect Pomo and forgot about it. We never walk out of restaurants, but this time we had to. The second we walked in Pomo, the manager told us to pick a seat, any seat, which was ironic.   Good food, bad service. No one wants to go to dinner and be treated that way. Especially when you support their business often and encourage others to do the same.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House salad
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wine time
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita pizza

x9B4PHGCcroFMoo81aDcOg.text: My BF is a sucker for good Italian food, and Phoenix has plenty of options. We ended up at Cibo when we didn't want to wait for Pizzeria Bianco. Cibo ended up being a cute spot for date night, located in a converted house complete with cozy nooks to get some privacy with your partner.   Cibo speicalizes in Neapolitan style pizza, with blistered edges and a "wetter" middle. If you don't like that type of pizza, you might not enjoy your experience here. We shared an the meatball appetizer (three huge balls!) and a glass of wine, then split the Capricciosa pizza,  topped with proscuitto, mushrooms, artichokes, and olives, the dough miraculously remaining light despite the ton of toppings! Our meal was filling and reasonably priced ($40), but we opted for dessert elsewhere, as all of Cibo's options are sweet crepes.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Receipt
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pizza
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Polpette

bKvs95DidmSIj7iDoGmbNw.text: Went with my son for dinner. Great food and super cute place. Pizza is super good. We had antipasti, trufulata pizza and Diablo's pizza. All amazing. My son also had dessert. Everything was great, service, food and location!

LYtxywHjhgEJkl5dGcSLWg.text: Good service, amazing food.  The food comes out fast and amazing each time. Went to Phoenix for a conference and had to eat here twice. Really good!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The meatballs were amazing!
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. They can do half and half pizza. Amazing
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing time! Great staff! If you&#39;re in Phoenix make sure to  check this place out.

ZQT_jPPKURWRir61xQCOqg.text: Homemade pasta was way to salty. Good atmosphere. Nice to sit outside and listen to live jazz but the place is a little over rated in my opinion.

va0WRbJavawtIZtKirmxpA.text: The service is outstanding. I went their on my birthday and got there Nutella crepe for free, which by the way was warm, mouth watering and delicious. Excellent micro brew beer choices. But the wood fire pizza is outstanding. Tons of different pizza options with amazing fresh ingredients. Definitely a downtown Phoenix restaurant to check out on the weekend.

zueqeAk5LbN6YGRbFNibnw.text: Unique and wonderful food. Service could use some improvement in friendly.  Otherwise great find!

L-8_OLN56C8LitKEmZGtSQ.text: 3.5 stars actually but I rounded up. I've come to Cibo a few times for client lunches and I always order the pizza. The patio is beautiful and the food is good too... But I wouldn't say it's the best pizza in Phoenix.

24DUneSNc4o68ygzJVav1g.text: It's been a while since I've eaten pizza here, which I used to love, but the last couple of times I ordered, it was kind of soggy. Yuck.  However, came in for lunch and ordered the Cous Cous salad with chicken. It was very tasty and filling! I also love that they serve you soda in the can. I don't know why, but it is so refreshing.  I would like to return soon to try the pizza again as well as some of the homemade pastas!

dTsRN2RKJ8cNbFAjg0ZIQA.text: amazing food here feels like home great atmosphere great place for celebrations gatherings special occasions really recommend this place line might be long sometimes but is worth the wait especially for there pizzas are amazing drinks are great well worth it !

OXrdmLAEOQJaIEChu2KsiQ.text: Great pizza and crepes! The interior and art is kind of outdated and strange but service and food was pretty good. Would definitely go back!

BpRWNE-pEJSZkRe-KKiVDA.text: Came here for my birthday dinner. Loved everything about it. Especially the atmosphere! Only thing that I didn't like was the food. Ordered pizza and pasta and it wasn't bad but I was expecting more. One word, bland.

nmm4_ZJwsEc91fRHH2BulQ.text: Hey Az it's Analynn here with another fantastic place to try . I love these little houses transformed into restaurants ! This is a very cool place and if course the food is terrific and so is the service . Ask for outdoor seating if it's not too hot because the live entertain kicks butt !  Choose your group wisely to ensure your evening g is enjoyable . You will want to valet park because parking g is difficult down town. Sometimes valet parking is complementary . As always if you go let me know how your experience was . Enjoy

yUiiDI1p7dCA0Mc_AaziIg.text: I know what great pizza is. I really do. I'm from NYC and I've been to a lot of pizza places. The pizza here is just ok. It really isn't amazing. Maybe I came on a bad night? I even tried their crepe. It's too dense, not light enough and also just a shy too sweet for me, I got the raspberry and nutella. I don't know, I met a couple from Michigan and they thought the exact same thing as me so I'm pretty confident I didn't come on a bad night. Maybe I'd come back to give it another try if someone else invited me. Maybe I just got the wrong kind of pizza?

IMqSAm9loW2K5mrzg4N0uA.text: Cibo is great.  I've been coming here since 2005 and it's been a favorite for casual and intimate nights out.  The pizza is good, but not my favorite in Phoenix.  I really enjoy their salads and desserts.  The crepe with Nutella inside, fruit on top and icecream is absolutely delicious!  And I usually don't even like crepes.  The cons - no parking lot, so you have to search for street parking or use their valet service; also poor ventilation inside, so your clothes and hair end up smelling like their pizza oven; the noise level inside can get pretty loud.

mIE4Ec7ctDhCq8uqNiT5_w.text: love loveee loveeeee loveeee loveeeeeee loveeee.  I've been here more than ten times. I absolutely love everything about this place. The atmosphere,  the people, the vibe I get. I just love it here. And who doesn't like it when someone is singing and playing the guitar while you wine and dineeee? So romantic and just perfect.   Its my favorite place for pizza and wine. yummmmm.  I come every day if I can. Haha

z2zvUfYi6kpAbusdjzo76A.text: Was in phoenix visiting my bro early November. We had planned to eat at Breadfruit which is a jamaican restaurant nearby. The  wait was too long so we opted for Cibos.  Wow.  Must say i was impressed.  Lively atmospher. Fantastic food and wine.  Melissa was a great server.   We had some wine at the bar for an hour then got our seat outside.  Perfect night with great food and service with a fun  atmosphere.  I now tell everyone to check out Cibos if in Az.   The people working here also love dining at Breadfruit.  It's refreshingly cool to see local businesses support each other.  This place is a converted house.  Thanks Cibos for a great saturday night.

ifVrtMN6cEVgLq10pOkkcw.text: AMAZING!! Flew in tonight for the weekend from San Diego and YELP'd this place, we were thrilled!!  San Diego has its fair share of incredible Italian restaurants, but Cibo has met and surpassed our expectations.  The pizza was nothing but authentic, crepes to die for, delicious Caprese Salad, and homemade Limoncello just iced the cake for us.  We can't wait until our next visit to Phoenix so we can come back

t4pU4hxk5cJQUPNow4vomw.text: Such an enchanting cottage-like restaurant. I love the little romantic twinkle lights throughout the yard. The ambiance is magical, and so are the desert crepes! I would come here just for a special desert date, without a doubt! Pizza here is pretty classic, so I can't complain. The only reason I took off one star is because our waiter was kind of scatter-brained. He was definitely nice enough, and maybe it was just his first day. However, the service suffered a little bit. At one point, he asked my party what we wanted drink, just to  neglect the one person that quickly responded with her order. He handed people the wrong orders and kind of disappeared a lot. Lastly, it took him forever to get our checks out at the end because he "lost track" of a beer that one couple in our group ordered. All in all, I would still come back. I enjoyed myself.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Our friend&#39;s pizza order
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Potato and sausage pizza

3Q5gpvgJPYdOThRb5j1YUA.text: This is definitely one of my favorite spots in Phx just due to it's very relaxed, romantic, and unique setting. Alongside this, their pizza is delicious but it may not be for everyone. Typically I order the Diavola and add ricotta cheese, AMAZING!! And I can't fail to mention their crepes; the Nutella crepe with strawberries is to die for!!

ar-kWP-oWI66H2oSKxXyfg.text: Best pizza I've had in Phoenix! Love the atmosphere, wonderful food and great service.

lsp-phXPVBTilMdBO4xjAw.text: Awesome food and Tony &  Karen are the friendliest folks ever - what an amazing menu.service is always outstanding 9th check in here. Come hungry - love the Diavola pizza .. Actually never had a bad meal!! Ciao Bella

4pkS6RQd6XhmmK30YnqPXg.text: I love Cibo it is a really cool restaurant. I have gone here about 3 times and had a great experience each time. My favorite part about it is the atmosphere. It is in an old house possibly early 1900s near downtown Phoenix. I have eaten in the dining room, the parlor and out on the lawn. My favorite was on the lawn, it was a beatiful day and we had the antipasto platter. They also had live music that evening and the vibe was fabulous. The other dish that stands out in my mind was the Nutella Crepes, I had them for dessert and they were scrumptious. The wait is sometimes long and parking can be a little tough but it is well worth the wait.

ScDzC8r6jEDzdNXs73s_5Q.text: This was my 3rd trip to Cibo's and I brought a friend. We went to support their donations for childhood cancer when you order the polpette appetizer - we didn't k ow what it was but we were going to have it just to be charitable  OMG they're meatballs like you've never had before in the most amazing red sauce w/ Parmesan & fresh basil! Delicious! We also had the wood fired Margherita pizza. The crust was incredible! Could have used a little more mozzarella, but overall really delicious and then comfortable dessert we had the crepe filled with mascarpone al limone cheese with fresh berries- a must have !  Go! Make it a date night, sit on the patio, they have live subtle music too. And it's totally an affordable place. Enjoy!

eIwye33hUneejc5yNcMkfQ.text: Cibo is me and my husbands favorite pizza place in downtown Phoenix. The food is delicious, the drinks are well-priced, and the interior is so unique and cool. It's a house that's been refurbished into a restaurant! We have never had a bad experience here, and will keep going back!

Fp0EMvnVf56iDC4oA-bLmg.text: What a great date night idea! So romantic and rustic at the same time. Was seated rather quickly for a busy night, saw some cute dogs on the patio, and food was served quickly. Would recommend for an affordable yet romantic date night spot... At least, more reasonable than the Vig next door! Will be going back to try a crepe.

H0NdSOnG28r3XafhjOBktg.text: I went here a while ago and am just now reviewing it. This is a nice place with solid Italian food. For the price I wish they gave more food. I was able to finish my pasta which I typically am not able to do at Italian restaurants. We came with a big group of about 15 people so I didn't expect the service to be great.  They also do not have liquor at this restaurant so if you are looking for some cocktails you are out do luck. Their water also tasted really salty and to me it was not drinkable.

UFumL4VUhBhOqEYoHOnGkA.text: Absolutley LOVE THIS PLACE! Great atmosphere, fun & trendy artwork but most importantly, clean place with good service and an exquisite gluten free pizza option that will blow your GF mind!  Will be back every time we are in town!

KyOxpCGv3pkLBZKlB9BlpA.text: i'm not a critic, just critical at times.  CIBO has always exceeded my expectations with staff and food.  My family loves to sit outside and enjoy italian cuisine.  The wine is nicely matched to food selections and desert is always a hit.  thanks for setting the bar cibo!

CzIt47Av4Q99jA_T41lycg.text: There are a lot of cozy and charming little houses in Phoenix converted into a restaurant.  Cibo is one of them.  We went there for lunch and service was prompt and friendly.  Pomo Pizzeria (the VPN certified pizzeria in Scottsdale & Phoenix) used to be my number one pizza place, but Cibo has won me over!  You can taste the quality ingredients and everything is absolutely delicious!    What we ordered: Salmone Sandwich Cold sandwich consisting of smoked salmon, cream cheese, sprouts, arugula, and capers. Served on an amazing saltimbocca bread that's baked fresh with every order in their wood burning oven!  Comes with delicious garden salad sprinkled with pine nuts.  Absolutely fabulous sandwich!  Healthy too!  Polpette Sandwich Homemade meatballs in tomato sauce with melted mozzarella.  Served on an amazing saltimbocca bread that's baked fresh with every order in their wood burning oven! Perfect sandwich with oozing cheese!  Yum!  Diavola Pizza Lunch size pizza with tomato sauce, mozzarella and spicy salame.  Very good!  Di Notte Pizza Fontina, pecorino, gorgonzola, mozzarella and spicy salame.  Their crust is perfectly thin, chewy, and crispy.  Puffed up on the side like they should be, and absolute delight to eat!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Polpette
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Diavola
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Di Notte

Li494ihNpN4DNSyWqSpSRQ.text: This place has a lot of hype.... I was excited to finally try this masterpiece! The staff is fun and the restaurant a cute area. Parking sucks as usual for downtown Phoenix. The menu, confusing. I have a gluten intolerance so I was very excited to know they make their own gluten free crust. You can spilt the pizza in half which was cool but it was honestly a crappy pizza. They don't offer ranch because it's "authentic." It was bland and dominos honestly is way tastier! I didn't get the crepe because the pizza alone was a whopping $22. You're better off going to fired pie.... Or dominos. Disappointed I didn't get the crepe, I'm sure those are delicious. Probably won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Looks good, tastes bland.

pe1_9srWyyKMCcgKxo_CeA.text: Slow "put upon" service and mediocre pizza served cold. Can't understand all the good buzz around this place.

6mBydrSxn7S7ash3RhQXiA.text: We dined on a Tuesday around 11:45. We were greeted by a upbeat smiling hostess. We were seated to the room on left side of entrance. Problem we had was the loud talking of other diners. The acoustics was unappealing for people who just wanted to relax and dine. Our server was very friendly and informative regarding menu. We ordered Calamari which tasted rubbery. Ordered the Meatballs and when they came with the Pizzas, they were only like warm at best. My wife ordered the Margahrita Pizza and the other was the Salcchica. The crusts were very good on both pizzas. The sauce was very bland. The Sausage was wet or very juicy which made the center of pizza soupy. Being in the restaurant business for over 40 years, including 3 Pizza restaurants, I was very diasapoited with all the hype Cibo was getting on FB saying they were the Best in Pizza in Phoenix. La Orange Cafe in Arcadia is so much better. Positive note was that the sandwiches and salads looked very good. Again our server was super friendly and sweet. Both of us being in restaurant management, we were kinda diasapoited that when we were leaving, the male who looked like a Manager, standing by the front door, didn't even acknowledge us or say thank you for coming or hope everything was delicious. He was just standing there. That's a No Brainer if you want to keep Guests coming back. Being Pizza lovers, we were not impressed. Sorry. Not recommending to friends and family.

ENa_s04Cm8eAS18hmRnmyA.text: the glasses has water marks on them. I don't like animals around while I'm eating and they had a roaming cat there. idk if it was a stray or not but they sure didn't try to get it to leave. the pizza dough was still raw in the middle. looked like they where in a rush to make the pizza cause it had a bunch of holes. was flimsy af, as soon as I picked up the slice it immediately flopped down and everything just slid off. sauce wasn't even good. would have rather gotten Papa John's.

QJSw3MZSgxkrTlrNhrQzfQ.text: Not only does Cibo great pizza and salads, but the outdoor seating is great!  The space is so relaxing and for a while you forget you are actually just blocks away from downtown! Highly recommend for lunch!  The valet parking is a huge plus also!

oG-KJdeNUcNQEQXl2vCfqw.text: Great vibes and excellent food!!! If you order the Veggie pizza, pay extra to mix Highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EEZ0ZN7O1T5bT_71y-a9oA.text: Great pizza and cool atmosphere. Pizzeria Bianco is better, but Cibo is very good and easier to get into.

blebOHTArscq7VpLIMZlPg.text: Upon recommendation from a local I visited Cibo and was delighted. The wait time was fast, the decor and ambiance are cozy and relaxing, and the food is excellent. The paintings on the inside walls are ostensibly done by the owner and are for sale. The artist/restaurateur introduced himself to us as I was ogling the likenesses of David Robert Jones (David Bowie), Prince Rogers Nelson (Prince) and Cassius Marcellus Clay Jr. (Muhammed Ali). Honestly would've preferred a painting of Will Smith up there, but not gonna dock any stars.  Bear in mind there's no full bar and no beer on tap, so it's a few bottles of beer, wine and limited mixed drinks. But as long as Mama Gorbachenko get her buzz on she all good!

86572o3eO3j9eJUSIpEnYA.text: We had some appetizer with rice in the middle-not worth it. Don't get it. I would get the dessert appetizer or something else. The pizza was delicious we had the one with pear in it. Nice environment bit slow service and we went at like 5 on a Saturday. Good, but not as good as I've heard through the reviews.

GTLWWyTzxMvnBPkdh_JzDw.text: Great downtown location, excellent pizza, and crepes that will definitely make you want it save some room for dessert!

Dp6Y62yL9pgvcpo_DHDo6w.text: Recently had a gals night out here for dinner and I could not have been more impressed with the delicious food, fantastic service and beautiful ambiance! Will definitely return again and again and I've already told many friends about this gem!

FS3P90O9ww-fg-spVw3XCQ.text: Been here a couple of times and liked it.  We ate pizza on the patio and enjoyed!  The bathroom was clean and decent.

zR8K_7iv4YRM1gflFIyewQ.text: This is absolutely my favorite Italian place downtown! The service is impeccable, especially if Ivey is your server. Had a fantastic experience this evening and was having trouble picking a pie since they're so many delicious choices. Ivey suggested the diavola with arugula and it was amazing! Next time you're downtown check out this gem.

9MJ9TnYaQfA4hSUomM8ZQA.text: Such a cute place! Haven't been here in a few years and we are happy we made it back! Buratta appetizer is a must, great for sharing! We each got our own pizzas and the cheese they use is delicious. The dessert menu looked to die for but we were to full :(  so plan ahead!

iDga9Tkh7ndGO0Y-RYKzAw.text: Great place! Sunday brunch is always enjoyable, sitting on the patio, under the tree. Everything is shareable (which is nice to try a few things). Have been going for years

G1i05appyupUA40RSiXjuw.text: First of all, I have to say for all those comparing it to Bianco what a compliment right off the start for this place.  Being compared to a place that was I believe voted the best Pizza in the USA by USA today (I think) should right away tell you something about this place.  I am not going to compare the two as both are fantastic places with excellent food.  If I had a last meal and one of these two were served I would not die unsatisfied!  So after about a year of trying to find the right time to go there my wife, 9 year old daughter and myself along with a few friends, we made it to Cibo last eve for dinner.  We goti there at 5:45 pm on a Saturday night, thankfully had reservations and sat right down.  First impressions, am I back east at a great eatery.  The ambiance being downtown outside was just fantastic, something I have not experienced here in Phoenix since moving here in the mid 90's.  Very old world, loved it!  We started with two appetizers, the meat plate with cheese, some grilled veggies and some fruit and the eve's special the fried rice and cheese balls with marinara sauce.  Both were spot on, delicious and loved by all at the table.  Onto the pizza's, what more can you say than spectacular.  My daughter and her friend had the margarita pizza with no basil, my wife the spicy salami red pizza, they all raved and devoured theirs quickly.  Myself I wanted to try two pizzas and was amazed that at a place with individual pizza's like this you can get 1/2 and 1/2.  What a treat and beyond what I expected at a artisan pizza place like this.  So I LOVE white pizza and went  with one half of the potato and sausage pie and 1/2 of the 4 cheese and spicy salami pie.  WOW is all I can say.  Now the sausage and potato half was very good, but it did not even compare to the 4 cheese and spicy salami.  The cheese on that side had great flavor, salt and spice, I sadly shared one (yes only 1) slice of the pie with the rest of the table and the reaction was the same.  Why didn't I order that?  If you like cheese, salt and spice, this is the pie for you!  All that food and yep we still had to try dessert.  My daughter LOVES nutella and they have about 4 or 5 crepes with nutella in them.  She and her friend went with the nutella, strawberry, banana and chocolate crepe with vanilla ice cream on top.  DELISH.  Glad they were kind of full after 1/2 way thru it as the rest of the adults at the table gladly finished it off.    The adults went with the Fresco dessert, crepes with fresh fruit and whipped cream on top.  It was also fantastic (but next time I would go Nutella), very light and a perfect ending to a great dinner.  Its quite a drive from my house in S.E. Chandler to this place, thankfully we had an event downtown.  Would I make this trip for dinner with the wife on a weekend eve, without a doubt worth it.  Would I make sure to go there next time I am downtown for anything.  Heck yes!  This is just the kind of place that I love.  Great food, great atmosphere.  One of the most enjoyable dining experiences I have had in Phoenix.

F4DcgwqmHejq45xY0286MQ.text: My wife and I love going here.  We've probably been there a few times a year for the past 6 or 7 years.  We usually get the pesto salad, di notte pizza and a nougat crepe.  Have never had a bad experience, great place when the weather is really nice out as well.

Zf8OP4g-cm32FcdMcz2VEQ.text: Love the urban ambience, great wine list, but the salad and sandwich menu is to die for. I've visited this place many times over the past 5 years and the quality of their food and service remains consistently outstanding.

l9VO6WuR9oO2BS_SlowNJA.text: First time we went there 5 stars. Second time was for my birthday and the inlaw tried ordering cal zone and didn't take my warning that it is just like their pizza, just folded. Anyways I give it 5 stars for me, but I had a four star birthday there because I was the only one who enjoyed it. Diavola pizza is killer!

H-2mTgHmtVi9eExadA6f2g.text: One of the best patios down town. They have wonderful appetizers, anti pasta, and unique pizzas. Great place to hang out for the evening with friends. Friendly staff.

F-jrh9Qy5J3Q5A0_4EtGJg.text: Went here for lunch with some coworkers last week. This place is adorable! I love when they turn old houses into little restaurants. I had the PLT sandwhich (Prosciutto, Lettuce, and Tomato). It had a spicy roasted red pepper aoili on it. It wasn't spicy to me but it was delicious. The bread the sandwiches come on is also amazing. I love good bread! I ordered my sandwich with the fruit salad as my side and was in love with it. It came with yogurt and granola on it and was more like a dessert, which I always love! Can't wait to bring my husband here and try it out for dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. PLT with fruit salad

dhf74av7EF9O-S7BGPXj-Q.text: This little gem in downtown phoenix is easy to overlook. Located in what appears to be another house in a residential area but is actually a quiet Italian restaurant. The place is nestled behind a row of trees that afford some privacy for the patio diners.  The menu is mostly comprised of pizzas but it offers a wide selection of both red and white sauce varieties.  There is also a decent selection of salads to accompany your meal.  Tonight I shared a salad with goat cheese strawberries and cartelized walnuts. Very delicious combination.  For dinner I had a red sauce pizza with artichokes, prosciutto and olives(whole). Quite a scrumptious flavor explosion. I didn't sample the desert menu which is made up of crepes of various flavors, although most of them entail Nutella.  The servers were extreme knowledgeable about the menu and provided excellent service.  Although I have to admit that the service was a little slow at the end. Overall this was a great place to spend a dinner with friends and celebrate a birthday.

P9QAzuRmKoEepihmxNXsCA.text: First of all, love the atmosphere of this place. Fantastic. Feels like a mom and pop pizza shop. Definitely a good place to go on a romantic date. Reasonably priced too.  The location is excellent too. Plenty of parking nearby -- a treat for Downtown Phoenix.   The food is phenomenal. Any pizza you order at this place is sure to be a home run. I recently got to visit them on an anniversary of the shop and they had plain ol' cheese pizza and even that was out of this world.   The wine/beer selection is also top notch. Not many places have great wine and fantastic craft beer to go along with some awesome pizza.   The ONLY thing I wish this place did was serve their pasta every day of the week. I'm pretty sure they only have it available on Tuesdays(?) which, if you just so happen to be there for pasta day, DO IT.   All in all Cibo is a great place to go with a loved one or just some friends. The food is great, wine and beer is good, awesome atmosphere and reasonably priced.   Highly recommend.

aIPRelTeDRUJpUCLbDw8cA.text: Was a great spot that I was glad I stopped in to grab a quick bite while in Phoenix on business. Definitely will be back if I'm ever in the area!

f-WysKu_ERGCF7jA1GvxQw.text: Food and people are all great.  I recommend sitting outside is the seating inside is a little cramped and very loud.

--hkbIWgBKBOZq4VcNwdhQ.text: Awesome neighborhood place. Beautiful patio, cozy atmosphere, and, most importantly, great food. I love the pizza, but the sandwiches at lunch (which are made with wood fired pizza dough bread) are unbeatable. I only wish I could get those sandwiches at dinner...

H4jHsG40ohUgNczffSwzGQ.text: We went for our anniversary - great experience. Very good appetizers, salads and pizza.  There is no pasta on the menu except on Tuesdays & Wednesdays when they make it in house. Looking forward to going back

BV0eBfUZQ79wEGLjSWyObw.text: I do NOT understand the hype with this place.  I was expecting to be blown away.  I was not.  It is ok.  The sauce is not that great on the pizza, but the crust was amazing.  The sausage was pretty bland, too.  Cheese was good, just needed a little more.  The pulled pork sandwich had a super wood flavor...a little too much.  The fruit salad was just ok.  It's good but not great.  I prefer the Parlor for pizza.

csOrpNxTxHUfS8Nhnv0Bhw.text: Cibo = Yumminess!!  Plain and simple!!  the ambiance is awesome and the food doesn't disappoint!!  I've always received great service here, and the staff is great at suggesting items that I probably wouldn't have tried, but will reorder again and again!  The patio is awesome!  Take advantage of it while you still can :)

CvAUl3NBVXDVAffNccFSVA.text: I love Cibo!!! They have this delicious salad with a pesto dressing and I add their tuna on it. MMMMM Their tuna salad is not like regular tuna salad, because they don't use any mayo. They use olive oil and spices, so it is healthier, but still has a lot of flavor. I have had their pizza before and it is very good as well. Great place and prices for happy hour. I would definitely recommend everyone try Cibo. :)

NBC5CLmdP3inPwD06qtFsA.text: Quaint and adorable. Great service and the food was good. Lots of great vegetarian options  which I am not but my friend is! This is a great place for a date night or a girl's night with wine, food & chit chat!

Cd5AzXhaaOYPCveUwVpJlQ.text: There isn't a better place to take a date in Phoenix.  The owners are always present and welcome guests as old friends.  The patio is absolutely gorgeous and has live music on the weekends.  The inside is a bit cramped, but is bursting with ambiance - low lights, gorgeous wood bar, local art.  And the food... Skip the wait at Pizzeria Bianco and come here instead.  Trust me on this one.  The pizza is delicious and you haven't lived until you've tried the Burrata.  Five stars.

aYdXhkeyyj76gExHFQtc-w.text: the perfect spot for a lunch meeting - close to the city center but away from the hustle and bustle.  the quiet outside patio is nice for a breath of fresh air before returning to the recirculated air of your office tower.  the lunch menu is affordable and delicious!  i highly recommend the eggplant parm or meatball sandwiches with the house salad! (if you are dining with a friend, try ordering both and sharing half/half on the sandwiches)  the pizza and antipasto on the evening menu is top notch as well!  a great spot for casual group dinners or an intimate dinner for two. love this place!

k72af59sK_hfwN0McrdzrA.text: I do not know what all the fuss is about.  I found the food to be okay, if small, and the service to be rather indifferent.

R3FuIJ2NboFP6CmD5UJzvg.text: I'd definitely hit Cibo again but I'd try to avoid a busy night. You're going to be hard pressed to find one of those though. Cibo's location, menu and ambiance will keep the locals coming. We hit a busy night and the service was not the best. They were out of quite a few items, so it made ordering a bit difficult. They also had some issues with their order system, so I'm sure that added to our servers headache.  That said, the food was tasty, the prices reasonable and the atmosphere is wonderful at Cibo. I'll be back.

Oic2hvTF_2YXAjU4MrsLAw.text: Incredible service and delicious food. Skip the wait with Pizzeria Bianco and come here -- this is where you find great pizza in Phoenix.  Highly recommend trying the 'fresca' dessert crepe -- ice cream inside a crepe with fresh fruit and whipped cream.  I also discovered my new favorite beer: Nimbus - Dirty Blonde - perfect beer to for tolerating 100+ degree weather. Try it. It rules.

k1DNv6fgSlNxbKnfglV09g.text: I love Cibo for the atmosphere, the food and the CREPES!  I haven't made it to Pizzeria Bianco yet, however Cibo is pretty impressive in itself.  It's location gives it history and warmth.  I get that comfy feeling like I'm over for dinner at a friend's house.    For an appetizer, the antipasto speciale is very popular.  The salsicca and the margherita pizza are my favorites here.  I know everyone always questions the crust when reviewing a pizza.  Well, it's not a gourmet crust like Pizzeria Mozza in LA.  It's probably the closest thing I've had to pizza I've found in Rome.  Not too thin crust, slightly crispy and slightly chewy, minimal toppings & a great sauce.  The fresca or the Nutella and banana  crepes complete a great meal!

V86b3SkR1YVLZ-FnSApMog.text: It's worth going here just for the unique ambiance. The restaurant is in a converted historic home in downtown Phoenix. The food is delicious every time, and they have a huge patio for non-summer dining. The warm family feel makes for a pleasant, relaxed atmosphere.   I think you'll agree it was worth the drive.

JEranJWIIMB1JU0OZgj61Q.text: Long time reader of Cibo reviews, first time diner and now writer.  Our group of 4 headed there Saturday night, and were immediately charmed by the atmosphere with the cute patio seating and white lights.  We arrived at 7ish and got a drink at the bar (a plus - Nimbus beer from Tucson!  And a $5 glass of Pinot Grigio!)  before being seated outside in about 20 minutes.    Our waiter was super friendly and helpful, suggesting the indecisive BF order half Prosciutto Crudo and half Salsiccia.  The rest of us ordered the Margherita - I know, I know, original.  More points to the waiter, who didn't look at my friend like a weirdo when she ordered her Margherita sans the cheese. Also, there was one woman who seemed assigned to water distribution only, and was on top of refilling our glasses.  And for me, that was every 5 minutes.    We started with the Caprese Salad, which was different but oh so delicious.  The cherry tomatoes were soaked in the pesto, oregano, and olive oil and were very flavorful - great with the mozzarella.  I could've used more basil leaves or arugula, but whatev.   The pizza's were mmmmm, mmmmm good but didn't blow me away.  Again, I could've used more basil leaves, but my fellow margherita eaters took theirs off, so again, personal preference.    I would definitely return for the overall ambience and uniqueness of Cibo, as well as the friendly staff and owners.  Definitely a downtown treat!!

uFKJiid5ZfMYhvIdJdRw0Q.text: The staff was just as wonderful as the food!  We had to wait a bit for a table on a Saturday night, but it was worth it!

iEcEZRvw4nFz7lXnQMA8zg.text: I am a pizza lover!  I could eat pizza every day for lunch and for dinner!  This is one of my favorite pizza places in town!  I bring all out of town guests here and frequent the place as often as I can.   I always get the capriccoisa pizza (not sure if I spelled that right), but it has olives, proscuitto and mushrooms!    AND I always get a crepe for dessert!  My personal favorite is strawberry and nutella.  To die for!

TME1iaKKiTH9VlmVrGwQKw.text: Stopped by for the first time for dessert and fell in love with the Fresca crepe! Our server Yvonne was wonderful and friendly. We will definitely be back for dinner.

PoGvpeHtnEd3ePkSrvN1Nw.text: Imagine if House of Tricks and La Bocca fell in love and had a baby. Cibo would be their love child. Classy, great vibe and delicious food are some of the highlights to this charming little restaurant. We had a big group and even two that arrived late and the staff was able to accommodate everyone. We ordered at least 5 pizzas and everything was fresh and flavorful. They have a good selection of drinks as well. I wanted a white wine spritzer and they didn't have club soda so I was offered sprite instead to mix with my wine and it actually tasted great! For dessert we all shared one that had nutella AND bananas. Mmmm. I would definitely come here and again and recommend it to all my friends.

fPcBAqCnvS0d_A8smYCw2A.text: Phenomenal food, hands down; from the pesto salad to the calamari to the puzza, the BEST food I've had in a LONG time. I would recommend to evwryinw. The place it quaint and very friendly. The service was wonderful. You will not be disappointed.  I'll be coming back for sure!!!

SikBQcMkOA8AL8sdLrgGNg.text: Great food...check, Great atmosphere...check, reasonable prices...check! How can you go wrong with Cibo. This is one of my favorite places for lunch downtown. I have been there numerous times and I am never disappointed.   I always tend to have the Salciccia sandwich which is sausage, onions, peppers and mozzarella cheese with a great house salad.  At dinner they serve delicious pizza.  The wait staff is always nice and very helpful. This is a great date place if you want to avoid all the chain places that occupy most of Phoenix.  Definitely try it out.

xi0hy4ZZR52j0gwAOZGWOg.text: Ate here again last week and I think the food was even better than the first time I was there. Great salads and pizza.

LIhHVTJjBOEFvrvUQrJb1Q.text: LOVE this place.  Food is always good, ambiance is better (especially on the patio at night).  Prices are very fair.

xJFIn4aVwzqkM5sjQ0ydDw.text: Cibo is da bomb!  After eating Cibo's Diavola and Vegiteriana pizzas, I will never eat another pizza again, they all are obsolete.  Even before you sink your teeth into one of Cibo's sultry pizzas you will fall in love with the quaint yet fun atmosphere of this little gem of a restaurant. Then, after you are seated, you will fall in love with the two cutest waiters ever! As if that weren't sweet enough, the fresca crepe is the absolute most delectable dessert on the face of the planet!  All of Cibo's courses are fresh and flavorful. You really can't go wrong with anything on their menu. The last time I was there with my five friends, we sat outside at a table next to the fire pit. We ordered the house salad, the pesto salad, the vegetariana, the diavola, the margarita, and finished it off with two frescas. The only thing that could have made the night better, was if the cute waiters would have joined us ;-)  I can't say enough good things about this place!

TiOsCcL01uv5RMtar4wBcw.text: Amazing meatball sandwich, real lemonaide, good service. Only complaint - it was VERY noisy inside.  If you sit outside on a nice day then you can give it 5 starts for sure.

WuyexJNX0s9luBfeaFFeGw.text: Great pizza. Great atmosphere. Very good service. Awesome dessert too! Highly recommend the chocolate Nutella crapes!

V8u_dGFVldoWwvDZtWMlMw.text: Was craving pizza and this was my last night in Phoenix. Yelped nearby restaurants and this one caught my eye. I love wood oven pizzas and dessert crepes and having both in one place was a dream come True. Went with my neice, who lives nearby and had never been here. The restaurant is in a great space though the location is a bit odd. This combination, for me, adds to it's appeal. The place was packed but we had a very short wait. By the time we left, there was quite a crowd gathered outside.  We started with caprese salad with homemade mozzarella. The texture of the cheese was spectacular and the tomatoes were good but not great. Perhaps that's because I'm from California, home of the sweetest tomatoes around. We decided to order two pizzas, one with red sauce and one with white because it all sounded and looked so good. We ordered the capprioso and the white pizza with pear (can't remember the actual name) The crust was the key. I'm giving Cibo 4 stars because the actual flavors of the toppings and sauce on the pizza are not as flavorful as I expected and not as bold as I like. Everything was very mellow. But man, the crust rocked my world. I might try some other toppings that have a stronger taste to see if they are better but what we picked was on the border of bland. The True highlight of the mean was the dessert crepe we ordered. We ordered two pizzas and one crepe but we should have ordered one pizza and two crepes. True, we got nutella in the crepe which is a gimme in terms of tastiness but we added strawberries and whipped cream which took it over the top. The crepe itself was light, airy and just melt in your mouth good.   I thought about giving Cibo 4 stars but I just couldn't do it. I wanted to love everything about this place but I just didn't. When the best flavor I had was nutella, you know there's a slight the problem. I honeslty wasn't impressed with the toppings and the flavor and the quality of the pizza sauce but the crust won me over. I would definitely come back for both the atmosphere and the food and perhaps a different pizza would be better. The servers ran around and seemed to work hard though the food came out slower than I expected and the wait staff, while flying around and by often, wasn't actually attentive. If ever in Phoneix again, I look forward to trying more things on this menu but until then, I can only say it's good but not great and certainly did not blow my socks off.

fulenV0XZae_9twdHf0U8g.text: they use nutella wich has many grams of partially hydrogenated oil!!!!!!!  They do not use any of this nasty oil in the pizza. I got a cheese pizza and it was pretty good, I would go back for sure, just not eat the dessert. The vibe was cool and laid back. Good place to meet with friends

64unMIqt5Y45vcP00apzwA.text: Went here for lunch Was bummed that they don't have pizza for lunch Poo  So instead I got a sandwich and it was ok The bread was tasty Eh  I'm so bummed they didn't have pizza at lunch :(

3jU2bTevq35tSDqzUgPtYg.text: Been there once on a friday evening, remember food being okay but it was uncomfortably packed.

S7jtxfuE6DgMYgZb5ysrFA.text: This place might have one of the best happy hours around, hands down! $2.50 peronis! Thank you!  I order a lot of food assuming the entrees would be small for the cost, I ended up with 3 to go boxes.   Service was sub par. My father and I were greeted and promptly sat but it went down hill after that. Staff hit all 3 tables around us before we were able to meet our new server. Maybe it was the shift change. Luckily the happy hour menu was so good that I will be back for sure

Nv0pgukjVKg42gW6jZ9p1Q.text: Cibo is phenomenal! You must try the burrata appetizer it is deliciously creamy and  is served with prosciutto and toast points. The best time to visit is when the weather cools down and you can sit outside and enjoy live music (on the weekends only I think).

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nutella crepes with ice cream
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crepes for dessert!
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great wine selection

lUI9R0FQQgeOubuMDHAyNQ.text: I can safely say that after trying pizzeria Bianco 3 times now, Cibo is Way better in my opinion. Flavors are on point and pizza cooked to perfection where you don't feel like the bottom of your pizza tasted bitter and burned in a wood fired oven (unless that's what you're looking for then I would eat somewhere else). Love their outdoor patio space!

OEKTz28KtsJ8MgKyjJxWKQ.text: Came here for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. Parking was a bit tricky but once we found a spot it was a quick walk to the restaurant. We were seated promptly and our very friendly waitress took our orders. I ordered the Margherita and it was really good! The basil was super fresh, not at stale that you get at most places.   For dessert we ordered the Nutella Crepe. I personally DO NOT like Nutella or thought that I didn't but in a crepe....this was so delicious! I could have eaten about fifty of those damn crepes. I highly recommend saving room for dessert. It's so worth it.

WM3hZta4OVfx9qKlQrhm9A.text: Came here for dinner while visiting Arizona for a weekend! The ambiance was romantic with live music outside. The service and food was great, will definitely come to this restaurant again when back in Arizona.

n9ss2L77bAhgWEXQKbTCtQ.text: Came here for our 1 year wedding anniversary to spend some quality time with my wife we had a good time. The bistro lights were on and the music was playing in the background., but i have to take 3 stars off pizza was mediocre (we had two white pizzas)  pasta ( the one with cheese and pepper)  and the dessert( fruit crepe with ice cream) . Very cute place to bring a date and the waiter was great! but the food was what knocked down the points for us. Didnt really get why the place is so hyped up, didn't meet our expectations.

9wuD6lTkPwuDic5PtebcaQ.text: Love taking a drive into the city for this gem. The caprese salad is so yummy! The margherita pizza is also something you need to try. I love the live music atmosphere and sitting out on the veranda at night.

8tBGI5MsVW1B4jZ56AdAeQ.text: BYOP-Bring your own placemat. I used to think highly of this restaurant, but in a recent visit with my family I was very disappointed. After placing my arms on the table I felt them stick and that's when I tried to wipe them down and discovered both tables were extremely filthy (moist wipes were charcoal black after I was done). The waiter apologized and said that the ink from the menu causes that, but menus are kept inside a plastic pouch, so it must be magic ink. I'm definitely not coming back, as I don't want to begin to imagine what the kitchen looks like.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. If you&#39;re bringing little ones, make sure to wipe down tables or take your own disposable placemat with you.
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vud-QUzkOFqFVqCRLsVzrw.text: I don't usually eat Italian, or pizza ... or give Italian or pizza places 5 stars. But this place really took me by surprise.   WARNING: If you sit outside during mosquito season, prepare to be bitten!! Otherwise, it is probably one of the most ROMANTIC cute outdoor dining spots I've ever seen. Perfect for Phoenix since it's perpetually warm almost all the time during the summer, fall and spring months.  We came here because of the phenomenal reviews, and also because everyone said it was better than Biano.   I have to say, their daily pasta specials are amazing because the pasta is homemade! I am a sucker for homemade pasta even though I don't like Italian food for the most part ... sooo delicious. The food comes out extremely fast!   The pizza here is the thin style wood-fired oven kind, which is great, and their overuse of truffle oil is totally ok with me. I loved the truffle mushroom pizza, and we got ricotta on the Diavlo. Recommended!

WnHmtVZZqAkc53Y_Gu2tRQ.text: We decided to bring some friends that were visiting from NYC over the weekend and I have to say that we were very impressed, not only with the food but with the ambiance and service. Cibo is classy and had a jazz band playing that night which created such a soothing mood. They have a great wine selection and can't go wrong with anything on their menu but the Tagliere and Di Notte are great choices.

ZT9NQrmQdZcuXi5KYNYOIA.text: The food and quality at cibo are good, but not worth how pricey it can get. Service is friendly and quick, and of the drinks, the limoncello is my favorite. The food, like I said, is good but I think part of what gets this place its charm is the cute outdoor lights and homey placement; it's literally a historic home turned restaurant. Parking can be a hassle during their peak hours, but they offer free valet if you're lucky enough to land a spot. I've been to Cibo many times and I've tried many of their dishes, but for the price you're better off checking out some other downtown italian places that offer amazing quality in their food. There's even a sweet little trattoria in Scottsdale that offers these same prices, except there a heavy accented Italian owner comes to your table to check on you and the authenticity and ingredients are unbeatable.

ZpQ0vnDLmP58By8orW4qRw.text: This is an old 1913 bungalow in downtown Phoenix and has a great patio. I can't say enough about this place, the food is amazing and so is the service.    The fresh burrata is so light and creamy, the fresh savory zeppole OMG, lets just say I could just eat those and burrata and be happy.  The homemade pasta and pizza are very tasty with great sauces and toppings.    Make sure you are prepared for on street metered parking or using the complimentary valet as long as its not full.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Homemade Burrata Salad

kC1EKBV9hGevLpDT1z1rNQ.text: Stopped in after friends recommended this place! I was impressed with the customer service and food was delicious!!!

nxrErEtmu-HUaUnDlKdi5A.text: Love Cibo! They should open an old town Gilbert location. Everything I have had on the menu has been great. They have a variety of fresh menu options from salads, hot/cold sandwiches, and pizza. Very cozy atmosphere with outdoor patio seating. There is a grid bike station nearby and valet parking.

SVpEVTJogKYFMjFRXAX97g.text: I finally went to the famed Cibo. Really lovely place.   I had the margherita pizza with some sausage added. Solid taste. You can always tell a pizza place by this staple.   The pizza sauce isn't overwhelming and doesn't get in the way of the pizza.  It's like sitting around late at night reminiscing with an old friend. My only gripe is that the crust gets a wee bit soggy. I don't like the soggies.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gluten Free Margherita. Good stuff
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita pizza with sausage

oT8ITgNx274UFDPusblwBA.text: Get the Diablo and eat outside during cooler months. Cibo is just as good as Bianco and does not get near the credit. Many more options on the menu and rarely a long wait.

mgXm54hByg3wJSvkTbZDAg.text: CIBO IS THE BEST IN PHX. Hands down. My absolute fave place to eat with my boyfriend. We ate here for the first time at our junior prom and 4 years later it's still just as special. Pretty much everything on the menu is amazing. My favorite pizza (which is pictured) is the margherita + Italian sausage. Today we weren't feeling dessert (super rare because it's soooooo good) but usually we also have the Fresa. Trust me, get it. It's amazing. Aside from the delicious food, the service is always on point despite how busy it may be. Everyone is super friendly, welcoming and it really feels like you're at home when you come here! Cibo is certainly a gem in the heart of Phoenix!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Right: Margherita + Italian Sausage. Left: Margherita + Spicy Salami. Also pictured is the amazing Root Beer Vanilla Cream soda! Sooo good.

lOKzHXbgdRK52qFV2c0LRA.text: Dint come here with 4 plus people. We called in advanced and we have waited almost an hour for a table. The whole aesthetic might cute and all but if it takes this long just for a table..forget about it.

_S7G4G1NiB_0JyWYwKx9lQ.text: I had dinner here with my friend before seeing a concert downtown. It's a very nice two block walk from Cibo to The Van Buren. Our server informed us that it was still happy hour, so we had arancini and gnocchi as an appetizer, and we split a margherita pizza for dinner. All of our food was delicious, but our pizza had a few very burnt black spots on the edge - that could be normal for the style of pizza or the type of oven they used. I will definitely be back to try some of the other menu items and maybe one of the five Nutella-based desserts.

8uD0wg7ynOiouijG3RA3dw.text: Went here with a friend for a late dinner.  we ordered the grilled vegetable plate, its served cold although grilled but to my surprise was really great with lots of special types of vegetables.  we also got a pizza which I unfortunately cant name, but it was part of the menu that was a no sauce pizza. its was amazing as well and I suppose that is all the matters.   Our Server was very knowledgeable and helpful with choosing a dish. appreciated him.    We sat outside which was a great vibe.  I feel like this is a nice place for a date.

E5DF8EN2QLzcoMs8zvrgFw.text: Great food! Great service! Cool art! Excellent service.

UeVUKQyleuWoJdjVMpPubA.text: Very tasty good and a super nice neighborhood-y vibe. Service was great and timely without being overly attentive. There was a musician playing outside while we were there which was a nice touch and made us lounge longer. Overall great place to meet friends, share some good grub and wine!

2GwEqwOElVvm0fvsTBGYiA.text: Awesome patio and food good such a cute place. They have good service and great pizza! I've never tried anything but the pizza so I can't speak but booo the pizza

bEQJFZz8Cd2mLN4vOshSeg.text: This is hands down, one of my favorite spots for date night! The ambience is romantic with hanging lights, as well as the European feel of the restaurant. We ordered the antipasto, a perfect combination of meats, cheese, tomatoes, olives, etc. We then decided to get the Siena pizza, with prosciutto and zucchini. It was my boyfriend's birthday and our server was lovely enough to whip up a free Nutella crepe, with a lit candle. All in all, perfect place for date night!

q2A0SR_zkxvMZy6jY59Jnw.text: Last night me and my girlfriend went for dinner we were seated outside next to a tree with lights it was about 1030PM We ordered two pizzas witch one was really burn, the waiter took about 20 minutes to check on us we didn't have no water no drinks no napkins and no silverware this was my first and last visit here. It seemed like the waiter just wanted to go home already really bad experienced.

i7Bvi602JeTerjL5UnhKgQ.text: I came here a few months ago and the atmosphere is fantastic! My girlfriend loved it. The pizza is very pricy but very authentic. We liked it... I do not remember the name of the pizza but it had truffle sauce and mushrooms on it... WOW. I definitely will be coming back.

nqO5ssUJX0TOapCV7c05gQ.text: Oven brick pizza here is delicious. Great romantic intimate atmosphere and on some nights they have live music outside. Love this place for dinner but not for lunch. I like this pizza better than the famous Bianco's pizza. Parking in the street is your only option and that is the only major complain I have about this place.

L4Vd3oLRzwcZquFVljgZTQ.text: LOVED THE cute in this place:-) Went here on a date.. its coolio for that.. HOWEVER, I didnt care for the pizza we had... and its not to say the other pizzas arent better! I had the Pesto, my 'date' ordered.. I just thought the combo of potatoes with pesto on a crust was odd.. BUT I loved the antipasto platter.. a huge assortment of olives.. and the marinade was awesome.. Great wine.. great service! Ill go back for sure... and just order something without potatoes and pesto!! :-)

M1cNJ9vXlqdefiTqEFuhzw.text: I love this place!! A friend picked it out for our group of 10 and we had reservations at around 5:15 PM on a Saturday night. It was within walking distance of the Hyatt Regency..Phoenix has lovely weather in February.   This place is super cute with all the lights outside, fire pit, little water fall/fountains for the birds to play in. Definitely cutesy plate for dates and couples! We got there at just the right time, because soon enough, the place was packed and everyone had eyes on our table. The owners are constantly serving people and accommodating everyone, super cool. Even though we were pretty much done with our meal, we didn't feel rushed to leave ASAP.   Several people in our group got the Pesto and Pear Salad. I tried the Pesto Salad and loved it. The potatoes are yum! I got the Funghi pizza and added sausage (posted a picture of this one), a friend got the salmone, and another got a calzone (huge btw!) The salmone was interesting, I've never had salmon on my pizza before - but I liked it. We all wanted to get crepes at the beginning of the meal, but ended up having a lot of pizza leftover and no room for dessert. When I come back to Phoenix in January, I am going to split a pizza and salad with someone and get dessert - no doubt.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cute!
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Funghi pizza, added sausage. Friend got Salmone pizza and gave me a slice, so that&#39;s in the top middle
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pesto Salad

sJp3v6UH_sbWtU70BvboOg.text: Ok just so you know, this is not your typical Italian restaurant with pasta, meat sauce, etc. They "claim" to be "authentically Italian, from Italy".  The menu is super confusing unless you speak Italian. I am warning you because you won't find many pasta options. For example, they don't have Lasagna, Ravioli, etc. Then they gave us jugs of warm water (105 degrees outside).  Who wants warm water on a hot night?  Next, the Asian waitress we had was very impatient with our menu questions.  I thought it was just me that noticed that, but then 2 other people in my party mentioned that she was quite rude. Also, no bread was served while we waited for our meal.  I guess they only serve bread for an additional $2?  The food was so-so, light on the sauce for the pizza I ordered, but my appetizer was good.  I had to complain to the manager, who was nice, about our rude Asian waitress.  I don't normally ever complain but she was that rude.  I was ready to walk out, but I was with a large group of 11 people.  If it was just me and my family, we would have walked out.  Don't go there is my advise.

gl9FAfeB65JFVDty8kRTLA.text: I'm not sure I can put Cibo on par with Pizzeria Bianco. I just can't.  It's pretty close, though. And when you factor in wait times (15 minutes on a First Friday night at 7pm), parking (much better, being on the west side of downtown), and leftovers (the pizza crust holds up remarkably well under microwaving), it's really no question.  We started with the burrata, and I really can't recommend this enough: two mountains of creamy, fresh mozzarella, sliced prosciutto that melts in your mouth, and toasted bread that's just soft enough to keep from dicing the roof of your mouth. The only problem was, by the end of it (and we scraped every bit of cheese up) we were hardly hungry. Between the two pizzas we ordered between my wife, me, and our daughter, we finished less than half. From now on, we'll go with the burrata, and split a pie...though then we'd miss out on the leftovers. I'll have to rethink this.  A few minor quibbles: it'd be nice of the beers were on tap. My Lagunitas IPA wasn't quite cold enough. Also, the main entrance is a tight fit, but it's worth it for the ambiance, I think.  Beyond that, though, everything about Cibo, from the food to the charming owners, was exceptional. I only half-jested that I'd like to go back today.

49UQ0lZ-lcySJqLVC0CE5A.text: My daughter and I had dinner at Cibo before a show.  They were unexpectedly slammed.  Our waitress Christina was really fabulous.  Calm and gracious. The food was, as always, wonderful.  Wish it was closer to my house in Scottsdale!

VuxWV1HxBAfZuYglMcww3g.text: Great place for lunch. Meatball sandwich is my fav! I have not had pizza there- I think it is served for dinner only, but I hear it is good. Cozy atmosphere for dining inside or out. Minus one star for lack of parking.

-bL73dxYnx2EUhJbpPXWGg.text: Amen & Hallelujah!  I finally made it to Cibo!  I can finally join the ranks of the other (almost) 400 Yelpers to post a review!  After hearing SO much about it and working downtown for 10 years, it sure has taken me a long time to get there!  Even the deserted patio (at 5:30 on a Thursday in August) made me happy.  Walking inside, instantly greeted by a friendly host, followed by an equally friendly server.  Service was stellar, attentive, kind, informed, relaxed but not lazy, and suggesting menu items which I always appreciate.  We decided on the special pizza of the night.  Pizza Marechiaro : Fresh Bufala Mozzarella, San Marzano Dop, Chopped basil and Sea salt!  Like a "super-margherita" the server said.  How could we NOT get it?  We also go the Pesto Salad which came with roasted potatoes, a light pesto dressing, and delicious bread to go with.  The salad was delicious as was the pizza!  The ingredients were super fresh, the crust was the perfect amount of chewy, the prices were reasonable, and YES there was not a two hour wait to go with the food (even though, I still love the other place too!).  The only part that I didn't love was that the super fresh tomato-ey sauce made the crust a little droopy when I picked it up.  My favorite is a crispy crust that doesn't fall when you take a bite, but hey, small price to pay for perfection every where else.  Even the tiny little flowers in the tiny little bud vase on the table made my day!  I can't wait to go back again . . . and again . . . and again.  Lucky me I work about a mile away!  You (may or may not) know me, I hardly give five stars on just one visit, but trust me, this has five stars written all over it!!

GE0V-ffH5krcvSYWT9GFlQ.text: I used to love Cibo for their food and atmosphere, but I went the other night and couldn't believe this was the same place. The margherita and arugula/walnut pizza were both droopy/soggy, the de cecco pizza was a bit better, the arancini was the only good item we ordered, the burrata was nothing like I remember. It had zero flavor and the bread that it came with was stale. I never use extra salt on my food but found myself putting salt on the burrata. It was very bland and the center was not creamy like it should be. I still like the atmosphere but that doesn't make up for the lackluster food.

ngcIuOR42khUeIHO_o81Ng.text: One of my fave restaurants in the Roosevelt district in downtown Phoenix.  The food is always fantastic. But if you can go here in the Spring or Fall - do it!  The patio has such a fantastic ambiance - one of my favorite outdoor dining places in the Valley.  Parking can be tough, but it's well worth it.

-c-MkY759XTjHjpkXOtyqQ.text: Fantastic location, ambiance, food, and beer selection.  I can't speak for the wine, but it looked good as well.  This place is definitely worth the visit, and you'll probably come back for the more traditionally prepared Italian pies with things like prosciutto and oil/pesto based sauces.

frtVgFbh3PVlVs_PmZauPQ.text: This pizza place is incredible. It has a wonderful atmosphere, out of this world good pizzas, and delicious pasta. If you can ever get their squash pasta dish, DO. It gets crowded; arrive early or come late. Order wine--they have a great selection.

F2_0pisyldGMfcNCi-Kkpw.text: Went to Cibo with a few friends and shared a pizza. It was so awesome! The waitresses were nice and respectful and if I'm in downtown again ill definitely go back! The pizza sauce was fresh and the crust tasted like heaven!!

9s64YCUGH_IeNINqYKpZpw.text: Went here tonight with friends. We were really dissatisfied with the whole experience. Food was blah and the service was horrible. Every staff member we encountered was rude. Won't be going back.

MR4WkhBQGx9G-vnq2nlXkg.text: Everything about this place was wonderful!  Neat old house with a beautiful shaded courtyard in the front. Live acoustic music played at a nice background level. Attentive, gracious wait staff. The portions are plentiful and delicious. I ordered the Calzone- enough for dinner and lunch tomorrow too. My son was able to finish his Pappardelle Bolognese but hubby has leftovers for tomorrow too. We split the Fresca dessert 3 ways-more than enough for all of us. And very reasonably priced as well.

O2nppPVSQuNU8FCCjrTMSA.text: Until I discovered Cibo's gluten-free pizzas, I thought I had to give up pizza forever.  Their gluten-free crust is tasty, and perfect for their variety of toppings.  My preference is the vegetariano.  The sauce is just the right amount of spicy, and the vegetable toppings are fresh.  Cibo has been my go-to restaurant for pizza for several years.
