I called in a take-out order today, but the server did not note that I wanted a gluten-free crust.  After discovering the problem, I had to drive back to Cibo to get a replacement.  The server never apologized and seemed to treat it as no big deal.  I was upset with the way the server treated me, and phoned the manager / owner, Guido.  He was so apologetic and helpful.  He promised to talk to the server and make sure this doesn't happen again.  Guido handled the situation expertly.  I am confident that he will give the server more training - or get rid of him.  Guido exhibited great customer service.  In spite of the potentially severe medical problem that could have been caused by the server's lack of attention or interest. I know every restaurant will have problems once in a while.  When they handle it well and make sincere apologizes and amends, their customers will return.  I will return to Cibo knowing Guido is aware of what happened and will remedy the problem.

HXCtKT4ifpI6uaGO04u23Q.text: may or may not be good food, don't know, but what i do know is the staff is not very informed about the menu. went to chibo because they had "gluten-free" pizza and my wife and i asked the staff about cross contamination issues due to her allergy to gluten, celiacs, and the staff acted as if we asked about a major physics problem. one young lady even told us that the gluten amino disentegrates in the oven due to the high heat! i'm cool with people not understanding how celiacs works and the complications it brings but the people at chibo do not have a clue.

51hfu9IpRtM_sRoB_rMOHQ.text: It took me way too long to make it here.  Many years ago I was at an event where Cibo was sampling food along with many other restaurants.  They were hands down the best food I had at that event.  I took their information and planned to go there for a full meal and never did.   I am so disappointed in myself that it took so long to get here.  I took my boss here for lunch on a beautiful Phoenix day.  It would have been great to eat outside, but we opted for inside instead.  It's an old downtown house converted, like so many awesome places downtown, into a restaurant.  It's cozy and unpretentious.  A+ for atmosphere. Just an fyi, during lunch, pizza is not served.  That just means I have to come back for dinner.  (Hopefully it won't take me another 5 years to do that).  At lunch, their delicious sandwiches and salads are available.  If you're not with your boss, you can also get a glass of pinot noir or chardonnay for $3.  I got a delicious lemonade and found a breakfast sandwich on the menu:  eggs, spinach, and ricotta on wood fired bread.  So good.  I got the fruit salad as my side which was yogurt, granola, and fruit.  My lunch ended up being two items I make myself for breakfast all the time, but elevated to gourmet deliciousness.  I can only strive to make my breakfast or lunch this great.  My boss got the pastrami sandwich and fruit salad and thanked me for bringing me here. Looking at the reviews, I need to come back for dinner, brunch, and dessert.  I can't wait and definitely won't.

xA_upwVTOVtXkS0NGISGng.text: Let me tell you about Cibo..  We went last night after seeing Kathy Griffin so we were both in dazzeling moods having laughed all night.. well leave to someone to suck the good out of your mood right quick.  We arrived at Cibo right at 10, they close at 11. The usual host and hostess sat next to the door chatting with some friends. The waiters were sitting at the large table in the front wrapping silverware and the bartender well he just ignored us completely. Finally one of the waiters asked if wanted a table.. no we would like to stand their and smell the pizza! Duh! So we asked him to hold one moment as we used the restroom real quick. Then when we came back he was gone and we were standing there once again being ignored. Finally the bartender made a huge sigh and asked of there were only 2 of us.. so he takes us to the left dining room and there are only 2 tables in there.. guess where he sat us.. right next to a couple that looked like they getting VERY romantic.. so they gave us crusty looks.. I then asked the bartender if we could just sit at the bar (I can appreciate someone wanting space, I didn't want to sit next to them either).. so he turns and looks to me, sighed again and said "if you want".. like those words were somehow causing his hair to fall out. So I said "Oh wait, I wouldn't want to put you out!".. he then just turned and stormed towards the bar.. the Mr stopped him and said never mind.. (he didn't want him waiting on us after that little episode) so we sat next to the couple.. they looked at us like we had just interrupted a marriage proposal and she hadn't quite answered yet.  So Im mad as all heck.. Ive been treated badly before but I gotta know you before you can walk all over me! Im SO over Cibo at this point and ready to leave but the Mr talked me into staying.. he has this special talent of calming the beast, not that I turn green and tear my clothes off or anything but my tongue has been known to be very sharp!   Waiter arrives takes our drink order.. nice wine list though very small.. he returns with the drinks and takes our dinner order.. antipasti, a rustica and a tricolore.. I asked if I could have prosciutto put on top.. you know what he says.. "Ill ask the chef if you can have that.. he doesn't like changing HIS pizza's".. I cocked my head at him (I think the vein in my forehead was ready explode) "he doesn't like to change his pizza's".. if you offer toppings on the menu for an up-charge, wouldn't you think they would actually give them to you? Talk about the dang pizza nazi! The waiter returns a few moments later or the 'chefs messenger'  (I think he was sweating) tells me that the chef has agreed to let me have the proccutio but only on a plate. Oh thank you thank you oh lord oh messiah!   Can you believe this place?  While the food was good the attitudes here has really put me off.. so the 2 stars are for food only.. the Mr and I will never come to this place again.. Cibo has officially been scratched from our minds. Oh, I will be sending this review to them as well.. that way if they even care, which I doubt, they will address not only the bartenders attitude (little scruffy guy) but the idea that the customer pays their light bill and tells all of their friends about the place!

pXSla_JV1Z5hNKS7JxdDsw.text: This place is awesome, great food and the patio is absolute charming. I went with a group and we ordered 7 different pizza's all of them were really good everything tasted fresh lots of different types of Italian meats and there wasn't one I didn't like. My favorite was the diaba it was had a spicy salami and was full of flavor. I'll"ll definitely be back here and just heads up they're closed on Sunday

5L4LQ4YFFydegXoWb9G6vQ.text: Saturday night (in March) - We hosted a private party in the carriage house around back for 60-65 people.  Michael and the crew at Cibo are so accommodating and friendly.  We had wonderful service, food, and wine.  This is the perfect place for a private party.   :)

F1RhYxOzO8c5gSLNBDj0Mw.text: Best tasting pizza in Phoenix,  room was small, could not even hear waitress talk, but food was great

APRwvHXcj2gVp6U0OyDU2g.text: What can I say about CIBO that hasn't been said before?...it has so many elements that make a great place to hang out and eat with friends...  * Good Service and courteous hosts * Delicious fresh tasting food  that  scream  I am somehow good for you  * Crepes that are to die for .. how can you resist... * Brick Oven Pizza  * Edgy Decor  dripping with hipness * Great reflection of the downtown feel   Great for meeting after work , taking mom out to eat , wine and pizza with friends , downtown close to events  Go ..you will love it   enuf said

le5tlVa3q2-2nK0RlluwIA.text: I took my friend to Cibo for his birthday a couple of weeks ago. He had been before and I had not (so I guess he kinda took me).   I ordered the Rustica Bianco Pizza and i believe he ordered the Diavola add basil. The food was delish however my Rustica had so much arugula on it it looked like a salad on top of my pizza. I'm talking a VERY unnecessary amount.... whatever, I just removed 3/4 of it. We had almost finished our first bottle of Pinot Noir before being seated so we had another along with dinner; it was a great compliment to the food. It was a Friday night and the wait wasn't more than 45 minutes, not bad in comparison to Bianco. All in all we had a quality experience.  The bar seating is very "close quarters" and if you're like me and you don't like strangers sitting in your lap I recommend imbibing someplace else.

MzSt0j-FuFyyxiRFRjup9w.text: My first time here and it was great. Outdoor seating made the experience better. Grab a glass of wine and sit by the fireplace while you wait. A short 30 minutes on a Saturday night and we where gazing upon the menu. Attentive wait staff and quick with the appetizers.  Pizza crust was crispy on outside and soft on inside. Fresh ingredients made my food hole want more. Try the Rustica pizza with basil. I find Cibo to be comparable to LGO and Bianco, but without the ridiculous wait you find at Bianco. Enjoy!

xH9A6i4HeaD2FLr6YnY4dQ.text: Cibo is a really adorable place, but I can't say that I think it is extraordinary.  The atmosphere and ambiance is totally five star, but too much goes wrong after that to give it an overall five star.    Food stuff:  I've been twice and both times I liked it, but it wasn't love.  We got the bruscetta plate and I wasn't really thrilled.  The traditional tomato one was the most solid choice, the bean one was strange and soggy and I don't eat pig so I can't comment on the third one (though everyone else seemed to enjoy it). The pizzas are pretty decent except that they lay out the toppings in a weird way, for example, if you order the vegetarian rosa pizza, if you like zucchini, it is all chopped up on two slices and so on.  It doesn't really make sense to top a pizza in such a way, to me.  I prefer draft beer over bottled beer, and all they offer is bottled.  I did enjoy a couple glasses of the Rossi Cabernet Sauvignon which was a solid wine choice.  Service:  The host/ess was a pleasant person, and the time quoted was less than we actually had to wait so that rocked.  While waiting, we attempted to get a drink.  The bartender was cool about getting our drinks in a timely manner despite the fact that it was busy.  Our actual server was super attentive at first and then lost for a good chunk of time as well.  Too hit or miss.    Cibo is an adorable spot with awesome ambiance but it isn't quite that awesome when it comes to food and service.

qE7E8bEb_iq59In9URzK4w.text: The things that stuck out for me with Cibo are the great staff and the warm, cozy ambiance that this little house-turned-into-restaurant provides.  Our waiter was on top of things, from taking drink and food orders, to bringing the cake out (we were there for a birthday).  He even said the menu items in a very distinct Italian accent, which always makes me giggle a little bit on the inside.  Tell me you've never said "It's a me, Mario!" in your best Italian accent.  When I went to the bathroom to wash up (the men and women bathrooms are single occupancy), one of the waitresses told me to just hop in the women's if it was empty.  Little things like this really help to give this place a cozy, inviting feeling.  On to the food.  The pizza was pretty good (though I found the crust to be a bit on the salty side), and the appetizers were excellent.  I had the geneva, which consists of basil pesto, potatoes, white onions, parmigiano and probably some other stuff that I don't remember.  But it was good.  My only minor complaint was that our table was a little cramped.  Certainly not Cibo's fault, since we were a party of 13,  but just something to consider if you go with a large party.  If it's cool enough outside, the patio would be perfect.

zi-z50ftl5PqOsp00_iZnQ.text: My first choice for pizza and bruschetta! And holy moly, their Nutella crepes for dessert will blow your mind.

GeDNY6QfjHJT8VKHRDVrMA.text: I love Cibo! It's so great. The service may be a little bit slow when they are super busy, but it's definitely worth the wait!

RpLPA-qdekojac9lH-uF6w.text: Come for the pizza and stay for the atmosphere.  I would wager that everything on the menu is awesome but I've only been here two times now and both times I have gotten the pizza and a salad.  The Genova pizza is so good.  Its mozzarella, fresh basil and roasted potatoes.  Seriously, once you sink your teeth into it you realize what a good decision you made.  I also had the margarita pizza and it was excellent as well.  The outside seating area is so relaxing on a nice night.  It really has the whole romantic Italian restaurant thing going on and they have really good prices on beer also.  I was surprised that one of my favorite beers was available and even more surprised about the price.  I would recommend this place if you want an authentic Italian experience in a great environment.

YLEhlbBYCKKzsB98fnisHw.text: Yes, another gutted house-turned restaurant/ bar to no prevail succeeds. Yippie-Skippie.  It's walking distance from work, so thats 5 badass red stars right there. Then, I almost gave it 1 star thinking it was closed and realized that it is 112 out today and no one was on the patio. Who doesn't like sweat dripping on their Pastrami? And thats exactly what I had. Good shit. It ran me a little over 18 bucks for lunch with 2 Ambers.   Go ahead and take someone "out-of-town" aka Scottsdale, to show them the advantages of knowing places like this downtown.  To my dispair, with everything being "authentic", they had a sensored-run paper towel machine in the restroom. Weak sauce.

cf7f3CHxTKUdw9Jg3gQ0Fw.text: Great food, terrible service! We made a reservation for a graduation dinner and there were 10 of us. Our server had two other large parties and could not get out of her own way. As a previous server, I know this can be overwhelming, but we had to get up and ask to order our food and drinks and to have the table cleared all night.

HyLURLnWTNUWTM9hzkjAQQ.text: I thought I would try this place after several failed attempts to find good pizza in Arizona.  I ordered the Margherita pizza and the nutella/banana crepe.  The service was good. The pizza was the perfect True italian pizza. There were a few more burnt areas then I would have liked, but it wasn't a deal breaker. The dessert was great! Definitely a must have!

uQh5qSTJycdjcZfsGl4sdA.text: It's situated in a home from 1913 and has colored lights wrapped all around the trees.  You can either sit inside or on the gorgeous patio.  Brick oven pizza and cheese plates offered here and it's definitely a place for a cool date.

_-Wt2bwTMOTvotFqBoSwww.text: You cannot be disappointed of this place at all, whether it is the decor, the ambiance, and especially the taste of the food. The reason why I would give this a 5 star review is because they hit every expectation of a great restaurant on point. And this is based on both times that I have been here.  From the look on the outside and even inside, this screams romantic, but also gives a nice casual feel if you are going with friends or family. It feels like a welcoming place to almost anyone. And the wait isn't even too bad. During a time that they were busy, both a Friday night and Saturday night took only about a max of 30 min to get a table. Only thing is that they don't do reservations, but this isn't too bad of a wait in my opinion and compared to other restaurants. The staff is extremely nice and attentive when it comes to getting your order, bringing your food, and even refilling water and taking your plates back.  If you can't decide between what pizzas you want, you can easily do a half and half here! Just keep in mind that they charge for the more expensive pizza, but that makes sense. The Genova pizza is probably one of my favorite pesto pizzas there and elsewhere. It has potato on it as well, and with the onion makes such a power-packed combo on your palette. That was definitely the consistent one. Then I have tried La Noce and Da Vinci. I am a lot more of a fan of the Da Vinci because it is like a Margherita pizza with Burrata cheese instead I believe, but it's only because I am not a huge fan of arugula or nuts on pizza. Though even the La Noce was pretty tasty if that is what you prefer! The first time we came, the middle was kind of soggy, but we made sure to ask them to cook it a little more the second time, and the crust was much nicer. However, there were certain parts of the pizza where it tasted a bit burnt, but I think its because we asked for them to cook it a bit more to make the middle of the crust firmer. The Linguine Cacio e Pepe was one of the tastiest white pastas I have ever had! That is what brought the taste to a 5 stars. Never did I have a pasta that felt so light in terms of sauce but yet still be so tasty. I think there was some cheese and garlic flavor, but that is definitely worth a try.  As a vegetarian even, there were so many options to try from, and they don't do a half job at it. I loved coming here both times, and will definitely continue coming here again and again :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Entrance of Cibo
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Linguine Cacio e Pepe
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Half La Noce and half Genova

lwsuUuQ6pIivFtRNeVCCqA.text: Cibo pizzeria has THE best pizza in the country.  I love this place so much I got married in their carriage house. Our guests were enthralled by the 5 course meal prepared by the remarkable chef Guido and his staff.  I can't say enough good things about this place, from the authentic, beautiful paintings on the walls by the notorious owner Tony himself, to the delicious special handmade gnocchi pasta every Wednesday night; there is much to appreciate from such an authentic Italian restaurant. My favorite pizza pie is the Margherita - so classic and tasty. I also like the Diavola if I'm in the mood for some spice. Both pizzas are complimented nicely with their spicy olive oil which I like to drizzle on my crust for a nice finishing touch. Also, don't forget to add ricotta into your pie, you will not be disappointed!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

P4ZbgFju_UTtvmYyAdQn7g.text: Our first visit here we went for happy hour. We ordered a quatro formaggi pizza to go. It was delicious. Tableside we ordered everything on the happy hour menu.  The gnocchi was excellent. The arancini was a bit off. It was more like sushi rice stuffed with cheese . Needed a little more flavor but presented well and wasnt awful.  The straccetti was good. Palline 2.0 was very good. And the peroni beer nice and cold and a bargain. The service was excellent and it is a beautiful outdoor spot.  We were indoors because it was 108.  It was a little hot in there but again it was 108 outside.  The only issue I had was when we came out  valet had set up and was blocking the passenger entrance to my vehicle in the handicapped spot. There is that space so a wheelchair can get through . The. Valet worker didnt seem to care.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Desert parking has no empathy for the handicapped.
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy hour.

SVTiepZM7uGdqCts1iGB4w.text: The classic wood-fired pizza at Cibo is to die for. Not to mention dessert: Nutella crepes!?  I've been here twice for dinner with a couple of girlfriends and am eager to go back. Whenever I crave pizza, I crave Cibo. Both times I have been to Cibo, we ordered bottles of wine with our pizza and had dessert.  Pizza:  On the menu, the pizzas are separated into Rosse and Bianche (Red and White) pizzas. One of my favorite things about the pizzas besides the toppings and cheese is the crusts. The crust is soo soft, yet delicately crispy on the outside. The bread pulls apart perfectly.   *La Noce* this pizza is a red pizza, has mozzarella, ricotta, arugula, and walnuts. I probably would have preferred if the walnuts were chopped into smaller pieces, but nevertheless, the pizza was still scrumptious.   *Tartufata* if you love mozzarella cheese, this is the pizza you should order. It's a white pizza, so cheesy it strings up as you pick up a slice from the pie. The other ingredients are prosciutto crudo, white mushrooms and a drizzle of white truffle oil after the pizza is cooked.   Wine:   The pizzas pair well with the wine. I usually get a Cab, and their Cabernet is amazing. The dryness of the Cab complements the moistness from the cheesy pizzas.  Dessert:  *Strawberry Nutella Crepes* Yes, I just had 8 slices of Cibo pizza, but I have an extra stomach for dessert, okay? These crepes were the perfect ending to an Italian dinner. I was stuffed and satisfied, but I can always, no matter what, use dessert. The crepes were so soft, Nutella warm, and strawberries so fresh!   If you are looking for a local pizza place in Phoenix/Scottsdale, please come to Cibo! You will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. La Noce- Tomato sauce - mozzarella - ricotta - arugula and walnuts (after pizza is cooked)

4aA2BPmB_B4sQ1akdg2SgQ.text: Family owned, definitely top 3 pizza (along with Federal & Forno 301) Excellent building and decor. The Diavola is to DIE for!!  The outdoor patio is beautiful and the live music is excellent!   Great staff every time!   Awesome lunch time happy hour too!!

Cf6gJgPwL9jUW-08DTCNDQ.text: Great for date nights, small bday, anniversary or valentines. The food is amazing! Love that they have different local artist playing at the courtyard at night.

AKqcQtySBbg2smha7POhEw.text: First time here. Walked right in and sat at the bar during lunch hour. Immediately taken care of. I wanted the meatballs for an appetizer but they were on the dinner menu. The bartender was gracious enough to check in with the kitchen and they were okay with making it. Came out quick. Love the tomato sauce. Meatballs were good. Texture was there. The toasted bread was dynamite. Onto, the main course. The magherita pizza was stupendous! Boiling hot, almost burned my tongue. Sauce, great. Cheese great. However, the crust was out of this world! I could have a whole plate of that. Absolutely terrific! I will be back soon again for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita

8aTObmaqlDmnVkJnX8YuaQ.text: Very fast service during lunch hour. Food and prices are average. Pasta not served till 5pm

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

PS6QYBOfdtFuZSsBPBxk9A.text: Stopped in here for lunch on the way home from a local conference. HIDDEN GEM!  Although they don't have pasta on the lunch menu, there are lots of other GREAT choices/options.. Pasta is handmade at 4pm ready for dinner service. We had their margharita pizza and the pastrami sandwich- both were lovely! We then split a banana and Nutella crepe with a scoop of ice cream- it too was delicious. Thin and flavorsome. So good that I forgot to get a photo before we tucked in - so the photo only shows the remnants of the crepe  We will definitely come back to try their handmade pasta for dinner..

wwkI5K4BGIk4-Ddw4ZLetg.text: My absolute favorite pizzeria in all of Phoenix! They make terrific Neopolitan style pizzas - my favorite being the Rustica. Literally, anything you order here, you cannot go wrong!  The ambiance is really nice and is located near downtown. It's in a charming old house that also has a great outdoor seating area where lights strands are hanging from tree to tree. A great date night spot! If you come on the weekend they sometimes have jazz musicians playing outside near the fire pit.   When you're done with your meal, don't forget the banana nutella crepe!

aeneGrteVkNmEHaGlN4YqA.text: My second time at Cibo & I finally had the pizza. I mean what was I waiting for it was delicious!!  Absolutely loved our time there, anniversary date. We sat inside which on a chilly night I was fine with, they do have a beautiful, romantic patio as well. My boyfriend & I both order pizza. His the Salsiccia & I the Vegetarina plus added spicy salami. We both enjoyed our pizza, and what I love most about mine was the dough/crust & the spicy salami. The pizza itself was great, loved the veggie variety, but the dough & salami made the pizza. Along with excellent pizza we had excellent service; fast, attentive & great atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Saliccia &amp; Vegetarina

H9syio6_Awl7JiDyB7rZjQ.text: The atmosphere- very cool, hip with a mixture of downtown, families and business people.  Service- okay. Very neutral. Nothing outstanding.  Food-  Ordered divola (misspelling) and fried calamari. Fried calamari was okay. Slightly bland, but love the sauce that it came with. The pizza was great! Hot, cheese melted perfectly. The crust was everything!!! The overall pizza had a slight spicy kick!  I'm not sure if we'd come back, but would recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried calamari
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Diavola

nFr4DkIg5ANUeot1HoVdtQ.text: Sunday double date night.   Started with the  Calamari Al Limon (Breaded and deep fried calamari lightly tossed in garlic - parsley and sea salt. Served with red pepper aioli and lemon) Serving size good as a starter for a table of 4. Couldn't decide on one pizza flavor so had to order half Diavola (Tomato sauce - mozzarella and spicy salame) / half Tartufata (Mozzarella - mushrooms - prosciutto crudo and truffle oil) Neapolitan Style Pizza.  Bf ordered the Calzone (Ricotta - tomato sauce - prosciutto cotto - salame and mozzarella). HUGE   Flavors all delicious!

vZZFcrP2tXhjVpTQrwwZ7w.text: If you have been in Italy and have had the food there, you know when you got back to the State's, Italian food  here is not at all the same as there.  My husband and came downtown to Cibo's , wow the food is awesome and just like in Italy.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pizza

wmfG4VdZ4CjyVdDz84hiTA.text: Dined here with a friend the other night. Everything was good except our service. Our server had the nerve to write down how much to tip her on our check. I was in disbelief how unprofessional that was, coming from a server who works in a fine dining restaurant that is pretty bad. I looked over at the tab on the other table because they were closing out too and she wrote how much to tip her on their tab as well. Also, we asked her to get a straw and she replied "sure" she couldn't even say "yes" or "of course". We've always had pretty bad service at cibo but the only reason we go back is for the food. I would mention her name in the review but she never introduced herself when she took our order.

Ljw9AAEDyC90K0ktkNLRCg.text: Overall opinion: just average (more like 3.5 stars though)   My fellow Yelpers are right - Cibo is quaint and a good date night spot. My boyfriend and I shared the caprese salad and the Prosciutto Crudo pizza. They were both good, just nothing I would rave about.   While the service was prompt and friendly, it seemed like the servers were all racing through the restaurant without regard for the diners. It made for a hectic experience every time you got up from the table, especially with the close corners of the restaurant. Our particular server was nice and attentive. Something a little weird though, he was wearing a blue jumpsuit reminiscent of a prison uniform or a house painter. Kinda strange.   I would be happy to dine at Cibo again in the future, especially due to it's close proximity to my office. But I'm not jumping at the chance.

5nyH49dBGL0LQSuTJcs7_A.text: I really enjoyed this restaurant.  It hints at a Napoletana style pizza but falls just a little short.  The pizza is really good but not quite as good as Pomo.  Still, the location and atmosphere are adorable.  It's fun to feel like you're in a garden spot even though you're actually in the heart of Phoenix.  The wait staff are fun and friendly.  There is definitely a coolness about the atmosphere and the staff.    I totally recommend this restaurant.  The food is very good.  It just isn't my first choice for Italian food.  My top choices are Pomo for pizza and Andreolis for Pasta.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Solid, quasi napoletana style pizza

8CGOKVWh0_QqtiOlJx-lPw.text: Delicious pizza and wonderful customer service!   Family and I have eaten here many of times and the food is always great! The main reason I decided to write a review today though is not just because of their food, but because today (Christmas Eve) I instant messaged this company through Facebook.   I asked them if they were open today (due to holiday) and guess what, they responded back within minutes advising me they were closed today. They are closed today but still took the time to contact 1 customer back on a holiday to answer my question.    That's great service!

roeNkB0jjsQwyKuSu4msjA.text: Cibo is located just NW of downtown Phoenix in a beautiful house with old trees all around it.  I highly recommend any of the porch seating under the trees - shade in the summer and heaters in the winter so it should be comfortable whenever you go.   We went on a Saturday night, it was an hour wait, but we grabbed beers at the bar and sat around the patio while we were updated via Yelp as to our place in line (a new feature for me!)  We started with the fried calamari and the burrata (cheese, tomatoes, prosciutto, and balsamic on toast) apps - very fresh and tasty - and then had two pizzas, a margherita pizza with the biggest basil leaves I'd ever seen, and an apple/Gorgonzola/walnut/arugula pizza that we sweet and bitter and peppery and funky. We were very happy with our meal and can't wait to get back and try the pasta!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Apple Gorgonzola pizza
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita pizza (look at those basil leaves!)
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burrata app

aazWPUDb2aEywxdxfBxY8w.text: A month ago, I had no idea Cibo even existed. Hidden in the alleyways of Downtown Phoenix, nestled on the corner of a residential street, it can be easy to miss. But I am so glad I was invited to a friend's birthday dinner to celebrate here and uncovered the charming spot.   The place is actually huge, with beautiful string lights decorating a romantic outdoor patio and an interior that mimics your favorite cozy Italian joint, there is plentiful seating to enjoy the wonderful ambiance. The wait staff that served out table of 12-15 was so kind and extremely helpful. Our food was ready quickly and the pizzas I tasted were quite good. A little burnt dough on the bottom and very thin crust, but that wasn't enough to turn us off to the menu. Good portion sizes as well. They also brought my friend a crepe with an ice cream scoop on top as a free birthday treat.   I'd love to come back here and sit outdoors, experience the live music, and try more of the menu. Well done Cibo!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

HnV_didC8fIXgd5ORosdMQ.text: I just left Cibo. We got there around 8:15. The wait was about 30 minutes on a Saturday night. The pizza is great, the ingredients are fresh and the dough was charred perfectly. The outdoor patio was well heated and comfortable. The reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is that the bartenders are terrible. They were not pleasant and not attentive. Note....it wasn't busy at the bar. At age 45 I can say I have been to enough bars and restaurants to know how a bartender should act. I pay $5 for a $1 beer and I am fine with that. When going out I kind of want to be welcomed and not a burden on the bartender. Overall, I would recommend the restaurant, but avoid the bar.

3y4R9WUqnEGPbzRSwI1OFQ.text: Cibo was definitely worth the hype. We ordered two of the red pizzas and each tasted fresh and delicious. I'd reccomend the da Vinci as it was a masterpiece.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Complimentary birthday crepe
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rAi8pqQNREhw8pHw8QhGhg.text: Fantastic Pizza, can't beat location.  Cibo has much more than pizza.  Their salads are wonderfual and you must save room for the crepes.  Trust me, they are worth the calories. Few places have such ambiance and allow you to sit outside and relax.

Qf4zfzPGfCB_A1Toj-ucEQ.text: Went there on a Sunday for my anniversary dinner and the ambience was just perfect. They had $5.00 house red and white wine glasses and $10 off a bottle. Such a beautifully lit patio and the food was so good! Pizza was nice a crispy and all the flavors were amazing.

Pn-YaZ490KpzgMCTikcDwg.text: Oh boy, you cannot go wrong with this place! I LOVE their pizza. I usually get the pizza with spicy salame or sausage. For lunch you can get a personal size pizza and a salad for about $12-13 bucks and for this quality, it's totally worth it!!!  Whether you are here for a business lunch or a dinner date, this is an ideal place for good food, a beautiful atmosphere (you have to sit outside) and amazing service.  I cannot wait until my next visit here!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

i3w037gwy3wfUmIxSggSBQ.text: I love this restaurant. It's atmosphere is as good as the menu. The menu isn't overwhelming and it has great entrees. Good service, excellent food! I have never been disappointed in a meal at Cibo. The owners are there to greet their customers coming and going, meeting new people in the community, making sure their meal was satisfactory and their experience was good.

jjgpKvgVyZek49J0D3Q5mA.text: One of the best pizza places in town.  This is high end artisan pie, quality ingredients that deliver a flavor explosion on your palette.  Outdoor ambiance is fantastic at night under the twinkle lights.  Parking situation is annoying, welcome to downtown :). They do offer free valet, I would  highly recommend you take advantage of.

WQfLjekMHys15MYOz6_84A.text: Wonderful, charming Italian eatery. The restaurant looks like a house and there is plentiful seating outside as well as indoors. We parked on the sidewalk on a metered spot but if your lucky enough to get a free parking spot do so! There is a small lot behind the restaurant. They were busy on a Sunday evening but service was great anyway. Our waitress helped us with our wine selection and we decided on the burrata and calamari appetizers. - burrata app - delicious and recommended! Came with crunchy pieces of toast, burrata with balsamic vinegar, heirloom tomatoes with arugula and prosciutto.. can't go wrong with this one  - calamari app -just ok.. not going to rave about this one - calzone - the bread was soft and had char from the oven.. prosciutto coto, salame, mozzarella, ricotta filling was good too.. we also added mushrooms.. a solid choice I loved the environment at Cibo. Would definitely dine here again if I came back to Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Calzone.. yummy
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burrata appetiser.. delicious!

w4YKc2S87Cr9dhmTEYQPKg.text: Cibo is a family favorite for us. We love going to eat fresh and healthy foods, but to also enjoy our time in the fresh air on their front patio seating area. At night, it's romantic with the lights in the trees where you can eat dinner and enjoy a drink or two. Every time we have people from out of town with us, we bring them to Cibo so we can show them what Phoenix culture looks and feels like. It's such a great place. The energy is awesome and so is the food.

otRxvlUe_MJOmV46CsVtSQ.text: Love this place so much we had our wedding dinner party there .  The food, the service, the location, everything is top shelf !

Ib1B40tWgq4KslqxB5-tWg.text: Owners Tony and Karen were amazing, had to catch a flight and they sat us right away! Pizza was amazing, great service, def recommend!

aoeAyhwsbMu4Bzd3O8mSFg.text: This is our favorite spot when we come to town.  The Ostia salad we could eat twice a day with these amazing fried parsnip bits, the pesto salad is equally amazing, and the truffle pizza is incredible.  Wait staff is perfect.   The outdoor ambiance is the most pleasant and it's great for conversation with your favorite date - it's romantic, private feeling, with lights in the trees in the garden, the best food, and always a really good musician.  We go almost every day that we are in town for business, we just can't get enough.

WHgbK9j2iQ0kDGJW0wX19g.text: Cute, romantic ambience. Delicious pizza. What more could you want? Unfortunately at 10pm on a Friday night, there was a wait to sit outside so we settled for sitting inside. Sit outside if you can, it's like a scene from a movie out there.   Cibo pizzas are Pauline P. sized pizzas. I'm a girl with a pretty sizable appetite and these pizzas left me feeling full and satisfied. Ordered the magherita and added italian sausage to it. Everything was great, even the crust and I'm generally not a crust girl. Basil was fresh and the sausage tasted excellent. Our server was well-versed in the menu and knew exactly what she was talking about. She recommended to get half of the Di Notte and half of the Tartufata since my friend was wanting a pizza bianche but was unsure of what to get. She also hooked it up with this spicy oil to dip our pizza crusts in - yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Half and half pizza bianche. Di Notte and Tartufata.
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita pizza with Italian sausage

xh0qfBCna5h3kVk8qstp4g.text: I can't believe it has taken me so long to eat at Cibo! This family owned restaurant offers a fabulous ambiance and delicious, authentic Italian food. We ordered several pizzas and we loved each one. The wine was on point and the service was fantastic! The location is within walking distance to several bars and music venues. I can't recommend this place enough. Cheers!

2-6gVoK-Kopd2gnMSQZ2WQ.text: Neapolitan pizza perfected. Food is always consistent and the pizza dough is one of the best around.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1lk79r10h9i8BfTtWta2Zw.text: Before Yesterday, I have only had Cibo pizza in take-out format, which I would not recommend. Cibo pizza is best eaten soon after it comes out of the oven. Last night, we order two pizzas, a red and a white. For the red we got half Funghi and half Capricciosa. For the white we ordered Dolce Vita and Tartufata. I thought I would enjoy the red more, but it was the two white ones that were the winners.   Both pizzas came out warm with burnt crust. The pizza is thin and a little soft in the center, which made for a soft, doughy crust. If I had to pick a favorite of the night, it would be the Dolce Vita. Creamy burrata cheese topped with spek, arugula, and a slightly sour/sweet balsamic glaze was the perfect combination. The other three were old delicious and flavorful as well.  To go with our pizzas, we ordered the calamari and assortment of grilled mixed vegetables. Both were average but I was disappointed that the vegetables were cold and did not taste grilled. I would not order either again.   Parking can be difficult in this residential neighborhood and the wait to get a table can get long as well. The outdoor seating area is beautiful with twinkle lights making the place sparkle  every night. Cibo is a great place for date night or just a casual get-together with friends.   What I recommend: - using the Yelp app to hold your place in line - Dolce Vita (pizze bianche)

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5iYXkX7NM-Cn7mR7DezHmQ.text: The last few times have been terrible. Never going back. Bad service. Waiter didn't come to check on us at all after food was dropped off and I needed some oil and vinegar. She didn't even come back once until she was ready to give us the check. The oranges they use are from a can and taste terrible. The sandwich was all bread basically and no substance inside. We wanted dessert but we were so irritated that we skipped it all together. Not going back.

c-IySMlKAR7gvxeOoVrgSA.text: If you like pizza then you have to get yourself to Cibo! If you don't like pizza I am not sure I want to know you.   This cute restaurant has a warm and charming atmosphere that is perfect for a romantic date, or just a fun night out with friends. I came here two nights in a row because the first time I tried it it was so good I couldn't get enough. We had multiple pizzas with completely different flavors (some of which I wasn't sure whether I would like), and they were all to die for! I love pizza, but this place takes it to a whole new level. Get an appetizer, some wine, a dessert and it is a perfect night.

U6n_RgNX76nXHygPg8N_8Q.text: Cibo is excellent. The pizza quality and taste is amazing and they have great specials. I especially enjoy the ambiance of coming here and eating. Such a great aesthetic, really enjoyed it!

0y2jXj8x2hq6NYK3QIK2Ng.text: Caprese salad, second to none. Family and I went on my birthday and ordered the meat and cheese board, Il Tagliere, I think it was called. Amazing assortment of meats and cheesed, fresh berries, olives, fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, walnuts just great all together. Certainly worth the trip downtown! Don't forget to order on of their outstanding crepes! They even give you a free one on your check to entice your return, as if we needed an incentive!! Great outdoor seating area too.

Ppwc7XRFlFvMWgU9A5_H9g.text: My sister and I came to visit my cousin in Phoenix. We came in with no dining expectations.  Our first meal was at Cibo, and it far exceeded our expectations.  First of all, dining al fresco in Phoenix is a "thing." A lot of restaurants have outdoor seating, and especially on nice, warm nights, it really adds to the overall dining experience. The ambiance at Cibo is amazing. There are lights strung in the patio, with the lowkey sounds of a live band in the background.  We were fortunate enough to be blessed with a nice, warm, May evening, so everything really worked in our favor.  The pizza at Cibo is amazing. Amazing. I can't emphasize that enough. We ordered the pizze rosse diavola (tomato sauce, mozzarella, spicy salami and ricotta) and thepizze bianche tartufata (mozzarella, prosciutto crudo, white mushrooms and a drizzle of white truffle oil). Both were delicious- savory, and packed full of flavor with every bite.  I'd come back to dreary Phoenix just to have another slice of one of these pizzas.

Yi3OQtC1QC_Gyof_l9u93Q.text: It's a cozy place! The food is Italian style, very tasty and well combined ingredients. The best is the service and not only that but the environment... If you go I recommend you to sit outside! It's plenty of trees, birds, beautiful area! I will go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nutella+banana+strawberry crepe! Omg! No words for this desert
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beautiful environment!
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Antipasto misto!! Delicious! The roasted red peppers were the best!!

qSfW4OvBHv-6yt8UGausOQ.text: Hands down the most delicious prosciutto sandwich I've ever had!  I came here for lunch and had the most delicious meal ever!   They make their bread and it's so light and crispy- so worth the $$$ and trip!  My meal was about $9 for lunch.  Staff was friendly and quick.  They even have valet for your car!  This place is a house turned into a restaurant.  Very clean and I would 100% recommend this place!  Can't wait to come back!!!!!  Might be my go to Friday lunch spot!    You won't be disappointed you came!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The best sandwich ever!!!
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I believe this is the PLT and house salad.

0v5FVRZ7gINWKvn4EV1ULA.text: I really enjoyed the vibe of this place! We stopped by for lunch and it was extremely fast. I ordered pizza, which was good, but I've had better pizza elsewhere in Phoenix. That being said I've heard Cibo recommended for their sandwiches, so I'll have to give them a shot next time. I will be back.

AlNLdLOds9GsojW6_2GxMQ.text: I just couldn't wait to try this place out and I Heard how awesome it was. We ordered a margarita pizza with anchovies on it, what they brought out was an artichoke pizza, they took that away and brought us a marinara pizza with anchovies on it.. No cheese or basil. I ordered the homemade roasted pork belly sandwich I think it was called after asking the waitress what her favorite dish on the menu was. It came out soggy she didn't offer ketchup or anything to put on the Fry's but I wanted malt vinegar her she provided it i'll sonic vinegar. Anyway I'm gonna give this place a benefit of the doubt and go back because it really was cool place that  has a good vibe to it.

HSQH7cOvFsa7LwOlgyQQuA.text: We discovered Cibo when our son was attending college.  Every time we are in Phoenix we go to Cibo (visited our son, spring training) Every pizza I have tried is delicious.  I always recommend it when I know someone is going to the Phoenix area.

ect8gCAS1ZaPQCtBnzKWMA.text: Love the ambiance, the feel, & the nutella crepe dessert!   I tried the Tartufata pizza which has mozzarella, prosciutto crudo, white mushrooms and a drizzle of white truffle oil after the pizza is cooked. I do appreciate the uniqueness of the pizza. HOWEVER, I do think that the crust was too dry. There is thin crust pizza and there is doughy pizza -- but this pizza seemed a little burnt? I did only try one pizza, so perhaps there are more tasty pizzas than this one.   I was a fan of the Nutella and Strawberries Crepe! Added a spoonful of vanilla ice cream on top! Yum!  Overall, I love the feel of this place when eating here at night. They've got pretty lights that sets the mood! Great alternative to Pizzeria Bianco's long wait lines!

h2-8uv9qpMHM_AL0KJXdfw.text: I hear this place is dog friendly, didn't try it but can totally see this because the outdoor seating is awesome. Pizzas: Out if the Salsiccia (red sauce) and Quattro Formaggi, we enjoyed the latter. You can taste the individual cheeses and the flavs all blend together perfectly, add some fresh arugula and life is good! Very Gorgonzola-ey. Our server was okay, kind of not really friendly, but our orders were perfect. Would go back just for the Nutella crepes. Valet..at 830pm they tell us the lot is closed, even though there are spaces(?) then when we left at 945pm and valet is open and parking cars. I don't get it. Just street park!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Arugula makes it healthy :)

SrIjQ2BnKo6QRptPIlD1yA.text: I had lunch here with a colleague recently and we had a wonderful time. It was bit too chilly to sit in their lovely garden so we sat inside where it was more cozy.   Lunch was excellent. I had the Polpette (meatball sandwich) and my friend had the PLT, both with a side salad. My sandwich was one of the best meatball sandwiched I'd ever had. The bread was chewy; the meat was flavorful; and the cheese was melted to perfection. The portion size for the sandwich and salad was perfect.  The only thing this place has going against it is a lack of parking. I got there early so I could get free parking on the street about a block away (I don't believe in paying for parking when possible). There were meters and they have a complementary valet too for people willing to pay to park.

pd6IhjlZjFVkPjFbtIOqNA.text: We were headed to The Vig and decided to try this place out instead. Amazing little restaurant in an old house. Great atmosphere, amazing food, and fairly reasonable prices. We had the Mele Salad and the Diavola Pizza... SUPERB!! Service was a little slow for not being busy, but we will definitely be back. Definitely worth a shot!!

DvCYDpFTzB2F2ya4FKZ3sQ.text: My first time here I loved the pizza, the second time was a horrible experience. I just recently ordered a lunch pizza with spinach, and they ended up forgetting to put it on till the last second, so when I bit into my pizza it was cold spinach. The pizza itself was so under cooked that the cheese wasn't completely melted and the dough was soggy. My first time here was over a year ago, I am going to assume they have just let there standards go since then, but they used to be a great spot!

ywfoKWWzMMY07iORd85R2g.text: Yummy pizza! Delicious salad. I gave 4 stars bcz it was a take out. Will try to eat in next time.

sviucPZbokUkkVQQUZWa_Q.text: Mr. B and I LOVE LOVE LOVE pizza! Good pizza that is. If it were up to us, we'd have pizza at least 5 out of the 7 nights of the week. The building setting is a house turned into an eating establishment. The service was good and the food was GREAT! In reality, 2 people can share a pizza and large salad and be good. Mr. B and are selfish and greedy so, sharing was not an option on the pizza situation; we did share the salad. The bill was a little hefty for 2 pizzas, a large salad and 3 glasses of vino but, you can't put a price on good food and service. The servers were extremely attentive, which was a huge plus. We will definitely be back for date night. Definitely a must try if you're in the area.

Lk-bhb6t3vd4Omwm5W14fg.text: Really awesome spot. The food was killer!   We started with the Antipasto Speciale (large), which was the perfect amount for four of us.   For pizza, they'll let you do half and half, so each of the four of us picked out a pizza and then got to try one slice of each kind that we ordered. Super yummy. My fav was the Capricciosa while boyfriend was obsessed with the Salsiccia Con Patate.  We couldn't resist the dessert crepes and split two orders between the four of us. They're pretty large, so we didn't have to fight over the last bite. :) Nutella and mascarpone tasted like hot chocolate crepes (holy moly), and the fruit and mascarpone were yummy as well.  The ambiance is so cute and would be a perfect first date spot. Cute and kinda romantic without overdoing it!

ipccyItChUAYxwNAS_Yk-w.text: After so many rave reviews of this place, we decided to give Cibo's a try. In a nutshell - the most underwhelming and flavorless meal we've had in a very long time. We should have anticipated what kind of meal this was going to be, by the dirty side plates brought to our table.  We had the Ostia salad - "Romaine hearts tossed with our homemade chick pea dressing, topped with oven roasted herbed croutons, shaved pecorino romano, crispy parsnips and black pepper." Our romaine lettuce was spoiled, and rotting, the dressing had absolutely  ZERO flavor, and the salad overall just generally lacked any flavor at all. We then had the Procida pizza -"Mozzarella, prosciutto crudo, asian pears, chopped arugula, goat cheese and black pepper." It wasn't bad, but it was just - eh. Again, lacked flavor. The goat cheese had no flavor whatsoever.   Our service was fine, but the girl who cleared our plates was very unprofessional. We let her know (and showed her) our rotted salad leaves, and she just replied with - "Oh...sorry." That was it. Also, as she was clearing our plates, she put others' dirty plates on our table as she tried to stack ours. At that point, we knew our complaint was going to fall on deaf ears.   We've been to just about every pizza joint in the valley, and this was subpar, to say the least. I have no idea what all the hullaballoo is all about. We will definitely not be going back, which is disappointing, because we truly had high hopes for Cibo's after all the amazing reviews.

NUeFXDziQA6O829nqf3EYQ.text: Best pizza in town. Nice venue, nice service, reasonable prices.

oe49IlOJVl6EQdNMeOPclw.text: Food was great!  Service was great!  Drinks were great!   I tried this berry crepe and it was mouthwatering good.  It was also huge so I saved half of it and ate it the next day and it kept well.   Pizza was yummy and we also got a few appetizers.  The veggie tray was yummy.  I don't know why but I thought it would be warm but they were cold and it was still amazing.  I will go back for everything.   It was a great atmosphere.  We sat outside with two small children and the kids gobbled up the good too!

uUoPc7_uME60-oN9jcCFew.text: The service and atmosphere were so bad that we left before we ordered anything. So my score is not based on the food, which I hear is delicious.   We were seated behind some obnoxiously loud lady who was over-explaining to her friend how poorly her coworker taught K-12 chemistry...and was getting almost everything wrong herself (I have a PhD in molecular genetics, so the convo was like listening to nails scraping a chalkboard). That's neither here nor there. Our bad experience was enhanced by this.  So barely being able to hear myself think, I try to order a drink. The cocktail selection stinks for a place that appears to have an open bar. Plus, the waitress wasn't very helpful at all. She offered the peach bellini and then quickly retracted when she noted that they were out of the peach ingredient. Really?  Then trying my best to speak over Loud-Talker explaining that all you needed to demonstrate "splitting atoms" is two styrofoam balls and a toothpick...nuclear fission with toothpicks...I asked the waitress if they had anything akin to an Italian soda, or maybe a soda/ seltzer with a splash of vodka and some flavor. What I figured was a simple request was impossible at Cibo.  We left as Loud-Talker proclaimed that grade school kids don't need to learn chemistry, just general science...and we wonder why AZ's 8th graders rank #45 in the nation in STEM topics.  All in all, our waitress was aloof from the moment we sat down. She was either spaced out or just had no people skills. Having the atmosphere ruined by Ms. Loud-Talker was our own bad luck, but I still give this place one star for the poor service.  We left and went to The Vig next door. That place rocks.

MvrlGgQA6VoYWI53qfmSnQ.text: Cibo is my absolute favorite urban pizza place! I love the set up and the romantic atmosphere in here! Food and service are always amazing! I highly recommend this place! ;)

CzKg4ovltZEJei-J0c-v7g.text: Like many have said the aumbience is amazing!!! Have been here multiple times and always enjoy the food and visit each time. Can get a little crowded during the busy dinner times or weekends but they will try and get you seated as soon as they can.   Looking forward to the next visit!!

8qottulIVugW2pRs93fHGQ.text: I really like Cibo especially because of the ambiance - it is just cute, quaint, and relaxed.  Waiting for your table, you can sit on a bench and listen to live music serenade you.  When you get inside, it is a little tight and cozy, but I didn't seem to mind it.  The food was good and I love their crust. The restaurant is located in downtown so you would have to try to find parking because there are many residential homes around the area.

bZ8TKJH09cXEStKH-eSM9Q.text: Cibo is my absolute favorite pizza restaurant! I love the atmosphere which is what I like to call, elegant-hipster and caters to a wide variety of people. My favorite is the burrata as an appetizer and the funghi pizza.

hSuA90idV8G8WCAFCRf3Hg.text: Cibo = pizza perfection.  I've been to many of the "top" pizza places in the valley, and I've come to a conclusion: you won't find a place better than this in Phoenix. I frequent here quite often.  I'm truly in love.  Dessert crepes are also amazing. Just try one. Any one.  The service is great. The waitstaff is extremely attentive, including the hostess/host. The food comes out quickly. Very quickly. These are things to appreciate, but I'm reviewing this place because the food is fantastic.

CywFlz4woAnNFlIhZp3yJA.text: My mil is in town and we decided to check this place out. The atmosphere was very inviting. Plenty of outdoor seating, as well as indoor.   Once seated we ordered some drinks. Mainly water for the 6 of us with one desert iced tea, which wasn't very good.   Next we ordered, a pizza margarita, pizza with spicy salami, a meatball sandwich, pesto salad, cous cous salad and a mele salad. The order took quite awhile to come out, but was definitely worth the wait. We all shared the food. And the reviews do not steer you wrong. The cous cous salad and pizza was amazing! Cen00zSlQ288Frit6R2U-g.text: I love this place. after I had their pizza I can no longer enjoy pizza hut,  dominoes etc anymore. Also I've never tried Bianco pizzeria and that's beacuse that's always a 2 hour wait. I give 5 stars cause the sevice is awesome, food comes out quick. And the bill is like 50 bucks for two. Cibo is definetly  winning.

edcqTeknlaFc1YVP7ZZgkQ.text: This place is AMAZING!!! I have had Pizzeria Bianco and really feel like this was better!!!! The service was excellent and that wait was not bad at all.  I love taking people who haven't been here!!!! Look forward to eating here each and every time!!!

-fs7cJp_Cfk_kJcfgbuulQ.text: This place has the best to offer eh? meh.     Date night around 8pm on a Saturday? 1) waited 10 minutes at the bar for a beer that was served half cold. Meh.  2) lady has a pesto salad, could not taste the pesto and nuts very well. Meh.  3) I had the genova pizza which left a lot to be desired. lQplRGuo9jt9wplsNHDXhQ.text: I have loved this place for a long time. It is an old converted house with tons of charm. The pizza is killer, so authentic and amazing. The patio is great for events when the weather is cool. In my opinion, this is on the top 3 list of the best pizzas in Arizona and I personally like it better than Pizzaria Bianco.

v5ysZo-BMl2JTjpRgfEFJw.text: Very good atmosphere and quality food worth a stop in the area  Outside seating a must Pizza and salads are well proportioned

KINy-wYcjWHJ5AdIOlzYQw.text: All I have to say was this was the best pizza I have ever eaten.  The gluten free pizza was like no other gluten free pizza I have ever eaten it tasted no different then the regular pizza. It's hard to go to any local pizza place now after eating here.

e-78utxhjTm1i3R2rRIQqQ.text: Great food, super service, warm and friendly staff.

aorhKq5x1zxrt43P485K8Q.text: Great food.   Came here after work at around 5:30 since we didn't want to wait for too long.  We ordered the following: - burrata  - Salsiccia pizza  - procida pizza   Burrata was great! The mozzarella cheese was so delicious and paired perfectly with the prosciutto. However, as a personal preference, I probably would've preferred the waitress had told us that 1 order of burrata is enough for a meal.. for 2 people.   When the two pizzas were served, my colleague and I were too full.  We managed to each eat one slice of the pizzas.. then I just picked out the toppings for the procida pizza.  Well, I guess that says how good that combination is.   Definitely coming back next time, but 1) with a bigger group or  2) order less food

Qd8cFOBZAfDediBdPau_Jg.text: Probably don't have more to add other then AWESOME! Went with a friend for lunch and was so pleased. Been waiting to go for a couple of years, but living in way north valley, wasn't convenient. So happy I had the opportunity! It was great.

wHLQbYSQKcVKLe3CNrpDMw.text: Dammm this joint is good, I mean the pizza.  Crushing all pizzerias in the area, no competition.......delicious!!!  The crust is perfect. Light crisp in the outside and fluffy in the inside, not too thick and not to thin either. Gives me a NY feel when in the Williamsburg area devouring pizza at spot called Patrizia's.  The meats are plump and juicy, great quality, right amount of fresh cheese, I love it.  5 stars for quality, presentation, and dining experience.

nyOvkV7vvob5Fc0QbArtdg.text: We've been to Cibo twice, both on Saturday afternoons for late lunches after perusing galleries like the goddamned refined culture vultures we are.   So yes, of course after 700+ reviews, you're going to know the product is amazing. It just IS. I've not yet subjected myself to the wait of Bianco but I can't imagine it's leaps and bounds better than Cibo. Cibo is dreamy.  First off: I want to plan a fantasy fairy wedding party in their front courtyard on a cool spring night. It's just so cute and perfect! The twinkle lights and the wrought iron and the fountains and everything is awesome. Too bad both times we've been there it was approx 48403 degrees out. Sometime soon.  Second off: The food is just sublime. What I've partaken in...  - Sardegna salad - "baby spinach topped with goat cheese, carmelized walnuts, and sliced strawberries with prosecco dressing" The salad was dressed lightly, the walnuts were plentiful, the strawberries were JUICEAAAAY! A perfect way to start a lunch (along with a glass of bubbly)  -Genova pizza - "mozzarella, homemade basil pesto, roasted potatoes, white onions and grated parmigiano" HELLO, YES, I LOVE YOU. I saw a few reviews wishing the potatoes were thinly sliced, rather than the small cubes, but it just seemed perfect to me. The gooey fresh mozz and pesto were the perfect blanket of taste under the potatoes and onion. The crust is wood-fired perfection  -Their take on the Margherita: Simple and classic. That's all there is to say. Mine had the perfect amount of basil and again, the charred underneath of the crust was on point.  So why 4 and not 5 stars if the food and ambiance seems so flawless? I just got the sense (on both visits) that the staff just didn't care to be there. I understand, late lunch is kind of annoying time to be working, especially on the weekends. But I mean...on our second trip our server came to our table chewing on a mouthful of food. What? Wait times just seem a LITTLE steep., especially with only one or two other tables occupied at both times. One time we got bread, one time we did not. I just wish things were a little more streamlined and a little more careful. I love places that let the staff be laid-back and casual...as long as their job is done. You know?   In any case, it certainly won't stop us from visiting again. The food is too good to not! We'll make sure to make our next trip a dinner event in normal dinner times to see if things shape up just a few tiny notches in order to bump them up to 5 stars!

Bz5z4Bo-Lg2_SZdGvWhn8g.text: Absolutely to die for! Margherita pizza is my weakness, and theirs is one of the best. I love all the combos and that you can do 2 flavors on one pizza. Their choices are too good to pick just one! Love their arancini during happy hour too. What a cute, quaint little spot it's in.

L4DP_PWTF4ksAD7jZ0WB8A.text: Went with friends on a Sunday after seeing all the raving reviews for it. I loved the outdoor patio area, which was spacious yet intimate. We sat under a giant red umbrella which hid my Asian glow fairly well. For the record, their bellinis are awesome.  The Fritatta Melfitana I ordered was good. Maybe I had too high of an expectation or something but I didn't think it was that special. Perhaps their pizzas would blow my mind.

CUgJcQ2kLRoddTCX-A4nwg.text: Been here numerous times. Not your typical pizza place. Pizzas are not your Pepperoni/mushroom type. All are creations of their chef. Have tried almost all of them and they are all exceptional. Wait staff friendly and service is fast.

L7zLQjE_80t69NewPBGFbw.text: It's been awhile since I'd been here and what a night to come.  Pasta night!  Got a delicious gnocchi with shrimp along with a great merlot wine pairing to boot.  The outdoor patio had great relaxing live music and the weather outside is perfect.  As stated in my La Piazza Locale review, this isn't my favorite pizza in town (that title belongs to Pomo).  However, in terms of ambience and atmosphere, you'd be hard pressed to beat the charm of this beautiful bungalow and the gorgeous patio outside.

SaDAKC3BSyp7MO3K6fMQ3A.text: Food is fine, valet is terrible. Meeting my girlfriend and a colleague of hers for lunch. Plenty of space in the parking lot for the valet to run an efficient operation. They turned away me and the 2 cars in front of my saying they were "full". Really guys? Isn't this the idea behind having a valet??? So then I go park miles away. Good job Cibo, good job.

Eo0xHtiHXvAP_3PHlCc4Mw.text: After my first bizarre experience, I was a little reluctant to return. However, Karen graciously invited us back to make up for it, a gesture I really appreciate. Things were much different this time around. The food was wonderful and the atmosphere was lovely. We had the buratta, two soft scoops of mozzarella with proscuitto and bread. Yum! I guess it's not always on the menu so get it if you can. We also had the di note pizza and the nutella and mascarpone crepe. Everything was perfect and made with care. Thank you, mike and Karen for taking such good care of your customers! I will definitely be back.   I've been sneaking bites of my leftovers and they are still just as delicious! I'll be thinking about the buratta until the next time I get to eat it.

CDcCh2KEcGypjq8YC-xUmQ.text: Hello again. Ate here last nite. Myself and 2 firends. 3x's ive been here and its always busy. the other two x's we attempted to eat here. We didnt want to wait, so we went some where eles to eat. Last nite we waited for about 30minutes.  We were seated inside. and quickly ordered. I had the omero salad, one firend had sausage pizza and a glase of wine, and the other had pear salad.  Ok food arrived promptly. my salad was good a bit on the small side for 11 dollars, but had lots of greens and onions, strawberries, and walnuts. it was good. my only complaint would be the candied walnuts........... couldnt even taste the walnuts too much sugar. When mentioned this too the waittress; She informed me that i could of requested plain raw walnuts and without any problem they could replace the candied walnuts with raw ones. That was nice to know. for the next time. My two firends both loved their food. I just thought mine and my firends salad were on the small side for 11 and 12 dollars. Other then that. Every thing at Cibo was very good. i recommend giving this establishment a try. I will be back. Just be prepared to spend 20 dollars or more. per person. Also depending on what time of day you go, be prepared to wait for a seat very popular with the  local folk. Lots of parties and groups coming and going. They serve wine and beer. not a full bar.  good place for eye candy of the both sexes. All ages here young and old.  Very nice atmosphere.  If if they offered organic whole wheat pizza they would get another star from me.

AteJ7fjsJTT4GckIc4VOYQ.text: Fun menu with interesting selections and some standbys. Recommend outdoor seating on a cool afternoon.

s2GXlh95gcPqiHiC52B35g.text: We went to Cibo with friends who are Italian and love the place.  We weren't disappointed.  The food was stellar!  It's got great ambiance and I can't wait to go back for a nice dinner on the patio with my husband.

y0cdziZyKWBXtxOhWZq51g.text: I'm glad they got over themselves and started serving pizza at lunch, because it's delicious.  But I'll tell you what:  Their barbecued pork sandwich is delicious, and better than any barbecue place in town. They also make their own Limoncello and it's fantastic.  The location is good, and when the weather is nice their extensive, tree-filled patio is a really nice place to spend some time.

X3X5mTaJ8ADDQI15cC02cg.text: Cibo and Pizzeria Bianco have a tie for the best pizza in town and best caprese in town. Less wait times and more seating at Cibo though, better parking too! Very attentive service and the owners are always around to greet you. Save some room for dessert: Nutella Crepe with fresh strawberries and chocolate drizzle is a-maz-ing!!!

DW0qW8Y7ZBNzs3uVxVcm2A.text: The meat and cheese board is out of this world, and a great way to start the meal. Layer on top-notch pizza after that, and there are few places that compare!

NAniitqInJgSA8GgL0hHCw.text: Great sandwiches and outdoor vibe. Could use more outdoor seating, but all in all, a good place.

BddyMdOW-axz92K6PwUHog.text: Love Cibo!  Always on the look out for great tasting food mixed in with a little (or a lot) of ambiance.  In a word- yum!

Q35QBTNQboR4z0v3E4InpA.text: If someone tells you there just isn't good pizza in Phoenix, you can tell them they aren't looking hard enough. Tucked away in what seems to be a residential neighborhood, Cibo transforms its early 1900's bungalow into a legitimate contender for the best pizzeria in town. If you're looking for great pizza and a great ambience for date night, your search ends here.  The pizza itself is heavily Neapolitan styled, but has a few small twists on the classic VPN formula. It's most distinguishing feature is its tomato sauce, which features a slightly muted tomato flavor. Cutting down on the bright acidity typically found in Neapolitan pizza, the sauce allows other elements of the pizza to come forward. I don't know if "sweeter" is the right word, but there seems to be a something that takes out the highest end of the tomato bite. It'll be a hit with every type of pizza fan.   The other elements of the pizza do come forward and do not disappoint. I tasted the fresh mozzarella more on this pizza than on other local places. Cibo finds a good balance where the sauce is not overtaking the milder flavor of the cheese, which is perfectly melted without starting to brown. The basil on the pizza works just slightly better when the cheese is brought to the front of the flavor too. It's just a really tasty combination that just works on this pizza to slightly different level than on similar pies.   The crust was probably the weakest point of my visit. Of the two pizzas I tried, one was overcooked and one was undercooked, which was strange. I like a good amount of char, but one half of the pie was dark brown/black. The undercooked pizza had the beginnings of leopard spotting but was too soft on the bottom. Looking around the room, I saw plenty of well-done pizzas, so the oven was working well that night, I just got a couple of duds. The flavor of the crust was pretty average, and I felt like there was a chance for more flavor development. Maybe better texture would have been enough to satisfy me though. I will note that I've been here many times and this is the first time I've had this issue, so I won't ding the star count (though this visit would have been a 4/5). I'm also not personally a fan of pizzas where the center of the pizza is wetter and soggier- I prefer a crispier crust throughout. The pizzas at Cibo trend closer to soggy than crispy in the very middle.   I tried the Margherita on this visit, and I've had other offerings with different cured meats on top. All of them excel, but the Margherita is my favorite; it's possibly my favorite Margherita downtown. The antipasto board is also fantastic, as was the house bread and Nutella crepe dessert. Service was average but the ambience is wonderful, especially if you sit outside where there is frequently a live musician.   Cibo might not be VPN certified, but their style of Neapolitan pizza is a must-try for Phoenix pizza lovers. I've yet to be disappointed by anything I ordered off their menu. If you love pizza, you owe it to yourself to stop by. You'll be treated to one of the highlights of the burgeoning pizza scene.

8WKK207MX_PH1GLuhAqn7g.text: Bruschetta: Great Wine: Great Ambiance: Great Pizza: AMAZING. The Crust! The cheese! The Texture! The perfect taste! yum yum yum!    I typically get the Tricolre and sub tomatoes for the meat. But really, anything you choose is going to be AMAZING.   I will spend my entire life hoping that I can find another pizza place as good as Cibo, and it will never happen.

E4VVp9jxvN-3nqQZX76LUw.text: This place is the best!  Awesome food, great atmosphere, wonderful staff.  You can not go wrong eating here if you are in the downtown area.

uMjdjEH8hhCx2GBetoE0Yg.text: Location and surroundings very nice, good pizza

evOnLnQP13MJ6qtRMngZTw.text: Showed up with a party of 10 and no reservations.  The staff worked hard to accommodate us quickly on their lovely patio.  Music and lights on the patio were wonderful as were all of our food choices including the dessert crepes.  Friendly staff,wonderful atmosphere, great food!

cxCEhoh5jf8oWDVafphrFg.text: Cibo is excellent! The atmosphere, service, and food are all spectacular. Also prices are very reasonable. Patio is great as well, especially with the live music. Blows bianco out of the water, plus you don't have to wait two hours. Also great location, very homey. I take all out of towners here. Great for date night!

yS_4mdccjjLknnA-kSvj5w.text: You want great authentic Italian food at a decent price? This is the place. Every pizza on the menu is terriffic (I think we've tried them all by now) but our favorites are the Tartufata (white pizza with white truffle oil) and and Diavola. Or maybe the Quattro Formaggi and La Noce. We ALWAYS begin with the Burrata starter. More than enough for two people. In fact, I'm tempted to ask if we can get a 1/2 order. The wine list is modest and won't make you wince when you see the prices. If you're still hungry, the Fresca from the Dolci menu is simply amazing. The fruit crepe is MORE than enough for two people. On Tuesday and Wednesday, Chef Guido make 3 homemade pasta dishes, usually around $13-15 per plate. Amazing stuff. The service and servers are second to none. All very friendly and helpful.

t3dsUtuepw-7noGVImPZLA.text: I stooped in for a Friday lunch with my boss. Parking was a bit of a pain as usual. The only table available was in direct sunlight and it kept us squinting though our entire conversation.   The lunch menu consists entirely of sandwiches and salads. I was in the mood for some hot food, this along with my love affair of cheese lead me to try the hot multi cheese sandwich. I did not know what to expect as on the menu it sounded like a grilled cheese sandwich.  My arrived on a plate with a small side of Cesar like salad.  The salad had a nice topping of shaved Parmesan, and the sandwich had a generous amount of micro greens in addition to the cheese. The micro greens gave the sandwich a nice bitterness to contrast the fattiness of the cheese. The crunch and slight char taste of the brick oven chibata style bread tied the entire thing together.  My bosses meal came on a old chipped plate, as if the kitchen had run out of the nice contemporary plates. This was troublesome as it was against health code. His meal of a cold meat sandwich and fruit salads looked appetizing as well.    I look froward to returning at night to try their pizza again.

RQADAwMm6rBwTD8S14b3Dg.text: Good food, loved the pizza and salads.  I'm definitely coming back! Cute place and awesome staff.  Ask for Shane!  :)

y8cvQab_oPmzaLQfHh0Xwg.text: Cute little place. Very quaint. We asked the server for pizza recommendations and was not disappointed. Just ask! Lemonade is delicious.

D-OetcWwbAnBgMqNqNQNcw.text: We were driving through Phoenix and found this place on Yelp. The outdoor patio was lovely, though it was too hot to sit outside at 5:00 p.m. The food was wonderful: a delicious and generous helping of burata, meatballs, and an arugala salad as good as any I've had.  The service was cheerful and efficient.

KulO1-6u74ft8A-tjpVoVA.text: Oh wow - pizza and ambiance were a homerun. Excellent service. But damn. That pizza - can't forget the taste! Be sure to build enough time to wait for a table. Although we only waited 20 mins on a Saturday night post 9pm.  The live jazz and outdoor seating decorated with dim bulbs makes it romantic and relaxing. Prego!

fYEwikUeC1lxZzp0iJmCRA.text: Amazing, feel good food that I can't get enough of. Staff is always professional and genuinely welcoming with a charismatic charm.

hAyXOF0HsLeDikd41UPDyg.text: 4 stars for appearance 3 stars for food. It left me torn on whether to leave 3 stars or 4 stars but considering it's a restaurant and not a garden, I went with 3.   Located in a small house inside of a beautiful courtyard area, you can enjoy the sounds of live music while paying a bit more than you should considering the quality of the food.  Ordered a pizza and it was pretty "meh". Thin, not very tasty, and not crunchy even though you'd assume it would be considering how thin it was. Service was also pretty lackluster. My drink was empty for majority of the meal and I waited to use the restroom for a good 15 minutes because there was a waitress taking her break in there. If you're not a big fan of good food, go for the atmosphere. It's a cute little place. The valet was awesome since it's a pain to park in the area.

Ofkj7kgsGxJpGwDpDJGkvg.text: We sat out on the patio for a beautiful afternoon lunch. Sandwiches were tasty. Service was slightly on the slow side. Limited menu, thought there would be more choices for lunch. Most menu items were repeated but you could choose hot or cold. We enjoyed ourselves and would recommend this place for a nice lunch downtown any time.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ask about gluten free items!

IYlQ0ACEasSEEuXoxbzX4A.text: Wonderful food and atmosphere. Very special little place which is great for dates and celebrations. Get the Fresca crepe with fruit and whipped cream.

sZ39EknW7BuexGX74lonJw.text: Very much enjoyed this place! Parking was a bit of a problem but sitting outside with lights on the True was very sweet. We shared a Genova pizza which was absolutely perfect in flavor and size. Not a white pizza but a no sauce pizza. This is a house made into a restaurant that has a lot of character. I will definitely be putting this back on my go to list for a second try.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

SF9rl_NEQHi5H_7bwMpzzA.text: GAWD, can't say enough good things! LOVE this place. GREAT pizza, good desserts, great service!

piHfBb1tGsfBr28fXfY9EQ.text: I love restaurants that have a good vibe, and this is just the place. They always have a live jazz band, pretty lights, and amazing food! Everyone should come here if they are in the area! I guarantee you'll love it!

hLniZFjjgqpTrN6loI03fw.text: One of my favorite places to eat! Excellent pizza, salads, drinks and service! Truly a staple in Phoenix Az!

C2ejeMOQflz5yB7qW-pIFA.text: Great ambiance, beautiful patio, good service. But most importantly the food was disappointing. The pizza looked appetizing but wasn't. I found the cheese to be bland and the prosciutto was basically diced ham. The only thing that was good was the burrata appetizer and the palline dessert.

7zsZbxGiC9rzLyx74LEiIg.text: Best gluten free pizza I have ever had!  My boyfriend and I came here on a date and we can't wait to go back. The food was amazing, the staff was friendly and very attentive and the prices were so reasonable.

y-k0BAetYos24QNXTkrz3w.text: Great place for happy hour!  We had the arancini and the meatballs. The arancini come 4 for $4.  They are deep fried rice balls with cheese.
