FSoUlSGtWvXUfP-TlA-ljA.text: I took my husband here for his birthday and the food was AMAZING! ! we had the calamari, with the tartufata pizza along with the banana Nutella crepe with a scoop of ice cream and my hubby had the Suzette. Everything was so tasty, the service was great we definitely left there very satisfied.

_7gi1xz2K-flnJpIPKSJUg.text: I came to this place with a friend, who raves about this place so I was excited to finally try it after all the hype that is was given on behalf of my friend. Sadly to say, I have had better pizza at a similar type restaurant to Cibo. The pizza that I had was soggy and had no flavor. I was very disappointed and do not believe that pizza should be eaten with a knife and fork. The only thing I liked was the dessert, which was the nutella crepe. I will never come pack here and stick to my favorite urban pizzaria, which is La Bocca in Tempe.

58g3CPbFl8omB83_xavu3A.text: I have not tasted food so authentically Italian since I left Italy. I was blown away by the menu and the fresh ingredients. Our salad and pizza was simple, fresh, and real! Well done on this shining star to our dining map here in Phoenix!  Bravo!!!

0K5maTnSPivRCnuYUoIrMg.text: We were here a couple of weekends ago for a friend's private party for her graduation from law school. We had heard a lot about Cibo and how great the pizza is, and it did not disappoint! We were out in the little carriage house behind the main restaurant due to the event being a private one, and it was so stinking cute! We had an open bar so we were just drinking the basic white & red wines they had, but whatever they were they were tasty! We were also happy to find that they carry Deschute's Fresh Squeezed IPA which is by far one of our favorite beers. For the food, we had lasagna, the meat & cheese board, a mixed salad, several types of pizza, and nutella crepes as a final treat! Basically, we were absolutely STUFFED by the time we left, but it was because the food was so good we wanted to keep eating it even after reaching the full point haha. I can't speak much to the cost of things, since again we were lucky enough to have all of our drinks & food taken care of by the hosts, but I can absolutely say that we will be giving Cibo another try for an upcoming date night!

Gz4uemsxni0QK0N2gnyWAw.text: Some people buy their wives jewelry, flowers or a puppy to say theyre sorry.. I just take mine to Cibo. Its the ultimate spot for good vibes and insanely addicting pizza. Definetly a gem I hope never dies.

UrJQycv8sp0BdlCAHZJQhQ.text: This historic little house has charm oozing from every wall and corner. It is set up in such a way that you feel like you're having a quaint and intimate meal at a friend's home. The husband and I found our way here for brunch on Sunday afternoon just before it closed at 2pm. Service was great and the food was delicious. My husband had the pulled pork sandwich which was tasty. I had the Prosciutto e Funghi crepes and loved it. Everything tasted fresh and flavorful.   We were disappointed that they weren't serving pizza but we learned that they only serve pizza after 5pm. We have heard legendary things about their pizza so we will probably be back this weekend to make sure we get a taste.

NgHzndqsVMimkibjjTo69g.text: Great italian food.  Fresh, home made pasta.  Great Pizzas.  Real italian flavor, not americanized.  One of the best pizza places I've been to in the country.  Also worth noting that this restaurant is actually an old home that was re-purposed.  The have several rooms inside which each accommodate an individual group.  However, when the weather is nice, the "front yard" is the place to enjoy your wonderful meal.

nMA9O8gt4jS2bS8ZJX78Aw.text: I visited this dainty little restaurant on what looks to be a not-so-nice area of Phoenix built into a house with an adorable front seating area while visiting family in AZ.  My friends were raving about this place while we sat at Gino's East in Chicago dining on what I like to think as some of the finest pizza around.  So for someone to suggest there was good pizza, in Arizona, I had to see it to believe it.    The inside is literally the front of a house with a bar area immediately to your right, a table for a large group set front and center, with the kitchen behind it, and bathrooms that in any other setting someone would have viewed the cracked toilet seat and floor tiles as grotesque, but here, the added bouquet of flowers and wall mirror made for a rustic, inside-someone's-personal-house, geriatric feel.    We sat outside, as the temperature had cooled down to a manageable, sunless 90 degrees and my friend's fiance was meeting up with us with her puppy (yes it's dog friendly). The outside patio was separated into two areas with the main walkway down the middle.  The floor was made up of mismatched bricks, some jutting up, with small two to four seat, wrought iron tables strategically placed around the center where a tree was unruly growing out of the brick and mud.  They had decorated it with a string of white lights which gave the atmosphere of the perfect place for a date.   Everything at Cibo is cooked in their fire-grill oven, and they mostly have wine with a few specialty beers brought to you by a rather odd waiter.  We first ordered an appetizer of Schiacciata Maremma, half without eggplant and our little sandwiches came with just enough time to gobble them up before my friend's fiance arrived and even knew we ordered.  The crunch of the bread from the wood-fired oven with the melted cheese holding the vegetables in was the perfect start to a fantastic meal.  We then ordered pizzas, the Pizza Rosse Vegetariana and I believe my friend had the Di Notte pizza, adding potatoes.  The crust was thin and had just the right amount of crisp, but still strong enough to hold the massive amount of toppings.  I wouldn't compare it to Gino's East, but overall, it was a pretty good, healthy pizza.  It felt almost homemade.    We finished the meal off with a nutella and strawberry crepe which was to DIE for.  There are few restaurant chef's that seem to make a crepe the correct way, thin, less like a pancake, and still strong enough to hold together your ingredients. They managed to get the crepe and ingredients just right and we walked away extremely full and satisfied.  Not before her 3 month old puppy went to sit on the neighboring tables lap after they picked her up.  An extremely chill, relaxing atmosphere.  I highly recommend finding this Phoenix gem while you are in town.

2zxVkEmZbocqNyA8d3LFRQ.text: My mother-in-law took us here when our friend from Japan was visiting. I would definitely go back! The service was excellent, and the food was, of course, delicious! We had a cheese platter, two pizzas (I don't remember what kind, but they were good!), and awesome drinks. Our server was friendly, had great suggestions, and was very patient with us. Oh, and the atmosphere was great -- very warm and inviting. Overall, we were very satisfied.

4S8Wz_9J2kNgRBirYyVnPQ.text: Went for lunch by myself when I was serving as a juror at the Municpal Court.  I loved it.  The service was great.  The food was outstanding.  The price was good.  The old house had a wonderful feeling.  I will return again for sure!    I had an eggplant parm sandwhich with a salad and highly recommend both!

fjL4kQ0f4k1FBUQnZg6YVw.text: Pizza with a thin but amazingly flavorful crust, delicious cheese and spicy salami, and not AFRAID to add just the right amount of mouth-watering sauce! Highly recommend for great vintage atmosphere and friendly service.

KAImyoX6c1vJ0BnShdxRXA.text: I think most locals are familiar with this spot, but for me, being from Tempe this was quite the treat. With an awesome spacious patio, that truly has that garden, been here forever feel, it already deserved five stars. But the goodness didn't end with the scenery, food and wine were rare for Arizona dining and the staff is well trained and on top of their stuff. With my girlfriend previously owning and selling a restaurant, I am familiar with the work and dedication it takes to be successful. The owners certainly know what their doing and have created a big success with Cibo, would love to see one in Tempe.

mTkAnVHC4gzIM8ByIpfT0g.text: I love the outdoor dining, but feel a bit claustrophobic inside. Expect long wait times during peak hours (and potentially slow service), but the food is good and the staff is friendly. Based on the wait times when I've visited, I've only been twice. Both pizza's were delish.

cvGO5HOvo2vBtTVX5O9xYA.text: So good from beginning to end.  The Margarita Pizza was SO good.  Best pizza I have had here so far. The fruit and crepe was a great finish to a great dinner!

PikKYBE-ydBp5rqplLJsew.text: My husband and I recently moved to the Phoenix area and for out first date night out away from the house and baby, we were blown away by this restaurant. The food was delicious, and as close as we have come to real Italian outside of our home as we have ever had (they have rice balls too!). The atmosphere is great, with live music outside, and Italian music on the radio inside, and lights strung everywhere. We're usually a little critical because we used to eat out so often, we weren't expecting this place to live up to the reviews. But it does! I definitely recommend trying this place. :)

2GSq1kxKHRdwLeAXF9pm6A.text: It was on a Sunday afternoon when I planted my heart in this restaurant. I didn't expect to fall in love with the decor not to mention the food...I was a little nervous ordering but after I ate their pizza my belly didn't have any bad reaction to their cheese or meat so I was relieved. I will definitely return

P6A6sAdafe11d7kGi8dsZw.text: The Porcellino sandwich is excellent!  It's pulled pork on great saltimbocca bread baked fresh daily.  The iced tea is fresh and is wonderful!  Sit outside in the garden and enjoy the soon to be cooler weather.  For dessert have a yummy crepe!

X5y1hdPM7KWIt-CPas8DAw.text: Yeah, another fiver, we had an amazing meal hear this weekend.  All the pizzas were great, I especially love the dough, it has so much flavor and perfect texture.  We were crepe crazy and ordered four of them, and they were so goooood! The orange marmalade one turned out to be my fav, I didn't expect that, but wow! It was so good! The marscapone and berry was a very close second.  I do have to mention for the sake of hoping it will help, not our waitress (she was AMAZING!) but the girl who brought the food to us, had a shitty attitude.  Thinkin a tune up is in order.

UdcqQ-ZQo4VJcJRNgh9ccA.text: Charming, great food. Lovely outdoor seating. Can get too crowded at times, but a wonderful place for a date, business meeting or a night out with friends.

D_d880FWlfcoDDS_kquUFg.text: He said... I'll take u to wherever u want to go.. You pick... I said Cibo!!!!!!  I had very high expectations for this place because everyone is always talking about it and telling me how amazing it is. I finially got a chance to try it out for the first time this past weekend.    So we ordered the prosciutto pizza.. I wasn't that impressed as I would hope to be. I felt like there should've been more on there. Maybe some basil, veggies, mushrooms? Something? It was just a pizza topped with some prosciutto.  I also got my favorite type of red wine. Pinot noir. Delicious. I definitely love their wine here.   It really is a perfect spot for a date. Super romantic. Disappointed about the pizza we got but I'll definitely come back to try the others. =)

l7Hl9fevMtWapFDeHwIsuA.text: This place is amazing! Perfect place to take a date. Beautiful atmosphere with a laid back vibe. I was Intensely listening to her speak.. Until I took a bite of that divalo pizza... Ooooooi that sauce! It was love at first taste. Forgot I was trying to impress a lady.. completely ignored her for roughly 5 minutes and made love to that pie.   I had an app too. No idea what it was called but I it was fantastic! Cream filled mozz ball with tomatoes, bread and of course balsamic reduction.   If I lived closer I'd be broke! Nough said.

Bg-FM1o8_mY20irUCrGdpA.text: OMG!! I'm in love. I've lived in Italy and despite the fact that I was young, the pizza there was to die for. Cibo is authentic Italian thin crust pizza. I want to go everyday just to try everything on the menu. We ordered two pizzas for 2 adults and a tween and the tween devoured damn near a whole pizza by herself. I know to order more next time, but all in all. It was soooo delicious!! My new favorite pizza spot. Thanks cibo.

8K-pwquvMxN_AJUMthmFxA.text: I will start by saying that I lived in the Northern Region of Italy for four years and I loved every minute of it. This place reminds me of the fabulous eateries throughout Italy. Not only does the restaurant have the feel of Italy but the food is simple amazing. My wife and I enjoyed the place so much that we are taking six other friends and introducing them to Cibo. I have mixed emotions about posting this. The upside of the posting is that it allows others to read about the restaurant and then indulge in its fine food and atmosphere, the downside to the posting is that the word gets out and it becomes harder and harder to get a table. Oh well , the wait is worth the reward.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The meatballs are sooooo good!

Lxy5ubZRfNWib_KQKLYQRw.text: Wow. I cannot wait to come back. This place is a True little gem of Phoenix. I went to a really amazing True Italian restaurant in SD awhile back and I was hoping to find one here in AZ . Well, I found it and all of my dreams came True. Please order the Burrata and let it melt in your mouth, please! You won't be disappointed. Also, that pizza dough is spot on.

0XT6gI41rNZI8k2fpHruhQ.text: Pizza is unreal! Do the caprese as an appetizer (not your typical stacked caprese). Such a cute atmosphere inside and outside on the patio.

UbBwhZKnK8lN0yavEBlKHA.text: Fantastic, great place for a date night, and fresh and delicious food!

w1FcpA8hZPgaV9JX2wk08Q.text: Cibo has the best food and amazing ambiance. Certainly one of the best restaurants in Phoenix!

ZAw8PJMf_e8jOrhT5QxZWg.text: Whaaaat!! We left Boston and found a restaurant that if we could pick it up with a helicopter we could drop if into the North End and it would be like the bar scene in Star Wars where it was business as usual. Waiting on a crepe so.... Got to go... Put this on your bucket list.  Go Pats!!!!' The Caprese salad and the Spinache sandwich are amazing!!  The service was amazing too!!  You have to order a crepe!!

ktVKvfZj_MyOw5wCtmSfqg.text: Great food and romantic vibe! Took my wife here and we had an amazing night with great food and drinks. Love the complementary valet parking and ambience. Would recommend for any couples looking for a nice date!

bwTZ5Fh4Ed6O2XjMUebG4w.text: Real Italian pizza. Awesome food and wine. I always get 1/2 Di Notte and 1/2 Diavola pizza, and it never disappoints. Crepes for desert are a plus! Also love that they have live music on the patio at the evenings, perfect spot for a date!

hY6Kpf2E6FlqRGqbT8NVHQ.text: Always impressed with my experience here.  Food is amazing, wine menu is long and dessert crepe is well worth over stuffing yourself for.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nutella and Mascerpone crepe is most amazing.

WXo5nJ3D_vhTDMoVHmWF_w.text: Overall, our experience here was great! The food was absolutely perfect. No complaints. The place was busy and the wait staff was a bit preoccupied, so our check took a bit longer to come. Also, valet was pretty much the only way to park because the street parking was full for blocks. Music? It was amazing. The background music sounded a lot like 70's girl pop from Italy and psychedelic jam bands from the 60's-70's. 'd it!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresca.
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried ball of rice and oozy cheese.
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried ball of rice and cheese.

AG09YmsO2Vwv8Oli0lzQuw.text: Amazing food, taste and quality. Pizza came out under 5 minutes after ordered, loved it.   Get these: DaVinci pizza +sausage and roasted red peppers  Margarita pizza   Friday night love jazz till 10 made a great date night atmosphere, and a group of 20+ mid twenties group behind was having a fun time too.   Calzones are HUGE Bruschetta was only thing not good

8GMj1MrI_-Sjd4V7RqKPBA.text: Ordered the Margherita pizza and it was a little undercooked, floppy for my crust preference. However, I had an amazing desert here. The doughballs were amazing so that's why I gave 3 stars.

L8cLSThAXWadPB2Jc4WFwg.text: The setting is beautiful. They have a live guitarist .. it's nice to stop by when the weather is nice due to the decor if you decide to eat outside . They also offer indoor eating as well but it's a little crowded. Service was good / the food could have tasted a wee bit better . Overall it was a nice experience! I recommend it

hhBrX-kUgrlScDgpmA2qvA.text: the food was ok. Make sure the hostess see you if you decide to wait for a table. We waited for 90 min for a table while couples after us showed up. I was behind one of the bushes and I dont usually say anything but it got frustrating after a while. Food was ok. Servers were nice and prompt.

wGjPeobxQu723PUlvKLYtg.text: Holy $#!T !!   I'm not one to use profanity when describing a restaurant, but this place was absolutely amazing.  I visited back in March and loved the atmosphere, and recently returned to see if that was a fluke, or if Cibo is the real deal.  The food, top notch.  We got a pizza, pasta & crepe.  Everything was authentic, not from a box, and had fresh ingredients.    We sat on the patio and it was secluded, quiet, and romantic.  A perfect end to the work week.  Thank you Cibo for creating a wonderful environment for fellow Arizonians to enjoy any day of the week!  We will definitely be returning!

QmkP5ssxtBHh5Bqx_oIJrA.text: Artisan pizza, salad, wine .....end with a little dessert and coffee.......ohh what could be better?? This place has been one of my favs for YEARS  and it continues to keep on meeting ( exceeding?) my expectations!   It is a bit pricey, but it doesn't stop us! it's always packed!!   You have definitely got to go here, I really think you'll enjoy the whole experience!!    Best pizza... Artisan not NY or Chicago style.....just sayin!

OgQen_S876oeBfCYwplk9Q.text: I wanted to like this place. The restaurant is in an old house or what looks like an old house. It's cute, quaint, cool, romantic. The moment I walked in, I thought I'd be going back frequently. But the food is very so so. The pizza crust tastes good but is far too chewy. The meatballs (we got them as an appetizer) were too large and too uneven in consistency. The meat didn't appear to have been blended thoroughly with whatever other ingredients they used. And everything was a bit cold. This all might be okay in the far flung reaches of Mesa. But if you are going to be down the street from Bianco and Pomo, you need to get this stuff right. They didn't.

-IYZCOxfPul3lwNLvew_-Q.text: This is another lunch pick up I tried. House-like eatery on the corner with outside seats to meet up with friends. Walked in in late afternoon. Not many people in there eating.  Saltimbocca are sandwiches. They don't serve pizza for lunch but somehow are known for pizzas. Their saltimbocca descriptions totally sound like pizza descriptions. Lol when we picked up our food we were expecting pizza boxes. They were sandwich boxes! What a let down!  We hoped that the saltimbocca will be deliciousoso!!   Shared half of the hot Vegetariano (grilled red bell pepper, eggplant, zucchini and mozzarella) and the  porcellino (pulled BBQ pork and mozzarella). I enjoyed the vegetariano because it was all veggies and much lighter than the porcellino - which was siting on the heavy side. Also comes with a side of house salad of greens, pine nuts, red onion and shavings of cold cheese.   I guess I'll have to try the pizza another time....for dinner. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Half porcellino &amp; vegetariano saltimbocca

nA9aTT5KSdAVSnExdWxH4w.text: Their pizza is fantastic. I try a different version during each visit. Have not had a bad one yet!  Try the marinara with mozzarella added.   Not for those that have an aversion to anchovies!  Delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quiet romantic alcove.

CrRJJXuvG_uyLWci4LooFg.text: CIBO is a pizza restaurant in a quiet part of downtown Phoenix. With a range of vegetarian options that taste just fine, CIBO is a go-to spot in downtown Phoenix if you're looking to get out of the hotel but not venture too far into the desert.  CIBO feels like one big home. Well, that might be because the restaurant exterior looks like a home. My server was a bit quirky: he had jokes, but also had a knack for stopping by our table at the most inopportune times. He reminded me of the mom calling about the squirrels in the GEICO commercial.   The food at CIBO is affordable: I paid $14 for a plate of pasta (linguine cacao e pepe) and $11 for a margherita pizza. I wouldn't recommend the pasta - it was as plain as a white t-shirt. The microgreens on top were a nice touch, but out of place. The pizza was tasty, but I avoided eating the crust.  I would return again if I were staying in downtown Phoenix, but the food wasn't particularly memorable. My strongest memory of CIBO was of the two people making out outside the restaurant as I was leaving. The food? Good enough, but not as memorable.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita pizza
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Linguine cacio e pepe

fAR2sEofsftm_Mk234GvWA.text: Amazing service with a smile and recognition from the staff after my second visit. Tasty food and good atmosphere. Great place, I will definitely come again! :)

ub2FN7hJ1OQ2dErfSbJcxA.text: Great little spot in Phoenix for lunch. I was in town and grabbed a quick lunch with a friend. The patio is shaded and is oriented beautifully. (It compliments well with great weather) They have a great selection of draft beer and their bread here is amazing. The bread is made to order and made in house. (both of which impressed me) Pizza was a little soggy and wet for my preference but otherwise tasted great. Servers were very nice and attentive. Wouldn't mind coming here again.

Vgo9GJepcLl9ytN0iGl-dg.text: Such a fun date spot!! Great for lunch, too! Patio is super romantic at night with the twinkle lights. Pizzas can be made 1/2 & 1/2 if you can't decide between two flavors... I couldn't! The caprese salad was delicious. Mozzarella, tomatoes & basil were super fresh. Great start to a perfectly fired pizza. Yum!

aH4gFH9svFvUS5c17vNQiw.text: Dog friendly! Nice patio seating, inside seating feels a bit more cramped. The food was decent, I do not rememberable having anything that swept me off my feet with wow factor. The atmosphere is what sells here, the patio is nice in the evenings and light up with white outdoor Christmas lighting, or something along those lines.

IOJBXiWlWGfZPHfmKR9RNw.text: Yelp's noting my check-ins here and asking what keeps me coming back.   What keeps me coming back?  The burrata. A meal in itself. A perfect dish to share in such a romantic setting...smear some of the creamy, milky burrata on a toast piece and top with delicate prosciutto and chase it with super-garlicky, perfectly acidic, tiny tomatoes.  The crust. Perfectly chewy crust delivers the pizza toppings of your choice. Red or white: you can't go wrong!  The ambiance. This place has such charm! I love the setting; whether on the patio or inside, it's the kind of place you could linger and solve the world's problems over a bottle of wine and course after course of delicious food!

RHz5GPYRSEKxNGpoJd0QqA.text: Wonderful food and service. We had a big group on the patio and had a great time. The Patio is gorgeous!!

OSrR0QHzbCkY1hYrescfaQ.text: You mainly come to Cibo for the pizza which I personally feel is arguably better than pizzaria bianco without it even really being their main specialty, it's just what people know this place for! I split a pizza and a pasta with a date and had the calamari appetizer.   The appetizer was not that impressive to be honest. It was steaks of calamari about 2 fingers width fried up. The batter itself was good but I think if you're an Italian place you should have calamari that's rings and tentacles.   Their pizza here is incredible. It's about a 12 inch serving good for and appetizer or splitting along with another entree. The pizza is thin crust that's dough while also maintaining a thin and crispy feeling. Pretty much perfect brick oven pizza.   Their pastas are extremely well done and the server said their pasta is all made in house which you can truly taste.   The wait staff here is incredibly friend and nice, the atmosphere is very cozy and intimate though you can definitely bring a larger group if your heart so desires.    Parking is extremely easy with complimentary valet. Definitely recommend this place.

k6_F2s7Uw6FLZcPo75ZbhQ.text: We called and asked if we could make a reservation and the guy who answered the phone laughed and said no. We showed up around 7:30 and there was at least a one hour wait. Put our name on the list and went to the bar to wait for our table. Bartender was awesome. After an hour we had to go to our event so we left and received a text message 15 minutes later saying our table was ready LOL! Can't comment on the food but seemed like everybody was enjoying themselves and Patio was exceptional.

ot4DYzgHns73xXFLUxgJlA.text: Didn't eat the food but we called ahead to ask about their HH and were incredibly disappointed. NO SPIRITS in the building! Just beer and wine. They had a few house wines on HH, but I needed a stiff one. We went across to The Vig.

bai_wjwAn8vCdlrjxLaoKw.text: We came here for a double date night and as we stepped in, I absolutely adored the design of the restaurant. It was as though it was someone's house with multiple rooms, diverse paintings, and a beautiful outdoor patio.   We all ordered pizza to share. They also let you do half and half on your pizza so you don't have to be stuck with one type. We ordered half Genova and half La Noce. Super delicious!!

zz98P76QnqXpudKveb-Fiw.text: Obsessed with this amazing cafe. Delicious coffee and treats and a fun place to meet with friends and do work.   Matcha latte is soooo good and must try their homemade goodies. The best cafe in Sausalito by far!

I4pk0PFwwl6Kk4eBP36RAQ.text: I first went here with my husband on Valentine's Day 3 years ago.  That was my husband's FAVORITE meal ever there, and he hasn't been pleased since unfortunately.  I wish that at lunch I could get broiled shrimp on my salad, and then I'd be here as often as I can.  I love the salads and the atmosphere.  It should be open later so we can go after the symphony and have a lovely crepe dessert and adult beverage.

2RY5I689CToo55FCs8ACeA.text: Cane here tonight with my husband and were immediately welcomed by twinkle lighting and cozy dining outside. We enjoyed the delicious bread, amazing pizza, and a refreshing goat cheese salad.

ZbJOMxnevOhEDpwtn8dm9A.text: great pizza...nothing bad to say about this place except i wish it was bigger!! Been several times great every single time

h8H30kSGGsPtUQB_S32OBw.text: Had a great lunch here last week.   The patio is great and really fits the vibe of the neighborhood and the restaurant.   Great pizzas and sandwiches.  Drinks looked great but had to go back to work.   Valet parking is a plus!

7h192ZcEr6v_3MFdjzFicw.text: Alright, so I'm just going to start off by saying that I was running on a short amount of time in the area & my only main mission was the crepes. lol. YES, you read correctly. I'm a huge sucker for an awesome, crisp to perfection, deliciously stuffed, delightfully tasteful crepe & I will tell you this, they are HARD to find.  Before calling it a night last night, I didn't want to take the chances of missing the opportunity to enjoy one of these babies before our departure back home. So, I called in an order around 10pm (luckily they close at 11 on saturday nights). I ordered the banana & nutella crepe w/strawberries added to it. I didn't want the 'a la mode' as I didn't want the ice cream melting on the drive home.   O.M.G.......This was delicious! I HAD to open it up in the car to see what it looked like (wish I hadn't, it made me hungrier) it looked amazing! As soon as we got back to our rooms, I couldn't help but start indulging it. It was perfectly crispy on the outside with drizzled chocolate and powdered sugar on top, the inside was even more of a delight being completely stuffed!   I'll definitely be back, you've won Cibo. Let's see what your entree's have to offer next.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banana &amp; nutella crepe w/strawberries inside.

xMI_LWAE1YUyU-Zz7w0F_Q.text: Meh.  It's okay if you like your pizza crust soggy.  I've been several times before and the crust has always been soggy.  On my most recent visit I asked them to bake the crust longer to make it crispy.  It was soggy again.    Please note one point of caution regarding the other reviews of this restaurant.  This place may be quicker to get into, but it is most definitely NOT anywhere near the caliber of Pizzeria Bianco.  Would every pizza chef in town who has a James Beard Award please raise their hand?  On March 18th I received this message from Karen Martingilio:   Dear Ted, thanks for giving us a couple of tries, everyone has their opinion about what they like in a pizza, in Italy they use a knife and fork, we make our crust more soft and chewy more Italian style, and that does not appeal to everyone, however to imply that our other reviewers are just coming to us because the wait is shorter, or that we take less pride in our product then others is somewhat mean spirited, I m sure you didn t intend to insult our dedicated chef or our restaurant but unfortunately it could be misinterpeted by other Yelpers, you are intitled to your opinion and so are our fans on Yelp, thanks again for your imput, Karen Martingilio  Yelpers, as Karen notes above, I am entitled to my opinion.  Her email does not change my opinion in any way.

VEeDNUyissrSWZy9H5ZWqg.text: I don't understand the great reviews for this place. I went here on a nice evening and decided to sit outside. The atmosphere outside is alright. Cute little old house set up. Big deal.  The service is horrible and our waitress didn't seem to listen at all. We ordered some bruschetta. It was ok at best. We then said we were probably interested in trying the lasagna, but to come back in a few more minutes. We told her we changed our minds on the lasagna and wanted to share a four cheese pizza. About 5 minutes later, we get lasagna. She said sorry it came out so fast and the pizza would be out in 10 minutes. We decided it wasn't such a huge deal and we could take that home. However, it is totally rude for one person to get their food and not the other person. Who does that?? We then get our pizza.  On to the awful food. Like I said, the bruschetta was ok. Postinos is 100 times better. The lasagna, we just boxed. My boyfriend ate it the next day and said it was horrible. I make much better at home, and this was some extra special dish they had. The pizza.......oh my. It SERIOUSLY tasted like I took a bunch of cheese and melted it in the microwave. It was some of the worst pizza I have ever had.  I will never go back. Horrible service and horrible food. I don't get why they have such good reviews. Maybe because it is in downtown and its a cool place to go hang out. Go to Angels Trumpet.

9KXvYo7vCYyOy2tcvnlJnQ.text: Cute, cozy restaurant in downtown Phoenix. Nice alternative to waiting hours to get into Pizzeria Bianco. The pizza here was delicious, with yummy varieties to choose from. I haven't tried the regular italian food on the menu, but I've heard it's good as well.

6aoB9u10fftHbK_s7Ki4yg.text: I have eaten at this place several times  and loved it.. but recently I noticed something has changed..   The food and service has gone downhill  what happened ??     I ordered the sample meat appetizer well there was one slice of each of the meat and the rest mostly cherry tomato's not worth the price anymore..  We ordered 4 pizza's for the table .. they all were under cooked soggy  a real mess.. The taste was bland..  Our waitress seemed like she was somewhere else.. would disappear a lot.  It was almost impossible get water refills..  oh  I forgot mention ... the pizza had a burnt flour taste.. which means they need to clean there ovens..   Sorry Cibo I loved coming to your place but not worth it any more..

ScG-UEkpAPyfgzBNFfyrYA.text: Some of the best pizza in Phoenix and wonderful ambience too! Every pizza I've had is delicious, and lots of vegetarian friendly options.

GBpBtzoWlWuQ2_LSlGctJw.text: I can't think of a better place to enjoy a glass of wine and an amazing antipasto or calzone. This place has probably one of the best patios in Phoenix and the coolest part is that it is an old historical district house that was transformed into a mom and pop style italian kitchen. I have tried quite a few things on their menu from the burrata and proscuitto to multiple different pizzas and they have managed to walk away unscathed and for that, the patio, the service, and ambiance I think they deserve 5 stars.

phcdU8xqDOhqKPucytzpyw.text: Fresh food leaves me feeling light and refreshed every time

pscbbMwV5E-_7skFyCOY4Q.text: Visited the Phoenix area from Chicago several times, and always wanted to try Cibo.  Glad we finally did!  My wife and I split a few things for lunch in the nice outdoor seating area.  The Alla Parmigiana sandwich with the side salad, and the Margherita pizza were all exceptional!  Definitely a return visit will be in order!

Yvb3eesUDy_N7E1PizWUdw.text: The place you go to when you are not in the mood to deal with the surly crowds at Bianco.  Great setting, good pizza, and excellent desserts.

dNDiVCOIg0Mgfj5goIq2fQ.text: I have to say that this place is the best of the best. I come here regularly, and the servers always recognize me (I don't know it that's a good thing or bad thing). It's a great place to enjoy wine and dinner before you head out for the night. Also, a great first date place. I brought my boyfriend (from a small town in Michigan) to Cibo for dinner, and he absolutely loved it... nothing like this in his small hometown.   And the best part about this restaurant... the CREPES. Yes, they are absolutely delicious. I recommend the strawberry and nutella with whipped cream... YUM!

WoO1bdmmuqNftYBln1MwyA.text: The pizza didn't really impress that much, it was just alright. You come here for the atmosphere. It was nice to seat outside withe lights on the tree.

TuJgAu7TzJfp7TSvPAKciQ.text: Absolutely the best! So great, my husband actually proposed to me here. The quality of the ingredients are truly amazing, and you can't top the ambiance. This place holds a special place in my heart.

R_0SNVCsG5u8PeFUJWqN6A.text: 2 words--not impressed.   I called ahead to see if we could make a reservation for our party of 3 as we had show tickets and was informed that they do not take reservations for parties smaller than 8. I was assured however that we should have NO PROBLEM being seated promptly at 6PM on a Saturday evening. Our show was at 8PM so I figured a 2 hour window should have been ample. It's just pizza--how hard can it be? Boy was I wrong.  Well guess what? The restaurant was P.A.C.K.E.D. We waited 20 minutes to be seated which wasn't too bad for a Saturday evening at a popular spot but when the expectation was already set that it "wouldn't be a problem" to get seated, it was annoying.  The hostesses were friendly and pleasant tho so it was hard to be outwardly annoyed.   We were finally seated inside and proceeded to wait some more for a server to come by and take our drink order. 10 minutes passed when I flagged down a busser to ask if we could get someone to take our drink order. A few short minutes later, our server arrived and so it began...the glare. The "can't you see I'm very busy and you'll just have to wait" glare. Sigh. Because we were seated in a smaller room, it was very noisy and our server REFUSED to speak louder to share with us the beers they had available. We aren't deaf...it was just loud. She wouldn't move closer to the person asking, she wouldn't speak louder, nothing. And then she walked away...and 10 minutes later, she passed by to inform us that the bartender was backed up and it would be a few more minutes but didn't stop long enough to take our appetizer or dinner order. Fortunately, the busser was VERY on top of keeping our water filled so at least we had SOMETHING to drink. Drinks finally came out and we had to ask her to take our appetizer order. Again the "can't you see I'm busy" glare. It was 30 minutes after seating that our appetizer finally came. We ordered the Burrata which is fresh mozzarella with proscuitto and toast. Although the mozzarella and proscuitto were delicious, the toast was burnt...visibly burnt. I'm not even sure why she put it in front of us that's how burnt it was. But, we couldn't send it back because no one ever came by to check on us.   More time passes and everyone in the room has received their appetizers, entrees, and have moved on to dessert except for us. We are still waiting for our entrees and are watching the clock. At 7:20, I flagged down our server who gave me the glare again to ask her if our pizzas were coming out soon as we had show tickets. Instead of "I'm so sorry for the wait, let me check on that for you" I received the "I'd call you a bitch if I wouldn't get fired for it" glare and this time the glare was accompanied by a lecture that there was a party in the Carriage House. I had NO idea what the Carriage House was or why a party there had any effect on our meals but our server had already huffed off before I could ask. So we googled. Turns out Carriage House is part of Cibo where they serve large parties. Good to know...would have been better to know back when we were getting seated about these delays but so be it. Our pizzas arrived at the table at 7:30 PM. We have now been at Cibo for 90 minutes. Our show was at Comerica and was starting at 8PM. We scarfed down that pizza as fast as we could and Ms. Glare left us the check at least when she dropped our pizzas.   After all that waiting, rudeness, and more waiting, honestly? I've had better pizza at Picazzos. This pizza was thin looking but was doughy. The sausage on the Salsiccia was sparse at best. The Rustica wasn't cut properly so we were fighting with the proscuttio. Both were just ok. It was really very anti-climatic.   Cibo was a major disappointment. Considering all the rave reviews here on Yelp, I am that much more disappointed that our experience was so dismal. I wish I could tell you our server's name. If she said it, we sure didn't hear her and I'm pretty sure she didn't say it. There are lots of other options downtown. You might consider not going to Cibo unless you go with a larger party because apparently that's the only way to get good service and properly prepared food.

Pbd5DA8wRrlU26nc1cvCrQ.text: Got the sausage pizza for lunch and found it to be tasty. Service was attentive and friendly, and the outdoor patio was really cute!

rywPhHWzWgDKXGPvH5ilLQ.text: Took someone out on a date here as per recommendation from a friend and was completely blown away! Their pizza is the best I've had in a long LONG time, accompanied by fantastic wine and some great company =) The service was boast-worthy and the establishment is a quaint little atmosphere that can cater to your needs; giving you a great place if you look dress-casual for a nice night of drinks or shorts and a t-shirt if you're just looking for some good eats and a relaxing night off. Cibo is really a gem!  Keep singing,  -Jerron

775VPYgtqSgr2XSYjXtFIg.text: WOW! Great place to relax and have some good food! My new Favorite in Phoenix for Italian! Great Salads! Great Wine!

xGJ2MY06IUHTtOYX0nfSWA.text: Great spot for some outdoor dining. Whatever else you do, make sure you order the burrata appetizer at Cibo. Just order it. Go. Hurry.

y42ghrpJsFk_3-scQyXNLg.text: One of the best patios in Downtown Phoenix. Love the atmosphere!  The salads and pizza are all amazing! It's my go to spot for lunch or a nice dinner. Romantic yet casual, this is one of my favorite spots!

4LL378Ed3XPcXAsRuiO0uQ.text: This place was great! We were told by some locals to come here rather than waiting in a two hour line for the other favorite pizza spot in the area.  the atmosphere really made the dinner!   It's an old house redone as a restaurant... we sat outside and there were twinkly lights everywhere and a great jazz musician playing live music in the background.   Our group of 10 ordered 8 different pizza's plus a couple of the special pasta dishes.  Both pasta dishes were out of this world, and the pizza's were tasty and above average.  (but i'm super picky about my pizza's) It was a great meal and a great atmosphere, and next time I visit I would go back.

eOAwHrfTuzoTbQv6vLD8Pw.text: After reading all the favorable reviews, we decided to make reservation for our party of 7 one month in advance.  The restaurant is located in downtown Phoenix to what looks to be a residential neighborhood.  It is ranked as one of the top first date places and the ambience is very romantic.   It reminds me of one of those restaurants that you stroll across with a beachfront dining in some romantic resort town.    We ordered a total of 5 pizza's, 2 appetizers, and 3 desserts for our party.  The pizza's were phenomenal, much better than the other place that has a wait of 3 hours.  The pizza's that stood out were the one with truffle oil and a red spicy sauce with ham.  Sorry, I don't have the names of the pizza's as I let my friends do the ordering.     Be sure to save room for dessert!  We ordered 3 crepes (nutella with banana, creme cheese, and fresca).  Each was delicious.  Upon leaving we were stuffed, but left with the satisfaction that this was one of the best pizza's we've ever had.  The service was great,  our waiter provided some really good tips and recommendations.  We'll be back on our next Giants Spring Training trip!!

VZbu7XdRzPo5xsoVLxE6rw.text: Great food and great atmosphere.  It's best if you go when the weather is nice so you can enjoy their patio.

nhKPnpObY9X_uQn4y1-ndw.text: Best atmosphere. Worst pizza. Ever!!! Bland sausage, bland cheese, bland and watery tomato sauce. Rubbery calamari with noncomplimentary sauce. I have no idea what the hype is all about.

6lPcdqFbAQOvq8pJDdgpug.text: The gluten free pizza was the best I have ever had. It was thicker than most GF pizzas. It was also homemade. My husband liked his pizza but he likes thicker crust and it was too thin for him. We loved the atmosphere. The staff was also wonderful. We will be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The gluten free pizza is the best I have ever had. They do cook it in the wood fire oven with the other pizzas but so good.

C45-wKLgYXcOz61aVf5e8A.text: AMAZING FOOD! The outside patio is so pretty at night too. There are lights and pretty vines everywhere. We got the Diablo pizza and the calamari and it was so yummy. I have already recommended it to my family and I will definitely be going back again soon.

mKmtFcfmH3PCuMC9NS_UXg.text: Great atmosphere, perfect for a date night. Can't go wrong with their pizza and save room for dessert: their sweets menu is exceptional!

_cwUsyithFtLuAaixzY9uQ.text: Our favorite pizza in AZ. There are many wood fired pizza places but there is something about Cibo that makes them our favorite. The crust is fired to a crisp yet just chewy enough texture. The cheeses and sauces are so fresh and delicious. On this trip we enjoyed the Caprese salad, sausage pizza and calzone that was filled with salami, prosciutto, ricotta, mozzarella and sauce. We have had Bianco and Cibo and we enjoy Cibo just a little more.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Calzone
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sausage pizza
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Caprese salad

NzBF5NlOASRYmN_fvXEMww.text: One of the best, if not the best pizza in all of Phoenix in my opinion.  It is very similar to the more famous Bianco style of pizza, however way less of  a wait.  Every pizza I've had from Cibo is excellent.  The decor and atmosphere is fantastic and perfect for a romantic date.    They have a great outdoor area and on a nice night when the weather is right, you can't ask for a more perfect/romantic setting.    Just so you know, if you are in the mood for some pizza for lunch, this isn't your place.  Pizza is only served at dinner and I think it's only sandwiches and salads for lunch.  I recommend it all though!

kygv7Mm4gY0QgqRw4IXeVQ.text: Went in and it was happy hour so ordered a mix of various appetizers and waited until they were done before ordering a pizza. I don't remember what everything was and their online menu doesn't seem to show it, but there were these chewy pieces of dough served with fresh basil, and tomato sauce, a rice ball stuffed with mozzarella and meatballs with crusty bread. All of it was outstanding. Not wanting to leave without trying a pizza, I ordered a margherita pizza and it was excellent. Check this place out, it's very good and services was fast and friendly.

rc7MTMrV4NGfq2Jt6QKv1w.text: The vibe & patio with live jazz music was really nice.  The beer was not cold & the wine was warm. The calamari was good not the best. Warm not hot  The pasta dish was ok. The pasta noodles were way more than al dente and the pizza crust was downright soggy in the center.  Not worth the trip down town to go .

NVB6wAoVv2nbNcKy9P2-2A.text: I am in awe of how fucking awesome this pizza was.  Especially in Phoenix, pretty much the last place I would ever think to find pizza this good because 99% of west coast pizza is dog shit.  I would put the Diavlo up against any of the numerous pies I've had in NYC, Rome, Florence, and Sicily.  Insane to read, right?  Well let me tell you those are words I never thought I'd write.  I am in fucking awe . . .

ryTQVeGdQkAIt_zCjy8aFA.text: Cibo is consistently amazing! They're pizza and appetizers are always excellent. They really take pride in their customer service and quality of food. I'd recommend this place over and over again!

MRFxUiL90CNNMgC7a4-JVg.text: Cibo's patio is just so pleasant night or day! This charming old house lends to a quaint and comfortable restaurant both inside and out! The pizzas are what Cibo is known for and they are delicious. Good for all ages and most taste buds!

rvvMZIPfsJzh5o5TPL1Nxg.text: Cool spot for sure. Great menu with a ton of fun choices. Great server too. One bummer was that the outdoor seating seemed to be a tad too cramped... A couple tables too many for sure. It slowed down the service a bit too. Other than that, super cool spot. Live music was rad as well!

uWieQkatCLBs3Hyu5fMEOg.text: Amazing!!! Everything was so fresh and service was great. We got the burrta and nutella with strawberrys you have to try!

vR-5IBuLBK-4SrxEI9Qs2g.text: I absolutely LOVE Cibo, I used to live downtown and remember when it opened. So quaint, so delicious. I live in the North valley now and miss my walk over to Cibo. Anytime I head downtown I make a stop by Cibo! Try it, you will love it!

IeMk_PrmjJBnhOIjwt4Nkw.text: After trying a variety of pizza places in the valley, I'm glad I finally found Cibo. This was my favorite so far. I got a red pizza and the sauce was amazing. The pizza dough was perfect and the mozzarella was everything it should be. I got the spicy salami which I thought was a perfect topping but it was a little spicy for my wife. I really enjoyed the ambience and the service was great.

P1I7H_iY_F_-WTexqaNP2g.text: Excellent pizza and great wine list, they are not pretentious and I have never had to wait more than 20 minutes for a table.   Depending on where you sit the atmosphere can be cozy and romantic,  or lively for a night out with the girls.   The staff is friendly and most times I can find a seat at the bar.   4 cheers for Cibo!

in_D9nxjs16mDx2iuD4_DA.text: One of my favorite restaurants. Amazing food and love the atmosphere! The service is spot on and everyone is very friendly. They are always busy so we try to go before the rush.

LJFxPqgOGb_6_sSVaHwXZA.text: I was visiting Phoenix and met up with an old friend at Cibo. When I was driving down the street I was a bit concerned that my GPS had led me astray since I was driving past houses all the way up until I saw the restaurant. The unassuming location made me feel like we had found this hidden spot only the lucky few knew about. The service was spectacular. Our waiter was attentive, water glasses were always filled (much appreciated since I was not used to AZ heat), and we felt welcomed. The waiter gave us some much needed guidance with the menu since everything listed sounded unique and amazing. I decided to go with a pizza that had potatoes on it and was thrilled with my decision. Both of our pizzas were delicious and we enjoyed some suggested wine.   I thought the meal couldn't get any better... but then we ordered the nutella and banana crepe. Seriously it was one of the best crepes I have ever had. We sat outside and the atmosphere was charming and inviting. I felt as though I was sitting in my own garden or backyard. They have twinkle lights in the trees and you feel like you should be on a movie set. Next time I am in Phoenix Cibo will be my first stop!

C64DQBoxloc62lFu3sVryg.text: I came here for my birthday, we are outside and the lights and candles at night were very pretty!  When we first got there I was a little confused who would be helping us. The hostesses were dressed very casually, I thought they were guests. We got a little table and ordered a starter (fried rice and cheese). These were good. Then we ordered our food, and eventually dessert. The dessert was my favorite part. I got a Nutella and Marscapone crepe and added ice cream. It was the perfect amount of sweetness. The restaurant wasn't very busy but the service was very slow. We arrived at 7 and left at 9.

ooST95mkc2nT-ihAb_SkEg.text: I have a coworker who refuses to eat pizza anywhere else. I think I've been converted as well! The pizza here is top notch and the pricing is actually really reasonable. Co worker is gluten free and I've tried both the GF pizza and the 'normal': they both taste phenomenal. The blend of cheeses is unique and they have super fresh crust. The resultant itself is very stylish and perfect for a girlfriend luncheon or date night. I will be back, and I will be bringing other friends who need to be converted.

fHy4wMQmGuR1G3kymbAAhg.text: This place is my go-to spot when I'm in Phoenix. It has character, good food and fine wine selection. What more do you need? Pizzas are absolutely fantastic; had a few.  Burrata is also great, so highly recommend it.  Salads and pastas are good, too.  I mean, you just can't go wrong with this place. It's yum!

y3hMmdn3B4bZkuNpbbYzoA.text: I'm a regular. the food is excellent. the service... well, here's my experience. the website days they take reservations. when I called to make a reservation, I was told "we only do walk-ins. so you're welcome to come in." I started to ask a question and was hung up on. I didn't feel that was okay. Will be going somewhere else for awhile.

WiKpB4OaYtT98-1jqsFuNA.text: Ambiance was great, wine was OK, food was bad.  The pizza crust was OK but the olives and artichoke hearts were still briny from the can and overwhelmed the taste of the sauce and cheese. The "prosciutto cotto" was salty and flavorless; sliced deli meat placed in clumps around the pie.   If you want the pizza that this place is trying to make, go to pizzeria bianco.

_m9XdaYqzpeg7c61cDitVA.text: The best service and experience. We had Nicole as our server. Since it was our first time she gave us some recommendations. All great!!! We had the Suzette for dessert it was awesome!!!

9Q2NbpqgrXWDGAtrjvhhiQ.text: What an enchanting location! Great authentic food. We enjoyed the pizza and  a salad in the patio. The only reason I'm not giving a 5 is that we ordered the salad and then the pizza and the salad came out after we were 2/3s done with the pizza! We were also going to a show after dinner and couldn't take the salad with us. My advice us to let the staff know you're on a time line if you need food quickly, otherwise this would have been a perfect "chill" meal on the patio.

9jegkMlFBYZrro6uENft4Q.text: Meal and service was exceptional! The pasta was simple and tasty. The nice brick interior and music added a great ambiance. The Maculan wine is a must have! Nutella anything is my favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Linguine cacio e pepe was soooo good.
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burrata was delicious

zYbGBEQrKsRrIpYBo1ItjQ.text: We came for dinner and it was a cute place. We weren't expecting it to be in a home, but it added to the charm. We ordered the burrata appetizer which had a ton of the cheese but not enough bread so ordered extra bread. Last time I had burrata at a restaurant the cheese was warm which I enjoyed... it was cold here but that is fine. I'm not sure what the norm is for serving it.   Sadly, we didn't enjoy the pizza very much. We ordered it half "Tricolore" and half "Tartufata" -- the tartufata side was heavy on the truffle oil and a bit too strong/oily for me. The tricolore was okay.  If I were to come again (if I ever visit Arizona again) I think I would try the pizza Rosses over the Bianches. The bianches just sounded fantastic (these had no sauces).  Our waiter was nice. I felt bad for him trying to explain the special as it took well over a minute to describe just the soup. It was amusing as I'd hear him at each table explaining it, but what a mouthful! It sounded fantastic and we were very tempted to order it but we already had too much food.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Half Tricolore / Half Tartufata
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burrata

nDs2Kcu9EVKrYnO2-FHZuA.text: WOW. Better than I expected.  I thought I would never find a place with better pizza than Grimaldi's Pizza, but this place stole that #1 spot.  Hubby and I came here for lunch. We were seated promptly. Waited promptly. And got our food promptly.   We ordered a pizza (you can choose two "flavors" so it's half and half) and the meatball sandwich with fruit salad. Everything was so delicious. Prices are reasonable. And this place is clean!  There is no pasta served during lunch. Only dinner. And there are more pizza options and dessert options during dinner.   We want to go back already! I recommend this place!

dHRJ86iyFHO1h7vRqlolRA.text: My favorite pizza place! So glad I live close by. Waiter suggested the pizza with no sauce called Di Notte and it has become my favorite!!

Krxxv8hOOkkqTvaY-0wSCg.text: Great evening celebrating a special birthday last night! Excellent service by Brittany and Colin along with fantastic food made for a truly memorable night!

eNtpoW1G5NRVxXutD9S4Pg.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Phoenix!  The ambiance and decor is amazing.  There is a lovely patio with large trees and lights all around.  It is very intimate and romantic.  The pizza is scrumptious.  My favorites are the Di Notte and Rustica with red sauce.  I would eat here every night if I wasn't worried about my girlish figure!  Last night, Paul and I tried the crepes with nutella and bananas with ice cream.  I don't normally eat a lot of desserts, but I polished this one off!  Sorry Paul!   You can't go wrong with this place!!

B3bEtN9Gg-BOmO4i1fKL8A.text: Love love love!  Best food in Phoenix.  Must have the Nutella strawberry crepe with vanilla ice cream... house salad really great and meatball sandwich with fresh bread.

vURAQqDU50fj9HM8L88wjQ.text: Genova pizza is amazing.  Pesto that will light up your palate. Potato that smoothes each bite.  Italian brick oven pizza crust. Simply amazing. Go enjoy.

zsGoP99ebDNRcGieB6DEJg.text: What a cute place. It's a wood fired pizza restaurant in the middle of a residential neighborhood, really random!  The pizza was very good, a lot better than the huge waits at Pizzeria Bianca.  I have never had their pizza so I can't compare, but this is really good pizza with no wait. Saturday at 5 pm, walked right in and got to sit outside.  I haven't seen the inside so I have no idea what it is like in there, but outside is really nice, the birds even walk right up to the table and then fly away.  They have "root beer" it's not root beer, it's sarsaparilla marked root beer, it was one of the best sarsaparilla's i've had though but I would not really have it again as I prefer real root beer.  The salsicca and genova pizzas were both great.  Salsicca was salami and cheese and the Genova was cheese and some dark greens.  Both were really good tasting and not burnt.  I also had the Cioccolino which is a thick chocolate liquer shot.  It was strong but pretty good, but super thick, almost too thick.  I must say it's hard to find normal pizzas here, which speaks to the authenticity, but be careful if you bring picky eaters.

Dc5q7diahO3Bxt5rG6-gog.text: I really like Cibo. I've been here for lunch, dinner, and a special event at the "Carriage House." The food is really good. I prefer the sandwiches over the pizzas - especially the caprese sandwich. They also had happy hour the last time I was there and the prices aren't amazing, but it's decent for what you get. I would skip the fried dough pieces. The fried rice balls are excellent, and the drink prices are really good. Oh, and the little salad that comes with the sandwich is perfection. Plus, the weather is perfect right now and they have a large patio seating area.

B5iTaUd4t68MdgAga2JqXw.text: I got the BBQ pork sandwich and it was great! The bun they used was unique and had great flavor. It came with truffle fries that were really tasty too. The decor was homey and vintage. The service wasn't good at all after we got our food. I was checked on one time maybe. But overall pretty good

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BBQ pork sandwich and truffle fries

xM0Pw69JOnW7YY39OnLPUA.text: AMAZING PLACE!!! You will never be dissatisfied!!!!!!! I can't say enough great things about this place, you have to check it out!!! WONDERFUL FOOD! REASONABLE PRICES, EXCELLENT SERVICE! GREAT PIZZA! A TRUE ITALIAN RESTAURANT! YOULL LOVE IT!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fAiiLKMuO81fAwk9acOcpw.text: My absolute favorite pizza in my life is served here! It's Tartufata: prosciutto + mushroom When it gets to my table, I have to bathe in aromatic truffle steam. Instant food orgasm

72g00F1JKK5oGgp3VjbbiQ.text: I brought my wife here for her birthday dinner and we loved Cibo! The atmosphere was amazing and the food was delicious! We will definitely be coming back!

-IsuzOy_9tKkxY6rC-GgTA.text: Yelped this place because of its food review and kid friendly menu we decided to eat there; came in at 2pm or so. The host sat us and gave us a "Cena" menu - what ever.  But then it got weird, we waited 5 minutes before she came back (place had a few people) and we asked for the. Kids menu. She took another 5 minutes and returned with a kids menu that said 5pm. We asked if they serves pasta and she said well not for lunch but for dinner only. So I am confused is this lunch or dinner. She was not very informed about the menu yet alone the hours of service - yikes.

U_xx4lD6qwd340pTtBLjKQ.text: My favorite spot for Italian food in the Phoenix land area! Very authentic!

MoGLLrZ-nDOtHDTe3btF5g.text: The best pizzeria in town, hands down. Their bruata is to die for; their wine list is on point; and each speciality pizza combo is curated to perfection My favorite is the  Di Notte! To top it off, their service is always fast, friendly, and accommodating. I had my 30th birthday here with 16 people and they handled the table and check splitting with ease. Oh and last but not least- they have gluten free pizza  I haven't found any gluten free pizza that even compares. Love you Cibo!

1Z3K3fM99IlWFUTEJ-YPOA.text: Not sure if the menu is being updated- but when I click on the lunch and dinner menu- I get a blank page. I tried looking at the menu on my office laptop and on my phone and both pages were blank. I called and the hostess said... oh weird.

YBvcDO4MI4tU3VTs--b8Uw.text: Hands down my favorite restaurant in the US.  The food is always good and the staff is always friendly.  I usually order the same thing (Di Notte) and finish the meal with their homemade limoncello.  It doesn't get much better.

WgChFy0tuIoISkwJ9qfD5Q.text: Yummmm..... Cibo was delicious. I had the Quattro Formaggi Pizza with Ricotta and Sausage added to it. The pizza had all the flavors I was looking for. The cheeses were tangy, but with the addition of the ricotta it really cut through and made it very savory. For dessert I got a Nutella and peanut butter crepe with whip cream and ice cream added on top. It was everything you want in a dessert. So incredibly delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KrgLvpcWM9FmPWspZZChEw.text: I drive from Tucson to Phoenix for your dining experience. The atmosphere is so comfortable and cozy. I love the fire pit outside and live music you have. The food is absolutely amazing!!!!

H-Gs72Y49dWZojqRqrOJoQ.text: Absolutely love the ambiance of this place! We passed by this place before and regret not coming sooner. The waiter was great and very knowledgeable of the menu. The food is amazing! We had the pasta papadelli and omg a must for anybody wanting some great home made pasta. It tasted home made to me at least. The guy playing the guitar and singing was a nice touch to setting the evening mood. Highly recommend this place to friends and family.

mHihVdb57-Iwy262WPKtAg.text: Cibo has a really cool patio area - neat to sit outside.  We had a table near the entry walk - as the crowd built up, some of the people waiting to be seated were kind of crowding our space (I had the seat closest to the walkway).  Other than that, nice environment.  (Be prepared to walk upon arrival - we had to park a couple of blocks away - nice evening, so no worries!)  We came because I was told Cibo had the best gluten-free pizza crust.  (I tasted it, and it tasted very much like the not-gluten-free crust - not at all cracker-like as most places seem to have).  This is one of those upscale wood-fired places that has pizzas with all kinds of things you may not associate with pizza toppings (e.g. prosciutto crudo, capers, artichokes).  That's great for some folks, but when you've got a teenager with coeliac, it would be great to have simple pepperoni as an option.   I went with the aforementioned prosciutto crudo topping for my pie.  It's added after the pizza is cooked (makes perfect sense).  However, it's also added after the pizza is cut, so you have to cut/tear the prosciutto to fit the slices (doesn't make perfect sense).  My pizza didn't have a terrific 'upskirt' and the gumline on the crust was pretty high - I think they rushed it a bit.  My wife's crust had better leopard-spotting.  It was nice that they had crepes available for dessert, and that gluten-free crepes were available!  The crepes were a nice finish.  My iced tea only got refilled once (turned out to be a blessing, as it's a longish drive home).  Also, great 'hipster watching', if that amuses you.  I'm going to lump Cibo into the same category as Pizzeria Bianco - if that floats your boat, this probably will too.    As for me?  Not my thing... overrated/overpriced.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crepes!
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prosciutto Crudo
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie, mixed, with spicy salami

htBOoeuVO8Gbu1p9WLSI4A.text: I ate here once and the experience was decent. The food was good, a little overpriced but I don't mind paying for good quality meals. Parking was a nightmare and the service was ok. The reason why I'm only rating one star is because of how unprofessional the staff/ hostess is. I tried to place a pick up order four times in the last month and I was put on hold for over 10 minutes each time.. when I decided to hang up. I even tried to call back, and I was put on hold again. Their line is obviously busy, since they leave costumers on hold until they've had enough.   If they're trying to lose business they are doing it right because me and family won't come back. There are so many authentic Italian pizza places in Phoenix, Pomo just to mention one. Cibo clearly doesn't want our money

IHB1q9xJ8wFR_VFvLZSHwQ.text: Amazing !!!!!  So first impression, the outside seating area is perfect for cool Arizona nights.  The food was really good and I would recommend the dinotte it was by far the best thing. The crepes were also good but I could live with out them. The ice tea was very delicious and the restrooms are clean. This place was great and the atmosphere was awesome

jqJcqq9xjFmzCUM5bJyDpA.text: Omg, the truffle pizza will make you self combust it's so good. Also the classic margahrita is delicious. The Nutella crepe is also creamyourpants worthy.

eVg0X8LK8zu6yb1KBgL1_A.text: Yum, yum, yum! This place was SO good! I had been to Cibo before, and loved it, but after trying their life changing Neapolitan-style pizza, I felt so compelled to write a review! Me and my two friends shared the La Noce pizza + one of their homemade pasta specials. We were told they only serve these dishes twice a week (& that's when you know a place has fresh food)! Everything was spot on, and we had no complaints or regrets!   The location itself is as cute as it gets. The first time I came here I sat outside and enjoyed every second I spent on their adorable patio. This past time I was in, I sat inside, but still thoroughly enjoyed my surrounding environment! Our server was very friendly, patient, and helped make my friend's birthday so awesome. At the end of our meal, she brought us a Nutella crepe with a candle on top! The crepe was so delicious that we decided to try one more dessert... Because what the heck! We got the Frutti Di Bosco crepe with mascarpone filling. The flavor was simply intriguing and all I have to say is YOU HAVE TO TRY IT.   Thank you Cibo for a memorable evening. Everything was amazing, and I will continue to come here for years to come!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TNOOF_OqFhRi7zHxr4t-7Q.text: Absolutely delicious! Unfortunately wasn't able to try any pizzas this time around, but had a bomb crepe with fresh fruit and it's been memorable since. The crepe was perfectly fluff- not dry nor soggy. The amount of naturally sweetened fruit was a great pairing with a side of vanilla bean ice cream. We came as a group for a surprise birthday party and the ambiance during the evening was just stunning. There was a live performer, lights were on, the temperature out was just right with some heated lamps. The waitress was very helpful in recommending dishes and making sure everyone was accounted for. Dishes came out all at the same time and the waitress even brought out and helped slice our cake. Amazing service and food!

f4guVCR-axejXiTct1qvBA.text: I'm just going to start by saying we are 100% Italian, and moved here 1 month ago for studying purposes... We are SO grateful we found this place! The food tonight truly made us feel as if we were back at home: their ingredients are original and tasty, their meals are traditional, and we left feeling beyond satisfied. The food is cooked by a real Italian.  We can't recommend this place enough for people that want to taste ACTUAL Italian food.  Best Italian food you can have in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ca02sKQNNSSrvVk-0XU4vA.text: Great food, drink and service!!!!  Love this place and so happy I finally got there to try it...including the Nutella desserts

BYheedy4_FENjIhmdD5RSA.text: Always delicious!! Just got off a plane from a week out of town for work & all I want is Cibo pizza, the crust is the one of best in the city.!! So good & it's a great place for eating al fresco. Love this place.

DWcR2Cu2N_t7UIXOJeZkWg.text: One of my absolute favorite restaurants in PHx is @cibopizzeria - everything is homemade and the ambiance is homey and inviting. Great patio seating! I had the strozzapretti pasta with ricotta & sausage, so delicious! But their pizza is also fantastic! Try the homemade limoncello, it's served in a fancy little shot glass - it's a sipper

Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pizze Tartufatta
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cibo

6RfihAvWsmkq1u9mgo_ttw.text: Went to this hidden gem on a nice Sunday evening for date night and were impressed by the ambiance and delicious food. Cibo is now one of my favorite places in Phoenix

dB578sl0u0OQiYLZ5AhzNQ.text: I'd heard a lot of good things about Cibo, so it has been on my to-do list for some time now. What better day to give this cozy little home-turned-romantic-restaurant a whirl than our Anniversary?  Cibo lived up to my expectations. The setting was perfect: candle-lit outdoor setting with some easy listening live music playing in the background of our conversation. The pizza is delicious and fairly priced, given the atmosphere and ingredients (some said to be shipped from Italy). Our server was kind and genuine. Cibo was everything we'd hoped it would be, and maybe more.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Romance is in the air.
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Arugula!
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. So authentic, you may think you&#39;re in Italy.

3nQfatMi6Mqog0IA-5Mu-w.text: absolutely love this little gem tucked away in a converted brick home in downtown Phoenix.  Sat at the bar and ordered a salad and pizza and was blown away by both.  The pizza has a crust that reminds me of a crustier version of naan with a tasty sauce (not too much) and salami/mozzarella.    Great patio when the weather is nice and cozy atmosphere inside.  Two thumbs enthusiastically up!

evlQWyj4Ah9AurF93QpXVA.text: Amazing place to eat some yummy pizza! The calzone is HUGE and mouthwatering good! Such a cute and romantic place, too. If the weather permits, you must sit outside. The lighting and live music really make your dining experience unforgettable. Really can't go wrong with this place! Looooove :D

IBx71dGWRXoQgM6jJJMkFw.text: Best place for lunch or dinner downtown, especially when it cools off to sit outside. The M&M (PB&J) is a must try, good to split as an appetizer or dessert. I Also recommend the eggplant parm panini.  For those tea fans, the iced tea is an unsweetened black passion fruit.

zlxpt_HWqLqJv-PltM84IQ.text: Cibo...where do I even start? Hands down the best pizzeria in Phoenix, and remains as the best pizza I've ever had. I've had nothing but great experiences with Cibo, everything I've ordered here has been amazing. The staff and owner are really friendly as well. My personal favorite pizza is the Tartufata, so good! I also really enjoy their patio and outdoor seating, looks awesome at night when all the lights are lit up.

bTPHUFijM5aMZByYnDfuxA.text: This place used to be better but unfortunately- it's going down hill. The food is bland. The chicken in their salads especially. I used to like it, but now I have no reason to go back.

-B0cfDL0_7PR1rLt0ThiQw.text: Charming, intimate, low-key, cozy, and solid food.   It feels like you are at a friend's home.    There should be more places like this... like in Scottsdale.  Yes, there are real people living there that are constantly driving elsewhere but bitching about the lack of places to go to in the near vicinity.  Maybe there's someone who will take a hint...

qMMakaNkBtLCClHauJEgMg.text: I'm a jew from NY and i know my pizza. Bianco, spinato's, grimaldis and pizzeria federal are all better. The hot sandwiches they serve for lunch during the day are the whip so is the nutelle crepe. Service & atmosphere are good. You can't go wrong for lunch or date night.

Vmtm1kcoljGeayORusBwtQ.text: Atmosphere is hip and quaint at the same time.  We enjoyed the pizza here.  Service was good.  We'll be back.

pWzxKmapvT6lzu5NXUftzw.text: Whether seated inside amongst the eclectic decor or outside amongst the lit trees and occasional musician, Cibo is always an enjoyable experience. The experience includes a delicious array of salads and antipastis, a savory wine selection, brick oven pizza, lattes and desserts. In my opinion, you cannot go wrong with any item on the menu. P.S. Brunch is also a delightful affair.

1iVqEBI_bw-j_pUZfN5Myg.text: Great Pizza!  Great Ambiance!  4 stars for service.  They are busy and popular causing them to be understaffed when I am there.  I think they are ready for a larger bar with more than 1 guy.    I felt like a bad guy as I crowded up to the bar and waited only 3-4 minutes to get the bar tender to get me a beer.  He was polite.  It is just that he was filling orders for the whole place.    To the owners of Cibo.  Build a 2nd bar for your busy nights, to make easy for your clients to get a drink.  I would have order a 2nd beer if didn't have to wait in that line....maybe an outdoor bar that is only stocked for your busy nights.

hGY-b34nx3aBUtKQyAe85Q.text: One of my faves, our go to meeting spot before events in PHX. Love the patio and restaurant, and I would choose their salad/pizza/pasta over other top rated joints in the Valley anyday.

-V2TuWny6FmZulc94lv8SQ.text: Its official - my favorite pizza place in Phoenix!  Sometimes it can use a little more cheese, but overall I consistently like all the pizzas I've tried.  Salads are pretty good as well.  Even with the price tag I will return time and again.  Also the fresca crepe dessert is a must try!

1UP-TCnkAcapKywib4EtqQ.text: All I have to say is awesome. Our waitress was friendly, the food was great and the atmosphere was perfect. Downtown Phoenix has the best little places to eat at!

k7Soj3J_ZXJpAj8jiwjzQA.text: Came here for dinner the other night with some friends who had been before. I love the look of this quaint little restaurant with it's twinkle lights decorating the tree stumps and greenery. I love their outdoor seating out front - it makes a great atmosphere.   The staff were nice and fairly attentive. It's got a nice laid back vibe.   We started off with a Caprese salad and I think that's why I rated this place just average. For me an Italian restaurant shouldn't ruin a caprese salad but this one was just not good. Something was seriously missing - maybe a little balsamic drizzle but it lacked all of the fresh flavors I was hoping for. The pizza I ordered on the other hand was so good. I was really bummed I couldn't bring the rest home (headed to a concert after dinner). It was the Di Norte and had a nice kick to it so you if you like a little spice in your life this is the thing to order.   I would come back here again but it's not at the top of my list. Great if you want to sit outdoors and enjoy the nice temperature and good conversations.

UsQYMOniMrs5_dni9oTOsQ.text: Probably the best pizza in the valley!  This was my favorite place to go for pizza when living in Phoenix. Very charming setting. We especially loved to bring our dog here and sit outside. Fantastic service. Romantic but relaxed vibe. They also have delicious pastas, salads, and appetizers if you are in the mood for something other than pizza.  Get the nutella shake for dessert!

gQfnBAZoFNdnClmJ-Y8uCA.text: I'm from out of town and found Cibo using yelp- not only was the food AMAZING but the service was great. I would defiantly recommend stopping by and grabbing a pizza!

H1xnAfflEgnL3eok-M80xQ.text: So wonderful. The best place to get gluten free pizza in Phoenix. The patio is excellent. Live music on Friday and Saturday.

gCuCYJjW1ewOfPaYIZy_tA.text: I think my mouth died and went to heaven.  Incredibly fresh ingredients. Hot and crispy thin crust.  Now My favorite pizza place EVER.  Pizza Bianco and Parlor are my next destinations- and they have some tough shoes to fill.

Bdhz3qRdSfJVpwzNqSch8g.text: Very nice patio, and great food! We enjoyed a beautiful lunch here with our friends...nice view of the city skyline too! I felt like I was in Italy.

9q_ReltYqoJ6nBf6JFAjxw.text: Cibo has plenty of reviews, but I still gotta put my two cents in! I have been here several times, all for lunch, so I have NOT tried their pizza yet but the sandwiches and salads they serve up for lunch are nothing short of phenominal! On my last vist I tried the Ai Spinaci, which is a garlic lovers dream sandwich topped off with wilted spinach and toasted prosciutto! All I hear is great things about Cibo's pizza, so I can't wait to finally give it a try!  The restaurant is a beautifully converted house in a historic downtown area, but that also equals very limited seating inside. They have a great patio with more than ample overflow seating outside, but it's pretty worthless during the summer days. The servers here are all friendly towards the customers, and work as a team to make sure the lunch and dinner hours run smoothly!  Also, the crepes are amazing! We never had any intention of ordering dessert but our server insisted on bringing us a complimentary crepe with the assurance that it'd be worth it! WE LOVED IT! Make sure you save room for dessert!

3N1Mi4yI1LjCZBZ2EhslBw.text: This is THE best gluten free pizza I've ever had in my life. I've been intolerant for 7 years, I've tried many gluten free pizzas, and I've never quite been wowed like I am at Cibo. Their gluten free is ASTOUNDING. Also they serve with a gluten free flag which makes me feel so calm.   Pizza variety is unique, flavorful and thoughtful. Wine options are great.   Absolutely love Cibo.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gluten free prosciutto pizza

4UmZs25BTuNn7ie7--mLlg.text: Cute spot! You can valet your car which is a must! We ordered two pizza they are personal size so you easily could eat one to yourself. We tried the Salsiccia Con Patate & the dolce vita!!! Good vibes , Good wine & everyone was super nice !!

IwKgPYigQvaYisFysF6C4Q.text: Yummy pizzas and really good happy hour! The outdoor patio area is lovely and perfect to sit during happy hour.  I ordered 2 pizzas, an appetizer and desert for under $40! Great atmosphere for a date.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Capricciosa
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Palline 2.0

Sm32-_dkEWFs-cgmJCabzg.text: Not sure I understand the hype about this place. I'm going to assume my gf and I just had a one-off experience but it was no bueno. We had the Di Notte pizza and there was wayyyyyyyyyyy too much Gorgonzola in it. Couldn't taste anything else except that. $17 pizza and I had half a slice.
