My goodness...how upsetting. If I wasn't trying to have a nice birthday dinner, I would give it 1 or 2 stars.

NV-h6mHuPHXlGo6TUAQ3dg.text: The crapes are amazing. Loved the rustica pizza! And the ice tea has a hint of orange. The outside terrace was beautifully lit. Id recommend this for sure.

grzeILlFwolomSfdj9oCIA.text: GF crust is probably the best I have ever had! I got the Di Notte and added basil and my boyfriend had the Genova and added spicy salami. Very good, we had not had pizza without sauce before. Next time we might try their red sauce pizzas.

0F6aVtmaD4G1khKsu7dOVw.text: So yesterday I'm in CenPho and pull out my handy dandy yelp app... I see reviews from Reese / Moanz / Samantha for this place less than a block away and it made my decision VERY easy.    It's a cool old house, and probably not a place I would ever stop if not for the amazing reviews (which were spot on by the way).  Within fifteen minutes I was enjoying one of the best pizza pies I've tasted in Arizona... and the gorgonzola almost threw me off.  I'm glad I went with my instinct, the pie was perfectly cooked and the flavors were out of sight.    Add to this an ice cold bottle of Peroni - and I was quite pleased with my decision.  Between this and Pomo, I'm convinced that it's the best couple of pies within a half mile anywhere in AZ.  COME EAT HERE!  You won't regret it.  Also, I don't have much of a sweet tooth, but if you like Nutella, you must try their Nutella crepe... it's pretty freaking tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I&#39;m sorry but lunch doesn&#39;t get much better than this.

c8ZfXTCEJhLVZyXD-d_WbQ.text: Don't really have much to say, was expecting more flavor and excitement from the Calzone.....it was just like the date you been waiting for several months, then she arrives, stunning, beautiful, and sexy as hell....then she opens her mouth and starts talking-  check  please !!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EKqpUuhMpBCx4eT54HKtnw.text: Amazing pizza!! The spicy salami is so good. The 3 bruschettas are so good and what a cool old house to be inside. You can feel the history. Such a great experience all around.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vYjXKs7ueChT_c4hCej7yQ.text: So this place did a lot right, and only miss steeped a few times-plus very good food.   The servos was great! Very good recommendations and follow through. Server even suggested a change to my pizza that the staff enjoys-it really made it nice. The problem with it was once she checked on my beer choice that was the lady time I saw her until I was completely finished. Small mistake to an almost perfect meal.  The food was insane-very tasty!! The pizza combined typical Flavors of fresh sauce and cheese with pepperoni with less used ingredients of blue cheese and raw garlic. Crust had a perfect chewiness. Very good.  There beer selection was ok-really would have preferred a draft selection but they did have great selection of local bottled beers.  All in all a nice meal

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Half diavalo half diamanté

PAuaVsquo4X16hPQWAEcVw.text: We took my brother out for father's day here to Cibo this Sat night.  Our party of six had called to be put on the list and when we arrived, our table was ready for us... AND it was crowded and busy, so I'm very impressed that despite the busy evening, they were able to get our call-in table ready for us.  There are SO many reviews, I will just give you a few tidbits that stood out to me: - there is no chicken on the menu, so if you're going to order a salad, forget chicken.. you'll get prosciutto or sausage but no chicken... but their Omero Salad was *outstanding*.. delicious and so flavorful and great mix of textures and flavors - place is adorable, small and intimate.. and at a 100 years old, there's no sound absorption.. my cackles were resounding... I had to purposely laugh softly (very hard for me!)... FYI - you can do half-half pizza orders...  I tried a slice of all the 5 pizzas at our table and found them all unique, flavorful, and definitely delicious - their Il Tagliere meat and cheese board is a fantastic appetizer idea.. burrata was outstanding and loved by all  We would absolutely come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Il Tagliere - recommend!!! highly!!!

Pz9ybr0yAV7r_hq47cfK4Q.text: It's been hard for me to write this review. It's my favorite pizza in the universe, so I feel I need to express that with a huge review, but all I can come up with is, that it is simply the best, and you should see for yourself. And the olive oil, oh, the glorious olive oil the have here. I can drink it as a cocktail. The salads are good portion and the patio is fantastic. Never an off night yet. Bravo!

FJw86mcxVdo_aYfw2WA2XQ.text: We lived in Milan for 6 mos and this place took us back to the legit Italian flavors we have missed since moving back to the states - best Italian we have had in years.

XLXzPusZV5akc4gm7uIThw.text: Although the food was half decent, if you have an interest in being welcomed by any sort of satisfying customer service than this is quite the opposite of what you are looking for. From the very moment we stepped foot on the property we were greeted with dirty looks, excessively passive attitudes, and were even told is to how much of an "inconvenience" we were for asking to be moved to an inside table on a 105 degree day(with plenty of open table space inside). The pasta I had was under cooked and cold when I received it. All around not a good experience. One star is a compliment at most. My recommendation would be to save yourself the trouble and boil up some spaghetti at home. You'll have a much, MUCH better experience.

Bjhu-ZxwDuXV5lSOcs3cow.text: This is a beautiful and whimsical environment. Usually, food is really good. I'm not sure if they were just so busy they were more concerned about getting it out quick instead of the quality. Just a bit disappointing.  Now, we were a large party so we easily entertained ourselves, and thank goodness because we had the rudest waitress I think I ever had. She seemed so inconvenienced and unhappy to be there. Let me also say, we asked for 3 different checks and she added gratuity to our individual checks. Which I don't like be cause I always give more for a tip! She was so rude, she was lucky she added the tip because she would have got way less!

U2mKuS4VD1iU5JHfO5WWMw.text: We stopped in here for a work lunch and I am not sure I will be back. I have been wanting to check out this place for a while now and finally got the opportunity. We called ahead and made reservations for our group of 7 and were seated right away when we arrived. Unfortunately their parking lot was full, but we were able to find street parking not too far away. First off, it was way way too hot and stuffy in there. They really need to work on their air conditioning, or at least get some fans in there to circulate some air. Second, the finishing on their tables makes them appear dirty. It was so sticky and uncomfortable. We tried cleaning it, but it is just the table finish. Even the napkins stuck to the table. Third, I had my one year old son with me and no one ever offered a high chair. We eventually found one on our own. Fourth, it took forever for the waitress to come see us and get our drink orders.   In regards to the food, I had the pizza and it was decent. Nothing too amazing, but it was good and it was gone before we left. As a group we also tried their crepe, which was also tasty, but not worth the money in my opinion. The thing I loved the most about this place is its location and decor. It is located in an old house with a lot of charm. I love the bar area as well, maybe I'll try to come again sometime for drinks and an appetizer. Overall though, I was just not impressed...

uk-hwZdp4Vy8fdBeCBNgug.text: Originally we had another pizza spot picked but a change in plans put us here.   Cute atmosphere, quaint little restaurant in a converted local house.   Friendly staff, nice outside seating and decorations.    Food wise pretty good.   We started with the fried calamari.  It was tasty except it comes with a homemade like sauce and not marinara.  Overall a bit spicy but not ghost chili hot.  Then got 2 pizzas, the prosciutto and then an artichoke with olive and ham.   Tasty, crust had some nice burned/charred flavor, pizza cooked well.  Enjoyed it overall and if in the area we'd return but wouldn't go out of our way.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The prosciutto and then an artichoke with olive and ham

sKAInR1USC0oUDYAlzDj2w.text: I really enjoyed this place.  Let me start out by saying I'm not a huge fan of Neapolitan style pizzas. I'm more of a New York style pizza fan the Burrata antipasto was delicious and enough for three people! The pizza was good but nothing special but all in all a very good place with great service friendly people and awesome environment

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burrata antipasto
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 4 cheese and sausage

8U6aSnvWvU3SyDCnK9PiKg.text: Great romantic spot and you can't beat the wine list.  Pizza is fantastic and well with it.  We split the pesto salad and it was excellent.  We also loved the outdoor music on Friday night.  Can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

PcvB9pGRfkdc9CmM-nmziQ.text: Cibo provided a mixed experience on a Sunday night.  My son enjoyed his pizza, Da Vinci (?), while my DIL was disappointed with her Di Norte.  The child's pizza looked good and was enormous.   My pasta and red sauce was very nice.   Service was good, price point was excellent, and the atmosphere was casual and comfortable.  Sitting outside was lovely.    I looked forward to a Crepe Suzette and introducing my family to this delicacy. The Crepe Suzette was a disaster.  The server couldn't get the syrup to light in order to flambe, which destroyed the presentation, in addition to the flavor.  The syrup didn't have the rich fragrance of Grand Marnier, just alcohol, the crepe had marmalade in it instead of the decadent orange, butter syrup, and was a soggy, doughy mess.  My DIL described it has an alcohol soaked tortilla.

6bvkobF6J5hQOD2xaKHROw.text: Out of town guest always love the patio and the charm of Cibo- not to mention the amazing food.  I haven't had a bad dish and we've tried everything from the pizzas to delicious homemade pastas. Cibo never disappoints.

_IDjGcqktAZLAXBUfRs2Pg.text: We just went here for the first time last week.  First off the place is pretty small inside. We were a table of 4 put in the corner of this really small room with a ceiling fan. But there were so many people in this little room that it was warm so it made it uncomfortable.  Our waitress was polite. A little timid which sometimes made her unhelpful but all in all she was ok.  We got a appetizer which was this fried rice ball with cheese. Nothing special. Pretty bland. And we got two different pizzas the margarita and the pesto potato one.  The margarita pizza was awful!!!! It had so much sauce that was the wrong consistency on it that it made the pizza a instant droopy mess and totally soggy. It was gross. The pesto potato pizza was actually very good and it is what we ended up eating. The rest of everything else we just left there and was a total waste.  We probably won't go back here just cause there is definite better options out there then the experience we had here.

bZMEmTpRrsuP46f0YE_F0A.text: Cibo is a local favorite! I have been a fan of Cibo for well over 10 years since a former co-worker invited me to go! I've been there for lunch and dinner and just for dessert! Cibo has excellent pizza, the closest to actual Italian style you'll find in the valley. They have a great wine list and also have gluten-free options now, which is really nice! I've also had great service. Their outside eating area is one of the more romantic and fun spots in the valley and is perfect for dining during the Phoenix "winter".

98ZOgas6Fx3W07xf28B79g.text: Yasmin was amazing! Didn't pressure and made sure we had everything we needed. The food was absolutely amazing and the fries are to die for! Will definitely come again soon.

ZGBkvB-jFiW3c_mUscvXxw.text: First time here and definitely not the last.. We got a 3 course and of course shared it all. Haha we got a salad (I forgot the name) but it was almost like a Caesar but not quite and still to me even better!  The pizza we got was a Diavola? With added Italian sausage. The pizza was gone in minutes!. It was really good the salami had a small kick but a good kick. You can tell everything was fresh the taste was just so much better. The crust I loved it wasn't too crispy but just right.  Dessert we got a Nutella Crepe with Ice Cream. Omg! Love love this simple dessert!   The only reason why no 4 stars I got a latte and that was no Bueno. And parking is all street parking. The waitress at first was a little rude but then that's her fault she didn't ask if we have been there before especially since we were asking amateur questions. Lol other than those will be coming back for more.

SvgMWIsgX766QH547EH3Lw.text: I really want to give this place a higher score, but I'm torn because while I have been here a great many times, and often bring visiting friends and family, I was pretty peeved at the service last Friday night 6-12-2015.   I genuinely got the feeling that the management had taken the night off, and the inmates were running the asylum because despite the fact that the place was somewhat empty by the time we got there, late in the evening, the front-of-house staff was out-to-lunch so to speak.  The place was really noisy despite being half empty. The water they brought was warm as were the three glasses they brought. We also had to push pushes to the adjoining empty table because the staff wasn't removing them.  One thing they don't put on the menu is that if you opt to order a Coca-Cola vs. say some beer, etc., the soda comes in a can (which had a weird smell to it), and at $2 for a can and a warm glass, it's a pretty extreme 10x markup.  Food-wise, the pizza to get remains the tricolore.  We tried the arancini as an appetizer, and it lacked seasoning. The server brought a small tin of marina, which wasn't enough for the 4 balls, and when we asked for more, they failed to bring more. In the end, we didn't finish the appetizer because the balls got cold.  My father got the bolognese, which I didn't try, though he said mine had more flavor.  I'd really like to try the other pasta dish sometime, as it looks quite good.  It would seem this restaurant has seen better days, but I'm not sure. If they make some small changes in the kitchen and retrain the wait staff, it might be worth visiting again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The arancini... mozzarella covered in arborio rice and bread crumbs then deep fried. Lacks seasoning and enough marinara.

IczWGhv5b72XApdh7Jkexw.text: This place is amazing and we have been coming for years. The patio is so beautiful and quaint and the service is good. The food is authentic and the pizza is divine. The homemade pasta is good but I promise you won't be disappointed by the pizza. I also love the house salad..its so simple yet delicious due to the fresh shaved parmesan and its so much more than a house salad. This is a great special occasion place but that doesn't mean we don't just go on a Tuesday! One tip...its pretty hot here in the summer due to it being an old house.

xNKAzWtE5DjD-Wgp2h_v2w.text: Thanks to a recommendation and other Yelp reviews, I found myself here on a Saturday night for dinner. Used the mobile check-in and only waited about 40 minutes. Live music in the patio and beautiful lighting/atmosphere helped pass the time.  Sat at a table near the bar, greeted by the waiter and promptly served waters and given menus. Started with the 3 bruschetta appetizer. Delicious! Prosciutto and fresh mozzarella, fresh tomatoes and basil, and a savory bean topping. For pizzas we ordered the Rustica and another with prosciutto and Italian sausage. Crispy crust and fresh ingredients, what more could you ask for? The arugula on the Rustica was a nice green and great aroma.  Cheese was perfectly melted as well. For dessert, enjoyed a simple Nutella crepe (light and fluffy) with a nice scoop of vanilla ice cream.    The lighting and decor of the refurbished homestyle restaurant is comfortable and inviting. Definitely recommend for an evening out and delicious food.

_3ppQNm20fnEvubpfot4GA.text: I love the outdoor patio dining, and the food and service have always been top notch! It feels like you are out in the country somewhere and certainly not in the middle of a big city.  Highly recommended!

DdW2yB62_OA8XkdC3bqDwQ.text: We have been to Cibo many times, we have also rented out the Carriage House for our company Christmas party and have never had any issues, ever. Until today.   Grab yourself a nice glass of wine, pair it with an assortment of exceptional cheeses, and have a seat for this glorious experience.   We walked into Cibo, were immediately greeted by the hostess; she was very welcoming, a smile on her face, sat us within a few minutes of our arrival. Then, boys and girls came our waiter, Ross. He had a smile on his face, seemed welcoming, however, the freshly smoked cigarette odor lingering off of him was extremely unpleasant. Restaurant dining is meant to excite your senses; sight, smell, taste, touch. I mean, there is nothing like, here is your glass of iced tea, with my cigarette fingers all over it.  We were a table of 4, we all ordered our individual dinners, three ordered salads, as an appetizer, in addition to their dinner. Out came their salad AND my dinner. Wait, why is my dinner coming out with their salad you ask? Not quite sure kids. Our waiter was nowhere to be seen. I asked a different staff member to take back my meal, as the rest of the parties dinner had not arrived at the table, and that they were just served their salad. The look of bewildered confusion came upon her face. She took back my dinner, and out came our waiter, Ross telling me that "it would be five minutes tops" before the rest of my parties dinner came out if I can just leave my hot sandwich in front of me until their food came out. Well, fifteen minutes went by, their dinner never appeared. We asked Ross to take back my dinner, as it was now cold, also because the rest of the parties dinner has yet to come out. During this wait, the parties dinner came out, with mine in the abyss of the kitchen. Almost fifteen minutes went by, my dinner never made it out of the kitchen. I asked Ross for the manager. She came to the table, with a smirk on her face. I told her what is going on. Wait for this.... she did not even apologize, or offer to make it right. She stood there with her smirky face, saying something about the way the kitchen works. Not my problem. During all of this banter, my dinner finally made its way to the table. The manager never offered to make the situation right.   Listen, I was not looking to have been offered anything for free, or have my meal comped. I just wanted my dinner at the same time the rest of my party was eating their dinner. I did not want to sit and eat my dinner, while they are eating their appetizer. A simple sincere apology would have made it better.   Needless to say, we will never again step one foot into this establishment. As a paying customer, there are plenty of options for dining in this city. I get better customer service at my local grocery store then I did in this restaurant. We have rented the Carriage House for a company Christmas party, I promise you this, they have lost all future business. We work hard for our money, and it will never again be spent at Cibo.   To the manager; not sure what your name is, you need to educate yourself on proper customer service etiquette. The way you treated me was horrendous and extremely unprofessional. You never made it right. You never even returned back to our table after our dinner was finally served, just to ask how everything was. Shame on you. What kind of example are you setting for your staff? To lack empathy to the customer. Shame on you.

VKZuco0ZKsuvCFjFKfu-0w.text: The best Margherita pizza in Phoenix! Cibo has always been my favorite pizza spot. Great atmosphere in the heart of downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita with Salami

3tEinaYSuKfigbQ5im0XhQ.text: Delicious! Definitely go for something you can't get at a typical pizzeria, because it will be well worth it.  For an appetizer we got the meatballs, which were HUGE. We polished those off pretty quickly thought because they were tasty paired with the grilled bread they came with (I wish I would've asked for extra bread though...)   For pizza we got the Tartufata, and it was a dream! That truffle oil is haunting, and the cheese was (while I prefer MORE cheese) melty and perfect.  We would definitely go back.

4Yn6zcrL0tla0VAhdbpPyg.text: To start off, were from Cali so going to a 4.5 star place, I def expected a lot more. The place seemed really cool but the food & the brew were ok. I felt like it doesn't justify its stars. It's safe to say, Yelp kinda let me down on this one. The potential is there but they need to step their selection of brews (more craft beers please) and the pizza needs better taste. All in all, I would try another pizza spot if you're from outta town, L.A. area to be exact.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. That Hef doe!

NwG_p6RIjLvDHbSdHYOiZA.text: An intimate little restaurant that was just the right spot for a date. We had a lovely evening, and the pizza was delicious.

3zHmWQ3wfXE0gGEj0I12tw.text: Been coming here for a few years and had always loved the food and atmosphere but each time over the last years things have fallen off. They have opted for smaller servings, their bread and pizza is inconsistently cooked each time, and to be specific their calamari has gotten to sports bar standards. All this can be overlooked because we love the atmosphere and overall the food still tastes good. However, when this is paired with horrible service and rude employees it's definitely enough to make us not come back. The food is brought out too quickly and thrown on the tables and they check back too inconsistently. Not to mention our food is brought out at inordinate times, we have found ourselves with a full table with unfinished salads, cold appetizers and a hot pizza if we are lucky. This is not pleasant it's as if they want us to leave and do so quickly all the time. This happened on many occasions, too many times. If you don't ask specifically for when you'd like things to be brought out you won't enjoy your stay. Also the servers all seem angry or uncomfortable, and it's very unpleasant not to see anyone smile. All they have to do is be a lot more attentive and kind. We just had this happen to us again on a slow Sunday night at a reasonable hour so customer traffic has not made a difference. Just please have better service and have people who actually want to be there.

JGBMl7fm0lL6oEUDQnYWdg.text: Food is bland. Side of chicken was cold, calamari clearly frozen. Disappointed and would not recommend sadly.

IfYEp_FTqbld-zv1IEn3ag.text: Had a few hours to kill before hopping on a flight and found this place on yelp. all the glowing reviews really drew me in and we weren't disappointed!   we arrived and found that this charming restaurant is located in the midst of a residential area. we were greeted by the evenings musician, who was playing soft electric guitar behind his back. incredible talent!   first of all the charcuterie plate (il tagliere) is amazing. so much goodness on the board, I could have just eaten that for dinner. we also ordered a margarita pizza and the pasta bolognese. both were outstanding, packed with flavor!   if I ever find myself in Phoenix again this will be the first place I go!

DV61wVxh-9zSkerVwBKEvw.text: Favorite pizza place in Phoenix, hands down. Also my go to place for any kind of celebration due to the relaxing ambiance. Their food is so delicious and fresh and the customer service is great, so really, what more could you want? Definitely try their house made limoncello, super tasty and unique. Don't get my started on their desserts! My only advice to you is to not wear your skinny jeans unless you are willing to pop a button in the restaurant, since you will be eating your weight in pizza and crepes.

KunLrHL3Yh6jkm9KocEEcg.text: Visited Cibo for the first time for dinner with my mom... ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!! I started out with the desert blossom iced tea and enjoyed its flavorful taste a bunch! My mom loved her Pilsbury Wild Child wine.  I ordered the Linguini Pasta dish and my mom ordered the Fungi Pizza. Both dishes were presented beautifully, and tasted even better! We ended our wonderful meal with an awesome tasting crepe with cream, strawberries,and chocolate sauce! Lastly, the service was unbeatable! We were  greeted super nicely at the door, sat right away, and our waiter was with us almost immediately! Our food came out quickly and the restaurant was able to meet any requests on the order that we had:-) will definitely be dining here many times to come in the future!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_P87IwE1GAUr9XiV_7bpuw.text: Tried again because 2 people in our group insisted on trying it. Sat outside as a party of 6. Birthday for 2 of the people.  Its OK. The pizza that has pears and arugula on it was good the very first time we went but this time was just LOADED with arugula and they put it on right before bringing it out vs right after it came out of the oven. So it never wilted. The pizza just didn't seem very fresh and was fairly dry.  We also had the antipasto and it was fairly lackluster with unripened olives all over. Huge ratio of olives to everything else. A bit stingy with the meat.  Service was sterile. Still not sure who our server was. We probably had 3-4 diff people come by from time to time. Had to get up and find someone to ask for a check. Being seated outside here you really feel like you're fairly forgotten about.  Hopefully won't be back. Too many better offerings now in the valley for pizza.

lK3HCZ6NLXs9j6hm9T7bHg.text: We went yesterday. I think our tab ended up being around $27. We shared a pizza, beer and desert. The atmosphere was awesome, the neighborhood was sketchy, the food was incredible and the customer service was great. We would go again. The tiramisu was killer and their white pizzas were better than their reds.

d6AXFA_feLxqhXPcg3cP9A.text: I was visiting Phoenix and this place kept popping up on Yelp so it seemed like I just had to go! As I was walking here from my hotel (16 minutes away) I thought I had gotten lost because it just somehow turned into a neighborhood. Very cute place and tucked away; I guess it used to be a house!  I got the Lunch Di Notte Pizza and it was delicious. Buttery cheese, salty, and sweet. If you drizzle it with some olive oil it's perfection! The crust is charred wonderfully and there's just something about this place that makes you happy every time you take a bite. Great flavors. Simple and not overpowering.  You don't need to order anything else for lunch, it was the perfect portion to make me feel satisfied.   The bartender served me cause I sat alone at the bar and she provided great service. The hostess was nice too but a Welcome or a Good Bye would've been nice (yes, I notice those things -1 Star).  I would be more than happy to return if I ever ended up in Phoenix again!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch Di Notte

4b3GGo2AeVN12NfU7myk9A.text: Love this classic downtown location! Perfect for a friendly happy hour, quick take-out, visitors from a far, or a romantic date. Service is always friendly.

RkGU1ADPMso-JCk_DR3G1Q.text: This is a great quasi-Italian pizzeria.  They have spectacular wood-fired pizzas with high quality ingredients.    We had the burrata to start with and it was great.  A huge portion at a reasonable price.  I had the tartufata pizza.  I loved the white truffle oil.  It would have been great to have porcini mushrooms rather than cremini mushrooms, but it was great nonetheless.  We also had the calzone and vegetarian pizzas.  They were also very good.  The limoncello wasn't great -- they use Everclear which is too harsh of a liquor.  They have a great selection of wines.  Good values and less common finds in the US.  Our server was very good, it was very busy, so he wasn't always right there, but made sure that we were always taken care of and the food came out on time and hot.

I5PT-i4whqKtidmFqJb1Kw.text: My favorite pizza place in Phoenix, bar none. Amazing, life changing pies. You must eat here.   Other reasons why I like it: - cheap, good bottles of wine - dog friendly - light rail accessible - romantic vibe (but not too romantic, totally ok for just casual dining with friends) - friendly staff - free of Old Town Scottsdale douchery - desserts with nutella - fresh & often local ingredients - no ridiculous wait times like Bianco (usually 30 min or less during peak times)  Highly recommended.

hKC4VwlJpQShbanSETY-mw.text: Pretty good... I ordered the Margharita and the wifey had the Genova pizza, before that we shared a salad...  Ok so the place and atmosphere was probably my favorite thing about the experience... I just like being in old buildings... this one was built in 1913... so I personally enjoyed just looking around. Plenty of seating inside or out... so thats all good...  The food was pretty good, I would not go back to order the Margharita pizza again, but I'll definitely go back to check out the rest of the menu... just to throw this out there... there is another very well known pizza spot down the road in which I WOULD go back just to get some more of that Margharita pizza... this one is good, but not as good as the place down the road! The Genova was freakin great... pesto, mozzarella, onion, potato... kind of like we had in italy... No regrets about the food, it was good, the salad was $14 which was good, but not 14 bucks good! The pizza is worth the trip and the money. If you read my reviews i base my rating on my desire to return... i give it 4 stars because the food was good enough that I'll definitely go back to taste the rest of that good sized menu, but not 5 because it wasn't upto par with other pizza ive had around the area!   *** i will say this though... CIbo seems more accommodating for larger parties... just sayin'.

B8GLZ7rOisOBAC-rwcRTZA.text: The food is just as good as the atmosphere I loved the pizza salad & crepes was just sad we missed out on the pasta (only served certain nights) but I'll be back to try it!

ajcoxllgucwOjf2xf4kFow.text: Love, love, love the pizza! The diavola is my fav- juicy & slightly spicy. My mouth is seriously salavating as I write this. I know it's strange for a pizza to be juicy, so let me explain...the fresh ingredients melting perfectly in the brick oven for an incredible burst of flavors in your mouth - JUICY!!! For apps I was introduced to the Burrata, which is outstanding and give the bruschetta and caprese a try, also yummy. Dessert wise the crepes with nutella are lip-smacking good as well as the nutella shake. (yep, I'm a fan of nutella)  Delightful atmosphere, patio lit with strands of lights, charming historic house inside.  Sometimes they have live music but I'm not sure how to find out this information. Also, they serve homemade pasta on a selected day :)

KZ1XkUdx8nbXqcmX_jwo3A.text: Cibo - NOT GOOD!!  I heard all the hype about Cibo and how great their pizzas are, we I'm not sure what everyone's talking about because both pizzas lacked quality and taste.  First off the crust is very hard and chewy, your jaw becomes sore after half a slice. Not sure what they put in their dough but this is way too tough (maybe need a little more yeast?)  It's almost like eating a cold hard sourdough with tomato sauce on it.  The toppings were non existent, a few little sprinkles of sausage, and pepperoni that's it!  The sauce bland, and the cheese just okay, We ordered the meat combo, I don't mind paying for good quality, but for this small little pizza, and for the little amount of topping this was unacceptable.  I have been to good quality "wood fired" pizzerias and they were loaded with toppings and full of flavor and wonderful sauce and cheeses. Cibo pizza lacked in all areas, I will not come here again - the ambiance was quaint and nice however the pizza and salads and the rest of the fare is unacceptable.    1 Star for the ambiance  1 Star for the pizza  I will not be back...unless I am going for drinks..

0UhlF56X-uwX6SZzfjjSWA.text: We had an absolutely lovely weeknight dinner here.  The patio was shaded, the misters gently cooling us, and the gorgeous landscape providing a relaxing atmosphere.  The cappuccino, quattro fromaggi pizza, the Margherita pizza, gnocchi, pear salad, and the banana  nutella crepe were great.  Probably the only thing I might not order again would be the pear salad as it didn't seem to be the greatest value.  The pizzas and crepe were PERFECT!  Soft, yet chewy crust delicately supporting the toppings with just a bit of gorgonzola on the quattro pizza!

zq2B2A5Z92jPk5hRLv-JKw.text: This place was so cute! I wish it was nicer outside to be able to sit outside on the patio. The food was great! It is a hidden gem! Their appetizers with fresh mozzarella was amazing! I had their pizza with no sauce and it was delicious! I will be coming back  here again.

9ReccduE95VdM5T9FWEoVw.text: This place is always amazing, every time I go.  The burrata is to die for and I order it as soon as I sit down.  If you don't get there semi early though, they typically run out by 6 or 7 on Fridays and Saturdays.  All of the pizzas I've had are super tasty, with local ingredients for toppings.  My favorite has to be the Diavolo with ricotta.  The salami has a nice spicy kick and the ricotta balances it out nicely.  Its a little warm during the summer, as most of the seating is outside.  But once the sun goes down and they turn on the decorative lighting, you forget you're in downtown Phoenix.  I'd recommend this place over Pizzeria Bianco anytime.  Half the wait and twice as good.

XmcDe4uVEoM8ienawHyuGw.text: Well the big fuss was overrated, however it is an ok place to dine with friends. The crust nothing to brag about but it's home made ,very nice.  The Orr of the place is a winner . Loved the  verify of dish to choose from. Will recommend to others just not Ooooo a must gotta go there recommendation .

PNB6Lk5DpdONk0gHGSnj-A.text: Really great food and atmosphere.  Valet parking is easy and convenient. Great wine list. One of my favorite places to go! Update for December 2014 - dinner was great, place was packed. Six of us dining and requested two bills. A tip was added onto both bills, but it was not easy to see that it was added...two of us looked for it before adding a tip and neither of us saw that it was added. Of course the server did NOT have the courtesy to tell us. We added 20% and she still didn't say a thing, resulting in an almost 40% tip!! I tip very well if the service is good, but I'm very disappointed that a server wouldn't point out that it is included in the bill already. We had to find her and request a partial refund of our double tip, which was embarrassing. She knew exactly what she was doing. Management be aware of your employees pulling this on customers.

RrrH0zSwfYM-5rl-he1aWQ.text: What to say that hasn't been said? My husband and I visited Cibo by chance. We had driven by about a year before while we were kind of lost downtown, and said "that place is really busy, we'll have to try it some time." I am SO happy that we did tonight. We were seated promptly outside tucked in the corner. It's December, so you would think we would be chilly, we kept our jackets on during dinner but there are plenty of heaters surrounding the outside tables, so we were kept warm. The ambiance is beautiful, the outside tables are lit how you wish every restaurant you visit would be.     I had the green tea, real tea, nothing that they bring you in a bag, but they actually pour the hot water over the real tea leaves, it was very good. My husband said the coffee was rather good as well.   As an appetizer we split the pear salad: Spinach, vinaigrette, almonds, cheese, pears and honey. I'm not horribly adventurous when it comes to mealtime so I was nervous, but it was so good.   I'd say 1 pizza can heartily feed 2 people, but we opted for separate ones to try anyway. I had the Salsiccia (sausage, mozzarella, and red sauce), while my husband opted for the Salsiccia con Patate (sausage, roasted potatoes). The crust is soft and chewy, not overdone like so many places. His was a bit drier than mine, no sauce, but both were still good and we walked away with a whole pizza left over between the two of us, yummy yummy left overs!   The Dessert: All we could say was "Oh My!" We had the Fresca Crepe. A delicious crepe filled with vanilla ice cream and fruit, topped with whipped cream and more fruit. Fresh peaches, kiwi, and strawberries. We had the Nutella on the side but it was quite good drizzled on top. I'd go back for the dessert alone!  Our server, James, was very polite and there was one girl going around always asking people if they needed more water. I never felt neglected by the waitstaff and it is Friday night after all.   Overall, I have to say this is a favorite thus far!

bVPnpGn2w8TQU0tFxjU2uA.text: Amazing crepes! The berry crepes were to die for. I want to try the Nutella ones next time.

u_zm9TQKoHa-rOjRBQnNlQ.text: Tuesday evening, three adults, came about 5 pm, not busy. 1st time here. Chose from Yelp reviews. Nice environment.  Good service, liked the varied menu. Had the 4 cheese pizza and the marguerita pizza, good size, fresh ingredients, excellent. Also had one small salad, fresh and tasty.  Prices not cheap, yet high quality, would comeback if in the area.  Needs help: Outside maintenance needs work, holes in the pavement, garden needs attention, some paint needed. Could indicate lack of attention inside the restaurant.

P4JDvyyU3y-eb6q1b9Mmaw.text: It seemed to take too long for the pizza to come out, but it was good. I liked the atmosphere but the parking situation sucked. I had the nutella crepes for dessert and quite honestly they are a distant second to crackers and company's crepes. Not impressed enough with the overall situation to come back.

G3kEdxHo83XJtX66vjWDFg.text: Love dining on the cute outdoor patio. On a few occasions, there has been a live musician.  Gluten free pizza is excellent- you almost don't realize it's gluten free. Fresh toppings were used on our pizza.  Good pizza and wine selection as well.  Service was prompt and friendly.

rFVru6FAztqoZBrlN6CBUw.text: What a great place! I yelped this restaraunt on the way to the airport. The service was speedy and the food is phenomenal. I got the funghi pizza with Italian sausage and my brother got the BBQ pulled pork sandwich. It was the best pulled pork sandwich I have ever tried. I only gave it four stars cause the service was a little awkward. Our waitress didn't talk much but it wouldn't be enough to prevent me from going there again. We will definitely be back!

WRWX5QrKiFRE8XOQPejG6A.text: Love Cibo, the simple presence of this restaurant in the neighborhood is really good for the revitalization of downtown.   The salsicce sandwich and house salad are amazing and the staff is great. totally recommend

dnTRfIIXpk5Cp5wpQdmIUw.text: Oh Cibo how I love thee! Let me count the ways  You have the most adorable setting i've ever laid eyes on  The Salads are so fresh and sized to share  The pizza's are OUT.OF.THIS.WORLD!   And let's not forget dessert. I look forward to the Fresca crepe with each visit I make.  I heart you Cibo.

0de2covQrYeJ0NWRrwEScg.text: Good food and good atmosphere. I love the patio area, quaint and inviting,

3aE8IRWahhYXOPgmqIYybQ.text: If you cannot get into Pizza Bianco, come over to Cibo, or come to Cibo first and enjoy the great pizza, sandwiches, and soups made here. The ambiance here is great.  It occupies an old home built in the early 1900's and a patio that makes you feel like home. Went one Tuesday Pasta night which used to occur weekly and still does I hope and had the best pasta since my trip to Italy.  A hidden gem in downtown Phoenix.

Juzx8vRiaNCZgIHl9plxKw.text: I'm pretty picky about my pizza and have extremely high expectations (LGO being my favorite in the Valley), but I can't say enough great things about this place... Amazing date spot, delicious fresh food, kind service, and adorable atmosphere. The pizza is that italian still, thin, homemade style crust with fresh toppings in a wood-fire brick oven. The pasta is delicious as well.  It can get pretty busy during prime weekend dinner hours so I recommend a nice mid-week visit.  Love, love.

1MSwO0NHyC0gS8pq2DbA8Q.text: We have been countless times for but lunch and dinner and have always had a wonderful experience.  The food, ambiance, and staff are incredible.  Actually, the pizza is the best I've ever had.  The Margarita is a tried and True but my new favorite is the "La Noce".

vaTIOP_nMI8unM3fjMoWEQ.text: The best pizza and crepes.  i had the crepe with fresh fruit and ice cream. i'm not a big crepe fan, but I crave theirs.

h-N_9gjY16lq9y0qC6AUHQ.text: One of my new favorite pizza places.  People have been recommending this place since I moved Downtown, and I am glad I finally decided to take a few friends there for dinner.  The pizza did not disappoint.  The friendly, service oriented staff was happy to make recommendations and highlight some tasty choices on the menu.  I will definitely go back.  Only down side for a vegetarian - double check the menu descriptions (lots of prosciutto).

3riQc9FUoTAvn2setO6Fow.text: This is my favorite downtown Phoenix restaurant. Unique, intimate atmosphere, friendly service, and delicious food, especially the pizza.

cEja3-2X1wOh0bDzuqdQcQ.text: This place is awesome! It's very quaint as it is a house converted into a restaurant. We sat outside but didn't realize that there had been construction being done on the street. At times it was so loud we just didn't bother to try and repeat what we had said. The other thing was the offensive smell! The dumpster sits right by the parking lot of the restaurant and if you sit outside you get a disgusting whiff of it every once in a while. Very unappetizing.   The food itself is delicious! I got the mele salad which has caramelized walnuts, blue cheese, and apple slices. The dressing perfectly complimented the other ingredients. The pizza was had a delicious crust and ooey gooey cheese. One of the better specialty pizzas I've had.   Definitely would go back and have!

eN5DFVTYLJm7Buce1F6C2w.text: AMAZING! This little gem is hidden away just outside downtown phoenix! It is a small little restaurant being run out of what looks like it used to be a small house. They menu offers a variety of flavor combinations that one would never think of when cooking at home.  The service staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. They have great suggestions and offer explanations of the ingredients in English.   The moscato de asti is WONDERFUL. It is so sweet and goes so well with any meal. It is very reasonably priced and is more cost efficient when ordered by the bottle.  Be adventurous, try something new, DONT ASK FOR RANCH and make sure you order the nutella and banana crepe for dessert!

ak_1kP_NYm8I81RZ7oF6wQ.text: I typically agree with Yelp ratings, so the cognitive dissonance I've experienced twice now going to Cibo is really strange for me. I have to chalk it up to going both times during lunch, when they don't serve pizza, because people seem to be crazy for the pizza here, but everything I've had at this place just plain sucks. From a mushy "meatball" sandwich that played more like an Italian sloppy joe to the criminally dry, flavorless salad topped stingily with tiny, cold chunks of bland chicken. I don't have any good words for any of the entrees I have tried here and nothing my companions ordered looked especially appealing either.  Oh cool! They start you out with some bread on a cutting board. Ask them for butter though, and you'll be informed that they don't have any. No butter! A restaurant that is devoid of butter. Let me talk about this for a second. First of all, I don't believe it, so just right there, I think you're lying to me. Saying "our policy is to not give our customers butter when they ask for it" doesn't sound so good though, so I understand. The service was otherwise acceptable, if not terribly friendly.  If you ask me, and I know I'm only one small voice amid a chorus of four and five star reviews, this place is long on atmosphere and location and short on everything else. Expensive prices for the stingy portions of mediocre food. I don't even know if I'll go back for the pizza.

UDDUz7MPJwXahEQtrM_jMQ.text: My boyfriend and I went here on a Friday evening. We had about a 30 min. wait which we spent in the bar w/ a good glass of wine.  We were seated and promptly greeted by our waitress. She was friendly and quick.  We split 2 pizzas, had a bottle of wine, and the Nutella Crepes. Everything was delicious!!  At the end when we received our check, we were pleasantly surprised at how affordable the meal was.  From start to finish, we loved this restaurant! The ambiance, food, and service were impeccable. We will definitely return!

Rx9_lNuWbd5N_rDQb0cemA.text: Pizza, service and nutella shake are always perfect . I have been to this place many times and will continue to go. In my opinion, they have the best pizza in Phoenix.

VGQxVDitUmzhDhyCIc34lw.text: My dear Cibo - do not get too big for your britches.  When my husband calls to make reservations, do not call him "Dude" and "Bro."  Don't tell him that we will be "lucky to get in" at 7:30 and that you don't take reservations after opening.  Also, the waitstaff appears to be in a constant state of change (not the bartenders, but the waitresses/ers.  The woman we had this past Tuesday was below average at best.  Yes, everyone has an off day, but when you work in one of the hottest places in Phoenix... and make your money off tips... MIGHT want to liven up a bit.  Cibo, you are our PLACE!  So live up to our memories and keep them going into the future!

_WphQpqS3A9dXWuJihJ-Xg.text: Man... what happened?  My wife and I felt pretty bad, after hyping Cibo up to friends for the past couple weeks, only to be treated fairly strangely and shabbily by our waiter. We were the only two in our group who had been there before, and luckily the only ones embarrassed when things did not go as smoothly as we would've hoped.  Our large party would agree that the food and the atmosphere are still top notch, as are the wines and that delicious homemade limoncello... But the service just fell off, due to one person in particular. Read Nader A's review for the full story, but the gist of it is there was a (rude) miscommunication on the waiter's part, and he was so steadfast (attitude) about not admitting his mistake that it cost him any additional tip he might have received. He also chose to do this at peak volume coinciding with the entertainer's break, so not only did everyone at our table get an earful, but so did the surrounding patrons. it was like a scene in a movie when a bunch of people who do not belong walk into the wrong bar and the needle scratches right off the record. To Nader A's credit, he remained cool, but the damage was done. Later on we found out that our waiter also dissuaded others at the table from customizing their pizzas because "they are perfect the way they are." I don't know if he had something else going on and decided to take it out on us, but to snap at us the way he did was truly unacceptable.  We were planning on having the table sample some of Cibo's delicious crepes for dessert, and I'm positive we would have certainly drank a bit more as well, but instead we chose to leave early and take our business elsewhere. Will we be back? Eventually, but in all honesty not anytime soon, and definitely not in that guy's section.  I in no way would dissuade anyone from trying out Cibo. They excel at what they do, and my experience was most likely out of the ordinary.

RFLGyf8DNVGkuZ68DmOqSQ.text: Cibo is just a couple blocks from my office and I have to say it's some damn good pizza. I visited there with a couple work buddies for their birthday party a couple months ago. The owners were there hobnobbing with the patrons as the passed out FREE Margherita pizza and two dollar beers. Good beer too! I got a Lagunita's Little Sumpin.   Aside from their awesome basically free birthday bash I have been several times before.  The starters are delicious and usually change with the season's (I believe). The charcuterie plate is a great way to get your night going with some red wine. It's called Il Tagliere and it really gets me going. The other starters are great too (honestly the starters are better than the pizza)  The pizza is delicious but not my favorite in the valley. They do Neapolitan style with a nice sweet dough that is a little chewy. I really can't say much about the pizza besides the fact that it is really good but i prefer the  za's at POMO, Bianco, and strangely La Grande Orange. That being said I have only tried the margherita and the fresco...  ALSO! If you happen to be there when they are serving pasta, ditch the pizza and get the pasta you will not regret it.

bnvX0Qr3IzIi7QYJAUf-xg.text: I keep meaning to review this place.  Every time I go, as I'm sitting, devouring what I have proclaimed "might be my favorite pizza, ever.", I commit to reviewing Cibo, but somehow, in my post-pizza bliss, I forget.  Not this time!  Time to give credit where credit is due.  Cibo is 100% adorable... the repurposed old house, the charming patio, the live music in the evenings.... just adorable.  It's small(ish) but I think that's part of it's charm.  Somehow we've been lucky and never had to wait more than 10 minutes to be seated, even on Friday and Saturday evenings.  (By the way... this is one of the main reasons I prefer Cibo over the highly-touted Pizzaria Bianco).    Antipasti-- I've had both the pear salad and the caprese salad and both are delicious.  Of the two, the pear salad is my favorite-- the honey adds an interesting element that compliments the rest of the salad nicely.    Pizza- La Noce is what I'm referring to as "might be my favorite pizza, ever.".  I love the flavor of the arugula, ricotta, and walnuts-- and the red sauce is perfect.-- an interesting blend of flavors that just works I've also tried the Pomodoro Fresco-- also delicious, but La Noce is still my favorite.  Others I've eaten with have ordered other pizzas as well and all have proclaimed them fabulous. The crust is perfectly done, thin without being soggy.    Service- The service is reliably good-- not amazing or remarkable, but good.  No issues here.    So if you like awesome pizza in an adorable atmosphere and you don't want to wait ages, this is your place.  Just do it-- you won't be sorry!

PhWWZpuGPJxEoN4QfrPm4w.text: Excellent homemade pasta and relaxing atmosphere.  So glad I live downtown so I can walk here and get my fix :)

08CKe5cxf9r-SWaMwkcAvQ.text: Hands down the best pizza in AZ! Favorite place to take out of town guests. Make sure you order the Burrata. Best appetizer that will be inhaled. Perfect blend of fresh homemade mozzarella, prosciutto, balsamic vinegar and toasted bread. The pizza is second to none. There can be a little wait, but just grab a glass of wine and relax on the patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burrata Appetizer

O4eFsk3chTansI37BJF3bw.text: My wife and I traveled to Phoenix last week to spend Spring Break with my daughter who is attending ASU. During our visit we had the "privilege" of eating at Pizzeria Bianco Tuesday night... after a 2+ hour wait. My father had suggested we go eat there after seeing this place mentioned on one of his Food Network shows. I must say the atmosphere is decent, the service so so, and the pizza just OK.   So, the next night I took my wife to a place I had eaten at last summer named Cibo which is just a few blocks away. After the first taste of her Siena pizza she turned to me and said "this place blows away Bianco"... she is right.   When you are there you must try the Burrata appetizer. I had the pleasure of trying it last summer when it was just added to the menu and was glad to see it stuck around. I seriously doubt there is a pizza on the menu you will not like but that night we had the Diavola as well as the Siena mentioned above (both fabulous). Make sure to finish off the evening with some homemade Limoncello and you will gladly thank me later...  We got lucky enough to find a seat on the patio and were able to dine under a perfect Phoenix sky. Our server was named Melissa and she was great. She suggested the perfect wine for our meal and was very attentive the whole time we were there.   We cannot wait to go again!!!

8qGdA5RwP9JBxyz65FbhVA.text: Disclaimer: Like many of you, I am a sucker for charming little homes that have been re-purposed into restaurants. I am certain that this colored my opinion of Cibo.  That being said, I absolutely love having lunch here the other day. I unknowingly arrived at 2:05 (5 minutes after they close between lunch and dinner) but was served anyway. I had the salscicia sandwich and a side of fruit. The sandwich was excellent, served on perfectly crisp, chewy saltimbocca bread. The sausage was flavorful and was complimented by roasted red peppers and onions. All this was finished off with a great quality mozzarella cheese. Really, really delicious.  I should also say that the atmosphere here was friendly and  comfortable, though a bit small. This would be a great place to hang out if you lived nearby.

vglgk6CFgUcK4-A989jX0w.text: Two words:  Sexist Bartender.  If you're a woman over the age of say, 35, and you're not with a man?  Forget it.   You won't get served.  I watched man after man and couple after couple appear after me, while I stood there with my money on the bar and waited, and waited,  and waited, missing all the conversation my group was having across the room.  Finally left in disgust.  Bleh.

HwIDsVTErXxhQ5PiSZkIRg.text: Pizza is not to shabby here. I like it better than Bianco and in some ways is comparable to a New York slice. But definitely a good decision to check out CIBO if you're in the mood for a good pizza in Phoenix! One key to good pizza is the dough and the crust is soft!  Great atmosphere, ambiance, quaint any time of the year. Love the outdoor seating on the patio with fire areas, live music and an assortment of lights. Service was okay, I had an empty water the whole meal.   I would definitely come back here and try some other pizzas and maybe an entree. For dessert, we had the strawberry banana crepe with Nutella - I mean a crepe with chcoclate, yum. But they were out of their other chocolate dessert :( Let me rewind back to appetizer, caprese salad is enough for a handful of people. The mozzarella tossed with pesto, oregano, EVOO, chopped fresh basil and grape tomatoes is absolutely scrumptious.   Check it out !

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. CIBO
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great outdoor vibe

dOCgqFVeJVjdPEAw9SdIeQ.text: Great atmosphere and food! I went here on a date and we got the burrata appetizer and a pizza. They were both amazing... especially the burrata!!. Go on a cool summer night and sit outside.

k75Mm-cnmHNpk27kUVaJjQ.text: Great spot for a work lunch!  Cibo had been on my list for a while. Had a chance to eat their for a work lunch and thoroughly enjoyed it. The staff is attentive, food options are appealing, and the ingredients used all combine for a very appealing feast. Orders, drinks and bread, and meals all hit our table with perfect timing.  We had the Margherita Pizza and a Capri Salad. Both were excellent. The pizza bread was perfect and they did not make an oily mess of the cheese. The flavors of the cheese and sausage (I added) came through nicely, without overpowering. My colleage commented that her salad was fresh and also excellent.   Will be back to try some other option!

7OX5yZaX_NWmkYtTxpIxXQ.text: I really enjoy both the food and the atmosphere at Cibo, especially on the patio. It's a romantic little spot and a great place to take a date. They have delicious brick oven pizzas. I love the Margherita especially. It it very reasonably priced. The parking is rough and I would suggest procuring reservations well in advanced because it's so popular.

zl3NaB1mKZVFepf_wVlplg.text: Fresh ingredients, surprisingly family friendly, live music (I went on a Tuesday night) and wonderful outdoor dinning. I was visiting from the cold Midwest so it was lovely being able to eat outside in March. I ordered the Margherita pizza and a wheat beer that the waiter recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The margherita pizza I ordered with a wheat beer. The basil was amazingly fresh.
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. entrance

hw_zWymNYsmXT8xRnFG36A.text: A gem in downtown Phoenix.  Food and wine was delicious and staff was very informed and friendly.  The building makes this dining experience even better, so cute and cozy.  We need more of this in downtown Phoenix.

LQBUsgnaoIkLHCU_Of1A9g.text: Visited for dinner on a Friday @ 7pm with 3 other people. Was seated quickly.  We ordered the cheese/meats board. It was delicious. We shared two pizzas. One was a mozzarella/meat pizza. It was great. The other was a pesto w/ potato... it was just OK. Overall, the food and service was good. This is not my first visit here. Been here a few times. Have been satisfied each time I have eaten here.

vW4QlXsgb0e7Z2UCohHHhg.text: ..... And there's a new winner in town.  I really enjoy a good pie, as most of us do.  Lately, I've been finding myself at Cibo.  I use to fequent another spot in the Phoenix area for my pizza cravings however, that has all changed.   So if your searching for  authentic Italian food, at  a reasonable price.  Look no further Cibo is the place for you.   Every pizza on the menu at Cibo looks amazing. I cant wait to try them all.  So far my favorotes are the Salsiccia and and Diavola.  However, I would be neglectful if I  didn't' mention the calzones which are absolutely delicious, the best I ever had.  You have to start your meal with one  of Cibo's aperterisers.  Try the Arancini or Burrata, its more than enough for two people.  Cibo offers a modest  wine list at prices that  won't make you cringe  when you see them.    The serving sizes at Cibo are very generous, however that didn't stop us from ending the night with a fruit crepe which was more than enough for two people.  The service at Cibo is second to none. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and accommodating. If your looking for amazing food and service, stop by you won't be disappointed.

H9TcURotw6cygVChJ3Cm_Q.text: This place is PHENOMENAL. We were driving across country from D.C. To San Diego and made a pit stop in Phoenix to have dinner here before the Suns vs Wiz game. The potato gnocchi was delicious, tender and plenty of sauce and mozzarella. We had a pizza halved between the red Diavlo and the white Tartufata, bon apetit! We sat outdoors which is somewhat secluded with the lit up treesand quiet chatter ambience. This place is a MUST! Erika was our waitress,she was superb!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Half Diavlo and half Tutafrata pizza

bNgx6Q6SgHAwIsmW9O5BGA.text: Really mediocre experience. We felt the waiter was kinda scattered and couldnt manage our large party. Food orders weren't taken accurately or timely and some people were billed incorrectly. The food was just okay... no one in our group raved about any of their items. Another bummer was that they only service wine and beer, but lacked a strong list of either. My bf and his friend hated the beer that the waiter recommended and I wasn't thrilled with their Sauvignon blanc. I had high hopes for this place bc of the great reviews but sadly it didn't live up to its stars.

ZLVbk-PXpnH8XpUKsXnMXQ.text: Staff was a bit pretentious but that was the only flaw here. Sit outside if you can!! Feels like a little Italian Villa ;) lovely

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-XNMDDGS_B2ZBgrflR168w.text: Great food. I had the Italian sausage sandwich with a salad and it was great. Unique seating options, as you can sit inside or out.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Italian sausage sandwich. Yum!!!

cAHAsdX685IG6pLeaQz1QA.text: Wonderful outdoor seating area. There is always amazing live music playing. The service was good. And the food was great. They let you do half & half pizzas, even with the sauce.

2-O8zaqQBiGEZf_sA7WWZA.text: Good food and friendly staff. The location is great as is the set up. The cooks are accommodating and the service is fairly quick.

0t2HwGEPl7kTxIypy1fZTA.text: Before I found out "Cibo" means "food" in Italian, I thought it was a Mexican restaurant, deceived by its extraordinarily cute exterior.   Cibo is, on the most part, a pizza place. The parking lot is full of very nice BMWs and Audis. So it must have done something right.  The pizzas at Cibo remind me a lot of those at La Grande Orange: gourmet toppings, thin sourdough crust, and fragrant cheese. We ordered three pizzas for the table, all tasted great, except that... they were awfully similar.   Granted, I probably shouldn't expect too much of a variety when we were having pizzas (for a birthday celebration), but I was hoping for something life-changing, like the slice of pizza I had in Rome. Well, Cibo is no food hauled from Rome for sure, but it is nonetheless a good place to chill and get solid food in central Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9sAvYgo6PPZ7jSGf-bytFQ.text: Cibo is our absolute favorite place for date night. It is beautiful at night with the lights and big trees and live music on certain nights. Their neapolitan style pizza is amazing and our favorite. The staff is always friendly and attentive, there's a decent wine list, a short beer list but does have some craft beers. Dessert crepes are amazing! Cannot say enough good things about this place! It is definitely one beautiful place for a date etc. There is valet parking in the back, but you could also park along the streets and walk.

g1ntnFlSncLdjeqj5FsQFQ.text: Awesome place! My go to pizza is the tartafata pizza. You can't go wrong. I like the "super" crepe for dessert. It's not on the menu. Strawberries, Marscepone and Nutella filled crepe topped with vanilla ice cream. Wash it all down with a fresh vanilla latte. This place doesn't disappoint. Get here early as it's almost always packed. Give it a try. You won't regret it.

dD4zWuJp412xp2RYFnDVJA.text: We had just one night in Phoenix and Cibo was such a pleasant surprise! As New York pizza snobs, we took a leap of faith that paid off deliciously. Attentive service, straightforward but creative menu and seriously good pizza - if I make it back to Phoenix, Cibo will for sure be on my list

KYpbKEdCUAm_hPXuQsI2Bw.text: Food 5 Service 5  Atmosphere 5   FOOD: Cibo has elevated my expectations of good pizza. The crust was crisp and the flavor combinations were expert! I had a half and half combination of Diavola and Genova. The Diavola is slightly spicy and though I don't like spice, the flavor was excellent! I highly recommend the Genova pizza! An entirely unique flavor experience!   SERVICE: We had a fantastic service team, Yasmin and Brittany were kind and welcoming and had such a genuine approachability. They wanted us to have a great experience and gave us passionate recommendations! They are great!   ATMOSPHERE: This place is so warm and inviting! The restaurant is within what used to be a house, it's clean and the tables are well spaced. Patio dining looks great! This could be a great romantic stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banana crepe
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Interior
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Diavola and Genova

0CUBEdtOkVXvCbm8uGAftA.text: delicious pizza. this place was highly rated on Yelp and so we had to come and check it out. We came during lunch time so we couldn't take advantage of sitting outside. The restaurant decor is relaxing and beautiful. Since we came during lunch time, we lucked out and were able to order a dinner time menu item. we started off with arancini balls. The rice ball was a tad salty but still delicious. we ordered diavalo (spicy salami) and tartafata pizza. The spicy salami pizza was our favorite. It had just the right amount of kick to it. The tartafata was a bit too salty for us. We loved the thin crust pizza and had just enough sauce go with it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. diavalo
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tartufata
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Arancini

Wqof89CIoOacj31YzS6mSw.text: Charming court yard with amazing service. I am big fan for Italian food but mainly for its pasta (and have been pretty peculiar about it). I was quite underwhelmed by the fried calamari- $12 for some frozen rubber-like breaded calamari was really I had hoped for thus a four star. (What was I thinking when I order seafood in the middle of a desert?! I asked for it). The pasta was quite a meh that I could not finish it; thank goodness the pizza with anchovies was great!   All in all, I would come back again as a no brainer, and will go ahead with their pizza and wine.

d5XRkVlgLnE-6ocVBp4jeg.text: This is my favorite restaurant. My wife and I go every chance we get. The sausage and potato pizza is the absolute best.

ydE-V9cGGhecNOtHO435hA.text: Best pizza in AZ. Tatufatta is bomb and so is the one with pear and goat cheese?  I think that's what it was. Anyway, if you're there and they have fresh pasta, get down on that. Also their crepes are dank af and you need that in your life. Stop reading this and go get fat at Cibo

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0FBSs8568GzW0muATReeIA.text: We were recently at Cibo for our wedding rehearsal dinner and rented out the carriage room in the back. We were extremely pleased with the food and service we received and our guests raved about how good the food was. For anyone looking for a rehearsal dinner for a smaller group, we had around 20-25 guests, I would highly recommend dining at Cibo.

YBskvGJSPBqGEAc_IAR3eA.text: The pizza here is some of the best in Phoenix. The ambiance is also a huge plus as it has a romantic setting. My only issue is the wait, but it's expected given the size of the restaurant. Come on a weekend night for live music!

gTPLdjBBe5ytG3L0W_A97w.text: this place is str8 fire  please, when you go, start off with the Arancini. i didn't know these things existed and now i feel foolish for going so long in my life without them. They are basically just like little balls of rice, stuffed w cheese, breaded, and deep fried. no nonsense, just wondrous, lush cheesy fried goodness.  when you are inside the restaurant, you feel like you are at home because 1) its inside a little old house basically and 2) great vibes. service was very friendly and accommodating (we had a big group)  since we had a big group, we opted for a pizza/wine spread to keep things simple. thus, i can't comment on things like pasta, salads, etc. however, if they have the same quality as the pizza that means they are bomb. and everything is bomb. i love this place

nSd8tlK3iKJxMzyi1j_hgA.text: This location is fantastic on a warm (but comfortable!) summer night. Live jazz band in the outdoor seating area is fantastic as well. Exterior and location is one of a kind in the area--and appeared to be the only restaurant or just a generic place taking customers in.  We of course took advantage of the cute scenery outside and decided to eat near the band. The waiter was very accommodating and patient with our seating decisions since we became a bit indecisive on where we wanted to sit in order to enjoy the entire environment. Food! tried two of their pizzas: Margherita and Salsiccia Con Patate (sausage and roasted potatoes on their white sauce pizza, this was superb!!) I thought I would end up feasting on the Margherita in case the Salsiccia Con Patate didn't pan out well, but this ended up being the dish of the night.   Cibo had a range of customers and occassions celebrated when we went. I would come here for a first date, 50th date, 55th birthday, any type of occasion.

HFh3TRtc5hWr3e8xm1v6vg.text: This is by far my favorite restaurant in Phoenix, and probably my favorite pizza I've ever had. The quality of food here is excellent! Love the 4 cheese pizza and the crepes are amazing as well.  The ambiance is romantic, relaxed and really gorgeous at night. Love cibo!

sxRSaiJtG8qoQKzsd3mIPg.text: Love Cibo! So cute for a night out with your special someone and if you're a pasta lover I would definitely recommend getting one of the two options. Cats do roam around though so that's a little weird while you're eating dinner.

QLF8m_DR4mjoD5V14asOfg.text: Great pizza. Great service. Great ambiance. Guido is amazing. You won't be disappointed.

PmQ5bdripuE0niyFjXL5Rg.text: I ordered the Genova pizza.  Straight up, it tasted like grass.  The onions and potatoes were still raw and I couldn't taste the basil pesto.  It tasted like grass.  The entire meal I was wishing I just ordered a margherita pizza.  My husband had a safe sausage pizza.  I ended up eating part of his pizza because I couldn't stand mine.    Still I can understand the charm of this place.  It's tucked away downtown and has a homey feel to it.    I don't know if I wanna give them another chance.  Maybe, but not anytime soon.

GWPEdNnJpqg77Oxm9VjPUQ.text: I have been here 3 times. Food is pretty tasty. Went with group of friends tried diff pizzas, salad and for dessert had crepes. Enjoyed the nice atmosphere. Great service too! A bit expensive for my budget so I don't go often.

IpeS9_S30ZWDoEStvbvwaQ.text: If you want to impress your in-laws or take your wife to somewhere nice.  This is the place right here.  The food is incredible and this location is perfect.  It's really nice in there.

v3ill95Z3pGYEhTtlKtGGQ.text: Was looking for a cute date night, and this was the perfect spot! The wait was fairly short for a Saturday night and the ambience was very romantic! I wanted to order a pizza but couldn't decide between the Funghi and the Da Vinci. The waitresses let me know you can you do half/half which is just what I ordered. I highly recommend the Da Vinci! My bf got the Genova, a pesto pizza, which he really liked! Also recommend the spicy oil as a nice dipping sauce! I will definitely be back to try the other menu options!

RwAlDfSllf9_I4DcKlHcwg.text: Came here for lunch while we were in Phoenix. We looked at restaurants in the area (downtown), and Cibo kept coming up due to the amount of reviews and the high ratings. Overall, I thought it was pretty good, especially relative to Phoenix restaurants.   FOOD: 4 stars. The food here was really good - better than I was expecting. The only thing I didn't like was the Bruschetta three ways. One piece comes with the traditional tomatoes, basil, and olive oil (really good), one piece had prosciutto (?) and cheese on it (second best, not great) and the third piece had something with olives on it. I didn't even try it because I absolutely hate olives. It would be a lot better if they stuck to the traditional tomato, basil, olive oil one. The Caprese Salad was also really good and it came as a pretty large portion. we ordered the pizza due to the recommendation by our server. The pizza was really good, especially for having no pizza sauce. It was light and didn't give us a food coma feeling. The only drawback was that their lunch menu didn't offer any pasta, which was a little disappointing. Apparently they make their own pasta in house for dinner only, which I really wanted to try but didn't get to. Everything we ordered was really good and I would order it again!   SERVICE: 4 stars. Service was really good and really patient. I appreciated our sever's patience while we had a lot of questions and a lot of requests. Everything came out quickly and was really good!  LOCATION: 4 stars. Cute restaurant but I was so confused walking up to it. I thought it was someone's house, honestly. It was hard to find the actual front door for the main restaurant, because there is a smaller side of the place adjacent to it.   This place is really good and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for Italian food in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch Di Notte pizza
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Caprese Salad

bIMxUfinJddVoLXeyq5fOw.text: I went here last night after a 4 year break. The last time I went I wasn't overly impressed. My experience last night reaffirmed my original judgment.   I will give them a 5 out of 5 on service and ambiance.  We sat out on the patio with twinkling lights and live music from the flute player. A very nice and romantic setting.  We had the meatballs for a starter and they were really good and a very generous portion. We had to take some home in order to not spoil our appetite for the pizza.   We got the capricciosa pizza that has mozzarella, prosciutto cotto, artichoke, black olives, and mushrooms. I guess it's  shame on me for not realizing that prosciutto cotto was not prosciutto as I know it but sliced deli meat ham, and the artichoke tasted like it came out of a jar. Over all the pizza lacked any distinguishing flavors, very bland and a lack of texture in the toppings.  The pizza crust was thin and crispy, maybe we just ordered the wrong thing?   I won't say don't go, but I'm not rushing to go back.

Xg1NDylAouxhoBNUYeQgcg.text: Not super great. We ordered a pizza with pesto, pasta dish and a sandwich. The truffle fries that came with the sandwich were the best of the meh food. I've heard people say that this place rivals Pizzeria Bianca, I disagree. But maybe it would just what we ordered, giving this place a 3 to give the benefit of the doubt. Won't be coming back though

5PRITBYP_-NmeU2QxjiqLQ.text: Cozy place to dine. Plenty of outside seating. We had the Meatball Appetizer ( sauce was great ). And the spicy salami pizza and Salad but the star dish of the night was definitely the Crepe desert filled with fruits and Marscapone cheese.  Dynamite.
