The dough didn't seem cooked through, probably due to the soggy dough. The toppings were skimpy and black olives turned out to be kalamata olives, whole kalamata olives. Server also never came back after dropping off our drinks until she brought the check.

ZoWDl1fzxTjyjWuJHx6f1A.text: The ambiance is enough to make me want to come in, but the food and service is what has me coming back time and time again! The deserts are really amazing too! They make amazing pizzas and one of the best spots in Phoenix by far!!!!!!!!

0V5LUvSnzg1k_7qAzjnGCw.text: Our family group was very happy dining on the lovely outdoor patio, though the service was inattentive, and the food quality inconsistent. Our waiter barely looked at us when he occasionally visited the table, and requests for this or that seemed to fall upon deaf ears, more often than not. However, he did have an efficient and personable young woman helping out, who pitched in now and then to keep ball rolling, luckily for us.   The pizzas looked lovely, but the salads seemed rather more thrown together, than appealing. After the main course, about half of our used and stacked (hint, hint!) dishware hung out with us while we waited on a few desserts to arrive. Requested to-go boxes arrived haphazardly, in dribs and drabs, necessitating repeated requests. The dessert crepes were delicious, though, particularly the one with fresh fruit, cream, and ice cream.   Overall:  Venue: Charming Service: Crummy Food: OK to Good

qpGFC5J7VQwPcdwVqxgVCA.text: We have now been to Italy and had pizza there. Cibo's has always been our favorite pizzeria/Italian food in Phoenix. Well now I can officially say it is just like the 'real' thing! Very authentic, delicious food and great service. I love sitting outside and enjoying the live music on weekends :) Awesome vibe downtown!

dYGs7QzNyQVCGGSwqckACQ.text: This has been one of my favorite local place for very long time.  Not just my favorite pizza place but favorite restaurant.  Every time we go, we have our small appetizer or salad, wine and pizza.  It's all delicious!  In my opinion, you cannot go wrong with any item on the menu.  Whether seated inside amongst the electric decor or amongst the trees, Cibo is always enjoyable quite romantic place!

Ol_WgOZYIrstsgZNuT5yEQ.text: My boyfriend and I came in to have some crepes, we ordered one with fruits and while it did looks delicious, it was not as tasteful as it looked.  The strawberries tasted very tarty and the lemon cream inside was not that great. I would much rather stick to my all time crepe place, colados. Also we felt a bit claustrophobic  inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The fruit crepe, beware of its tartness.

oBowZGYrDENsVANhY7OXLw.text: What a great meal - delicious, great service, and an amazing value!  I came during happy hour (ends at 6PM) where they had house wine for $4/glass and many affordable appetizers. The happy hour menu is also really cute - the original is hand drawn and quite colorful.  I started with the Arancini appetizer ($4/4 arancini) - Arancini are rice balls stuffed with some mozzarella and then deep fried. When it got brought out I was surprised by how large they were, they were each about 2 inches in diameter! The mozzarella was nice and gooey on the inside and the marinara sauce completes it.  Gnocchi alla Sorrentina ($6) - the gnocchi could have been slightly fluffier but overall the flavor was good. The basil and the tomato sauce were nicely balanced. There was a decent amount of cheese which melted and made the dish an interesting mix of textures of flavors.  Linguine Puttanesca ($16) - You can order their hand made pasta starting from 5PM. It was highly recommended by the waitress so I decided to give it a try. I was not disappointed! The pasta was perfectly al dente, it had just enough of a bite. The black olives are not your usual olives, they were the perfect complement to a mouthful of handmade pasta. The fresh ground black pepper and large grain salt also helps to elevate the flavor.

CaUkNgH9YoDN7QcQyp_Gcg.text: Caution flying bugs!  Server was good and the food was good, I do wish I tried something more adventurous but my date wanted pizza.   My biggest problem was we're the bugs!!!!!!!!!!! Because of the heaters bugs were attracted to a warmer environment and eventually they were on my food, in my hair and on my last nerves!   Management: if you insist on having heaters in a leafy area consider investing in some bug zappers. I might come back, maybe at a time in the year they don't need space heaters

DB0V-zDNB3wotBgbdhF3UQ.text: This is one of the best spots in Phoenix. The ambiance is cute and charming and the food is amazing. Just had dinner there this weekend with friends. Pasta is fresh and homemade, and the Diavola pizza is so good. Save room for a Nutella crepe. And you can eat here and then walk to the Van Buren so you can have dinner and a show.

FejFHOcuRNGofgv5_0EjBA.text: Fell in love with this hidden gem last night! Tucked away in a neighborhood in Phoenix, this place definitely did not disappoint!  Not only did the server comp our bottle of wine, but the food was out of this world. Tried the burrata and everything was full of flavor. They also had live music and lights on the patio for perfect ambience. I would recommend for a date night or special occasion as its moderately priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. We ordered the burrata and a bottle of Italian Red called the Cajo Umbria. Was amazing!

4qAMxx2BGVZ4EGlwll_EIQ.text: Such a cute date night spot! We went a few months back around 7 or 8pm on what had to have been a busy Sunday, they were out of a couple of things we tried to order, which is understandable for smaller restaurants. But it was great, the patio is amazing!

Bo7Dve7T55fBQdpaA2bqyw.text: Cibo Urban Pizzeri a is located in a charming 1913 converted house in central/south Phoenix on 5th Ave.. We were seated promptly and our server brought menus and our drink orders quickly. No draft beer, but bottled craft beer is available Spouse & friend had wine. We shared the gnocchi w/san marzano based tomato sauce, a Caprese salad and two pizzas.  We also shared the polenta fries. Pizzas: 1 Salsiccia (sausage) and 1 Pomodoro Fresco (basil,grape tomato, and buffalo mozzarella. These are tin crust Neapolitan style. These are basically individual pizzas. Our friend's brother, who had lived in Naples and been based there, claimed they were the most authentic he had in the states. The ambiance and atmosphere were beyond reproach. That said, the portions are skimpy at best and are overpriced for what you are getting. Expect some sticker shock. This venue is most suitable for dates or two women having lunch, not a hearty appetite. Coming from Broohklyn, and loving Chicago deep dish  finds me more comfortable with more food and less pretension. Good place for yuppies and foodies who want a gastronomic happy hour.

S19Q2Rkw2bHGj8tkd7T4xA.text: Delizioso! Ate here with friends on the fourteenth anniversary of my 29th birthday (I'll let you do the math!) and had a splendid, splendid meal! The service was attentive, the food was delish and I want to go back -- NOW! I'm not much of a meat eater so had the Quattro Formaggi Pizze -- but have to admit the other meat-laden pies were looking mighty good. Complimentary Nutella crepe on your birthday (money)! And I would highly recommend the Bellinis! Evviva! (Sorry, practicing my Italian!)

cbsAkGiqOiPWLjzEjrmyjg.text: Came here with my boyfriend on valentines day after I read a review that said to skip the wait at Pizzeria Bianco (where we were originally going) and come here instead.  I am SO glad that we did!!! Our waiter James was absolutely amazing - very attentive, and knows a lot about the menu - you can tell he is very passionate about this restaurant and likes his job.  We ordered Bruschetta for our starter and it was absolutely amazing.  I don't even like tomatos and I couldn't get enough of their bruschetta board.  We then split a pizza as you can order half and half - I ordered their Trufeta (splg?) pizza - it has truffle oil - and is absolutely to die for!  We finished the night with a strawberry nutella crepe also very delicious.  We talked about this restaurant, the great service, the great food, and the great ambience for the rest of the night; and then took our friends there the following week.  Wish I lived closer I would go every day if I could.  Definitely skip the wait at Pizzeria Bianco and come here instead, the atmosphere is cozier, the wait staff is friendlier, and I think the pizza is way better!

t2cVKaeBX5pPh9iT37WiTg.text: Was there a couple weeks ago.. They don't take reservations for parties under six but it was a Wednesday and not that busy. Food and atmosphere was great- though the birds outside were constantly landing on our table to sneak a bite.

XJSc1zQKc1WRyL5liEWOXg.text: I'm glad I found Cibo while visiting Phoenix! My co-worker and I went on a Wednesday evening around 6 and had no wait/crowd. I love that their happy hour runs until 7. We had wine and the meatballs (fabulous!). Then had dessert before dinner with the fried dough balls that we dipped in Nutella. Loved it! For dinner we shared the Prosciutto pizza and the Diavalo pizza and both were fantastic! It's is cute little rustic place with a beautiful patio. It'll be a regular stop on my trips to Phoenix!

bUmp6yRpGUIh_Go3nbuvoA.text: Oh my gosh - the best Gluten free pizza ever I am in heaven!! I didn't think that I would survive this wheat allergy but now I have hope!!! The Pizza was crisp and chewy and amazing - I can't wait to try all of the flavors and they even told me that they would make one that was bruschetta - that was poetry to my wheat deprived mind!! Thank you so much!!

fjIulI0gZOAfpzYynJ1mEw.text: My boyfriend took me to Cibo for a lovely birthday dinner the other night. He couldn't believe I had never been... now, neither can I! The food was absolutely amazing (gnocchi with spicy sausage), the wine list had many great options, and the atmosphere very low-key and casual. We were able to enjoy our food leisurely and without interruption. Matt, our waiter, was timely, humorous, and charming.

YyZEyUbQ3DYjhrKpuSg8ag.text: The food was soooo good. We got a pizza and a sandwich. The pizza was so delicious I ate almost the whole thing myself. After that we got a crape with nutela. This is a must get. Definitely going here again.

zoeyGu80pbJaeKaYJiduZA.text: amazing atmosphere, the pizza is incredaible...one of my favorite local resturants in town.

sS28yEuU1NIWdEW9pXwjkQ.text: Delicious!  Delicious!  Delicious!  Their pizza is better than Pizzeria Bianco, in my opinion and their nutella crepes are to die for!

zVlYHm9NeC-DtlbC4k41_w.text: I have been going to Cibo pronounced "CHEE-boh"over the years. I love the unique space being located inside a house (restored 1913 bungalow), with wood floors.... gives this place a warm inviting atmosphere. The owners are often there, friendly and staff is cool, helpful..... The outside patio area is beautiful on a nice night, white lights decorate the trees adding to the ambiance and coziness of the place. I always enjoy ordering the antipasto for two to share, a pizza or two, some wine and the amazing marscapone desert. Just wish they were open for dinner on Sunday. Check this place out sometime for a unique experience.

W9tQfoYWOfuZkzOBLbT0ZA.text: First of all, I've been a Yelp lurker for years... I had an experience tonight that compels me to write.  Felt in the mood for some Cibo pizza on my home to SoPho from a downtown Phoenix client ... was guided by the awesome female bartender towards the Diavlo pizza with added ricotta (something different from my standby Margarita pizza ... she didn't steer me wrong).  As I tend to do ... stopped by on my way home with novel in hand, ordered a dry white and a pizza to go.  The serene hum of this sweet little place was broken up by a nice older, very clean, but obviously mentally challenged man.  He walked in and loudly asked what was on the menu ... wanted a loaded pizza and a beer in this upscale downtown restaurant.  The owner gave him his utmost attention and ordered him the pizza with his toppings of choice, and a beer. I'm sorry I didn't get the owner's name, but his attentiveness and kindness endeared me even more to this place.  This diverse downtown environment may scare some away ... but I just love the energy of people helping people.  Oh, and the pizza at this place is to die for!  Can't wait to try Pasta Tuesdays and Wednesdays, which I just learned about while I was waiting.

2JoS-BVawSE1VTVJ35SDWQ.text: Not too long of a wait.  Super cute little renovated bungalow downtown.  Pizza crust was thin and chewy.  We got the white pizza with mushrooms, prosciutto, and truffle oil and the salami pizza with spicy marinara and both were very good.

I1OV2GYS6MdQIrf0FACYhg.text: This place both blows and sucks,  The antipasto appetizer is mostly grilled zucchini.  The pizza is thin crust like a quesadilla (at three times the price).  The service is horrible.  And they close at 10:00PM.  I'd rather microwave something at home than put up with this bullshit...

sgOA0iWIGqEhYpcLiJzI5A.text: La Noce and the Omero Salad are to die for. Great chill place to have either a relax everyday dinner or romantic.

hXLUYD7f3t41MOftmHxY6w.text: We decided to try Cibo after it was recommended by a friend. The restaurant is an old home creating a quaint atmosphere. They have excellent wood fired pizza. For happy hour, try the Polpette and Palline (dessert)-delicious! Service was excellent as well.

eI0zAUOp0vbehjtDwujMxA.text: I didn't love this place.. the pizza tasted burnt. we went in a group of 6 ppl and ordered  different types of pizza, but they all were a bit burnt with the burnt taste. Although, I did not like their food the location of this restaurant was fantastic, and the ambiance was wonderful as well with friendly staff.

n68b_OZ2HW_vi5M_z6PYiQ.text: Yum, this place was great.  Went with a party of 5 on this past first friday's and only waiting about 10-15 minutes.  Not too bad at all!  Services was excellent.  I loved their wine list.  We each ordered a different pizza, so I was able to try 5 different kinds.  I like the quattro cheese one the most.  It was delicious.  I will definitely return once I've checked out some other pizza this town has to offer.  Two thumbs up!

jmY3CIdKV17LT8SJV2EGzw.text: Went here when traveling for work as a local colleague recommended. Excellent spot fresh pizza. Fresh salads  and nice atmosphere but the most memorable part of the meal was their deserts. Nutella crepes were unbelievable.  We went with a group of 15 and service was outstanding. Next time I am in Phoenix, Cibo is a must stop.

hhiDAc0890VTRpub4xoGjQ.text: Cibo has been one of my staples and I go fairly frequently, and have for years. I love all of their salads, pizzas sandwiches, the burrata and of course, the crepes. Yum. Double yum. They have a nice wine list, the ambiance is great, and service is great. Brunch is amazing too. The only thing I've ever been disappointed in is that a month ago, i went for lunch and got a pizza.. definitely wasn't of the same caliber as the dinner pizzas. I will stick with 'za and dinner and enjoy their amazing sandwiches for lunch.

Z-WZBCMvSEdrdnS-zm-Dbg.text: This pizza is fantastic, probably my favorite in Phoenix, though that's very hard to name. I also love the location, both inside and outside is fantastic.  The whole menu is fantastic. It's a great place for a date-night, or to bring friends visiting town, or to go with a small party, if you can either make reservations for a large group or wait it out.  Everyone must check this place out at least once!

7CHl-9zr8gcyIuUjSzfR8A.text: Lovely little authentic Italian Eatery with beautiful patio dining when weather appropriate.  Our server knew the menu and wines very well.  The salads and pizzas were a bit larger than single serving size.  Two people could easily spit a salad and pizza.  Everyone at our table enjoyed their meals which included salads, homemade pasta and pizza.  Not advertised on their website or menu is the fact that they make a simply wonderful GLUTEN FREE pizza crust which you can ask for.  The parking lot is small, but there is street parking available though it could be a bit challenging during busy hours.

vU2dRthiKZajIEMOcu-w0Q.text: Cibo is a fantastic dinner spot with a beautiful garden and excellent pizza. It's easy to get a table on almost any week night. The pizza is solid, and there are a variety of choices with sauce and without sauce. Great place to take a date or just to have a quiet dinner with friends. The federal law clerk crowd loves it here.

RUoKoI3bRwVpJ33sU_cZKA.text: If I could give Cibo 10 stars I would!! Every time I've been here the food is amazing!! The Burrata is so tasty I could eat it daily. My other favorite is the pear salad! All of the pizza is mind blowing :)  This is a great location for dates or just grabbing a bite with friends. The patio is enchanting with all the lights and trees. The little house and patio transport you away from Phoenix and make you feel at home.   If you have never been here, then you're making a huge mistake!!!!! Be prepared to wait though.. Depending on what day or time you go there could be a wait but its well worth it! The wait staff is pretty good too.. Ohh and if you want to avoid the wait you can order to-go and grab and drink at the bar while you wait.

Jqn8eUVsBQUTsbQv9dNdPw.text: Okay, I know there are many pizza places that claim to be the best, but seriously this is the best pizza, closest to the types served in Italy.  My wife and I had our honeymoon in Italy this past summer and had pizza everywhere we went.  The pizza in Italy is a little different from what most Americans are used to, as they aren't as heavy on the red sauce, and they usually incorporate more exotic and fresh ingredients.  Now upon our journey to Italy we ended up in Naples (birthplace of Pizza), and couldn't believe how identical the pizza there (Naples) was to Cibo, delicious may I add!  So if you've never been to Italy and want something extremely similar in style and taste, then you'll love Cibo. The atmosphere is great, the place is a little cozy and expect to wait 45 minutes depending on when you decide to go.

uGk1kiadk9biVII_DklS9w.text: Food is great. Staff was unfriendly. Went to pick up a pizza, walked in had 4 staff members sit and talk to each other while I waited for someone to acknowledge me. I say loudly "I am here for a pick up" and I have to get the pizza box myself before someone comes over for me to pay.

SodLIQ-Pnywc0VbjgQZh4A.text: Found this gem on yelp after a long drive from tombstone to Sedona. We were exhausted and hungry. The service was great and the food even better! Mangia!

HP4A2_SzQSohqNqfWW2mDg.text: We were referred to this place from some friends and found it to be exceptionally charming. The atmosphere was delightful and our kids (and us) loved the patio. And the pizza was delicious!!

tGs62wvzam657XCU26muuA.text: After 3 bad experiences at Cibo over time, each caused by pretty random circumstances, I wrote a fairly nasty, profanity-laced review of this place last night. Basically, they ran out of some of their specials, didn't tell us in a timely manner, and then annoyed us further with some schtick about their chef not liking substitutions for an alternative entree we ordered.   In response to my review, the owner wrote me a personal message acknowledging what happened and offering a heart-felt apology. She also graciously offered to comp my meal, which I told her she didn't have to do. I have to say, with that kind of attitude by a business owner, no one can argue that she doesn't care about the place or its customers. And so, I can only conclude that I've been struck by lightning ("random crap going on with a manager or servers on a busy night" lightning) 3 consecutive times. So, I will shift my review back up to 3 stars for now (2.5 from my original review, plus a half star for sending me such a nice email), and reserve judgment for my next visit.   In the meantime, if you look at my original reviews of this place and filter out the annoyances that seemed to pop up, all of us the pluses still remain True.

D_vuCXRo_0npcp9bFj6TqQ.text: I've had many excellent dinners at Cibo, and tonight's was no exception.  We started with the Antipasto Speciale, which was extraordinarily fresh and flavorful.  Likewise, the Capricciosa pizza was delicious... no complaints whatsoever about the food.  I've never had an appetizer or a pizza at Cibo that I didn't thoroughly enjoy.  The experience is normally quite pleasant as well -- tonight, we were greeted very courteously by one of the owners and seated shortly thereafter.  Our service was rather lackluster and inattentive, but this fortunately doesn't seem to be a normal occurrence.  I look forward to visiting Cibo again upon my next visit to Phoenix, hopefully to try their new weekend breakfast!

Md0J1s5U_4M7BoC_sj8c_A.text: We loved the ambiance, loved the location, loved the food, enjoyed ourselves a lot. We are planning on going back, and write a more in depth review, once we try more on the menu!

qxnaktAJ99MtYHxnxKyaKg.text: this place was right at the corner along a row of residental area...it looked homey actually, like eating in a house.   came here for dinner saturday night...it was packed!! ambiance was quite good and they had a tiny bar.  got vegetarian pizza...just love zucchini and artichokes on pizza! crust was good-chewy, rustic, thin- but some parts were a bit too burnt for me.  wouldve enjoyed a bit more veges on my pizza.....  will def come back for pizza!

Afz18pTPPCGjEvRohiMwEA.text: I will join the troves of people writing reviews for Cibo.  By now, it's known that it one of the best places to eat in Phoenix.    Cibo's atmosphere is the best by far.  Inside the "house" is quaint, and intimate.  Perfect for a romantic date for two.  The outside patio is lit well with stringed bulbs, great landscaping and the occasional live music.  The pizza is on par with Bianco.  I recommend getting a pie per person so you can try a variety.  Also, I usually prefer red pizzas, but the whites here at Cibo always end up being my favorite.  The crepe deserts, with fresh fruit and ice cream are beyond words.  Save room, you must get it.  I love brining out of towners here to show what Phoenix really has to offer.  Not some chain restaurant in a strip mall.

mRo8b5ItINXbQGbZ0ewwgg.text: Margherita pizza with baby arugula and prosciutto added after cooking...appetizer plate with cannellini bean substitution (a few years back)...crepe suzette....Cutest patio ever and great small bar where you can eat on your own!!!

BGIzgLBgzS78Ua4zua_4Hw.text: Great brunch/lunch specials... I may just drop in right now to enjoy another awesome sandwich. Their caprese, IMHO, is superior to Pane Bianco, and a better buy! Yum yum

72YXJnBVf3K0v6YkDY_ByA.text: So good! Worth the wait for a table. Definitely recommend you arrive early before 7 p.m.

6ykc47g7dw1og6SjUHjNtA.text: We were visiting friends for the weekend in Pheonix and wanted good food that wasn't too expensive. This place was one of the top places on yelp, and our friends swore by it, so it was a done deal that we were going. We got there just after 6, and were told the wait was going to be about 20 minutes. We waited patiently and finally got seated, though it probably took closer to 40 minutes.  We were seated outside, and the atmosphere was very romantic. There was a fire pit behind us, and trees all around.   We ordered several pizzas and a bottle of wine. The pizzas were all very unique and flavorful. My favorite one was the Margherita, which had full size leaves of fresh basil on it. The crust was perfectly thin, and pizza was nice and light. One of the other ones we had contained proscuitto on it, and was also very good. It really reminded me of the True Italian pizza that my husband and I had sampled in Milan and Rome on our honeymoon.  Overall a great experience, I would recommend.

zGWOqe2UFr-XHwo5KgKnig.text: Cibo has both the ambiance and taste of an amazing Italian restaurant! From the outside twinkle lights on the trees to the spicy salami, this place has it all. If you're looking for a quiet restaurant, you'll want to sit outside as it is a bit cozy and noisy inside. Great service and great food!!

bFl6XlGOF_N-n2_ANMw5zQ.text: After reading so many good reviews I was excited to try Cibo. To me it just didn't live up to the hype. However, the patio was perfect for an afternoon lunch in the shade. I had the Salsiccia Saltimbocca Caldi which was good but VERY greasy. I'd definitely try it again next time I'm in Phoenix!

WPcJq0406gCZ6ohYfebYxg.text: Cibo is a cozy little gourmet pizzeria hidden away in an old neighborhood. The pizza is excellent. I would encourage you to try anything on the menu, even if it doesn't sound appealing.  They really know what their doing and if they've put pear on a pizza, you better believe it was for a good reason. The ambiance is great, especially outside when weather permits. they have a respectable wine selection and this is a great place to take a date.

v5SBNBWMpjTwEnWSinZ-mw.text: Wow, was this restaurant was delish.  I am not a huge Italian food fan but I was VERY impressed with the quality of this restaurant.   I tried my son's homemade pasta and it was unbelievable.  I've never had homemade pasta but once I tried it I knew it was homemade.  I love that the portions weren't HUGE (which is one of the reasons why I don't like going to Italian restaurants--they put way too much food on the plate including something as filling as pasta).  It was just the right amount for an adult.  The pizza was delicious.  Again, even on the pizza, everything tasted super fresh and homemade.  The only thing that I didn't love was the marinated veggies.  It was a bit too tart.  I'm not knocking the restaurant because I figured that it was just my own issue with a dish that is a traditional starter.    The other thing that I didn't care for (which has nothing to do with the food at the restaurant) was the route that my family (hubby and two boys) took to get there.  We walked there from our hotel in downtown Phoenix.  Not sure that was a great idea, looking back.  Lots of homeless people wandering the streets and the main street that the restaurant sits on has some low-income housing that was a little scary looking.  Also, having that fraternity house right across the restaurant with these rowdy frat boys screaming things at the patrons as they walked into the restaurant wasn't ideal.  But the food was yummy.  I'd go back.  But I'd take a cab next time.  :)    Absolutely worth it to check it out.

m9MBa2UC74XWmDCwM009GQ.text: Sat at the bar and had a couple of appetizers. Could have done without the calamari..pretty bland. Had the Il Tagliere which was great. Service was also great. We'll come back and try the pizza at some point!

SAFMxrfvPRCoflJk3CwkSg.text: Great little place for small groups of people. The parking was hard to get, but by the time we got in and ordered; it was worth it. We grabbed a seat at the bar because it was quite busy. Food tasted pretty good and filled us right up.  The atmosphere was nice after getting outside to hangout for a bit. There was live jazz music playing and a warm fire to sit near.

h-JfkdOrpcPQbqNnxD9n9g.text: Never had anything bad here from pizza to appetizer to lunch including salad and/or sandwich. Always freshly cooked and staff is always very nice greeting you as soon as you arrive. May be the only place I never have to ask for more water or tea!  Perfect date night at night outside with live music and lights. Only negative sometimes can be parking.

Ingrll_FDOyQdZXeGLz8ZA.text: Shared a gluten free pizza and gluten free crepe with my husband and all I can say is we were very pleased. It's hard to get a gluten free pizza crust made right and they do; but it is their crepes that did me over. So good! I'll be dreaming of their crepes long after my return to home to Seattle.

KHMCb8rKLKC8xmkP2tsreA.text: My woman took me out to go eat at this place.It was actually pretty awesome.I love the authentic atmosphere, and how fast the service is.The shop is tucked away into a little over-looked place in downtown Phoenix, and it's just wonderful...especially if you want a quiet date. Five out of five, no doubt.

e-eExFBITktdN2Z1G1gWdQ.text: One of my favorite things to do in Phoenix is to sit on Cibo's patio in the evening. There's just something enchanting about it. I've been there just under ten times, and for the majority of those, my service was friendly and attentive. The caprese was probably the best I'd had anywhere, with grape tomatoes rather than the usual romas, and just so much deliciousness. The pizza is good, as well. I wasn't hugely impressed by an omelette I had the first time I visited, nor the service that time, but I sometimes encounter that when I dine alone and the service has been good since. I was also impressed with some of their other salads. All-in-all, not much beats sharing a caprese and a pizza on a Friday night, listening to live music, enjoying the faerie lights and a good glass of wine under the stars.

tfwQpghbVnlb-ZMaBe82yQ.text: Let me make your life real easy here.  When you get lucky later, you can thank me. =)  First, start off  with the Il Tagliere - Antipasto, meat, cheese and fruit board.  Or the mixed vegetables.  mmm.  Course 1 = success.  Then move on to the Caprese Salad - So fresh!   The smell itself is intoxicating.  Course 2 = winner.   Pizza time!   From the Pizza Bianche: Siena - mozzarella and zucchini, topped with spek and pecorino cheese.    ahhh!  the cheese, the crunch of the zucchini.  Spek (or hold this if you aren't a fan of spek, i like it both ways).    Course 3 =  Ding Ding!   From the Pizza Rosse: Diavola - tomato sauce, mozzarella and spicy salame.   You simply can't go wrong here.    Don't forget dessert!  Crepe -  I suggest the Fresca, but you really can't go wrong with any crepe on the menu.   Course 4 = Heavenly  They have a great wine selection.  I suggest the 1/2 bottle of Moscato d' Asti if you like wines of a sweeter, bubbly nature.    Be prepared to fall in love.  The food, the atmosphere, great service.... this is a great little house-turned-restaurant in Central Phoenix.  It was built in the early 1900s and they have done a wonderful job with the decor.  Sitting out on the patio under the sparkling white lights in the trees is a great way to add a little magic to your date night.  If you take your special someone out for dinner here, I promise that your lucky night will end just the way you hope...  Ladies and Gentlemen...you are welcome.  hehe ;-)

fXJ2UjOPcTmAsHNbyU7VEQ.text: Best PIZZA in town.  I love the olives and cheese pizza. I like my pizza a little burnt and they hook it up that way.  I take one pizza down on my own.  The desert is YUM.  GET THE FRESCA....  Price is also easy to swallow.  Pretty neat little spot for the family or a date.

I-uHPopFB4JbCzS_6-VFqg.text: Reboot Technology Services  I have taken both my laptops and cpu's to Drew.  His turn around time is quick and the work done is always top notch.  My computers are VERY old and he keeps them running.  He has a back-up service as well.  I would not take any of my computers anywhere else.

5u_bQEKHVUhiTDSH975pYg.text: I had not been to Cibo since it first opened and was pleasantly surprised again last night...such a charming place, friendly staff and truly delicious pizza.  We shared the funghi pizza and a split of spicy salame with ricotta and sausage pizza ...so good and even the crust was amazing too!  For dessert we shared the nutella and strawberry crepe...oh my, you must try this - so divine and the perfect way to end your meal!

g1c2Tlti5g5VGFA26ukDOA.text: If you can, get a group of friends together and make a reservation early!  They only take them for groups, but unless you want to wait 1+ hours, it's required on busy nights.  Nice setting, especially nice outside.    Ordered 7 pizzas for a group of 8, but that had some children.  All were good to great.  I think the simple pizza margherita was the best, and a great value at only $10.  When I come back, I think I'll be tempted just to order 2 of these and a salad for my family of two adults and two children.    Just a nice setting, cool older building, busy hip crowd, and great pizza that comes super hot and fresh out of the oven.   Only reason I am giving this a 4 star is that our service was slow.  I didn't mind too much since it was so busy and I was with great people, but it took about 20 minutes from when I asked for the check to when I was able to sign and walk away, despite me putting the credit card down immediately.  The server just had other priorities.  In fact, they had the table cleared and were literally seating other people at the table before we had the check back.  So a bit of a slip up.    Still, they were very friendly, and it was a great meal.  I recommend this highly as a  date spot or even a family spot.  Loud and so very easy to just focus on your table.

zEH_ksoF28QCZXu-FuFQ4A.text: We used to live a block away from Cibo. It was our go-to pizza place and for good reason; it's delicious! Their Margherita pizza is divine, and only $10! Writing this review makes me want to go back, like, NOW for the Funghi or the Vegetariana. Think about it, you're dropping the same amount of money on a quality, fresh pizza as you would at some crap joint.   This place can get real busy, so we usually do take out. I remember it being warm inside during the Summer months, but there's no way to escape that when you go to a small restaurant that has its doors open.

mt8v1qoDawvObitI-8y--g.text: The restaurant itself is beautiful..very nice ambiance.  Unfortunately, I wasn't able to have a sit-down meal, so I did pick-up and ordered my meal ahead of time.  The pizza was meh...I've definitely had better pizza than that! The dough got a little soggy by the time I got to my hotel room 15 minutes later..so that didn't help either.

FSFPfms7paJR6HI_RyN3CQ.text: Please let me start this review with my usual preface: I am Italian, born and raised in Italy.  I have recently been to Cibo during a business trip in Phoenix, actually thanks to Madonna. Yes, that night a Madonna concert made all places busy in downtown, so, thanks to my colleague who yelped Cibo, we went there. The staff was very friendly, and our waitress was sweet.   My colleagues ordered some pasta that looked great, but those were somewhat small portions.   I ordered my favorite pizza: aragula, shaved parmesan, and prosciutto crudo. Maybe this is not a popular combination here in the US, but...did I mention I am Italian? I guess I did...  So, to be concise... my pizza was a 5 star Pizza. I thought I was in Rome or something! But no, no, I was in Phoenix Arizona, USA.   Are you still reading my review???? GO GO GO...Cibo is awesome!  OK since you are not that hungry, I want to talk about their patio. Actually, calling it patio reduces its awesomeness. It is a True Italian "giardino," it reminded me of my summer vacations in Italy.  The only downside is that in their menu there is a typo on an Italian word... LOL...   I wish I lived in Phoenix...

XdVCQJdroxqcS7XC8JjKmw.text: Diavola. I'm pretty sure this was the best pizza I've ever had in my life. I was not expecting to think that while shoving hot slivers of flavorful dough, just enough mozz, and spicy pepperoni while just trying to catch a bite on my road trip up to Page. The Capri salad was also refreshing with pesto dressing and pine nuts. Super fantastic place. The outdoor seating looks quite heavenly as well.

iQId5u0DHeY_vSs6mXT7nA.text: You know how you have high expectations of a place. You've even been, but the wait was too long for you at the time. The reviews are off the wall and all your friends love it...but then...you go and are disappointed???  THIS IS SO NOT THE CASE. Cibo was a start for our fabulous evening downtown on my farewelll Phoenix tour (LOL!). We had dinner here before the Madonna concert and it was Fanfreakintastic!   The place was humming with regulars and plenty of Madonna fans. Weather was perfect for al fresco dining. We sat comfortably at a table in back with impeccable service by a new server named Kim. She rocked our meats and cheeses.   Literally. We ordered the appetizer of meat, cheeses, nuts and fruit. For $19 it was really a steal and fed us four Madonna fans well. The homemade mozzeralla was TDF...the proscuitto, bread, olives, goat cheese, grilled veggies...MOUTHGASM!  Of course we had to have a pizza and the Margherita pizza sang to us!!! Crust was perfection, pillowy and crunchy with the soft cheese, tangy sauce and fresh basil.   We were indeed doing the happy food dance. Which was a great excercise as we danced our tails off several hours later. So the food was much needed fuel.   Ambience was as charming as everyone has mentioned.   Cibo. First date. I will squeeze in another if you'll have me. Maybe I'll even kiss you good night and good bye!

2LYOTHZfcFpaPNI51dgRIQ.text: After studying abroad in Italy, I was in search for a place that could bring back some of those yummy and wonderful memories. This place is so warm, inviting and beautiful and absolutely reminds me of Italy. I had the Prosciutto Crudo Pizza and was in heaven! If you go at night and it is good weather out, I suggest you sit outside. It completes the whole "Italian experience".

jN2ZebGljImtCxk63zYbxA.text: One of my favorite pizza places in Phx. Comparable to PB, as many have noted, but without the wait. I love me some wood-fired pizzas and theirs is pretty legit.   The decor is very homey and imtimate so it's suitable for date nights. They also have yummy crepes for dessert, so get that if you're not stuffed.

qYj8HjcrI5IjfJZ4cl29iA.text: My absolute favorite place in the world for date night. Share a bottle of wine and a pizza and don't forget a Nutella crepe for dessert. Love love love this place.

nfQSpNVISiHdT8BmhiZUpA.text: Anytime my boyfriend and I want an incredible meal for a celebration we always end up going to Cibo. Never disappointed.   Our anniversary, New Years, and my birthday most recently. Always consistently delicious. We normally split a bottle of Scarpetta Pinot Grigio and then the Burrata appetizer (only gripe would be that the Burrata has TONS of tomatoes on the dish recently. We miss the old days with ALL burrata!). For the pizza we normally get the Diavola. SO good!   I am the type of person who tries lots of things on the menu first, but we found our favorites at Cibo and there's no turning back!

uMQbnM9qVSeNxFdukYgahw.text: One of my most favorite restaurants in Phoenix. Anything we ordered on the menu was delicious. Little expensive but well worth the experience.

ByEyG_vxpMGgArPQ3Ga97Q.text: This place has the best spinach salad. I had a great visit here with my husband. We split a pizza and salad and crepe. Love this place

GjNTsqOoHO42Lv2FT1Fi6g.text: Recently our party of 3 went for a special occasion. The guest of honor was moving out of town and had had so many good experiences at Cibo they wanted their last meal in Phoenix to be at this spot that has been the source of so many good memories over the years.  What a disappointment. The server (male/floppy haired/'stoner' look/attitude, who's been there for years) ruined the night. 25 min after dinner was finished and NO contact. And none during the actual meal. Empty drink glasses, un-taken dessert/coffee orders, etc.  This guy needs to go.

9tZpUQJrjJZAnz3V1xqJ_A.text: First impressions for me are always a tell tale sign of how a restaurant experience is going to be.   Chocolate was on my seat, luckily I didn't sit down in it and I had noticed it. I moved the chair to another table and let my server know. The seat was never wiped off. Also my boyfriends water glass had lip stick on it so we had to ask for a fresh one.   I had the tuna which was really dry but the bread was really delicious. PLT is spicy and prosciutto was okay, nothing great. Pizza was okay.   The server never checked on us after food was dropped, worst part, the place was DEAD.   Go elsewhere.

4Zb0LyUVFGRnBZopAGb9gg.text: This place gets 1 star for the cute adorable patio.  Besides that this place sucks.  What is all the hype about this place??  Pizza was sub-par, very generic ,nothing special!  And the Nutella crepe for dessert... Is very pretty looking, but it's a Nutella mess!  Yuck too much Nutella!  And yes.... The flies are everywhere!  It's too bad cuz they have a really cute patio that's cozy.  But the food is a 2 thumbs down.  Over rated.  Will NOT be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awful pizza
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nutella nightmare!

w0UPbYvr4MfqDCdr_mLdOA.text: Food was excellent. Had mozzarella cheese with fresh tomatoes and also the margarita pizza and it was perfectly made nice outdoor patio to sit down highly recommend this place.

VYk8p8XT5IMhDQFjM9iMFg.text: fantastic place to visit in vacation. we ended up loving the sharable sizes of everything. party of 4 ended up getting 3 pizzas, 2 salads, 1 app, all to share. we loved every one of the dishes. simply amazing!

4AzqNiSt-XJRlylQDivyEw.text: Friday 6 PM. Table of 2. You will never run short on water as they give you a bottle on your table and promptly replace it when its out.  I got banana nutella crepes. Additional: Vanilla ice cream ($2) and whipped cream ($2). I wasn't told about the additional charges till the bill was presented. Surprised bunny. $7 for the crepe, $2 for ice cream, and $2 more for whipped cream. Total 11 USD before tax and tip.  Food came out kind of slow, but it was a busy friday night.  The pizza "Latina" was okay,... I had better. All the toppings fell right off, including the cheese. The crust was puffy and airy, and the center was extremely thin.  The server was tall handsome lanky and friendly.  The venue was loud alive, lots of ppl, had a lot of flies too, even indoors.  I liked how the windows opened to let outside air in.  It looks like a house was converted into a restaurant. The red bricks are charming. The lawn/garden /patio is welcoming. I liked the art on the walls.   There's only one walk-in bathroom for both genders.  Its a nice little oasis from the hustle and bustle of downtown.  Perhaps I'll return for the crepes in the future if I happen to be in that side of town.

4ZW2D0tUJP4OlMJIps3XqA.text: This place was spectaculars sat outside with friends and the food and decide was exceptional!

qYIeW2e7y3Lt3dDwRfcjjg.text: Generally love the ambiance here. Good food and nice casual atmosphere. The pricing is fine. I would recommend this place if your in downtown phx and would like a nice night out.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

PjBAkmjR5gyFE6ZRrycBHQ.text: We came here on a busy Saturday night after a Cactus League baseball game.  It's kind of in a weird Phoenix neighborhood, but we really liked the vibe inside.  We had to wait for just a little while to get in.  We were attracted to the availability of a gluten-free pizza.    For starters, we had the pear salad on arugula, which was very good.  We went with a capricciosa pizza with prosciutto, mushrooms and artichokes.  It came out super hot and the crust was really good and crispy, even though gluten-free.   The service was very friendly and helpful.  I would definitely come back again.

MtPUHRravD26dnTWgrZWSw.text: The service was great. He was very attentive and always nearby when needed. I am hoping that the kitchen was just having an off night. We ordered the bruschetta appetizer and the toppings were great, but the bread was burnt. We ordered two different pizzas, one red, and one white. The red was the vegetariano. It was quite salty and the crust was very burnt on one half of the pie. The white pizza's name escapes me, but it is the one with a truffle oil drizzle. This pizza was extremely salty! The crust was in better shape, but still on the well done side.  I like the location, the atmosphere is great, and the service was also good. Because of the salty pizza and consistently burnt bread, I'm not sure that I will return. Again, I hope it was just a kitchen error, but I dont think I will take that chance.

J0P1vsxdDhF_NMUPITA3ow.text: Absolutely DELICIOUS. Aside from food though, the decor inside was cozy and beautiful. Very cute and warm, lit up for holidays. I came here with a large party. The service was great. We got appetizer boards and bottles of wine to start. I was never without a full glass. Now, I am from NY, and I loved my personal pizza I got here. The best pizza I've tried since being in AZ thus far. I got the basil pesto pie with roasted potatoes and mozzarella cheese, ate every last bite. Then I had the Nutella dessert. I wish I had photos to show. I will definitely be coming back, I already told my boyfriend it seems like the perfect date night spot.

_7KUJBMcQC5_K55kKnCgMw.text: Good grief where do I start. This place has such delicious pizza and I love their dessert options. Did you know they have a very dog friendly patio too???!!! What more could an animal loving, pizza loving- person ask for! I also have to give BIG kudos to the owner for giving me a donation for the animals on top of having delish food and great customer service. I'm a big animal fundraiser and the fact that he was so giving made my heart happy while the food made my stomach happy. The staff is so friendly too. Love this place and I will be back for more, you need to visit with your fur kids and tell them I sent you!

vNtJKhvb4jCq2vo_-r6bFw.text: I came here with a group knowing that avoiding dairy might be hard at a pizza place, but they did have pasta on the menu too.  Unfortunately the bolognese is "finished" with cheese, but that happens ahead of time so I couldn't get the pasta without cheese, so I ended up ordering a cheese-less pizza and substituting a spicy salami for the cheese at the waitresses recommendation.  I was charged extra (despite removing 3 kinds of cheese from the original order), and with the automatic gratuity (parties of 6+) I ended up spending $30 for a cheese-less pizza, a side house salad, and only drank water. The service was pretty bad.  Maybe because our waitress knew she was getting auto gratuity she just didn't give a crap but she always seemed annoyed whenever near us, and one of our orders came out 15 min after the rest of the table (but they comped it).   On a positive note, it has nice outdoor seating and there was a jazzy quartet playing, which I did enjoy.  I wish I would have known the pizza was going to be as large as it was.  I could have shared one and spent more money on some wine.

1e1yRlHWV6BHwyWqOv8qtQ.text: Love this place.  Great sandwiches at lunch and the pizza is among the best in town.  Cool setting - great for a casual date.  Sit outside when the weather is nice.

i6F05s_UA3Od-LwMileV7A.text: This place is absolutely amazing. All the ingredients  are fresh and the food is truly authentic southern Italian!

9N3wO7I5il3BJlK2IiktSw.text: Go here for lunch and get the pulled pork sandwich. It is heaven in a sandwich.  Also the vibe is super romantic at dinner, with beautiful lights everywhere. Don't forget to get a crepe - or you're doing yourself an injustice.

bUrxXnO3ExA72TMPqh98fw.text: I've gone to Cibo 3 times now and each time, I said, maybe it's just an off night, let's see if it's better next time.... I prefer writing positive reviews, but I have to say, what is the big buzz about this place?  What am I missing?    The place is pretty busy for a Wednesday evening.  We had reservations for 2.  We sat at 7.  We were greeted within 5 minutes and placed drink orders.  Our waters came 5 minutes later.... our one beer and one glass of prosecco came at 7:18pm.  We decided to place our dinner entrees, so not to get caught behind huge parties.    So thankfully, I can pull teeth to make conversation, but dang the wait was long and I did not appreciate having to be dragged longer on an already not-so-great date. (haha, that's another story).  Our food arrived after 8:00pm.  It's one thing if it's extremely busy, but the server never came to check in on us or apologize for the hold up, or see if we wanted an appetizer 'til then.... ;-/  The Capricciosa pizze rosse and bolognese were all we ordered.  You would think after the long wait that I would devour into this and think it tastes amazing..... I guess I was disappointed.  The food wasn't as hot as I'd like it, but felt like it might have been sitting under a heat lamp for too long.  The center of the pizza's crust was soggy.  And yes, I appreciate and know the differences between napolean and sicilian style pizzas.  My pizza's toppings seemed sparse, too.    On a good note, the bolognese pasta was delicious.  Thin wide noodles cooked al dente paired with a good serving of meaty red sauce.  Love the chunky tomatoes.  Great herb seasoning and not too salty.  Very tasty, but again, semi-warm.    And to not completely knock the service, our server asked if we wanted their spicy oil - I asked what that was, she gave a good description, which I tried.... that was a nice dipping sauce for my cold crusted pizza.    By this point, I didn't want to stay around longer to dry the desserts... so hopefully, next time it'll be better!?

S8tVCUY8F6N1NrXDd8X2qw.text: Been eating at Cibo for many years.  Everything that I've tried has been awesome.  Very fresh ingredients and portion sizes.  The dessert crepes are fantastic.  Prices are reasonable.  Service is quick and servers are very pleasant.  Highly recommend!!

edz-ecNxnSAD4Xa_uzpa1w.text: Very cute cozy patio seating. The menu had two pasta on it. We split a maker salad it had both red and white quinoa. My husband had the pasta bolognese. Homemade pasta good portion very tasty. I had a gluten-free pizza with white sauce goat-cheese, pear, prosciutto!  It was awesome! I just wish I had room for their desserts.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. White pizza with goat cheese, pear &amp; prosciutto!
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

lu2g-_55wTr2I3LvjloZ8A.text: Seriously one of my favorite places to eat for date night. Very romantic vibe and excellent food. The service is paced for a dining experience, so don't expect to go in rushing to eat.   Great wine, food, ambiance and service. Nothing but great things happening here!

eck4PKwzWdRwfej3QcERoA.text: We had this place bookmarked for dinner since it was near our hotel.   We would have loved to sit outside but it was way too hot at 5pm on a Sunday evening in early August when we swung by. If we ever visit Arizona again, I'd much rather sit outside, it looks so beautiful!  The pizza we ordered was pretty good! To start we had a Caprese salad, but it came with giant slices of fresh mozzarella and was a bit too filling. We had a couple glasses of wine with dinner and it was a pleasant and intimate experience. The restaurant is generally quiet and we were seated in a corner. Between 2 people we couldn't finish the pizza. Maybe the Caprese in the beginning wasn't a good idea.  I saw someone else at another table order the Calzone and that thing looked absolutely monstrous.

qV3YQ9YDvwulfGH_mRaY4Q.text: Love this place for a quiet meal outside on patio. Pizza is excellent! Glutton free bread is best you can find in town very excellent!

zrChUJHCD71TCr-7WVzXrQ.text: The seating inside is that of a home, crowded with wobbly tables. Outside looks like a good hang I suppose.  There are no fountain drinks which always seems to be the case in pretentious places along with the exclusion of saccharin from the sweetener options cause we know how awesome sugar is for you. Anyone lose a foot to sweet and low lately?  The meatballs are ok but far from having any stand out flavor. The bread is good though.  The calamari was ok but the pepper sauce was bland.  They only serve pasta after 5pm and you will hear people ask over and over as you dine only to hear the same origin story about how they make it fresh and its spun into gold by an artisanal god who does nothing but work on perfecting the pasta. This whole thing is just to push a feeling of demand, plain and simple. The menu is limited without the pasta so if you come before 5pm you are a sucker, if you come after 5pm you will have to wait. Just the right kind of mind tricks that get people thinking this is all they desire. I think its petty, petty as this review I suppose but its a crap ploy and stinks of smugness.  The pizza has the good bread but goes off the rails from there. The red sauce is watered down. Some people like the wine taste in pizza but this is clearly not the kind I like. They also do this authentic bs with the cheese where its is more of jizz clumps here and there and the meat thrown on with lackluster placement to show how not serious they take themselves.  The wait staff were great besides getting sat at the worst table but all these reviews are delusional. You could walk into a red devil any day and have a better pizza than this. This idea that authentic or age old ways of making something automatically means it's better is BS, sometimes new ways are better suited. To think this place has all these positive reviews for such a mediocre dining experience hindered by purposefully limited options speaks more about the people who frequent here just being happy with style over substance, bland over taste.

zN0uZm2SshQRx44wUj_BzQ.text: My favorite Italian restaurant In town hands down. Food and service are great, always a treat when I go there. Love, love, love this place!

q8zamP-Hc7zI5QPlV63lbA.text: The white pizzas are amazing! The red sauce is a little watery but everything else is perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The amazing meat and cheese board. With things you would expect but you will surely be delighted

qfbPLwt5D6h_fKUDC697WQ.text: Very good wood fired pizza here. Also some nice pasta selections.  What makes Cibo a must visit is the really cool outdoor eating. The area has trees and plants and small white lights everywhere.  When it's chilly, the portable heaters are on. There is also cozy indoor dining. The service is great here also.

gpY4ArvOfDMWejbGi5kWiA.text: Get the Dolce Vita pizza! You'll be doing yourself a favor. It is hands down the best pizza I've ever had. The restaurant is so cute and romantic with a peaceful vibe. You can tell the food is fresh and made with quality ingredients. Definitely one of my favorite restaurants

xDZ9QOnPKJKRgjXmWZGouw.text: Super cute place. I would definitely recommend it. I love the cozy feeling and overall just love the charm of the place. Pizza is delish!

OUh4Tbw-VU8dbuB0kOJuWQ.text: Cibo is so delicious and quaint. It is one of the most adorable restaraunts I've ever been to. I love sitting on their patio with the lights on listening to a live band or just the chatter of happy families. The restaurant is made from an old historic home in downtown and it makes you want to keep coming back for me for that relaxing atmosphere. Their food is absolutely delicious. The way they cook their pizzas...it's all of them were kissed by an angel to perfection. It's actually ridiculous how how good this place is. I suggest everyone go check it out.

ou3cVsBquwwe-ZflHL2S8Q.text: Birthdays beware they charge $2 per person if you bring your own cake. "It's kinda like a wine decorking fee, but for cakes" is how they described it. Good thing it caps out after $15. Pizza was great though. The atmosphere is relaxed with a nice patio set up.

zzteaet-ZSiXLOjzZL1EPQ.text: Great place for date night,  or just to enjoy delicious food with friends and family. On a nice night, enjoy dinner in their patio with live music by a local artist. They have a great selection of beer and wine, and their woodfire pizza is amazing.

2d1A7NWwP1nVZdTZ2_IY_w.text: Pizza looks amazing and tastes ok. Not quite cooked enough. Crust is a bit doughy. The slice flops over. Soggy pizza isn't my thing nor do i like to eat my slice with a fork and knife. Fresh and large basil on top is a plus. Cheese is fresh and great tasting. Service is pretty mediocre. Hostesses and servers seem distracted and not very attentive. Wouldn't return. And the ABC PHX pizza ranking is dead wrong. This is not the #1 pizza in PHX. That's still Bianco for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2GTZUVVns5YIxwB_NUrslQ.text: I love cibo, the happy hour is amazing.  Wine and meatballs, definitely a go to. The waitress brought my phone back after leaving it on table, after the delicious wine, thank you!!!

8eo_5JvMI8tVKBXXjOACUw.text: Place was good overall. The pizza was pretty authentic and the appetizers were good. Definitely try the meatballs at happy hour, they are huge and very reasonably priced. My one gripe was the mediocre service. Staff stood around talking and didn't do much. Other than that it was good.

XKWJC75I-C45T3OE6ckgGg.text: No bills barred when it comes to food. On any given night at one of the valley's upscale venues, witnesses have already caught me spending 300$ for a la carte dinner. So what's the biggie about going to Cibo to drop 20$ on lunch?   I ordered two hot vegetarian sandwiches ($9.50 ea) on saltimbocca bread and chose salad for sides. The topside of the bread was a beautiful golden brown, the bottomside was overdone. But I knew what to expect from the pictures on Yelp reviews. Still though, burnt bread is bread burnt.   What I didn't expect is the first bite. I went in with an open mind. Hmmm. What's that familiar taste? Bread. So I took another bite towards the middle of the sandwich. A little better, I got a faint flavor of grilled veggies. But the overpowering component - bread.  SMH. Cibo, ccibo, chibo. I know y'all are all 'bout it 'bout it when it comes to your wood oven baked saltimbocca bread, but can a customer get some filling up in here? Where's the filling?! Veggies sliced thin and not generously applied across either sandwich. Sauce spread so thin that I couldn't taste it. Spread so thin, I could barely see it - the inside of the bread was still white.   But hold on, I was sensing something. Feeling. I was feeling like you robbed me, Chibo. Come on! Forget ch'you! I'll make myself a real sandwich!  In order to even enjoy the amazing flavor of grilled veggies, I had to combine the two. But here's the sinker. When I was done combining them into one, you couldn't tell that I ever had two sandwiches. The one sammie now looked normal.  For taste, Cibo gets a 4. For presentation, I'll give 3. For value, the restaurant only gets a 2. Overall 3.5 outta 5 estrellas.  Will I visit again? Of course.  It's a beautifully kept place with easy foods and quick service.  Salads are great too.

Uz76SR_ox2DVj54QTNK5kQ.text: In an old house on 5th Ave North of Van Buren where you can sit inside or outside where there is live entertainment.  This is the 2nd time I have been there and enjoyed it more the 2nd time than the first.  Ordered pizza both times and this time had the Funghi Pizza with Italian Sausage. Good thickness with the crust and a good amount of mushrooms and Sausage.  The Capricciosa was tasty with the black olives and artichokes with the black olives on the strong side.  The service was excellent with our server (Kul) who made sure we were taken care of.  The parking is along the street with a small amount in the back.  I like that it is far enough from downtown to avoid the crowd yet close enough if you have an event downtown.  Will be back again to try other items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fungi Pizza with Italian Sausage

2mF2I2CpHHmwDTVdJhNx1Q.text: This by far is the best pizza in Phoenix! I can here with my brother for lunch and we were seated quickly.   We sat outside on the patio near the tree which was so cute. We had a nice waiter who was very attentive.  I enjoyed a glass of red wine, during happy hour so it was reasonable and yummy! We each got our own pizza, I had mine on their gluten free crust. Let me tell you that was the best gluten free pizza crust I've had in my life. It was almost the same as eating regular pizza dough. We finished our meals off with a gf crepe which was phenomenal as well. I will definitely be back!

c9KoXqpqCPqkWujGmoEnBg.text: By far my favorite restaurant in Phoenix. No restaurants in this huge city can be compared: pizza is truly Neapolitan. Meatballs, arancini, and the porcellino sandwich are great too!!! The garden is huge and very cozy with live not loud music. Prices are absolutely fair for the quality and quantity of food you get.

ojAHQb7H3hKSGbBcnRlHig.text: We went to Cibo for dinner and it was such a lovely experience. We decided to dine outside and it was really lovely. There was live music and the lights were really pretty. We ordered Pizza and Pasta that our waitress recommended. It was really awesome! The portion was generous and price was reasonable. This place is perfect for a date night or family dinner time. This place is located near Downtown (walking district from main downtown) and definitely a must visit place when you are visiting Downtown Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

r5lrEjRYLgFudlrBHsOLlw.text: A really great spot for something romantic. Especially when the weather is gorgeous. The outdoor seating is very pretty and well lit. The food was all delicious and leaves you very full. The wine list was pretty good. Definitely a great spot to try when you need a new date spot.

9IcNbexw7W0YmUDZQTTsyg.text: Excellent experience.  They have a beautiful outdoor seating area, the waiter provided outstanding service and the food was excellent.  My wife and I were both very pleased with the food. The ambiance is really nice and feels very intimate in their outdoor seating area.  We will absolutely be returning.

jtFOfGfMRAY1QCmRmDvpNQ.text: Mellow. We had a friend in from out of town that suggested we go here. It was way less stressful than one of the last times I was here. They now have valet (shared with to the Vig downtown). The weather was perfect so we sat outside with no wait. Great patio if the weather permits. However we got eaten alive by mosquitoes so bring bug spray.   We tried the calamari, salad, pizza, and a pesto pasta special. Everything was good but nothing really stuck out hence the rating. Everything has cheese as the main focus on each dish so might not be a good pick for vegans. Overall, we enjoyed our mellow night out of the house.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EkecLS7SC7Wqvjecyd7xhw.text: Wow! Excellent food and great service! We were a party of 6 and everyone had excellent food! We had margarita pizzas, pastas, pork panini, meatballs, salads, appetizers and desserts- all was amazing and delicious- great ambiance- bummed we didn't get to sit on the outside patio. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dessert
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Appetizer
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great place to come for a family dinner - we were a party of 6 and the service was amazing and the food came out quickly, hot and delicious

wzv_HrH4lrCGV1QSWJqKUQ.text: We love this place. The outdoor seating is so much fun and so romantic. Great servers. The food is amazing. We were in town for 2 days and ate dinner there both days! Must try!

v9qMi3quY1quM1NH_S54zA.text: Cibo means "food" in Italian. It doesn't get any more obvious than that on what they offer here! We actually got dessert first nearby, and figured we should be adults and also get dinner. Cibo was recommend by my friend who we were with so we headed over to try out their Italian cuisine.   They offer valet parking at Cibo (Can't remember if it's complimentary or not), but there is also street parking available. We got here early (Maybe around 5:30-6) and were able to find a spot nearby. When we left around 7 though there was a lot of traffic and parking spots were a rare commodity.   The patio looks very picturesque, but there was someone smoking like a chimney outside and I'm sensitive to cigarette smoke so I decided on dining inside. We got a table with a view of the patio near the window.   Since we got here during happy hour (Discounted drinks and appetizers), we decided to split the happy hour arancini. It came in a basket of 4 with marinara sauce. The arancini were golf ball sized, and were fried to crispy perfection on the outside. The inside was very plain, just risotto rice, but the rice was nicely cooked. I was a little disappointed there wasn't any filling in it (The menu says there's mozzarella in the center but I didn't really see any), and for me the taste was a little bland and the texture monotonous. For the size of the rice balls I would have liked an additional hit of texture in the filling.   For our meal I had the cacio e pepe and had a slice of the vegetariana pizza. I've never had cacio e pepe so I was excited to try it out (Plus it gave me a chance to say "cacio e pepe!" in an exaggerated fake Italian accent at the table). When our dishes came out they looked amazing. I tried the pizza first. The vegetariana has various vegetables and each one is layered on a different part of the pizza which I thought was a unique touch. It was like you were eating a different pizza depending on which part of it you took a slice from. The vegetables were fresh and the pizza itself was decent. The type of pizza they make here leans more towards a Neapolitan style crust which is thin and can be hard to pick up. You might need a fork and knife to eat this pizza depending on your dexterity level. I personally don't really like "floppy" pizzas so it was just OK for me. (By the way this isn't to be confused with NY style pizza which has larger slices, is thin yet foldable and you are able to pick it up)  The cacio e pepe was well prepared, but for me I didn't really enjoy it. The pasta was perfectly al dente, and it had a good amount of fresh cracked pepper in it with butter and cheese. I can see what this dish tries to aim for, by contrasting the spicy black pepper with the delicate flavors of the butter and strong flavor of the cheese, but for me the dish fell flat. For me it tasted mainly like I was eating peppery plain pasta with a hint of cheese. It needed some more flavor for me. I did get a very generous portion of the pasta though which I ended up taking home.   Service was friendly and sweet. The other thing to note about my experience was that we were at a table that was slightly wobbly which made it a slight annoyance when we were eating.   It was overall a decent experience food-wise. The ambiance is nice but I'll go to a place for their food over how the restaurant looks. I might try them out again and get something different to see if another menu item strikes my fancy.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy hour arancini
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cacio e pepe
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salsiccia pizza

Vii7pe0VS9pIltSTxTaROg.text: I stopped here on the recommendation of a good friend and this place checked all the boxes. From the quaint patio with the perfect ambiance, to the amazingly fresh burratta appetizer and perfectly prepared pasta this place has it all. Go see Joe at the bar. His service is great and he's very knowledgeable. Thank you for a great experience.

XqupiozzDGIIZkc60RnCCw.text: Food was fabulous.  Service was great.  My BF and I sat outside at night which had a live band playing upbeat jazz.  Can't beat that while enjoying good food and company.  Definitely have to try this place out.  Their pasta is amazing.  Pizza is delicious as well even though I'm not a big pizza girl myself.

5fmVlhoHJza2r6fIdpuQhA.text: The best pizza and Italian food I have had in my life! From the appetizers to daily specials the food never disappoints. The crepes are also to die for. If you haven't been to Cibo at least a dozen times your life is not complete. Oh did I mention that they make they're own limoncellos?! The service is always outstanding. The staff is super friendly and makes you feel like they're friend from the moment you meet.

SvBDy50-7sHGoVQx-23vWw.text: If you're looking for a fabulous outdoor dining space and charming ambiance, you've got to go to Cibo!  They have the BEST gluten free pizza I've been able to find.  They offer gluten free dessert and beer options as well.  This place is always busy, so prepare yourself, but it's worth the wait!

A8aHGlrm9uX-KbgoKr1BRg.text: This is my favorite outdoor patio and we also love the indoor bar.  My perfect date night, wine paired with pizza or one of their meat/cheese platters. YUM! I celebrated my 50th there, and my friend celebrated his 60th there. It's so nice to see the twinkling lights in the trees and hear the live music (when it's available) on the patio. You will feel like you are on a mini-vacation from the crazies  - right in the middle of the city! Go there, it's so worth it!

tUudpk3vVbO6hNsPhJxMdg.text: What do you want me to update.... my rating is still 5 stars +++ and love love this place. Pizzas were amazing and the wines were perfect. Appetizers we had calamari and a meat and cheese board and everyone was welcoming, professional and took good care of us. Thanks again for a great evening and definitely coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1DPPV42BwcFB9xbDeGIJCw.text: Giving them a 3 1/2 star review. I came during the weekday, transition from lunch into happy hour. We were never given a happy hour menu and had to look it up online to see if their even was one. We got an appetizer, which came out after our main course, and a pizza that was the perfect size to split between two people. Being Italian I was telling myself to just enjoy the food and not criticize it too hard because it might not be as authentic as I wanted. In the end the artichokes on the pizza tasted fishy like they were old and the food in general was a little bland. For someone that has never had authentic pizza or Arancini I could see how this place has such high reviews.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

F6gwME47H9URIC1zcpw4KA.text: I'm convinced they have the best ambiance and service. I came about 1 hour before they closed on a Monday night after class and was waiting a good 25 minutes for a friend to meet me there. Our server Tom (I think that's his name?) checked up on me and made sure I had water and he didn't forget about me while I was waiting. He even moved a heat lamp closer to the table since we sat outside and it was chilly, so that was really nice.  We ordered the Vegetariana pizza, bruschetta, and crepe Suzette. My friend had a wine drink and I had the iced tea. The pizza is a pretty big, so I think it can be shared by 3 people or so. Because it was just the 2 of us, there were leftovers. It was flavorful but light, which is what I like. I'm not into heavy or salty foods, so that pizza was perfect! The bruschetta had pretty big portions too, which I think could easily feed 6 people (1 each) and we had leftovers for that, too. Bruschetta was garlicky and aromatic. The tomato one was kinda salty for me... so I ate more bread than tomatoes, but otherwise the one with beans really hit the spot. I always get crepe Suzette wherever it's offered. My friend wasn't impressed, but I thought it was quite lovely.  I'm glad I found fabulous little gem!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

tkIPMPMqx4alH9G-90y0tg.text: Cute place! Pulling up here, I thought we were in the wrong place because the restaurant looks like a house with decorative lights outside. It certainly had the feel of a cozy place, good for a date or catching up with friends. We sat inside because it was hot outside but their outdoor seating seemed really nice.   My friend and I were in the mood for some dessert so we ordered a Nutella and banana crepe and a Nutella and strawberry crepe, both with whipped cream. They were tasty and not too heavy. The service was also great as the waitresses were very attentive. I'd definitely like to come back to try some of the other menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nutella And Banana, delicious!

wSzn8Vt9gZpNWqhrulDy9A.text: Definitely one of the better pizza places in the city. However, we did try this right after having pizza at Bianco and would have to give the slight edge to the latter. The crust at Cibo was slightly thicker and chewier than its rival. Started off with the calamari, which was decent as well, but strange in that they were all uniformly shaped almost like nuggets (no tentacles or rings). I suppose that is a positive for those people who are weirded out about the shape of squid. We asked for a pizza form of the calzone and added arugula, which they were more than generous with. No complaints about the service either, as the server was quick and attentive.    However, I do have to say the atmosphere is better at Cibo when compared to Bianco. It's like eating in a living room of a rustic farmhouse. The outdoor patio area was really charming as well, although we couldn't really enjoy that as it was 100+ degrees outside.

0mpGQblZ2sEZCWIKyk5xHQ.text: One of my favorite places to take out of towners. Great for lunch or an evening on the patio.

kVPR2Rs3e5b8owptODnRGA.text: Delicious! The food couldn't be better! We came here last night with another couple and all of us thought the food was spectacular. We all had wine and 3 out of four (excluding me) got seconds. Our friends got the Ostia salad for an appetizer and said it was delicious. We also got the Arancini which was good as well.   For dinner 3 of us had pizzas. Our friends got half Bianche and half  rosse. I'm not sure which ones they got but they loved them. I got the Vegetarina which was wonderful. My husband got the Pappardelle Bolognese and said it was delicious. The only thing I would say is everything came out really fast. We had 2 bites of the appetizers before the entrees came. My husband and I like when the food is spaced out.   We didn't get dessert. I had coffee and one of our friends had a beer. We will definitely be back. The waiter was also great. He really enjoyed his job and he described the food wonderfully. I can't recommend the food enough.

YmfktAZArkwDvSFrP2PJOg.text: I love Cibo.  Their sandwiches are delicious. Their pizza is fantastic.  The ambiance is excellent.  Service is good.  The price is appropriate.  I often take business partners here for lunch.

shmoczgGkB8dzgmx3LrYFg.text: I'm really torn on how many stars to give Cibo so I'm sticking in the middle  Went there on a Tuesday night for the very first time and I absolutely fell in love with the ambiance outside.  The outside seating totally deserves 5 stars, but thats about the only 5 star I can give, if it weren't for the wonderful atmosphere I would've only given 2 stars.    After being seated we had to wait a while for our server to come over to the table.  Not sure if he was new or just having an off night but I was not impressed with him.  I was actually jealous of the tables around us and their interactions with wonderful servers.  We explained to the server it was our first time eating there and he just started pointing to stuff and spouting off about all sorts of different pizzas, meats, cheeses, wines, etc...It was a little overwhelming and he lost me.  When we were  ready to order we had to first flag him down and interrupt his conversation with another employee.  He took our order and quickly walked away without even asking if we wanted  anything to drink.  We originally planned on getting a bottle of wine but after my boyfriend had to walk inside the building the get some service and a drink we decided against the bottle.  Very disappointing!   I'm also somewhat glad we didn't order the bottle of wine because while we were still sitting there enjoying our dinner and conversation they started clearing off our entire section and staring at us as if we were keeping the restaurant open.  Keep in mind the place was still open for 30 more minutes.  I honestly felt rushed and that I couldn't enjoy myself.  If we didn't have to wait so long, flag down our server or go in the restaurant ourselves to order a drink we may have actually finished our meal a lot sooner.    We opted for the sausage pizza, which was good but not the best.  The mozzarella cheese was delicious and tasted very fresh, as was the crust.  But other than that I really wasn't all that impressed.    I didn't hate the place nor did I love it.  I'd probably give it one more chance and hope that I had better service the next time around.

RCm_HCEtcq5k-AfDyBUvuA.text: After being told there was a six hour wait at the ever popular Pizzeria Bianco in downtown Phoenix where I was planning to celebrate my birthday with a few friends last week, I remembered another wonderful place and off we went.  Cibo is in a converted 1940ish bungalow and has a yard full of beautiful trees woven with tiny lights. We got a table under a canopy of a few trees and shared four different pizzas that we chose by popular vote. I have to say that it was a hard decision since they all sounded pretty amazing. We agreed that the Diavolo was our favorite. And it didn't hurt that they had a nice wine list including Orvieto Classico which always reminds me of a favorite trip to Italy and a Salice Salintino that I always liked to share with a couple of my best friends back in my New York days. For dessert? Crepes of the Nutella and Suzette variety that we passed around.

kVqDsOEH5_3M-3aXiEd6Dw.text: We 100% loved our dinner at Cibo. The pizzas were fantastic, and the limoncello was to die for. And while the recommended appetizer was pretty bland (risotto and mozzarella balls), everything else was just delicious. I would go back there for dinner in a heartbeat.

5m6kmZQmFtxTUFCHKhoeUg.text: Cibo is hands down, my favorite gourmet sandwich place in town. You can't go wrong here...their caprese, spek and pulled pork sandwiches are among my faves (served with a nice, lightly dressed house salad or fresh fruit, yogurt and crunchy granola - skip the chips because they're just store bought in a bag), and if you are lucky enough to go on a day when they have their meatball sandwich special, don't even hesitate - it's so delicious.  Also, consider having a private party at their adorable carriage house, it's separate from the main restaurant and used for parties of 10+. I went to lunch with 10 or so coworkers and we reserved it; the service was awesome and we had the place all to ourselves!
