sT87r4-7J_d5SkVVLDfjBw.text: Seriously this place is amazing!!!! We had the pesto Genova pizza which was full of flavor!What's not to love about pesto and potatoes on a pizza!! The house salad was also a good size and very fresh! We also had a Nutella strawberry crepe and the little donut holes for dessert. Our server was super friendly and made us feel so welcome! We highly recommend this place if you are in the Phoenix area! You won't be disappointed one bit!

_VRHHs0WKs1dws9eggwRdw.text: Fresh made pasta is something I eat a couple times a year. Tonight was a pretty good pasta experience. Things I loved about this place: outdoor patio that was very well decorated and live music playing at dark. Service was wonderful, attentive but not over bearing. My salad was fresh and shaved cheese was delicious!

ozBNK4FCTCWJJjher4AAwg.text: I've been here only a couple of times and for the most part it's always been great. Last night was the exception. Friendly service but food was less than mediocre. We had cold food and soggy pizza. We were a large party of 10 and half of the food came out( cold) the rest of us had to wait 34 minutes until our dinner arrived. This was the first time for several of our guests and unfortunately my recommendation was not a win. Cibo fell very short.

KvKbahXs8tqR4qASZc4Oeg.text: Holy Cow!! How have I lived here 13 years and never been here? This place is an old house that has been redone into a restaurant and wine bar. The patio under the twinkle lights is like something from a movie! We had the prosciutto pizza and the nuttella crepe. I cannot stop telling people about them. The bottles that the water is served in are super cool as well. My mouth is watering as I write this.

rRqeoluSON2vVT-Bu--Y2Q.text: Cibo is romantic!  Romantic as hell! Dimmed lightening everywhere.  Perfect date night!  Perfect solo date night!  Soft music playing.  Greenery and plants in plain sight.  Homemade sauces made with Love.  You can smell it.  You can taste it.  The serving sizes are huge!  A party of 2 really should split everything.  The salads are huge, share it.  The pastas are huge and heavy, share it.  The desserts are rich, fulfilling and huge, share them too.  Everyone walked around with a smile.  That made the place feel really warm.  We dined pretty late, about an hour before closing time.  At no point did we feel like we were rushed out or impeding on everyone's time.  We loved the restaurant, the food and the dining experience.

Y_UIuAX99-c69gkr3SUxmg.text: I really enjoy the food here my favorite dish is Diavola. This is my favorite place for pizza.  My experience today was unacceptable. The food was great the customer service was bad. Our waiter did not come check on us. Throughout my whole time their not once after getting our order was she there . Other servers came with our dishes. We waited a while for our check and had to ask for it from another waiter. Then it was then that she came back with our change. We had to mentioned that the chicken we had for our salad was too hard and cold and didn't not say anything but wait for us to pay. We were still charged the chicken that we did not eat. This happened during their lunch time. Which was our first time going during their lunch time. It was no excuse for them to not check on us . Also the fact that it was not busy that we also had to wait to be seated when we seen the employees seating down conversating.

rTXfhLDzmVQ8U0GgR8vkXQ.text: Charming place.  Love the atmosphere, great service and the pizza is the best in Phoenix!

mLpk-fWYOw_C3JcTV3Shdw.text: This is literally my favorite pizza place  i love the pizza and especially the crepes! If i ever crave crepes this is my go to. Im pretty sure Ive never had a complaint here everything always is amazing and very romantic for a date! The lighting, warmers (If Its cold)! I really enjoy this cute little place

l6mHLehZQYEtoCbW6MrcNA.text: Good pizza? Good pasta? Are you kidding? The BEST in the city! We were fortunate enough to meet the head chef (born in Italy) who stopped by our table and asked how we were enjoying our "Il Tagliere" cheese/meat board; again, the best in town. Did I mention the unique charm of the historic downtown building? Did I mention winning the Cibo Instagram gift card contest? I love this place!

BCAjIUZYXVOJTPTaKXEpyg.text: The pizza was okay but the wine tasted as if it was watered down. The atmosphere was decent. They seemed to have a nice patio set up but it was too hot to sit out there. They had misters however it's summer in Phoenix.

s1dGLqIdcGmZQxvPzkabEw.text: So worth the 50 minute drive to this place. The restaurant is an old charming house. Live music was playing outside in the evening and inside had a very welcoming atmosphere.  Let me just say.... the pizza was AMAZING! We also got the bruschetta which was perfect for two people and my husband and I were fighting over the last bite of our Nutella crepe. This place will be a staple for our weekly dinner date night.

BAHG-alkQcfRXaIs9dluxg.text: Had a wonderful experience here! Pizza was amazing and our server was friendly and prompt. The ambiance is cozy and I love the old cottage feel of the place. Had a wonderful, inexpensive date here and will definitely return in the future!

vIxXMSlE4DKnMw953YRH9g.text: I would give 5 stars if the service was better. The food was delicious but our server kept disappearing and we mostly had other staff help us whenever we could find someone. The pizza was delicious, but our favorite dish was the pappardelle in bolognese sauce- my mouth is watering now thinking about it! The dessert crepes were decent, I wish they were more unique with their toppings for the crepes.

c6XdtWH8KHfKyQG4b5L8-g.text: One of the best places for pizza in Phoenix, great outdoor seating and always some good music.

P7qnDUE3G5u5pfM6WpWpHA.text: Came for dinner and there was live music outside. We chose the outdoor dining despite worries (and an eventual) mosquito bite. The outdoor seating is super romantic and pretty. It's large and comfortable, plus not near a busy street so it feels private.   We tried one pizza (split into two types), pear salad, and a bolognese pasta. Everything was delicious. We spent a long time reviewing the menu since there were so many options and combinations. Eventually, we did ask for recommendations.   First pick for pizza was the mushrooms and the second was one with sliced Italian bacon. The pear salad added some additional sweet flavor so we ended up not even choosing a dessert to try.   This place is great for small groups or even an intimate evening for two. We didn't have a wait, but I would recommend a person to go early to get better seating. We were not right in front of the musicians, but close enough to hear each other speak and enjoy the music.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pear salad
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Italian bacon pizza

IzGiPwqZXZBlmgOi34gh0w.text: A little pricey, but our food was DELICIOUS, the ambiance was comfortable and inviting, and the service was great. They accommodated my family of 7 with a reservation and we sat outside. It was an absolutely beautiful experience and I will DEFINITELY be coming here again.  I took my two small children (2 and 4) and while there wasn't anything about the restaurant that was overtly bad for kids, a lot of people go to have a nice talk over dinner and relax, and, well, my kids (like most their age) are beyond boisterous so I probably won't take them again just to spare the other guests.   The two things that made me a little uncomfortable were the mosquitoes outside and the lack of lighting outside. I went when the sun was setting and it was a bit hard to read the menu, but I asked our server to turn some lights on and when she did all was well :)   Added to my favorite local phoenix dining destinations!!

NY6sXM-Bd1onsa3yDLEpPg.text: Love this place  1) Food is amazing, even the salads. 2) Service is good. 3) The patio is gorgeous, especially during the day time.

YBR3toaWoTwUZVkKODQiDQ.text: This is the most adorable little restaurant I've been to in Phoenix. Situated in a home converted to a restaurant, it is charming and romantic and a perfect place to take advantage of outdoor seating during Arizona's lovely cooler autumn nights. We sat outdoors during our first visit because we couldn't resist the big beautiful trees covered in twinkling lights. Aside from the ambiance, the service was knowledgeable, prompt, and friendly. I had the house pasta of the day (made with guanciale - pig cheek - don't be afraid! It's amazing!) and he had the Diavalo pizza. We didn't have any apps because we were trying to make a movie time, but we'll definitely be back to try more. The dishes we did have were outstanding. Fresh, well seasoned, and delicious! I can't wait to go back! Take your first date or the love of your life here, because it is sure to impress and add a little spark to the evening.

THVkfeDDlATVEQ2kOR3JVw.text: Loved the ambience and food! Server was super friendly and helpful with dope unique earrings that I loved!  Next time I'm in town visiting I'll be sure to be back!!

go1dpZYo0NxBe98_SXL1Uw.text: The reason I am giving this restaurant even a 1 star is only because of the food, not that it was over the top, but because it was decent plus. The service/no service would have been good if only our waitress Monique would even understand the meaning of the word.  There were 4 of us, and we all..figured that she was very aloof and full of her self right from the start.She offered nothing. "More coffee"? Etc... we even had to  get our own plates for sharing. Did not offer dessert, and when I ordered tea, I got the bill instead.. shame on a restaurant that keeps servers like her.

a46YOTXOaj793nW0cPYAdA.text: Went to the fairgrounds and after the show we were hungry and anxious for a quiet spot to relax. Not knowing Phoenix well, my friend dubious asked where we should go. I suggested we Yelp it and showed her how to use Yelp. She found this place and when I realized we were in the Willow district, I relaxed. The ambiance couldn' t have been better. The waiter was friendly and helpful. The food was fresh, generous portions, and tasty. Lunch for two was less than $20 and there was plenty of off street parking too.

A3HSndIIdw7Ml8odqDXOiw.text: I think that if you come here with a large group, the wait is longer, but I came here with only one other person, and we were seated right away. However, we sat inside and wished we could have experienced the lovely outside ambience. Next time. The two of us shared a pizza and it was perfect! One of the best pizzas I have ever had, and I would consider myself to be a pizza lover. I would now like to try Pizzeria Bianco so I can compare the two.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

XJOQoR8aX3RJ1OjuO6cw_w.text: Love this place.. awesome, awesome outdoor patio.. cool live music on the weekends... I love the diavla w ricotta pizza.. awesome crepes. The ambiance is  unmatched the food seems authentic and fresh. Def a nice spot for people visiting, w a couple of the girls, or a romantic night for two. For a busy place, I always seem to get seated pretty quickly as well :)

nLiihfCTcOfpNxxtvzLW0w.text: This place is adorable. A nice little detour from the airport to eat dinner while traffic dies down.  Wine was a bit pricey, but a large salad and pizza shared between two was a great meal.

TZStVSnYIbXywFxCcVIQXA.text: Great place for my daughters 10th birthday dinner - six of us!   Made a reservation for 5:00 PM for the outside patio - we got there almost an hour early and were seated right away.  We were excited to try the Home-Made Pasta - the Pappardelle Bolognese.  We were informed that the Pasta wasn't served until 5:00 PM - the chef just got there and was making it for the night.  So we decided to try a little of everything while we waited for 5 - lucky for us their Happy Hour Menu has some great items.  First Course - We started with the following:  Polpette (Meatballs) Arancini (Fried Rice Balls) Margarita Pizza - Charred Crust and fresh Ingredients (will definitely try some of the other pizza's next time) White Wine  Wow!  - Happy Hour portions were great and we even ordered more Polpette's because the first batch were devoured!  Second Course - we k now we were getting the Home-Made Pasta at 5:00, but we still had 25 minutes to wait - so we ordered round 2:  Gnocchetti Sorrentina - mini gnocchi with melted cheese - Yum Ostia Salad - This was the only item we ordered which was just OK.  The ingredients were fresh and great quality - the dressing just lacked flavor.  We all thought it was very bland - considering it was described to us as similar to a Caesar Salad.  3rd Course - Pappardelle Bolognese  -This was defiantly worth the wait!  One of the best Pasta dishes I have ever had.  The Bolognese was rich with a great texture from the underlying vegetables.  The Home-made Pappardelle noodles had a perfect consistency from top to bottom and melted in your mouth!  Dessert Course - We ordered the Banana Nutella Crepe with Fresh Whipped Cream and the Palline 2.0 (Mini Doughboys, Spingi, etc...) with a side a Nutella!  Both desserts were exceptional and they topped it with a birthday crepe for my daughter!  Great finishing Touch!  We live in North Scottsdale and will make an effort to come downtown here much more often!    Thank you for a Great Dinner!

rLDMo2f3l_pOqOyo-q_AcA.text: Food is 3 stars but the atmosphere is 4! Great desserts! Ask for crepe with Nutella and Reese's peanut butter inside topped with ice cream!  It's not on the menu!

RXd9he3ut5dN6uoPyQU_1Q.text: Hands down the best pizza in Phoenix. I've been to Pomo, Pizzeria Bianco, Andreoli, Parlor, you name it. Cibo just tastes... fresher? Might be something in the water (which is surprisingly not shitty compared to a lot of Phoenix venues, good job) but I just can't get enough of this place.  Atmosphere is nice, cozy and not pretentious. Wine selection is above average. Staff is generally personable and helpful (Meagan is the best though). Cleanliness is never an issue.  But the pizza, that's what we come for.

PmcxYdSSmHnRxRbPKthVPQ.text: We came to Cibo for a late dinner after watching a World Baseball Classic at Chase Field a few weeks ago. Cibo is one of the few restaurants in Phoenix that is open until later, and we came in to try their thin crust pizza. It is in a bit of a strange location, and is the only restaurant/store in that area. At first, we thought we entered the address incorrectly in the GPS, since Cibo doesn't have a lot of lighting in the front of the restaurant. It was close to 10:45pm on a Friday night, and the restaurant still had a good amount of tables, but we seated right away. We ordered: -Funghi (Tomato Sauce, Mozzarella, Mushrooms, $11.50, yelp.com/biz_photos/cibo...): Just ok for me. I thought the tomato sauce was a bit too tangy. However, this pizza is good for those who enjoy a classic and simple pizza. I wouldn't order this again though. -La Dolce Vita (Burrata and Speck [Smoked Prosciutto] Topped w/Arugula and Balsamic Glaze, $16.50, yelp.com/biz_photos/cibo...): Delicious! This was one of their specials that night. I've never had a pizza with burrata on it before, and I was glad we gave this a try. The burrata went really well with the speck, arugula, and balsamic glaze, but I think swapping the speck for guanciale would also be really tasty. Their pizzas are split into red sauce and white sauce sections, and they have a good amount of variety for each type of sauce. We wanted to order more (the salads looked really good), but we had already snacked during the baseball game so weren't super hungry. I really appreciated that Cibo was still welcoming customers even though it was close to closing time- there's nothing worse than rushing to get to a restaurant before closing and the staff death staring you through the meal. Even though it was past closing when we left, there were still a good amount of customers still at the restaurant having a great time. The only slight complaint I have is that our server (I can't remember his name.. maybe Tom?) was really weird. He tried to crack a few really lame jokes, and become overly chummy with us. It was just a strange experience interacting with him, and none of us felt comfortable. I saw him drinking a glass of wine later on, so he probably got started a little too early. In any case, if you're looking for a good meal while out in Phoenix, and/or love thin crust pizza, make sure to check out Cibo!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fungi ($11.50)
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Daily Special- La Dolce Vita (Burrata &amp; Speck, Topped w/Arugula and Balsamic Vinegar Glaze, $16.50)

BO2ckTAEGOGeFzkeJwcrvg.text: The best pizza in the Phoenix area and probably one of the best pizzas on the west coast. Worth the trip and wait.

u3KWp38wUtVhviL1S09MAg.text: I don't know if I could be any more in love with a restaurant than I am with Cibo. Last night was the first time I have been there but I think this is going to start being a new go to. We started with the meatball appetizer, let me just say I would have licked the sauce from the bowl if it wasn't publicly frowned upon, and the meatballs were delicious. We also had the arancini balls-basically gooey balls of cheese and rice. They are very good as well but very filling-obviously. My husband then had the prosciutto pizza and I had the diavola, wish I would have taken pics as I usually do but I was too busy stuffing my face. Then we finished off with a crepe Suzette...filled with orange marmalade and topped with gran marnier and set on fire with ice cream. Needless to say we were so full we had to roll ourselves out the door. I could go on and on, but basically the restaurant is beautiful, the patio is amazing, will definitely need to sit out there when it cools off and the food is to die for.

lehECERgVpcXMbTKhXCprA.text: Good is awful, no meats, just salads, pizza & pasta.  Not for kids, no parking, got to find a street

S03oAGI4hDR_TziVfOCARQ.text: The food is sooo delicious!! Also they have a fantastic happy hour. They serve gluten free as well! Excellent day.

Aa_kZe5r26tO4mBqdZqPQg.text: This is one of my favorite restaurant in Phoenix. I love to gather with friends and sit outside and enjoy their limoncello. This is a unique building with charm and character. They often have a musician playing outside. Their oven-brick-type of pizza is amazing! Simple and delishious menue that will make you want to come for more. Reservation is highly recommended if you plan to attend with a large group, especially afternoon.

QXj5oXQlgjEtGJnrKXGiSQ.text: My family and I checked this place out after having an unsatisfactory Italian food experience elsewhere. We were very impressed overall with Cibo.  Starting with the place itself: it's home-y, well-lit, well-decorated, and just all-around cozy. It used to be an old house, and it definitely shows. Great patio seating, as well.  The food is next, and holy mackerel was it good. We got polenta fries and salads to start with. The salads had delicious and fresh ingredients, as well as gorgeous displays. I got the pesto salad, and would highly recommend it. For entrees, my parents got a white pizza, and I split the pulled pork sandwich. Both were delectable, and we all had food left over to bring home.  The kicker is that they comped our desserts (about $15 worth). They said it was because they made us wait too long in between appetizers and entrees. It was a bit of a wait, but nothing crazy! The desserts were so good, too. The 'fresca' is a crepe with ice cream in the  middle, topped with fruit and whipped cream.  Next time we're in the area, we are definitely coming back.

amzZeRgYy554_8QKYbzlxQ.text: Great restaurant experience. The food was fantastic and the server was absolutely first class. We brought the kids and had an excellent night out. We were all raving about every aspect when we left.   This place is great for all ages and tastes!

-BUBBlSkxiZEPjRExnk1Qg.text: I've been here three times. I would say this place has the best atmosphere for early Friday evening. The best seats are outside during the springtime and if you could get the inside, it would also give the great view of the Phoenix downtown. The pizza here is made hand tossed and thin crust. Some of you may know that there is competitor near this pizza restaurant. Honestly I would choose this place over Pizzeria B.... because of the wait time there.   In addition to Pizza, this restaurant offers variety of wine selections and locally brewed beer. If you were not driving, I would highly recommend some of the wine; it matches well with pizza! Also, the crepe here is amazing mainly because of the fresh cheese that they use to make it. IF you are fan of live music, they play sweet guitar/key board smooth jazz on Friday night at outside patio. Check this place out and let me know if you visit!

NRtAH-eHBlKP_b4aX_9I1Q.text: This place is romantic. Seriously.  Reese Witherspoon movie romantic. Housed inside a lovely old home.  Nice little garden out front, with twinkling lights strung over head.  If you recently messed up with your lady friend, a bottle of wine on this patio and prior transgressions will be forgiven. And you know what? The food is good! Really good.  All fresh, home made pasta, fire oven pizza's, everything made with care and attention to detail.   Parking can be a hassle, but worth it.

ZqxrfUItZqWpe_qzjfpurg.text: My favorite Phoenix lunch spot. Food is served quickly, always consistent and fantastic. Always. I think the staff are wonderful and friendly, their iced tea is so delicious. Being vegan, I either get the cous cous salad or the vegtariano without cheese. That sandwich is sooo good, and if you happen to save half for later, it tastes great afterwards too.   I love love love Cibo. Best patio, delicious food, friendly staff. Best of Phoenix for sure.

s9GfH4goGtalgaFH-28wjw.text: One of my favorite pizza places in downtown Phoenix.  If you like authentic Italian pizza then this is one spot you'll want to dine at.  I love pizza and not just any pizza either, I love great authentic make your mouth watery I wish I could eat 2 pies worth pizza.  This one makes that list.  It's a good place to take a date on.  Sit outside in the spring and you'll enjoy the patio lights they have.  Staff was friendly and the food is awesome if you like pizza.  They do have a full menu, but I only go for the pizza.  Can you tell I like pizza?  yom yom yom yom yom

DnslIjyvxLrHO6jqenDQ3Q.text: TIP: this places takes no reservations on fridays and limited reservations on saturdays so expect long wait times standing in front of the house.  when you get in, skip the mediocre salads and just order the amazingly fresh pizzas.  ask to sit inside cuz outside can get crazy hot even at nights.  This joint is just unusual because it's in a house that serves pizzas and salads (i'm surprised neighbors don't complain).  expect long waits in the weekends.  Service could be better cuz the dude thought i ordered a nut brown when i asked for a dirty blonde and a calzone when i asked for a magherita pizza.  The pizza is as fresh as it gets.  You can tell the ingredients are fresh because the tomato sauce in the pizza is extra tangy.   The local beer from sedona (nut brown) and tempe (pale ale) are extremely flavorful.  The pesto salad is not that great (can't taste the pesto, should have tossed it).

XkrpvxXRbBpGYKEPow8jlg.text: I love this place! Such a gem and the food is amazing!!! Definitely recommend if you're in town. Service is always amazing as well and it's just such a cute little spot.

ymzshhfdLAZDL1Ud4RQRVw.text: I love this place.  They have great gluten free pizza and salads for those of you who cannot eat gluten.  The patio is very comfortable and ambient.   Definitely a great place for a date night

v2LAEV2CtMIaKj0AvZgRfg.text: Some of the best Pizza and abiance available in down town phoenix. Truely worth the wait.

3imMiJ3PcrErtihQk_g9vg.text: In my opinion this place is overrated. Margherita pizza was bland. The crust is well done, but the sauce and mozz were flavorless. Server and hostess were rude, won't be back.

A3uabgOhau8f14g3z2WK_A.text: Dinner was great half vegetarian and el noce pizza rosse. Good wine selection. Calamari was strips with a spicy sauce is a good starter. Love the ambiance and patio.

UcputV_RihQX_Tx21X5DoA.text: More like 3.5 stars.  Cibo is a very charming and cozy house turned restaurant, and they offer plenty of seating with their large front patio as well as ample seating inside.    My family and I decided on 2 salads and 4 pizzas to share.   All the pizzas were delightful but I wasn't really blown away.  The service was great except for the rude brunette hostess who barked at me when I mentioned we had a reservation.  It's ok though, I understand that Saturday nights can be stressful, but just keep your cool, lady.

SBv6EZq-eClRrJ4JA-J-5g.text: The service, ambiance, and food is absolutely the best. You feel like you have escaped the heat and desert for split second and found a beautiful oasis tucked into another city. This restaurant is the best, the owners and staff are happy to be there and so are we!

W-p7ZYNi6S4kcoOTt-lPaw.text: I had my engagement night dinner here so it will always have a special place in my heart. The patio is the highlight of the restaurant. Not a big fan of the indoor seating because it is pretty cramped. I would have sat outside but it was a July night we went here so it was hot not to mention I was in a full suit after proposing.  Parking was a bitch. The food is really good. Their pizza is very delicious. Our server was very nice and accommodating.  Not a big fan of giving me a soda in a can and still charging me $3 per can lol. I don't know why some places do that. This isn't Mexico. Get a damn fountain.  I would go back.

vjc6mq2IbqieQRnJnsIsIQ.text: In town for a very short trip when a local recommended Cibo.  It never ceases to amaze me that Phoenix is right there with NY & CT when it comes to pizza.  There has to be something in the water in that town.  The spot is in a nice residential area.  I was seated immediately.  I really love the flexibility with the pizza.  Unlike other pizza joints, they allowed me to split my pizza so that I could try different flavors.  I went with a 1/2 Salsiccia - tomato sauce, sausage and mozzarella and 1/2 Tartufata - mozzarella, prosciutto crudo, white mushrooms and a drizzle of white truffle oil after the pizza is cooked.  It is everything it had be billed.   Service was attentive.  Price was very reasonable for what I got.  Worth the drive.

UmrqDAocAs7Yn2_Q3IzocA.text: One of my favorite DT PHX joints... EVER. I've been here several times and have always had an amazing experience. Cute place, friendly staff, quick service, excellent food... I mean, I couldn't possibly ask for anything more.   The first thing you need to do is get the Burrata as an app... holy COW it's creamy, yummy amazingness on a plate. Funghi pizza is one of my faves. The Capricciosa pizza is also delicious. Okay before I remake the entire pizza menu... they're all amazing, it just depends on what you're in the mood for. When we visit here for birthdays or other special occasions that are deserving of dessert, we always get one of the crepes that have Nutella and other fun stuff in them so make sure you get one!  They have pasta night on Tuesdays and all of them I've had in the past have been great. Each Tuesday they feature two different pasta dishes, and it varies week to week. They have a great selection of wine and are great at suggesting a certain type you'll enjoy.   They also serve brunch and lunch. I haven't been to either but plan to head there for brunch soon! :)

yf2T2E82PWP91LVUYrnu4A.text: Another great experience at Cibo. Our party of four was seated right away, with an attentive (but by no means annoying) server. The food was great, as usual. If you're going with a group, do yourself a favor and check out the menus ahead of time if you're planning on sharing any of the pizzas. We would have been able to order much faster if we hadn't argued for so long over which of the pizzas to get. We ended up agreeing on the quattro... whatever is Italian for cheese probably - and the red pizza with sausage. The 4 cheese white pizza is delicious, but very rich. I'd probably get a lighter one to go with it next time. Their pizza with arugula and walnuts perhaps (La Noce maybe? I can't remember all the actual pizza names).   On an interesting side note, a friend of mine chose to brave the line at Pizzeria Bianco last night, and wound up wishing he had gone to Cibo instead. Advantage Cibo!!

NwwwNCMCeI_aIO6bFjMerA.text: I have been here before and had a great experience, though that was years ago. That night we went with a group of friends, there were 8 of us. First, our waitress was extremely rude and dismissive. I work in the restaurant industry and where service is concerned, she definitely failed. She was impatient with us, when my friend asked for a clean plate, she investigated the plate before deeming it worthy of being replaced. I kept asking for more water, 4 times and on the 3rd time she just ignored me, physically looked around me, while getting my friends drinks. Finally, the same friend ordered water for us because she was pretending not to hear me. The food was mediocre at best, which was really disappointing. Then we ordered dessert and got a crepe with nutella and strawberries. While it was delicious, there were maybe 3 strawberries in the entire thing, which was a drag since the bites with strawberries were so good. When it came to the check, she split it by "couple" took our payments and then completely forgot about one of the couples and just brought it back with the card, not run. We were all just stunned that she had added 20% gratuity to all of our checks (Im sure is policy with larger groups) but we would not have left it for her awful service. I can't recommend this place anymore, that's for sure.

iPBxLHsfwkj7jIDt8v7A0A.text: Cibo is a great place for nice dinner!! Compared to Bianco, Cibo has a more local and intimate vibe. Also, they have a bigger selection of pizzas and unlike Bianco, they have other traditional italian entrees (They have homemade pasta on some nights!). When I went it was busy, but we didn't have to wait for a table. The servers are dressed really casually, but a lot of the people eating were dressed up. It's kind of a casual place but if you dressed up you wouldn't feel weird.   Bianco is the place to try for pizza in Phoenix, of course, but Cibo is just as good...especially if you are looking for something other than pizza too!

71Ugcs-TsUebpQqnLIlJzw.text: A few girls from work suggested we eat at Cibos for lunch. I was a bit hesitant because I am not crazy about Italian food. But, after eating at Cibos I wanted to live there. I wanted to eat everything and proclaim of its awesomeness to the world. Instead, I decided to write a great review. Great selection for lunch, quick service and the taste was out of this world. I tried a Salsiccia sandwich and angels sang when I started eating. Or maybe that was me...because it was AWESOME!!! I will be frequenting this place all the time. I may just try to live there....it is that good!

VxE_ThBWVSAVK8RgM1jiFQ.text: Food was absolutely delicious i got the antipasti palatter with a side of meatballs and the pizza was super good it wasnt very busy when i went as i had read that the service was worse on busy days but to be honest it wasnt great. Only 3 other tables outsode and not crowded inside we saw the waiter literally 4 times the entire time. To be seated, water, food and check. Never refilled the water or asked about how we were matter of fact the servers seemed more interested in talking to each other than checking on their tables, didnt stick around for dessert. But still I'd  go back for the food alone. Maybe take out next time.

Iy-2l2keTxl2tK5Hhi5ASA.text: I love Cibo. I love going with my bf here. It is pretty much located inside a historic house so it is very small. It is perfect for a romantic close date.   The food is good. It is pretty much the same kind of style as Pizzeria Bianco. Although I might argue that Bianco is better.   The salad is boring and dry. I I dislike salad that is a plate full of lettuce. I need more in it...shoot give me a tomato atleast !!!   The crepes for dessert are delish. I would go there just for pizza and crepes.

1eG_jcr4Pmoq-pGitU6eQQ.text: I had read some reviews about this place, and between those and my prior love for pizza, I knew I had to give it a try.  Sadly, it took me way to long to get here.  I actually took the GF & my parents there for a joint dinner.  They had never met before, and I was really banking the success of their meeting on Cibo's food and ambiance.  I can honestly say, mission accomplished!  Not that the restaurant had anything to do with the weather, but we had an amazing table outside (the only way to go here), under a tree in what turned out to be a cool Saturday afternoon. That was only the beginning.  Our appetizer plate was amazing, and definitely enough for four people to share.  This plate had enough variety, that even the pickiest of parents found something he/she enjoyed.    We all order pizzas, because none of us really knew how big they'd be.  The crust, cheese and toppings were everything we could have wanted. Crisp, warm and delicious.  The pizzas are big enough for two, and I'd actually recommend sharing with someone else (unless you want leftovers) because dessert is the best here.  You won't find many places that serve Nutella, let alone in homemade crepes.  The crepe with Nutella and banana was unbelievable and is a destination dessert in itself.  I'll come back just for that.  We also split one limoncello drink, which was so strong.  The parental unit was flying high after just sipping that once!  All in all, this place is excellent.  It is totally tucked away in a cool neighborhood, and is a great place for a date or to feel like you are escaping the suburban sprawl in PHX.

_6fMpaRvUprXWxszNCf8_Q.text: If there were 6 stars I would give them all. Everything was great including the casual, outdoor seating. Our server was very friendly and took great care of us. From the start we liked him as he knew his menu and was able to recommend, wines, appetizers, and entrees. When the kitchen let him know they couldn't prepare one of the pizzas we ordered he immediately suggested one he thought would be comparable and he was right. Everything was delicious! Will definitely be back the next time I'm in Phoenix.

1C5h6qiWf28g8ZhD4OQ8AA.text: My husband and I ate at Cibo when we visited Phoenix.  The pizza is excellent.  I'd have to say it is either the best or the second best pizza we've eaten, and we eat a lot of pizza.  The crust was not thick or thin, it was just right.  The ingredients were fresh and the cheese was delicious! We waited about 1 hour to finally score a spot at the bar, which is first come, first serve.  Be sure to get there when they open or you're in for a long wait.  Definitely worth it!

eehbjSai8U6UJ2jOjYWwPA.text: Two of us went on a Friday night, so no surprise - there was a 45 minute wait...  But MAN - it was WELL worth it!!!  We started out with the Bruschetta, which was good (I especially loved the tomato bruschetta).  Then we split a pizza - also delish - I'm looking forward to returning and trying a different pizza every time...because all of them sounded SO GOOD.  But the real game winner was the CREPE at the end - with Nutella and Mascarpone - O.M.G. SO GOOD.  The atmosphere is fantastic, the wait staff is busy - but good, and the food is WELL worth any wait on a Friday night.  I will definitely be a "frequent" at this cute little pizzeria!!! :)

VsiLcgHY1rx3O7ege5G8Bw.text: Were in the neighborhood one weeknight and popped in for a 'snack'  For a Wed night this place was jammin'! We didn't feel like waiting for a table so we got lucky and squeezed ourselves into the bar to grab a pie.  Our server/bartender was very sweet.  We got a sausage  pizza and it was decent.  It has a thin crust (which we loove) but it just seems to lack in flavor a little bit.  The crust is a little soggy towards the middle.  I still prefer Pomo's pizza, but for the downtown hipster atmosphere and people watching, this is a fun place to sit down and throw back a few glasses of wine.  Old, but charming :)

WVwDm1Vd8llqnvBjmCNNzA.text: I'm very lucky to live right across the street from here. I think this is the local favorite when it comes to Napolentana style pizza. Bianco can stay with the tourists. I love coming home from work and smelling the wood burning from the brick oven, walking over and having an expresso at the bar or finishing the meal with an amazing limoncello. The staff are great people and the ambiance is second to none. The gnocchi is on special on Tuesdays and is absolutely to die for. Great and impressive date night.  And they have a pet!

ZxKuwj2wqTXL8LVJrWnDdA.text: We had attempted to go to dinner at another little place a few blocks away, but were put off and decided to explore. Lucky we did cause I absolutely loved this place. We sat outside and it was very enchanting! I forgot we were in Phoenix for a while, which is a good thing. Phx needs more places like this! Our pizza was good, but I would have preferred a little more spice. Our crepe was delicious! I would go back for that alone! Overall, we had a great experience and hope to get back there before the summer hits us so we can enjoy the quaint patio experience:)

Q_D1N4lhA12BUuPP70omog.text: All Good -- Great lunch today. Service was good. We wanted to eat outside today given the weather but no shade tables were available. No worries -- we had a wonderful meal inside. We are a party of 4 that loves pizza and hungry. We had the DiNotte, Salsiccia and the Genova pizzas. They all were excellent-- fresh crust not too thick and the dough had been allowed to rise properly. Toppings were all fresh and there are multiple non tomatoe sauce options which is to my liking. The Gorgonzola on the DiNotte pizza gave it a unique distinctive flavor(good). We also had 2 salads -- the house salad was very fresh. In my opinion the biggest distinction was the freshly grated Parmesan flakes. My wife had the only other salad offered prior to 3 on Sat which had strawberries, goat cheese, and candies walnuts over spinach. My wife added grilled chicken and enjoyed it all. The restaurant is not close to my house, however I will go back again when I am near downtown for lunch again.

ReRl2jks6uavbx2Zg-4bjA.text: After a glut of pizza watching on food network, I was on the hunt for some good thin crust pizza. Being in my third trimester, however, I wanted to avoid the hour long waits I was reading about all the pizza places in town, and decided to go during lunch time. Unfortunately, I didn't do my research enough and didn't realize that Cibo does NOT serve pizza during lunch, only sandwiches; pizza is only at dinner time.   After the initial disappointment, and being too hungry to go somewhere else, we decided to go ahead and order. For a weekday lunch, it was still pretty busy. No wait, but only seats available were at the bar, and just 2 seats were available. However it looked like the turnover was quick. Service by the guy at the bar was relatively quick and very friendly, but he was running around like crazy taking care of both customers at the bar and at tables.   All the sandwiches are made with the fresh baked focaccia made in the brick ovens. Very fresh and tasty. Not oily at all like a lot of other focaccia's I've had. Good texture, chewy without being tough. There's a choice of cold vs hot sandwiches, my husband and I both got hot ones...I got a mozzarella, tomato and pesto i think? Whatever it was, it was good. My husband got the pulled pork buffalo style...He enjoyed it...I'm not a big fan of buffalo style sauce so I can't really comment on it. You have a choice of side salad or fruit salad witht he sandwhiches, or chips, which we didn't get. The salad was fine, fresh, well dressed. The fruit salad was a bit of a surprise...more of a parfait w/ some thick whipped cream and granola on top. It was good, but being lactose intolerant, it came as a bit of a surprise, so just a warning for those who can't tolerate dairy, or thought they were being healthy by ordering a fruit salad.   Anyways, m/b I'll make to try the pizza one day...but the sandwiches were still worth the visit.

K0MB6-Jh9tj0t2T-SdMkEg.text: Amazing food and great atmosphere! Wait was a little long and unorganized, but worth the wait

EPRhTcdwLZxlMZvondJ-hQ.text: Best pizza in Phoenix, fun experience, small rooms and tables but the food is the well worth it.

nOZ4mei17NcdAEEL0FxucQ.text: Absolutely loved the food, cannot put to words how good the soup, pizza, and wine was. Excellent, fresh tasting products used in their pizza. My only problem was the server was slow, seemed like he didn't know the menu well, and took roughly five minutes to open the bottle of wine. Service aside, this place has AMAZING pizza!

x13EJUKIdNwa-EWM8JGHvw.text: This is the Antonio Banderas in Desperado of Pizzerias.

CmePepx_jnsQJI5zfNwLgQ.text: Damn good food. friendly service. And not too expensive either. I will return

wGKp8MeF2Ri-m-FkhcHxDw.text: I've always been satisfied with the food here.  Not too expensive, respectable pizzas, salads and paninis.  (No pizzas at lunch time, mind you.)  Not consistently mindblowing, but consistently good.  I think I was really impressed by the food once out of six visits or so, and the rest of the times I just enjoyed the atmosphere and drinks on the patio with family or friends.  It's a pretty little patio with trees hanging down and an organic feel to it.  Not pretentious, just pleasant.  And the staff's always been down to earth and decently cool.  Superior to Bianco if you don't have four hours to blow.

TJHzqJSrgd12Zdv9zrzOEQ.text: SIX STARS!  This is by FAR the best place I have ever experienced. Everything about it is great. The Vegetariana Pizza is a fun adventure for a couple.. and the crepes for desert are to DIE for! Vanilla ice cream, fresh strawberries, kiwi and peaches with some whipped cream in a crepe! WOWzer this place is so fun and I just love it.

qx2ZBerv4lWADbetQ6u0Pg.text: This place is AWESOME!  Closest thing to NYC/East Coast Italian that I've seen here in the greater Phoenix/Scottsdale area for a reasonable price.  We had the meat antipasto with capicola, salami, olives, various cheeses, roasted peppers, etc. and it was fantastic.  Afterward, our group shared white and red pizzas as well as a calzone which were all delicious. The menu is somewhat limited but what they do, they do right.  The old-home atmosphere was charming-we had a private alcove for our small group. Walking by the small bar area, it reminded me of intimate restaurants in homes in CT.  We're going back when it's cooler to sit on the outdoor patio with the tree lights, misters and take in the ambience.  Oh and to top it off, our waitress was one of the best ever and that's saying ALOT.  We've dined in a few places in our lives and have a good basis for comparison...she was excellent (just which I got her name!)  If you haven't been, you have to try this place.  It's worth the trip. We went on a Monday night and were seated right away...I hear it's insanely crowded on the weekend...I know why...it's good!

4E_TlOyxjRBWwY022o32HA.text: I love love love their pizza. I've been there several times and I've had good service each time. This is the place that we take friends to for pizza. The wait time has not been more than 20 minutes even on a First Friday.

Ea5zdxW0D54FCv4hKXutzA.text: I love good pizza, really love good pizza. And Cibo has the best that I have ever had. They have your choice of white or red pizzas - they have this white pizza with italian meats that is addicting. Their salads are delicious too and you can't beat their desserts with Nutella. I enjoy Cibo because their ingredients are so fresh and everything is simple but amazing in taste. Their staff is always so friendly - you can really tell they enjoy working for this place and serving the food - they are truly excited about it. This place I'm a fan of and a definite regular.

we_gHTKFh9XlWO_y-HWrYA.text: Great Pizzas and a phenomenal cous cous salad! Good service and a cool outdoor patio. It is located inside a converted house, which makes it very homey and comfortable.

ePtnz9vNhVriU8m7mmdjhA.text: My favorite pizza place (Pizzeria Bianco is great, but this place is better). I live in Gilbert so it is kind of far, and yet I still make a trip out as often as I can. Have brought multiple friends to show them the goodness that Cibo is and we are never let down. Great atmosphere, live music outside. The Diavola is my favorite. Complete it off with dessert (Nutella and Banana) and you'll be in food heaven. Two suggestions: turn the music down on the inside and have a better hostess bar (every time we walk up to be seated they seem confused)

fFs3VsuaEY6NcGtG2f9uGg.text: Order the burrata you will not be disappointed.  I love spice so my favorite pizza at Cibo is the Diavola with fungi.  The garden dining is a plus with twinkle lights and lots of trees, makes for a romantic setting.

YaJnYWG2HPe8ZBydCEeoXQ.text: Overpriced. Tiny dishes.. Food was cold. Avoid at all costs.

ixp_gwzfcT76ohHDecSXCQ.text: Very romantic spot. Inside and outside seating, but outside is beautiful during spring. My wife and I love Cibo. The pizza is delicious and comes in perfect sizes. The Crepes are to die for. The prices are not bad. We spent about 50 bucks for the both of us, but we left stuffed!

8OoYvX4l9Tz0A70wkVlJ6Q.text: Cibo has a great atmosphere and a wonderful menu. Servers are very pleasant and have gone out of their way to provide excellent customer service. Try the limoncello!

eilfE2CQAdBmaTVZmq2Jhw.text: And now to add to my list of pizza places, Cibo.  Here is how I rank the pizza of Arizona, and I've tasted a LOT of it.  1. Pizzeria Bianco  2. Patsy Grimaldi's 3. Cibo 4. Pomo 5. Humble Pie  . We ended up at Cibo because we were craving Grimaldi's (didn't have a car to get to the location in Old Town), we didn't feel like waiting for Pizzeria Bianco, and the light rail had a convenient stop around .4 miles away from Cibo. Easy walk over.    Cibo can best be likened to Pizzeria Bianco or Pomo in taste. The owners, both very kind people, were working as the hosts the night we came in. It was around a 45 minute wait at 8:00 on a Thursday, so I just talked with my two good friends while we waited. No big deal. The restaurant had a homely feel to it, as it is a renovated old house and it was family-ran.   The atmosphere of the restaurant had an older feel to it. More of a place for 25 year olds instead of a bunch of college students, but whatever. I'd highly recommend the outside tables for a date, it has a "romantic" feel to it. It is also a good place for large parties, although I think Grimaldi's is a bit more convenient.   Now, the food.  The bread. Wow. Great bread, only beat by Chris Bianco's bread or the Andreoli's bread. I loved it, definitely worth the $2! Had a great crunch to it and was very tasty. Europeans definitely put more emphasis on their bread than Americans!  The pizza came in a pretty timely manner considering how busy it was that night. I ordered my standard, Margarita with Spicy Salami (aka, pepperoni). No normal pepperoni here. :( They had a lot of other options as well, such as Salmon for your pizza and more! The pizza was excellent. The crust was great and all around it was delightful!   We didn't order Crepes, Salad, or Bruschetta, but I definitely want to try the Bruschetta and Crepes next time I go there. Both looked great! The restauraunt seemed to have a lot of good options for wine as well!  All around, an awesome place to be. We'll be back once school kicks up again.  P.S: Keep in mind their hours! They are closed Sundays.

u5hQtv4ytt0KSYObOsnqVg.text: Cibo was like that movie that everyone tells you is so awesome, but when you go to see it, it's just alright. Solid average experience. I had heard so many great things about this place, that perhaps there was a bit too much build up.  It was a bit of a wait on a weekend night, which is expected and not a huge deal. We sat on the patio, which is really pretty & has room for a lot of people, which is always a bonus in AZ.  Here's the thing, I can barely remember the pizza. No, I was not drunk. I had one glass of wine, shocker I know. It wasn't bad, it wasn't amazing, it was just decent pizza. Sure pizza is almost always good, but I expected much better that ok.

PxloyONA-U3X54gY-hnk2Q.text: Set in a restored 1913 bungalow, Cibo (pronounced "CHEE-boh") has hardwood floors, exposed brick, a stained-glass panel and a fireplace to set the mood.    Right off the bat, I was impressed with the ambiance this place exudes. Every corner of this place is unique, Great for small parties, or just two.     We were seated outside at a table for four. The server was very well versed with the wine list, and the menu. She right away offered some appetizer ideas, and wine pairings. All good offerings. We decided on a bottle of Vipra rossa. It was over all a good wine, and went well with dinner. Also we ordered the 3 Pair Buschetta. This little gem was awesome. It came to our table on a cutting board type platter. Three little bruschetta slices each having a different topping. First was grape tomatoes and basil, the second had cannelini beans, and the third had prosciutto crudo and mozzarella. Ah mazz ING.      Being that I wasn't feeling super adventurous on the meal, I just ordered the Diavola pizza for one. Average pizza I'd have to say, was not very inventive. Good presentation though.    Service was a five.

4rXSAnYOzjEoUxkfzCXrKQ.text: I wish there was one in LA!! I went to AZ to visit a friend and I fell in love with this place! I kept on wanting to go back everyday but my friend was being a cheapie because it's not the cleverest thing to eat out all the time. Regardless, I really enjoyed my time there. The staff was great. I loved my dishes and especially the burrata appetizer. It was amazing. I got a pizza and added prosciutto.  Excellent in everything. We finished with a shot of lemoncello (I don't know how to spell it) but its vodka infused with lemon and it was amazing but hella strong. I want a Cibo in LA!

TZWaBSpw1WDKbRnUFrM_Hw.text: Cibo is a great place to get fresh, delicious pizza in an intimate setting. The crepes are also delicious and I recommend this place to anyone looking for quality food at a good price. The fact that it is an historic house adds charm!

m6IuPOjjLZ6W2FuwE_tO-A.text: Much better than Pizzeria Bianco!  Cibo is a great date spot.

C39R8Opy6lTPexZ0KqtmJQ.text: Been here a few times. The most recent time we decided to have a group of 10-12 for dinner and they were pretty busy. Despite that the food was quick and service was pleasant. Great selection of beers and the pizza was great (we tried a significant portion of the menu). Definitely worth checking out and reasonably priced.

3ymlH0qqY3Ppe_N3m3BPaQ.text: I finally got to try out this place yesterday at my gfs baby shower. I was soooo excited that I finally made it here seeing that I have had a few friends continuously recommending this place. This could be a great date day/night place or a place you meet up with a group of friends. They offer both in and outdoor seating. I highly recommend outdoor seating:) Beautiful weather during the day and beautiful weather at night plus romantically lit up with small lights around the patio. We were seated on the patio right away around 1pm on Saturday afternoon. We had a party of 10 and had more than enough space.  There was a young boy singing and playing music on the patio, which made the overall ambiance and atmosphere even better especially on any day in Arizona:) The waitress filled our glasses with water and lemon right away. I thought it was a bit strange that the water came with a lemon already in the water because typically they don't and I also happen to be someone who does not like knowing that someone probably used there bare hands to put it there. We waited about 10 minutes until the rest of our party arrived and began ordering our food.   About 10min after we order, the majority of us ran out of water and additional drinks people had ordered. So we waited, waited, and waited some more until finally we were able to waive down a different waiter to refill our drinks. Our food began to arrive about 30min after it was ordered. I ordered the Rustica Pizza, which was highly recommended to me by multiple friends and boy was I pleased! The crust was by far the best part! It was semi thin with a crisp bottom crust. The prosciutto was very tender and melts in your mouth and the cheese was just he right amount. This pizza was AWESOME! I also tried some of the entrees around the table including the side salad, which was huge with a variety of organic veggies, fresh parm cheese and balsamic vinaigrette to top, the Caprese sandwich, and the Margherita Pizza, which were all great!   Half way through our meal we again waited without drinks for about 15min. We were at Cibo for a total of 2.5hrs and our waitress came by our table 4 times. With that being said we waited around for refills, waited about 30min for our table to be cleared of the finished plates and had to physically get up to get our waitress twice because we couldn't waive someone over to us. My gf had to wait a long time to open her gifts because it took the staff a ton of time to clear a table that should only take 2min to  clean. While we were waiting I decided to use their restroom. On my way there I noticed that the location of the restroom was hard to find and was shoved into a back corner where they also had shoved 8 sets of chairs. It order to get to the restroom I had to walk sideways about 10ft (and I'm tiny!) to the restroom to handle my business. The average size woman would not have been able to fit through such a small space, which to me raises a HUGE red flag. I went to wash my hands and to my surprise the paper towel dispenser was not working so I had to use me pants...lovely! When I got back to the table we finished unwrapping gifts and called it a day. Overall, I loved the food and ambiance and feel that the service we recieved was extremely poor considering that it was not busy at all and there was no excuse for it. I would not recommend this place to groups larger than 6 people and I would also advise anyone who goes here to be ready to test their patience when it comes to service:)

4AoBuLhJw2TDxOiNeFkXvg.text: My go-to place for a great fired pizza...everything here is delicious and great ambiance in historical downtown.  Great place to sit outside and enjoy lunch in our awesome weather as well (note that lunch has a slightly different menu and includes sandwiches).  Favorites include the Omero salad, Prosciutto Crudo and Diavola pizzas, and the Fresca for dessert.  Recommended over Pizzeria Bianco.  I wish I could more stars for this place...

2Ig5BY2tbj4jqRsapBsP4A.text: Cool spot to eat at, been a guest many times over the years they've been open. food never fails, service is good. Plenty of wines to choose from and plenty of fresh ingredients in use, really like this place.

Cg_SXqkvHCMgb_q41mJ6bQ.text: Cibo I love your salads and pizza. Your ambiance is tops what more can I ask for. I keep bringing more friends here as you never disappoint.

bITwzjVGq4z0vILJTwVAEA.text: I was so excited to eat here based on reviews. Not sure if it was an off day but I will never go back. My server seemed mad I came in. Like I reminded him of someone he doesn't like....then we order etc etc. I get the charcuterie plate, 3 meats, 3 cheeses, 3 fruits. It came out with 4 meats (which was nice) but only 2 cheeses (1 which was a caprese salad with no basil), 2nd was the goat cheese like on the menu, and for the 3d cheese...they threw on the pear salad...but with no pears. Then the fruits! I got 3 slices of apple. Instead of 3 separate fruits, it was 3 apple slices. Instead of fruit, they sent out grilled veggies??? No. Not cool. I asked the lady for some fruit she came out with the kids fruit plate.  ok thats fine. I like my fruit cut up for that anyway .my kids didn't like the pasta (red sauce and plain) not sure how that got messed up but it was really bland.  Anyways...then when I got the check I got charged for the fruit plate. Ok out of an $80 check, what's $3? But still...I don't feel like I should pay $3 for something that should've been on the $20 plate. When I asked the waiter, instead of apologizing he got super pissy and turned around (like a diva) and said "ok I'll take it off" like not even being I'm any way caring that he gets tips. So then him and some other girl were talking about what shouldve been on the plate (I was proven right) then be rudely came back with the check and kind of tossed it in front of me and said "thanks". Thanks but no thanks guy, you totally ruined my whole cibo experience. I think I'll stick with the always gracious Pomo Pizzeria on 1st ave...BUT on the bright side, my daughters did like the margherita pizza and the pear salad was really good. I just had a messed up order and horrendous service.

Bt3vKpjHQYaBA-1VaQN4cw.text: I amy or may not be completly in love with the Nutella and bread desert dip thingy

Hqom7kxpQvOiWuLCqtZhKg.text: While in town for a quick trip we stopped in to Cibo.  Thanks to Yelp we went to this quaint little off "off the beaten path" pizzeria.  At first dear husband and I were a little sad that there was no pizza on the lunch menu but reading the sandwich descriptions and seeing some plates on other diner's tables, we figured it was fate.   My Alla Parmigiana - fried eggplant sandwich - was wonderful!  The thin crispy wood fire oven baked saltimbucco bread held the eggplant, mozzarella, parmigiana, tomato sauce and basil.  The flavors were the perfect combination of all things Italian.  Every bite was wonderful.  The house salad was the perfect pairing for a great lunch.  And we hope to get back to try the pizza soon!

u0Yb22nGx_LYl3QLFPJZoA.text: Got lunch here yesterday while in town for work. Let me start by saying that the food was excellent. I ordered a margherita pizza and it was very very good. Also ordered a a nutella, strawberry, banana crepe and it was excellent as well. Now you're asking, why only three stars if the food was so good. Well, the service was pretty lackluster. It was pretty slow and apathetic overall. What really annoys me now is that the server asked me if I wanted whipped cream on my crepe and didn't mention that it was a $2 charge for it. It looks like they also charged $2 for strawberries which I think was included on the menu. My crepe ended up costing $14, which is a ripoff. For comparison sake, the pizza itself was $9. I shouldn't really care because I'm expensing it anyway but won't come back here just based on the principle.

0ZuQNtiJkeqwPlM0242qQw.text: Cibo is one of those places that doesn't have the most amazing food, yet you keep coming back because it's always a beautiful experience nonetheless. The service is always top notch, and the wonderful owners are always within sight. The whole restaurant is gorgeous of course, with the overhead lights and plants in the outside patio and the vintage, house-turned-restaurant on the inside. As previously mentioned, the food isn't amazing but it will do. The pizza is tasty but not the best. I remember the burrata and the caprese salad being pretty good. The nutella crepe was delicious.  Over all, I would definitely keep coming back to Cibo because of the perfect ambiance. Whether it would be a date, a birthday dinner or an intimate meal with your family, Cibo is the perfect place to be.

nzTLNC8tWmBLxORSHeIBFw.text: Had their salad with shrimp, calamari, pizza and sandwich.  All were pretty tasty.  I've been a few times and plan to return again.

7mURX4WnvEos-IY93SbxHA.text: What a bummer. This was my first time here and came to celebrate my birthday. The atmosphere was really nice and is definitely a cute place. However, I don't think I will be back. After waiting over 20 minutes at the table, we finally figured out who our server was. Did not greet us once and constantly checked on other tables around us. I was so excited to try it but completely lost my appetite for this place and went to a different restaurant. Very unfortunate because the place really is cute and the food did smell really good. If you do try this place, highly recommend going on a day when it's not so busy.

-pcwjk0Rl4r3zzNJ631ivg.text: Great pizza and nice atmosphere. Pretty cool how they took a old house and turned it into a restaurant. Nice area outside to sit in as well, very relaxing setting.

41VEbNZbe4XPMTtNKrl8Lg.text: I'd say this restaurant has it all: food, service and ambiance.  We stopped by here on the way to the airport...only about a 10 minute drive to the car rental drop-off.  We were looking for a comfortable place that would work for three generations: 2 boys, my wife and I, and the grandparents.  This place met the mark: we all really enjoyed the experience.  It was unseasonably cold, so we ate inside--if the weather is warm, I'd recommend eating outside under the lights.  There were plenty of people outside braving the 50 degree weather, as there are heat lamps there.  We were told the house that holds the restaurant is 100 years old!  We had three pizzas: Rustica, Vegetarina, and the Funghi.  Our six year old had the individual margarita pizza.  We also had two of the house garden salads; a large is good for two people.  Started with the risotto balls and the meatballs.  Everything was excellent, although the risotto balls were a bit bland.  Pizza crust was perfect--crunchy on the outside with a bit of char from the wood fired oven.  Like othe reviewers, we loved the Nutella and banana crepe with ice cream.  We had two scoops, and it was plenty to share among six of us...very rich.    Our waiter was really attentive, and the hostesses were nice.  We will definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outdoor area.

QlsniSUTrL0B7sUQZKAJxQ.text: First time in Phoenix and since we were just there for an overnight layover, we used Yelp to find something nearby that was awesome! Cibo was perfect. Indoor and outdoor seating with live music created the perfect ambiance. The Caprese salad was fresh and tasty. I also wasn't sure how big the pizzas were and we ordered our own. They were huge! Definitely order to share. Service was quick and awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0hCz5d9kcsqFv3i4nIKcrg.text: Cibo I love you. Your margarita pizza, pesto salad, borata, and everything else on the menu is PERFECTION!  Also I just want to squeeze the adorable little couple who owns this place, they are so kind and their work ethic is unreal, they are never not there knee deep in the chaos!

BhTiCuOt1vlmFvqRh2pCLQ.text: We had one night to spend in Phoenix, and I'm so glad we spent it here! Lovely patio with twinkle lights and live music. Everything we ate had high quality ingredients and tasted so lovely. Most enjoyable meal I've had in a while. We split the pesto salad for starters and then split the Da Vince pizza with Italian sausage added. For dessert we had the crepe with mascarpone. I would do it all again!

wAFGF_ULVySENh6k37sE6w.text: Love this place! The outside patio is perfect when the weather is goods. Nice vibe, great food. Whenever I go, my boyfriend and I split a pizza and a salad and it's more than enough food. Service has always been great as well.

7BDDE4XwTVkf-eJ-l0aBUg.text: This restaurant is quaint, with trees outside doused in twinkle lights. If the weather is nice, sit on the patio and enjoy the ambience. If it's during the winter, sit inside this old house and get cozy with your friends and fellow eaters. I had pasta the last time I went and man it was fantastic.  The owners are so nice and personable. I've been here twice and the service was fantastic both times. The ingredients are fresh, and you can truly taste the difference. I remember lots of fresh basil and garlic, which always score points in my book.  Great place for a date, or to go when you have a serious Italian craving. Such a magical place.

XxNvUxPh_OGKY1qwneN91g.text: Went here on First Friday and it was very busy. The two of us were quoted a half an hour wait, so we grabbed a drink at the bar. The bar is very small, only seats a few people but the bartenders were prompt with greeting us and making drinks. The wait was only about 10 minutes before we were seated on the patio.   AMBIENCE - Great for a romantic date night or evening out with friends. There was a Jazz band playing, but we were still able to have a conversation.  DOG FRIENDLY PATIO  SERVICE - Extremely friendly and accommodating, on busy nights patience is necessary as the service is much slower.   FOOD - Delicious! The calamari was cooked perfectly, the dipping sauce had a great flavor and a little bit of a spicy kick. The portions were well sized. It's a great opportunity to order several items and share as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Small Antipasto Speciale was delicious and more than enough to split between two of us.

OMEQzPJfy_6QKYmUb3OF0Q.text: Simply Awesome food and atmosphere.   Plus the abandonded house about 3 doors down serves as a cat sanctuary .  Love this place and the area.

xJC0VFHR9fA7pdjx1bbZTQ.text: Amazing little pizza joint in downtown Phoenix.   I cannot believe I just found this place, though I've lived up the street for over five years.   Location: 5th Ave, downtown Phoenix.  There's street parking here and there, but I can walk!  Food:  Pizza, salads, sandwiches, bread, Nutella-based desserts, wine.  We ordered a pear salad that was tasty; it included arugula, pear, and cheese. The bread delivered with the salad was a white chewy bread.  My friend wanted meat on his pizza, and I didn't. They allowed us to get half and half; I got my veggie pizza on one side, and his sausage was on the other. Perfect!   The dessert we ordered was kind of like a delicious deconstructed funnel cake with Nutella for dipping sauce - delicious!    Service: The servers were efficient and brought us water throughout and were helpful and quick.  I wouldn't say the employees were overly friendly, though. While walking in, a female employee opened the door but just kind of stood there, not saying anything. No, "welcome" or "hello" - nothing.  Strange to me, but that's my Texan roots craving some more friendliness!   For reservations, one must have a group of six or more to make reservations.  We just had two but easily found a table on a Saturday evening at 5:30pm.

9MNTP6apUN17l8WBU5a52g.text: Really worth the wait.   Salads and crapes were the best!  I will be back.  Service was a bit slow but we dined outside and the weather was perfect.

GoeZ9cB-S2Oi-NgHiClhhw.text: Really excited to try this place out before a show. Got here a little before 6 and our show starts at 8. Told a 20-30 min wait. Though it's hard to estimate wait time, you should be somewhat in the ballpark. Just left after waiting an hour to go to a neighboring taco joint and I just received notification that my table is ready after an hour and a half. nbz58twK-EprbbcsAZRW0A.text: We adore this place!! The gluten free crepes are to die for!!! We always have great service and  get seated quickly. We have had a few issues with our orders but they are always willing to go above and beyond to make them right!!! Which we highly appreciate!

tTigJUMxvYEXx0Z5oc33jA.text: First off I'd like to say it has great customer service. I walked up and was greeted no more than a minute of waiting. They have live music on the patio outside which is a great addition to the vibe it displays, however I decided to sit inside which wasn't pleasant at all due to the lack of fans inside. The food wasn't what I expected it to be, even though I enjoyed the pesto. I don't recommend this place to others but if you wind up here it wouldn't be the end of the word being that they did offer great service when it came to offering opinions and being  on top of me and my family. Also if you come here and want a last minute drink, order the limoncello. Hope this is helpful as this is my first time coming to this restaurant.

GbTNNB5BYn-iwEzp6RmLqQ.text: Cozy little place! Everything in their store gives you a great experience. Service is great and the food is amazing. We always get pizzas as we think they do have one of the best pizzas in the Valley.   Sometimes they have live music in the outdoor area which could be fun and romantic depending on what you like

1E-MPYvrOySlWhoGMTZqoQ.text: Amazing food.  We love their burrata!  I've only been for dinner, but the service has always been good and the atmosphere great.

C0ujTt1bX7Zxcg8Tl4awAQ.text: I have been hearing about the great cuisines in Phoenix and decided to come to this popular Italian restaurant to get a first impression. Located in a house with a spacious front patio, the interior encompassed a full bar area, breakout dining rooms, hardwood floors, and red brick walls. A friendly staff, constant foot traffic, and opportunities for people watching added to the festive, home-like atmosphere. I came here for dinner with a group of five that included fellow Yelpers Fia R, and Kurdy S, and decided to order antipasti and two pizzas to share.   For antipasti, we went with the server's recommendation and ordered the Burrata ($14). The platter came with fresh mozzarella, balsamic drizzles, razor thin prosciutto, and toasted bread. I was impressed by the mozzarella, as it was light, airy, flavorful, and easy to spread across the warm crusty bread. The gentle flavors between the balsamic and prosciutto went hand in hand, as they complemented the mozzarella and bread without hindering it. This is a must get for those visiting for the first time.   Next, we shared the half Diavola and half Magherita Pizza ($13). The Diavola was pleasantly spicy, as the pizza was inspired by the centrality of spicy salame embedded in mozzarella and tomato sauce. I also enjoyed the Margherita, as the light tasting tomato sauce, mozzarella, and fresh basil were spot on delicious. One noteworthy limitation regarding their pizza was the soft crust. It had a nice flavor but the texture was also flimsy and unexpected.   Finally, we shared a half Procida and half Tartufata Pizza ($14). The Procida came with mozzarella, prosciutto crudo, Asian pears, chopped arugula, goat cheese and black pepper. The goat cheese flavor was very sharp, so I didn't particularly enjoy it as much as the other finesse tasting pizzas. The Tartufata arrived with mozzarella, prosciutto crudo, white mushrooms and white truffle oil drizzles. I enjoyed the smoky flavor stemming from the pizza, but the combination of strong-flavored white truffle oil and cheese didn't go particularly well for me.   3.5 stars. Overall, it was a delicious meal with plenty to rave about. I suggest interested diners to be aware of possible long waits, especially for those arriving later in the evening. Additionally, I also would not suggest this place to those who have a strong preference for thin, crispy crust pizzas. Their desserts were also limited to crepes, which we didn't care for on that particular evening. I must say, the place is great for dates, but the noise level can be pretty loud. Despite these limitations, our water was constantly refilled, and we were attended to frequently without much interruption. It was a great way to start a new journey in Phoenix. I hope to find the perfect crust in the area before coming back.

feDJXaVQZaddKI_Mc_dUIg.text: What a wonderful , quaint place.  Our server Britanny was just fabulous  The food was amazing as was the atmosphere.  We met the owner who was as charming as his restaurant.   I am so looking forward to going back.   Thanks for such a great experience

AYt62S3kWxGUpYn0WM2YHQ.text: My girlfriend and I came in around 5pm for happy hour on Monday. What a great experience. We ordered a House salad, meatball app and Gnocchi app. Everything was fantastic!  Peroni beers are $2.50 and ice cold. Great service, great food, great ambiance. We each had two beers each and an abundance of great food for $31.00. This place is a little gem.

SeERpCX9Ne-HdAL87mTTDg.text: Just had a veggie + salami pizza...   might literally be the BEST  I have ever had....  *seriously*

mQGdij72jPrsew92Hh09gQ.text: We love CIBO.  Food, wine, ambiance is terrific.

9HkiZoRUqaGj1D0i9OoALw.text: Cibo is my go-to restaurant for anything from a quick tasty salad for lunch to a romantic dinner under the stars. The food and service are consistently excellent and their pricing is reasonable. It also doesn't hurt that it is located in  super cute old house downtown with an awesome shaded tree-filled yard perfect for outdoor dining during the milder months.

photos.caption: Photo of Cibo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pesto lunch salad with shrimp

v8t4EYnhLR3jl4dLpKgQNw.text: My boyfriend took me here as a surprise last weekend, so I pretended to like it, but I was pretty darn displeased.  We got the tartufata (?) pizza, the one with mushrooms and drizzled truffle oil, because we're suckers for truffle anything. The taste and aftertaste were awful, the texture was kind of slippery and sloppy, and the pizza (though cooked in True stone pizza-oven fashion, so kinda expected) had a lot of black char dust on the bottom, which tasted very bitter. Our waiter didn't seem to care about our needs much; he didn't stop by a single time while we ate and it took forever to receive the check. But he DID keep trying to sell us extra stuff while we were ordering, which was annoying. Are the waiters here paid on commission, or what?  I was considering ordering the fried dough with nutella for dessert, but the service was so bad, and we were sitting outside so there were tons of flies around our food. We left. Would not go back.

jZh2_dlHJtDnfPSApIhxFA.text: This place is so lovely and romantic. Its a must on our list every time we are in Phoenix. It's a small Italian restaurant in a renovated house and the place is always packed so be ready for a line. The pizza was a delight. Can't wait for this nights meal with my family.

YijiYRUn9pRbPnLt4tt6vQ.text: It was a tad bit hard to find, BUT completely worth it! Went on a Friday night- pretty crowded but we were seated quickly. The food was delicious. Great spot for a date or brunch w your friends, etc. Highly recommended!

DRH-N9gVD5GcLxPYJiaekA.text: Romantic, great Italian food, excellent live music, what could be better?--oh, Crepes Suzette!

rqPx8bfYTNZSIlCHnb2LGw.text: The first time we went to Cibo it was delightful. The second time, not so much. First my fiance had a dirty glass to where you could visibly see the old lipstick mark. Although not preferred, this isn't something that would affect us from coming back or not. Then we noticed a hair in our pizza, which to me is unacceptable. They replaced it with no issue. They did, however, rush the replacement pizza out which wasn't cooked properly. It did not have much taste either. The waiter did not offer a discount but oddly gave me the wrong amount of change for our bill. Wasn't too sure if this was his way of apologizing, but overall was a very lousy experience.

qfIyBxPJp3xLMOPPFI7_vQ.text: This is a romantic place. Love the atmosphere from the artwork that they posses, to the historical look and outdoor patio with lights. I came here with a friend just to go out and eat. The staff was very friendly and interactive with the customers, enhancing the experience. The pizza here is just fantastic. I am definitely up to coming back soon.

nJB8FYouqocab9FHLiO9eQ.text: If it wasn't for the long wait and wobbly tables, I'd give this place 5 stars. The staff are quick, friendly, and get your orders right. Their tea is absolutely delicious (and I don't even like iced tea). The complimentary valet is awesome too! I come back for their omero salad, margherita pizza, and last but absolutely not least their crepes. Holy smokes are they good! Your bill will be no less than $60 for 2 but it is most definitely worth it!
